entries.title: Advance
entries.description:
IT'S FIRE!

RUN!

@-------------------------------@

"Advance" is a short and hard 2D auto-scrolling platformer about being overwhelmed by the first technologic discovery.

Music progresses with you.

Catapults are not safe.

I warned you.

@-------------------------------@

Controls:

'Up' to jump.

'Left' and 'Right' to slightly strafe .

'R' to restart.

'Escape' to exit

@-------------------------------@

At the moment, only for Windows. I hope I can manage to port it to Linux.

@-------------------------------@ 

Contact: @Sergio_Pks

#LDJAM

entries.title: AquaDuck
entries.description:
The Roman aqueducts are a foul place, and that's perfect for a fowl animal like you. As a duck, you enjoy water and there's none better to swim in than the very water that Roman citizens use. Be careful thought, there are a number of obstacles that you must avoid no to mention a few areas of the aqueduct that are in disrepair. That, however, won't stop Aqua Duck!

I started on this game late Saturday night after thinking I would be unable to participate. As a result, I was only able to work on for mayben 7 hours. Be that as it may, it is something.

Controls:
Left/Right Arrows (or A/D) = Move
Spacebar (or Down Arrow) = Jump

Goal: Swim as far as you can in the Aqueduct, AquaDuck.

entries.title: Archeotech Digger
entries.description:
You have been hired by The TLA to oversee the excavation of ancient alien technology.

This is an incomplete ASCII-driven base building game made from scratch by me for LD36. I'm going to put up a timelapse in the following days, as well as maybe my archived stream. Although I didn't get to finish this, I might put up a post LD version of some kind later.

Tools:
- text editor
- Cinema 4D
- Audacity
- OBS
- Coda 2

Libraries & 3rd-party resources:
- jQuery, Lodash, Howler.js
- Glass TTY font

entries.title: Boxatons
entries.description:
Boxatons is a game about boxing automatons. 

Instructions:

You control the left player. The goal is to knock off the head of the other player, so aim for the head, but protect your own. The health bars at the top show how close the heads are to falling off.

Controls:

Use WASD or arrow keys to move player forward/backward and rotate up/down. Press Space to toggle stance. Press LMB or Left Ctrl to punch with right arm. Press RMB or Left Shift to punch with left arm.

Gamepad should work, but you have to figure out the buttons yourself. You can change the button assignments in Unitys input menu.

Update:
-Fixed sound bug.
-Minor AI improvements.

Known issues:
-Arms sometimes get stuck in wrong positions, but changing the stance or
punching with that arm should pop it back.

Music:

"Intended Force" Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

Other free assets:
Font: http://www.dafont.com/tangerine.font
Sound Effect: https://www.freesound.org/people/joseph.larralde/sounds/352423/
Images:
http://www.textures.com/download/wrinkleshanging0040/27573?q=curtain
http://www.textures.com/download/woodplanksold0210/117308
http://www.textures.com/download/ornamentborder0196/55772

entries.title: Complexity Beam
entries.description:
A normal girl has wandered into an ancient ruin, filled with dangerous lost technology... and has tripped the alarm!  Now she must defend herself against the security system with a stationary laser turret she found.  Hopefully she can figure out how these randomly generated controls work....

This game came out of an idea I had to see if I could randomly generate a "skill rotation" like you'd see in an MMO.  In the end it became a really different game, but in the end I'm pretty happy with what I was able to make.

entries.title: Curse of the golden skull
entries.description:
Explore a temple full of traps and find the legendary golden skull. Arrow Keys to move and jump. All content is original with the exception of "Desert City" by Kevin MacLeod.

This is our first jam so all feedback is very much appreciated. Help us to make better games.

entries.title: Defence of eSTONEians
entries.description:
Hey all! After a bit of a hiatus, I've returned to the dare with this game I threw together mostly in a cabin with no internet. It's fairly simple, but i'm sure it'll get some chuckles. Use the arrow keys to jump and walk around! Try to get the fastest time! Thanks and enjoy!

-TMAT Productions

entries.title: Fireworks Grandmaster
entries.description:
Combine exotic substances into fanciful displays of colour, shape and sound.

Shapes of the ingredients need to match slots on blueprint.

If you regret a choice, just slot another item.

Try to make sense of what your eccentric customers are ordering.

And remember, the customer is always right.

You can fast forward texts somewhat by clicking the button... if you think they are too slow... to much sloth.

Be sure to leave comments we will try our bests to play back your games and give good feedback!

entries.title: I.F.F.
entries.description:
For the theme of Ancient Technology I figured that with the rate technology advances currently, technology from even 20-30 years ago could be considered ancient. IFF is based on early radar technology and requires you to identify friends and foes. 

Gameplay:
Click on green pings to highlight them and choose if they are friend or foe.
Foes will destroy the friendly bases(blue pings) so pay attention to figure out which are foes.
Shooting down friendly pings will reduce morale, while letting foes get to close will cause your health to drop. If either of these reach zero its game over.

entries.title: No Mario's Sky
entries.description:
UPDATE: NMS has received a DMCA takedown notice. As we've had to remove the game, we are voiding our entry into Ludum Dare. Thanks for playing, everyone!

NOTE: You can play an alternative version here: https://asmb.itch.io/dmcas-sky

----

No Mario's Sky is a game about exploration and survival in an infinite procedurally-generated universe. 

A game by ASMB:

https://twitter.com/Cannonbreed
https://twitter.com/BananaboySam
https://twitter.com/1bardesign
https://twitter.com/eigenbom

entries.title: Oldfag adventure.
entries.description:
Russia, 2116 year. Future, flying cars, robots. Machines took place in all life’s areas. Cybernetic became Russian reality. Life in the world of high technology seems great…
But not for Ivan. Ivan is our main hero, he is oldfag. He loves old computer games and old times. He knows history of whole game industry and feels bad because he cannot play old games on modern machines..
One day he wakes up and decide to stop suffer from it. It’s time to do something. Ivan decide to make 100 years old PC with his own hands to feel the old atmosphere and play legendary game – Heroes of Might and Magic III.

Control:
WASD - move;
E - use;
Esc - exit.

News about us:
https://vk.com/blazingplanetstudio
https://www.facebook.com/BlazingPlanetStudio

UPDATE: v.1.3 - More bug fixies.

entries.title: Orgog's Prison
entries.description:
You are an axe slinging dwarf warrior that has been captured by the Orc Warlord, Orgog the Savage. Now you must escape Orgog's Prison before it becomes your grave. A retro style action game that will transport you back to the arcade. No quarters required.

Controls:
- Move with arrow keys
- Sling axes with spacebar

Technical details:
- Created with Construct 2
- Sprites created with PyxelEdit
- Sounds created with Bfxr / Audacity
- There are 5 levels in total. When you leave a room, the next room is randomly chosen among the 5.

Inspiration:
I was inspired by two "ancient" arcade games, Berzerk and Gauntlet.

I hope you enjoy!

entries.title: PokeBattle
entries.description:
Nothing to do with ancient technology, just an attempt at what a Pokemon battle in the anime sense might've looked like as a game.

The game a is a split screen Pokemon action battle simulator with local multiplay using joysticks.
This is basically just the basis for something, more moves and species can easily be added by inheritance of the Skill and Player scripts accordingly.

Controls are on the screen as UI reference GameCube controller buttons, so this probably won't work on other controllers unfortunately(Mainly because I think that C-Stick is referenced differently as a button than right thumbstick of typical controllers).
Feel free to adjust the input settings to your preferred controller though.

Controls are:
Thumb stick for movement.
C-Stick for camera direction and aiming of skill shots.
A, B, X, Y to use the Pokemon's 4 moves(Only 2 per species were made for this right now though).
L, R for player class specific abilities.

entries.title: Postman simulator 2000
entries.description:
In a world where all teleporters have crached civilization have to resort to the ancient technology snail-mail to survive!!! Can you deliver the mail in time?

---changelog---
added executable so its easier to play otherwise exactly the same game

entries.title: Ragdoll Romans
entries.description:
NOTICE: On your first time pressing the start button, changing scenes is slow. Be patient, the game is not frozen, it is simply loading the next level. After your first race, the process is much faster and smoother. Thank you.

Ragdoll Romans: Utilizing the latest in dirt cheap chariot technology, one Roman races to win the newest iTablet. Onward, to glory!

W, Up Arrow = forward

S, Down Arrow = back

A, Left Arrow = turn left

D, Right Arrow = turn right

(Controller is also supported. Drive with the left stick)

Art and Music by: Trevor Haugen

Programming and Design by: Noah Schultz

entries.title: Reinvent the Wheel
entries.description:
A game inspired by the square bicycle (https://www.sciencenews.org/article/riding-square-wheels) and all of the other curious pairs of Roads and Wheels as described in http://web.mst.edu/~lmhall/Personal/RoadsWheels/RoadsWheels.pdf . 

Controls:

Use Spacebar to jump over the gaps. Use the mouse to select and switch to the wheel in your inventory that matches the shape of the terrain. Good luck!

entries.title: Relics of Mortality
entries.description:
An Archaeologist has found an ancient Egyptian ruin, in which he finds a strange and old Egyptian object, however, this object reacts to the presence of the main character and sends him to another Dimension. In this another Dimension he can't die, instead he is moved randomly to different places filled with traps, being trapped in an infinite loop. Will he be able to get out of this?

Work made in a team of two: one artist (@SilfriM), and a programmer (JeanValjean, @jeantheparanoid, me).

WASD -> Movement

Space bar -> Jump, Can double jump and can move in the air.



Thanks for playing and any feedback is welcome :)

entries.title: Spear the sun
entries.description:
My original idea was a castle of sorts that you had to breach with catapults and such. Not a cheap Angry Birds knock-off. Oh well, it is what it is.

Controls: Click and move mouse, release to shoot.

Goal: Get the "sungod" figure out of place.

Known issues: win condition can possibly be finicky in a few rare instances. I have managed to play through the game often enough that I found it not that big of an issue

entries.title: The Chosen One
entries.description:
Unfortunately, during this Ludum Dare, I had limited time, because I had to study for an Algebra test.

For this reason I decided to interpret ancient technology as ancient game technology.
I decided to make a game which would run entirely over a telnet connection, like the MUD games of yesteryear.

This game is a simple labyrinth-game with a bit of exploration and a monster.
It is tested on Windows with putty, and Linux (telnet), but other clients should work fine.

Controls:
In menus, type the character of the thing you want, and then a carriage return (ENTER) to confirm.
While moving, type either WASD OR NESW (option during startup), followed by an enter for each character. Sorry about that, limitations of telnet....

telnet 37.139.0.65 1337

Additional joke game on
telnet 37.139.0.65 8944

IMPORTANT: Windows users should use a full telnet-compatible terminal. An example is Putty, but others could also be fine. Web-telnet clients often do NOT work.
MORE IMPORTANT THINGS: Set Putty to TELNET, do NOT keep it in SSH mode.

entries.title: This never stops to aMAZE me
entries.description:
Collect all three mystic amulets and take over the world, but don't get lost in the MAZE!


Maze is randomly generated and change over steps.

How many steps it took you to finish?
My personal best is 264 :D

entries.title: War Goat
entries.description:
spam enter to defeat enemies.

left and right to move.

you are a war goat. an ancient viking war machine.

~~~

Okay, so my game wasn't too great this time. I only took 6 hours, in a badly made custom java game engine, and so I didn't have high hopes for myself. A lot of the game was rushed, and this isn't a "final product" of my game, despite being my final product. Maybe someday I'll come back to this. I didn't have time for the greatest artwork, or a logo, or an icon, or a good description. It BARELY fits the theme, too. My goal was to make a simple, thrown together game, and that's what I did. All things considering, I'm relatively happy with my final product.

Known Bugs:

If the window doesn't fit on your screen, button collision doesn't work properly. Sorry about that...

entries.title: When Aliens Are in the Desert
entries.description: This game will tell you exactly what happens when aliens are in the desert. Enjoy!

entries.title: Yggdrasil
entries.description:
A little game made in 72 hours for the #LDJAM 36.

You have been sleeping for many centuries. Now that you are awake, will you carry out your mission?


Made by Ana Guillen Fernandez @FdezGuillen

Special thanks:

Manuel Guillen Fernandez (Help with audio)
Martijn de Boer (NiGiD) - Romance for Piano and Cello (Song)

entries.title: A Robot named Rover
entries.description:
One hundred years ago, humanity was destroyed by the apocalypse. However, for some reason, all non-human species were left alive. Robots, animals, etc. They were all quite happy about the disappearance of the humans. Except for one little, ancient robot. A robot named Rover. 

Use WASD to move and space to progress dialog. (Mac users: use the run.command file, everyone else: run the jar file)

I added an easy version for people who can't complete the regular version (try the regular version first though).

entries.title: Ancient Akkadians
entries.description:
The 110% Historically (and Mathematically) Accurate Ancient City Defense Game!

Figure out how to survive, and learn to manage a neolithic civilization. You must build a ziggurat! Deer will eat your crops and saplings during the day, and wolves will eat exposed workers at night.


Controls:
Mouse Click to interact (the menu on the right is buildings and actions)
WASD/Arrows to move camera
QE/PageUp+Down to rotate camera
Space/Enter to speed up time (and at prompts)
Escape to pause game


Credits:
HitchHiker - @HitchH1k3r - hitchh1k3rsguide.com 
http://ludumdare.com/compo/author/hitchh1k3r/ 

Solifuge - @Dahold 
http://ludumdare.com/compo/author/solifuge/

Naali - @AlopexL
http://ludumdare.com/compo/author/naali/

entries.title: Ancient Caverman
entries.description:
A Ludum Dare #36 competitor from Anchient Technology Theme.
This game was developed by GDRB Gang Group. 
We are members from Game Developers Brazil, a meetup group from São Paulo - Brazil
Artist Designer - Eduardo Souzacampus
Programmer - Joton Ferreira
Programmer/Sound - Juan Montesinos

entries.title: Ancient Defender
entries.description:
"You have been called by the high gods and been requested to defend an ancient artifact. This artifct is the essence of the universe and you must protect it at all cost. Advanced ancient civilisations will try to stop you and steal the artifact from you. They have managed to create a portal to the room in which the ancient artifact lies. GO SAVE THE WORLD!" 

The main point of the game is for you to defend an artifact which 1 specific enemy will try to steal, while the other will do all they can to stop you.

You will be equipped with a advanced crossbow to defend yourself, and be able to buy a highly advanced mini-gun for a certain price!

CONTROLS: 
Move - WASD
Jump - Space
Reload - R (Currently no reload animation, but it takes 3-6 seconds to reload)
Restart game - F5 (In case something fucks up)
Purchase new gun - E (Near shop)

All sounds and graphics are made by us, except character animations. 

Credits: 
Michael H. Riggelsen - Programmer guy and Unity guy
Mattias S. Hansen - Graphics guy and Sound guy

Special thanks to: 
Asger Gotved Hvid - Meme lord

entries.title: Ancient Tower Defense
entries.description:
A basic TowerDefense game.
WITH ALIENS!

entries.title: AZtech
entries.description:
--- I'll change the font ASAP  ---
--- Tested on newest chrome - I'll make it compatible with others ASAP ---

One dimensional matching game.
You can only change block's value 3 times!

Controls: mouse

entries.title: Catapult Whack-A-Mole
entries.description:
Control with WASD and mouse. Mouse right for camera control and mouse left for shooting.


A learning experience with PlayCanvas which I had not used before. 

End result: I don't like PlayCanvas. Everything is just hard to use and mistakes are easy to make. This is why I'm giving up long before the deadline (it is not fun to use bad tools, making something bad doesn't really matter).

Features:

- wheel rolling based on movement (hard to see because they're just cylinders)
- mostly basic shapes used (didn't want to touch modeling tools)
- wheels leave marks
- reloading catapult (with which you probably won't hit anything)
- animations done in code
- blood particle effects
- no objectives

entries.title: Cronus' Tomb
entries.description:
My first LD Jam game. Made in around 68 hours.

You play as... You? I guess?

Fight your way out of an ancient dungeon hosted by greek mythology-inspired monsters.

IF YOU CAN'T DOWNLOAD - LOOK HERE!
If you can't download the game, it's probably because I'm uploading a new version with bugfixes, check back in a few minutes and you should see the download.


Controls

Z - dodge
X - Stab
C - Slice
Arrowkeys - Move
Enter - Skip Dialogue
R - Reset game and data saved for the 'relics' that you find to open the boss door.

NOTE:

Some things may feel missing, I made the mistake of planning a lot of content and got barely any of it complete.

Game on Indiexpo: http://www.indiexpo.net/en/games/cronus-tomb-ld-36

entries.title: Extinguish the dinosaurs
entries.description:
Have you ever had the need to kill some dinosaurs by throwing things at them? I do... all the time.
Grab your chance now and kill those bastards with ancient technology!

Timelapse: https://youtu.be/3cD1nBsG1QE
Gameplay video: https://youtu.be/-n8NHK9zsHI



If there are any bugs, please let me know :)

* Web play on Itch.io has some lighting bugs.
* Walking though walls isn't suppose to be a feature of the game ;) 


***** For best performance, download offline version of the game *****


Soundtrack from www.madebyloop.com

entries.title: Heroes Tavern
entries.description:
Hello everyone.

That is our game: heroes tavern. See the heroes begging for items. It is for you to decide whether to fulfill their wishes. 

Done by:
me(code): korvyashka
art: Crowdel

entries.title: Joe Grainger
entries.description: A stupid physics game with catapults - two players go head to head, they either throw the rock in to the goal posts or force the opposition to drop theirs!

entries.title: Landfill of Underappreciated Advances
entries.description:
"Landfill of Forgotten Advances" is a game where you are digging up lesser thought about inventions that changed the world. It's sort of the ridiculousness of Carmen Sandiego with the optional intel popups of Valiant Hearts and gameplay like a simpler minesweeper. Red means warm, blue means cold.

Levels are randomly generated.


Tools:
Godot Engine
Pixlr


Cut features:
-Originally your shovel had durability so you could lose, it didn't really add anything though other than giving people a place to quit but if people were bored they could do that anyways.
-Sounds… I didn't have time to find one's that didn't just drive people nuts with repetition.


First time using Godot Engine and I have to say I liked it, I hope it gets brought up in more than just passive aggressive jabs against unity in the future.


Blog post on process here: http://ludumdare.com/compo/2016/08/30/ld36-progress-shots-landfill-of-underappreciated-advances/

entries.title: Light Caller
entries.description:
Light Caller
It's the life just better and worse? good or bad? god or devil? Light or Darkness? Get on alone in this journey and call the light.

Gameplay:
You will find some puzzles during the proccess, just solve them. The game is divided in three stages -> Menu, Gates Room and Locked Room, can you find them all?

Controls:
    WASD: Move around.
    SPACE: Jump.


Ok, i think that its all for now, the past hours i’ve focused on the two first puzzles to bring out some "playable demo". By the way, there’s a release of the demo version avaiable.

entries.title: No Man's Earth
entries.description:
CARD
------------------------------
Name: No Man's Earth
Genre: First person stealth game
Platform: PC - Wnindws
Engine: Unity 3D


CREDITS
------------------------------
Miguel López: Programmer and story writter
Jorge Momplet: Game & Audio Designer and Illumination
Paloma Pipeleers: Artist


DESCRIPTION
------------------------------
Metal Gear Solid meets Silent Hill meets Cats!!! Hideo Kojima Wins!

Man's No Earth is a stealth first person game in wich you must have complete a level without being spotted by cats and use a floppy disk for save mankind. You gat 3 Ancient Artifacts that can help you in your mission.


KEY FEATURES
------------------------------
- Stealth mechanics
- Use 'Ancient' Technology against evil cats and save the world!
- 3 different endings


CONTROLS
------------------------------

WASD: Move
Space: Switch Crouch
E: Interact with environment
Left Mouse: Use selected tool
Right Mouse: Run


STORY
------------------------------
Year 2133.

Evil cats have taken the control of all the technology on the Earth and have decimated mankind.

Combined armies of all over the world have been defeated by their own weapons and the terrible but charming cat look.

Every day we are closer to extintion.

However, humans do not give up.

Our infiltrated old women spies have discovered that cats jealously guard 3 powerfull Ancient Artifacts capable of change the course of the war.

Only you, a stealthy ninja deprived of any weapon, has a chance of infiltrate their base, locate the 3 Ancient Artifacts and use it to defeat the cats once and for all.

You are the last hope of mankind.


KNOWN ISSUES IN ORIGINAL VERSION
------------------------------
- You cannont get batteries :(
- Game boy should help you see in the dark, but...
- It is very difficult!!!


POST-LD VERSION LOG (NOT VALID FOR LUDUM DARE!!!)
------------------------------
- AI bugs fixed
- Illumination issues fixed (night/gameboy vision affected)
- Now you can get batteries
- Enemies positions balanced
- Scene props added
- Now you can select a weapon using mouse wheel
- Now you can see equiped weapon/tool
- Minor improvements and bug fixing

entries.title: PALEO
entries.description:
Life in the Stone Age is hard. If you're not losing your finger in a freak flint-knapping accident, you're getting stomped on by a woolly mammoth. You need energy. You need the Paleo Diet! (Paleolithic folks just call it "the Diet.") Hunt and gather all the fish, berries, and meat you need to keep your tribe healthy. Bring down the mighty mammoth and your troubles will be over! (Note: The concept for PALEO was developed while eating Oreos.)

Brought to you by Questwood Studio, the game company that has come to save us from the Everdark, as was foretold in the prophecy!

PC: Play in 1024x786 resolution for optimal graphic performance!
Web: Refresh if you get blank screen. If you don't see the intro text, refresh again!
MAC VERSION NOW AVAILABLE

Code: @ripporkins
Art: @blogofholding
Sound: @chefelf

CHANGELOG
- Fixed most performance issues in web version
- Log no longer scrolls like a crazy person

entries.title: Pix Eliz Great tiny adventure
entries.description:
Follow Pix Eliz in his adventure through ancient temple of Era Backtracking! Yey!
The game was supposed to be extremely themed on how we got from textual game to full graphics games, but my unability to finish it in time makes it... Well... Not about that. Just a sort of metroidvania with a lack of monsters and room.

Basically, use the arrows to move, and the rest of the key will be shown on screen when you unlock an ability.



It's fully fonctionnal, just lack a lot of feature I wanted to put in, like bosses, and I only had time to make the first area decent, yet still unfinished. I couldn't even make the forth area at all...

I'm not sure if I'm sad or proud, because it's the best game I made for the Ludum Dare until now, but I could have made way better if I didn't got stuck on a lot of little but soft-locking bugs... If I find time to, I may try to make it a real short game, you know, these kind of game you pay 99 cents and play half an hour then forget about it.

Last thing, the musics are procedurally generated with a little software I made, but I won't share it because I'm still working on it a lot. Since I'm not sure that's totally legal, I prefer to precise it. Hope you enjoy them.

entries.title: Project Meteor
entries.description:
Controls:
 - Arrow keys or Gamepad to Move
 - Space or Gamepad Button 1 to Jump
 - Enter or Gamepad Button 0 to Interact with the Ship/Use the Drill

Description:

You picked up a strange signal from an asteroid and landed on it to investigate it. It seems there is some ancient alien technology hidden on it.

 A very prototypical version of a puzzle game. The asteroid gravitation took a lot of the development time. With more time there would be more tools, story and more of an actual puzzle to solve :D.

Credits:

Graphic resources:
 - Meteor picture from these from these Lecture Notes: http://www.lpl.arizona.edu/~hubbard/PtyS206/Lectures4/Apr17.htm
 - Space Background by Westbeam on OpenGameArt: http://opengameart.org/content/space-background-1
 - Planet from Planet Collection & Builder by RSL Labs on OpenGameArt: http://opengameart.org/content/planet-collection-builder
 - Everything else by me

Sound resources:
 - Background music is Cliffdive by Fabian Kierse
 - Sounds created using bfxr: http://www.bfxr.net/

Font is Retro Computer by Petyka on dafont: http://www.dafont.com/retro-computer.font

entries.title: RGBJam
entries.description:
This is my first game jam and first completed(ish) game in Unity and my second attempt at a game in Unity. Best at 800x600 still resolution issues. I will continue working on this game as I am classing this as a working prototype.

Its a multiplayer game which uses the ancient technology of colour. First to three wins. You can only score when player colour matches goal colour. Players collide and colour is reset. Also never tested with another player!! Let me know how it goes. 

Player 1 keys A,D and Space

Player 2 keys J,L and Right CTRL

entries.title: stoneagetechgame
entries.description: wasd/arrows move. lmouse to throw. space for techtree(incomplete).

entries.title: Super Cute DNA Sucker!
The Puzzling Pyramid
entries.description:
A puzzle game about matching tiles.
Didn't finish the ending, so just enjoy the puzzles :)

Warning: THIS IS A HARDCORE PUZZLE GAME; the puzzles get difficult really quickly...id be surprised if someone beats all 8 levels.

I was going to make a web version, but there were some issues reading the game files on itch.io so yea.

By the way, The last level is almost impossible. It took me so long creating it and then trying to solve it; Never would have though making a puzzle game required so much work. Enjoy.

entries.title: Time Trigger
entries.description:
A short game about an archeologist cowboy lost in time. Made for Ludum Dare #36.

Controls:
WASD and Arrow Keys move
W and up arrow jump
Space uses the whip to pick things up

Some aspect ratios will not work right, set it to a 16:9 aspect ratio such as: 1280x600,1280x720, 1366x768, 1600x900

Credits:
Manager- Maakole
Programmer- Kino Rose
Artist- Pineappleskewer
Support- Omoroi

entries.title: Unsheathe
entries.description:
Unsheathe is a tile based game where you fight enemies with you magi- I mean high tech sword.

I did the jam for the extra time, other than that it follows compo rules. The .love file is a zip file where you can find the source code.

If you want to play on Mac or Linux then you will have to download LÖVE (version 0.10.0 or greater) - https://love2d.org/
You should be able to launch the .love file after that.

entries.title: Vålnad
entries.description:
This game is, for me, an experimental game. This time I tried to focus more on atmosphere,aesthetics and storytelling; it ended up as a puzzle/mystery game. This is also my first entry in Ludum Dare that's in full 3D! Please enjoy!


Controls:

WASD - Steering
X - Pulse
Spacebar - Boost
Esc - Exit the game

entries.title: Ancient Alien Attack !
entries.description:
Ancient Alien Attakc ! is a Top down shoot them up

Just wait a couple of seconds if you want to see the cinematic, click with the mouse or press space to skip it.

Story :
Lucy, a cro-magnon accidently awaken an old alien species which was hibernating in a sacred cave. Now she must fight for her life.

Controls : 
Arrow keys : moving up, down, left and right
Mouse : aim
Left click : shoot
Space : pause

entries.title: Ancient beast 64KB
entries.description:
You are at your grandfather's house and you didn't bring your tablet or anything. He's out and you are bored! But before he left, he said you could play his favorite game, Codebreaker, on his computer.

Will you be able to compute anything with that 200 year old, hard driveless beast before your patience runs out?

entries.title: AQUEDUCTULOUS!!
entries.description:
Friends! Romans! Countrymen!

Welcome to Caesar's high stakes competition of plumbing, hydration, and civil engineering!
 
Defeat your rival, Vitruvius, to become Caesar's top engineer! Control the flow rate of your aqueduct by pressing any button. Watch out though: your builders made mistakes, and some sections of the track can't handle high speeds.

Using your hair trigger reflexes, keen foresight, and fine motor control, your professional reputation and the thirst of thousands of Romans will be decided today!

Will you ride to glory atop the waves of history? Or be drowned by it?

Good luck!

P.S.: Everyone starts on the same #LD36 level: share your times in the comments! Want to challenge your friends to a faster time on your own levels? Click on the Web version link, and share the URL. Every hashtag is unique!

entries.title: ARMED N' READY!!
entries.description:
ARMED N' READY is a strategy game in which your only goal is to kill the enemy soldiers. Pay close attention to the stats to win each battle. 
Follow me on twitter https://twitter.com/Davethenoobgame

 Click on the weapons to spawn the soldiers  and the fight button to start the battle.

entries.title: Artifex
entries.description:
Artifex is a bridge builder game with ancient roman theme made for the Ludum Dare 36 Game Jam in August 2016.
- Currently just Windows PC version (4.8 MB, requires .NET 4)
- Features nice comic style graphics in roman theme
- Relaxing sound track and great ambient sound effects
- The helpful artifex guy (which is just latin for builder specialist) will "guide" you through the gameplay,
  or he will just make fun of your building skills ..
- Build a tower as high as you can. Score is how high you get.
- Compete with your friends in the online highscore (coming later, did not make it into the LD version).

Made over a weekend with the www.deltaengine.net by Kirsten Grobe-Nitschke (art) and Benjamin Nitschke (code)

entries.title: Bobble Battle
entries.description:
Welcome to Bobble Battle! Protect your friends from your dark foes as they collect the crystals that keep you alive.


This is the Ludum Dare 36 jam submission for Adam Higerd, Austin Allman, and Aaron Stouder.

Controls
=======

Arrow keys / WASD: Move player
Space: Attack
Escape: Pause
Left Click: Select a friend
Right Click: Instruct friend to move

Credits
=======
Map tiles and pointer icon from "Hard Vacuum" by Daniel Cook (lostgarden.com)
Background music "Unearthly Chaos" by LacesLawless (http://www.newgrounds.com/audio/listen/541977)

entries.title: Castle Clash 2: Armageddon
entries.description:
Made in (roughly) ~24 hours!

Castle Clash 2: Armageddon is an immersive robot killing, cannonball launching, game!

Development of Castle Clash 2: Armageddon was livestreamed on Twitch (http://twitch.tv/galacticglum).

INSTRUCTIONS:
--------------
Esc - Pause game.
S - Open up shop.
Q - Switch turret (focus).
Use mouse to aim on active (currently focused) turret.
Click to shoot.

SHOP INFORMATION:
------------------
"Slow Motion" - 200: Slows down enemies' attack rate for x seconds.
"Blitz Turret" - 100: Increases turret fire rate; allows you to shoot quicker.
"Power Turret" - 100: Increased turret damage.
"Blast Turret" - 200: Blast cannonballs rapidly for 5 seconds (applies to both turrets).
"Castle Repair" - 50 Doubloon: Repairs your castle to full health.

entries.title: Catapult Runner
entries.description:
<space> = fire
<- = left
-> = right

entries.title: Decimus Maximus
entries.description:
The time has come to prove yourself in the Grand Arena.
Decimate your opponents and be the last man standing!

Controls:
- WASD to move
- Left Click to shoot (if using the catapult)
- mouse to rotate camera

Gameplay:
Decimus Maximus is an arena vehicle combat game. Ram into your opponents with your deadly spikes, the battering ram or launch heavy iron balls at them with the catapult.
Last man standing wins.

While my initial plan with this was to make it multiplayer, I decided that it's not the best idea to learn how to make networked games in the 48hrs so I've added some really simple and dumb AI.
There's some simple networking code in the source left over from initial tests if anyone wants to play/learn from it.

The game was done with UE4 blueprints and Blender.

Hope you like it. Enjoy.

Mihaivdev

entries.title: Diamond Burst
entries.description: Match up diamonds with statues to make your way through ruins.

entries.title: EgyptGeddon
entries.description:
Sidescroler in which you, an archeologist, (much original XD) find an egyptian bracelet with superpowers. After that the pyramids start taking off like starships and the world goes to hell. Run to one of these pyramids to find what's happening!

--------------------------------------------

This is the first time I make a Ludum Dare by myself, so although the game is really horrible I'm happy to have finished something at least XD

--------------------------------------------

Controls:
Cursors to move Z to jump and X to shoot. Also you can use a XBox360 gamepad.

--------------------------------------------

MANY THANKS TO:
    -JacksonYarr - Xbox 360 Controller Support
    -Nikke - “Dark Intro” Music
    -Gundatsch - “InnerCore” Music
    -DTS www.nosoapradio.us - “DustLoop” Music
    -Jdagenet “Temple of the Mystics” Music

AND ALSO THANK YOU FOR PLAYING!! :D

entries.title: Every Day Is a Sun Day
entries.description:
Our submission for Ludum Dare 36: Ancient Technology!

Take on the role of Archimedes and protect Syracuse from the incoming invasion using your newest invention; The DEATH RAY! Those Romans wont have a chance now that you're harnessing the power of the SUN. Move over moon, there's a new celestial orb in town!

Control your DEATH RAY by using the arrow keys on your keyboard. Destroyed ships will create obstacles that the other incoming ships must avoid. Your beam has a decent reach, but it's much more powerful when the ships are closer by.

FIGHT WITH VALOR!

(This was our first Ludum Dare--It was a lot of fun!)

entries.title: Gladius: The Destroyer
entries.description:
Destroy your foes and people who have wronged you and prepare to face the ultimate evil! You're in control of a fierce gladiator who has lost everything and seeks revenge, fight your way through the roman empire to defeat your main nemesis.

Built with LibGDX, Tiled, TexturePacker, Box2D.

Programming: Daniel McAssey (@DanMcAssey) (me)
Pixel art and other art: Elizabeth McAssey (@bunnycub)

First ever LD game. Proud of the outcome.

entries.title: Ig-Knight
entries.description:
EDIT: Fixed several game-breaking "typos". Reduced file size from 25MB to 15MB.

Developed by Polyrogue
Art by Technicolour

PLEASE READ THE SECTION SEPARATED BY TILDES (~)
I apologise for the lack of in-game instructions. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
WASD to move (Press S to drop from a platform)
Hold Left Click to charge fire spear.
Release when fully charged to throw towards mouse cursor.
Taking damage will deplete your Light. Run out of Light and you die.
Pressing E next to the blue torch at the end of every wave replenishes your Light.

To clarify, this game has infinite waves. Every six waves, however, instead of pressing E at the torch, the door will open, and pressing E will end the game and you get your final score.

If you simply wait, your Light is replenished automatically, the door closes, and the game continues to increase in difficulty for another six waves.

If you die, you lose all your score!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Oh! And I should mention that music is a Royalty Free track by TeknoAxe.

Please let me know what you think, and what your final score and wave was! Thanks for playing!

entries.title: Legends of haired Pyra
entries.description:
Legends of haired Pyra is runner with multiplayer. Ofcourse, not everythink was done, but you can play 5 champions on 3 maps. Every single game have differend skies and road, because that part is proceduraly generated when game is started. Feedback is important for me. :)

Max players: 4
Controllers: keyboard + 4 pads
Play with friends and have fun!

entries.title: Little God Academia
entries.description:
Last night your drank heavily with cute Angelinas. But today is exam day. 
You've got a hangover.. so you copied work of unknown student in refectory. Erhhh.. Good luck, man.

But copied work have some problems. These people easy will kill each other for last apple or kitten. Try to learn these barbarians manners.

entries.title: Melthain
entries.description:
Melthain is a 2D platformer where you control 4 characters to destroy big monsters. The goal being to destroy an ancient artifact in the lowest level of a temple. 

requirement - a rectangular display (16:9 or something similar)

Royal Tea Time Studio is a solo dev studio. This is my 3rd time participating in a game jam. Everything in this project was made by me and I did not used any old assets. I did run out of time a bit. I planned to do way to many things. This is why I don't consider this game completely finished. Characters are not animated, sprite could be improved, I wanted to add more classes, and the level design is nothing like I was originally thinking. But the main point of this game was to learn new things. The last 2 game jam I took part in, I made turn based strategy game. So this time I tried to do a more action-ish game. I also tried to include as much my twitter follower in the process of making this game.

Thanks to my followers -
The warlock class was added.
The artillery class was added.
characters can't move while jumping.
characters pass through each other.
The snake idea.
And more.

Thanks to everyone who made suggestion and supported me.
Also thanks to Nine for this soundtrack.

Music made by Nine - https://soundcloud.com/ninon-aud
Twitter : https://twitter.com/RTTStudio

A classic rendition of the game No Man's Sky in wonderful atari 2600 colours.

Much like the real game, you can explore planets and... well that's it basically. Have fun!

entries.title: Pharablock
entries.description:
Ever wondered how Egyptians built their pyramids? Well, the answer is actually quite simple...


The goal of the game is simple - you need to build the basic shape of various gigantic monuments using nothing but huge blocks and a giant slingshot! You control the angle and strength of the shot simply by dragging the slingshot holder.

You can find block reference and a story in the Help section of the menu.

Thanks for playing!

-------------------

The team:
Pavol Molcsan - Graphics
Milan Vaško - Programming

http://fryhet.com
https://twitter.com/FryhetOfficial

entries.title: Stonehenge unleashed
entries.description:
Did you think stonehenge was just a stone calendar? Think again! It is a crash site! Pyramid ships are attacking, destroy them with your mighty stonehenge ship!

So yeah.. the story didn't really make it into the game. I didn't get even nearly into as good a flow as I did the last time, but I wanted to make something, so here: a shoot-em-up for hi-scores!

entries.title: SwordSmith
entries.description:
Swordsmith

A Ludum Dare 36 Compo Entry
Manage your sword shop! Complete your customers' orders, ranging from copper swords to gold katanas, but don't take too long, or else your customers will leave. Have three customers leave and it's game over! Try to last as long as possible!

How to play

Menu
Arrows: Move Cursor
Enter: Select

In Game
Arrows: Move Player
'z': Interact

You will receive your orders at the top of the screen. There are three weapons (Sword, Shield, Katana) and each can either be in Copper, Iron, or Gold. To make a weapon, first pick up the correct case at the top of the screen, then bring it back to the correct forge at the bottom of the screen. If it's a sword or a shield, your weapon is done and can be brought to the front of the counter. If it's a katana however, you must then bring it to the anvil and mash 'z' to fold it.
More information

Install instructions

This game was made in java with LibGDX, so this game requires a JVM. It should be as simple as unpacking the zip file and double clicking on the .jar file. If that doesn't work, then contact me at [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ and I'll try to sort things out for you!

entries.title: The Great Sphinx Pyramid
entries.description:
Venture into the Great Sphinx Pyramid and uncover the mysteries hidden in its depths. Utilize various mechanisms along the way, find the artifacts spread across and discover the greatest invention of that time.

...it's not like you have any other options, since the highly powerful kitten running the place got veeeery lonely for all these years, and will seek to make the most of your visit.

Made by me for Ludum Dare. The mechanics and the content used in the game were all made in the Jam time, except for some basic file-reading code from Data Toolkit asset of mine.

The Jam version contained only 3 levels, while the most recent post-Jam version has 6 of these. Generally, I'd prefer if you wrote your feedback based on the post-Jam one. ^^'

Enjoy your time with "Trojan Horse"!

entries.title: Antiquis Apparatus
entries.description:
Controls:
UP arrow: release the rope, lowering the hook
DOWN arrow: roll up the rope, raising the hook
LEFT arrow: roll up the other rope, raising the crane arm
RIGHT arrow: release the other rope, lowering the crane arm
TOUCH a block with the glowing point (hook) to attach it to the rope.
SPACE: release the attached block;

Stack all the blocks in the target position to complete the level, it's harder than it looks!

-----------------------------------------------------

First entry on LD and first "game" too, what a day!
Well it's more of concept/prototype, but still I'm satisfied with the result.

These 2 days were full of learning, discovering, curiosity and maybe some swearing because things never work the first time, and sometimes not even the 14th time... But that's part of the fun, right?

I think the whole first day was spent on blender trying to model the crane. I work with code daily but it's mostly websites and web apps, so this was completely out of my comfort zone. But because of that it's much more rewarding to have something done!

I'm a big procrastinator and also one of those people that start 1000 projects and never finish one, so it's a big goal to be able to click the submit button today :)

Things I wanted to implement but had to cut out:
- multiple levels with different configurations
- more realistic handling of the cargo rope, it should get shortened/lengthened when the crane arm angle changes
- title screen, victory screen 
- customizable controls
- better graphics
- audio... sound effects didn't make it, unfortunately

Would love to get some feedback/ideas!
Can't wait to see what everyone made!

BGM used in the game:
"Teller of the Tales"
Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

EDIT:grammar fixes

entries.title: Azteciablo
entries.description:
I wanted to make a roguelike RPG hack n slash. Whew as always I bite off too much.. anyway, I'm quite happy with it in the end. It's quite a bit of fun and a challange. Hope you enjoy it! Please leave some comments and tell me if there are any crashes and I'll fix them!

I wanted to work on making the levels much more interesting, and have some better progression at lower levels, but I didn't have enough time and focused on getting the rest working well enough.

Mouse - Movement
Q - Melee attack
W - Ranged attack
E - Magic attack

Tab/I - Inventory

M - Music
F10 - Fullscreen

Try to beat the online highscore!

entries.title: Come Forth by Starlight
entries.description:
A metroidvania game set inside a recently re-discovered pyramid. I'm not saying it was aliens, but it was aliens.

------------------------------------------

Controls:

A and D to move
W and S to aim up and down 
Shift activates diagonal aiming mode.

S to drop through platforms

L to shoot
; to jump

F4 enables some debug features. When in debug mode, K is suicide and backspace is reset, which simply reinitializes the game and returns you to the entrance of the pyramid. 

Rebinding:

The executable version does not support key rebinding, but if you run the game from source, you can modify keybindings.lua in the source root.

------------------------------------------

The game is far from finished. It lacks the sound, enemy variety, and map size that I wanted to achieve, but it has progression and a win condition of sorts, so it'll do.

Made with LÖVE

The egyptian name for the Book of the Dead translates more accurately as "The Book of Coming Forth by Day."

entries.title: Dino Dash
entries.description:
You play as an ANCIENT Dino dashing through the air after discovering an awesome TECHNOLOGY called a jet pack.
So dash through the air and try and survive mass extinction!

~How To Play~
The Dino Follows the height of your mouse.
Move your mouse up and down and avoid the meteors.

This game is a visual novel. The focus is on plot and character designs. This game is only in alpha stage, but we will try to add all the locations and characters and update the music during next one or two weeks .

This is a heat-ray technology game,you have to let the carrots to grow up on this grass field, the player act as a mirror to cast ray, i got little time to do this, but hope you like it .
This is the first time i try to draw everything in game by myself with oil painting tool- ArtRage.

entries.title: Hapalochlaena
Iviking
entries.description:
The Longship! The pinnacle of naval technology throughout the Viking Age!

The trouble is, it's ahead of its time. You're not even supposed to have most of this technology for a few hundred years - and you're the only one on board who knows how to use any of it.

On deck, you have a compass to point North, a small flag to show the wind direction, a helm to steer, a horn to replenish your boarding parties, a dramatic-looking axe to speed up and slow down, and some bizarre nautical equipment to raise and lower the sail.

Oh, and you've accidentally sailed into the middle of a raiding party, who are not happy to see you. Defeat the enemy ships, and try not to get killed. Good luck!

WASD or arrow keys to walk, mouse to look. Click repeatedly on things to perform actions.

---

entries.title: Sticks, Pipes, and the Call of Nature

======================
SPATCON 
======================

It's THE illest rhythm game of the 4th century!
Dance, jam, and rock out to the freshest beats of Ancient Greece!

======================
How To Play
======================

As the notes pass the first fret, tap the corresponding number key* that pops up. The closer the note is to the fret, the greater the score! Move on to increasingly challenging levels as you rock out. If not, well, you get to try again.

Kermed
Elenesski

entries.title: TFE: Transport for Egypt - Karaoke Edition

Travel for Egypt: Karaoke Edition.
Every journey matters. Just turn off your brain.

Be the fastest and most economical camelbus!
Party game for 1-3 players.

How to play:

entries.description:
Join the archaeologist, Sam, on one heck of a ride as he searches for a mythical lost treasure with his faithful companion, Lucy. You'll flip as you experience the world from different perspectives and Sam's life goes topsy-turvy the further he goes down the rabbit hole.

Created by Omiya Games and Apostrophe (http://ludumdare.com/compo/author/apostrophe/).  Character, portal, crate, and spike art by SpaceJase.

This game is funded through Patreon. Many thanks to the following:

Adam R. Vierra
Joshua Jennings
XanderHD
Tommy Pedersen
Jacob Clark

Dev Log:
v0.1 - initial release.
v0.2 - WebGL release.  Fixing spelling errors, too.

entries.title: Before The Fire
entries.description:
Danger! Higly incomplete prototype.
Arrow keys for movement. Z or Space for context action.
Gather food and use weapons of stone age.

entries.title: Bullet Reality
entries.description:
After finding a mysterious stone tablet you've gained the powers of a witch. Survive wave after wave of invading ancient robots.

Flap mode - Tap to flap
Fly mode - Hold down to rise

Controls:
Jump - Left click or W or Up arrow
Shoot - Right click or D or Right arrow
Switch fly mode - Space
Start - Enter

Art/Programming - Kyle Parsons @Frump3d
Music - Joel Tansley

entries.title: Defend Earth From Ancient Asteroid
entries.description:
Defend Earth from ancient asteroid!!!

source: https://github.com/Stephen-Seo/LudumDare36_AncientTechnology

screenlapse video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IKUJNYWhtBo

entries.title: Dolus
entries.description:
Dolus a game of exploration in magnificent proportions.

Controls:
A - Move left
D - Move Right
Left-Click - Interact

If Windows stops the game from running click on more info and run.
Otherwise you can run the the jar by double-clicking on it or from Command Prompt with the command:
java -jar Dolus.jar

For others you can import the source to eclipse and run it there.

entries.title: Egyptian Builder
entries.description:
You are the last Eqyptian builder after the robots attacked. You must save Eqypt with your skill.
==============================================================================
Controls 
arrow Keys = movement 
Space = throw your Gears
R = restart
==============================================================================
---------------------------------SPOILERS-------------------------------------
There are 3 kinds of robots 
normal- you can hit him anywhere
high- you can hit him only in the body
Shield- you can hit him in the back

entries.title: Endeavour
entries.description:
Hi there and welcome to my comp entry, Endeavour. It's a text controlled game where you lead an explorer through a perilous journey with plenty of surprise twists. The ending might also leave you scratching your head!

For the best shot at success, use short, imperative commands like "walk", "look", and "eat". If ever you get stuck, "help" should provide you a large hint.

If you're a Unix user, try using some of the more well known Unix commands. You might find some fun surprises.

Apologies for no sound. I guess this really is Ancient Technology!

Any feedback is very welcome, and thank you for playing Endeavour.

entries.title: Forest Walk
entries.description:
Forest Walk is a quick 2D side-scroller that can be played through in a couple of minutes. Use arrows to move and explore the deep dark secrets of the forest. 


Tools:
Game was developed with love2d. 
Music was created with guitar, cheap webcam mic and audacity. 
Graphics were done with Krita and Gimp.

Linux version requires love2d to be installed, so the easiest way would be to play it on web.

entries.title: Gronk, Stone Age Barber
entries.description:
Before lubricated triple bladed smooth glide razor blades, Gronk (the stone age barber) had his flint.

Gronk shaves good when slow.

Don't draw blood, Gronk.

How to play... Shave your customer by moving the flint over the beard with your mouse. Move it slowly. Use space bar to move through title, instructions, & game over text.

Created in about 9 hours with Click Team Fusion, Pixel Art app, Paint.net, Caustic.

I tried to keep it simple & do something different this time - most of my other games are "finish this game as quick as you can" based, so I wanted this to be a game where you've got a better chance of winning if you're slow rather than fast. It's a short game too - only 1 round. Maybe in a later version you'll get a chance to shave a woolly mammoth.

Update: I wasn't happy with the text fonts, so changed them in the post comp version. Font (Pixel Breack) is from Fonts101.com

entries.title: I want this gold
entries.description:
I want this gold

  A very rare Egyptian relic is lost inside one of the pyramids, but since you are a quality collector you will not give up on this rarity.
  Legend has it that the relic is kept in a kind of security with an old technology, but for that time, this technology was very advanced

SoftWares used:
 - Unity
 - GIMP 2.8

entries.title: Jack and Casie
entries.description:
Jack and Casie is about a mysterious talking inventory named Jack and his master Casie, a magician's apprentice who has never heard of the words 'self control'.

Casie ambles around getting into trouble and / or fights and it's your job to manage her inventory, keep her healthy and hand her weapons to defeat enemies as she explores the mysterious, hyperadvanced ruins of the Ancients and gets harassed by suspicious moles.

entries.title: LOGO - The Game -
entries.description:
A strategy resource manager and crafting game amazing prehistoric "Cars" =D

This game is make by Simón Sanchez (graphics ans sound) & Santiago Menelao (programming and godot compiler(?) x) )

entries.title: Operation Unfinished Morse
entries.description:
This is in no way a game... We had a great idea, but I was too slow to code (and stubborn, since once again I started to do everything from scratch)...

This is my third entry in ludum dare and this time I enter with my sister who did the artworks. 

The idea was that you are a soldier in a WWI kind of war that suddenly had to do the morse communication for her division.
first It would mainly involve taking clear text and "morse" it, and the other way around decode morse messages and transmit them to the team.
But day after day you would have first to encrypt the message so that the enemy would not understand it.
We had the idea to add side quests, like sending a love message or altering some messages to gain some kind of benefits, or commit some acts of treasons

So what is in Operation Unfinished Morse
There are 
*  some ui elements ( you can shift papers, read the notebook, type on the morse ), 
*  some sort of generative music ( sometimes it doesn't load the first time you may need to reload the page)...
*  some input messages ( morse sound ) and output message ( text to send ) 
There is no : 
*  gameplay...
*  no storyline

we'll continue working on it, in the following weeks

entries.title: Roma Evolution [Zen Experience Type Game]
entries.description:
You are playing as Praefectus (roman city overseer) who must expand his province and defend it from barbarians. 
Every day you will have to make a decision which will influence city. Read carefully popup windows and keep an eye on your province's needs.
(Gameplay instruction is inside game)
It's more of a "zen experience", just take your time, read text, choose wisely and watch your city grow.
I wanted to add more gameplay mechanics but i run out of time. Anyway i hope you will enjoy playing.
DISCLAIMER: Options during siege/raid don't matter, they are there purely for cosmetic/comedic purpose.

Controls: mouse

Soundtrack was made by my friend, here is his youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwwsRV8QC06KpyPaLUPRXfQ

Everything except 3 textures and music was made by me in 48 hours.
Programs used: Unity, Visual Studio, 3ds max studio, Photoshop

entries.title: Sailing The Sea
entries.description:
Many years ago, sailors relied on the stars for navigation using a sextant. You too shall do the same in Sailing The Sea.

The aim is to get to the other side of your map. Press "m" to bring up the night skymap and navigate your way across the sea. Watch out for tornados and whirlpools. Use the arrow keys to move

If you get caught up in a whirlpool or a tornado. Press "r" to start from the beginning. Alternatively refresh the browser/reload the game to load up a new map/adventure.

This is the first game I have made using Pixi.js and HTML5 (figured I should try something different since I am used to working with unity). If you have more experience than I do with this setup, then please give me feedback on the logic of the code itself, its structure, and let me know how I would improve upon it for future work (e.g what should I change / do for next time should I extend this game further).

Game by Cosmosquark: http://cosmosquark.com
Artwork by Brenniscool: http://brenniscool.tumblr.com/
A Dark Field Games collaboration: http://darkfieldgames.com

night sky image: http://i.huffpost.com/gen/1272354/images/o-DARK-SKY-facebook.jpg
whirlpool: http://orig06.deviantart.net/c6a4/f/2008/124/e/d/pixel_art_whirlpool_by_dethklok78.jpg
tornado: https://cdn2.iconfinder.com/data/icons/weather-24/256/Tornado-256.png

entries.title: TankXP VR
entries.description:
Oh no! An alien invasion! Time to strap on your Vive and show them who's boss using your awesome tank. Unfortunately, your tank's operating system seems to be a little out of date....

This game was built for the HTC Vive. It assumes you have at least the smallest room-scale VR setting (no standing-only settings).

Check out some gifs here:
https://superheroesinracecars.com/2016/08/29/tankxp-vr-drive-a-tank-to-fight-aliens/

entries.title: Temple Escape
entries.description:
While exploring an ancient Aztec ruin, intrepid explorer Carolina Jane found a clockwork Aztec robot! Activating the robot, however, has triggered a failsafe, causing the ruin to start collapsing! Help Jane escape the ruins with her prize!

A simple side-scrolling, endless runner type game made by myself and a friend using Unity. See how long you can last in the collapsing ruin. While the game is not as finished as I would have liked (there's no audio), I hope you enjoy nonetheless!

entries.title: The amnesiac adventurer and the Temple of Doom
entries.description:
There was once a great adventurer...
Long ago, he explored the fearsome Temple of Doom and knew every traps and dangers...
But now, back facing his mission again, he's amnesiac!

How to play:
YOU HAVE TO DIE AND REMEMBER WHERE ARE THE TRAPS. THEY ARE NOT RANDOM. WE ARE JUST FOOL AND CRUEL GAME CODERS...
Use keyboard arrows. Push the gears to activate ancient technology and open doors. Collect maximum gold, catch the statue, do not die.

Code: David (Gamecodeur) Mekersa
Gfx and Animations: Antoine Calas

Made with: Visual Studio / Monogame / Tiled / Audacity
Tiled reader by: https://github.com/marshallward/TiledSharp

Free sounds and music from http://www.gamecodeur.fr

I create all from scratch in around 15 hours of work. Just started with few lines of code to display a sprite. It is my first production with Monogame. I wanted to use this Jam to improve my mastering of Monogame and C# and to create a tile 2D by tile game engine.

entries.title: The Lost Caveboy
entries.description: A 2D rpg where you play as a lost cave boy in a land filled with dinosaurs.

entries.title: The Safegaurd of Goldfinch Rock
entries.description:
|| NOTICE ||
     If you have the opportunity, please play the downloadable version of our game. It is much better than the web version is, in terms of graphics and functionality. If you do happen to play the web version, play in full-screen.


It's World War IV. After the events of World War III, the world was sent back to the medieval era, where only remnants of advanced technology remain. Kim Jong-un has sent his army of wooden robots to attack one of the last remaining lighthouses of your kingdom, Goldfinch Rock.

Defend the lighthouse, and don't forget to head around the back of it to buy a few upgrades along the way!

Press 1 & 2 to select melee and ranged weapons.

All sound effects (except for unity's FPS Controller), models, textures and code (except for iTween and, again, unity's FPS Controller) was made by us.

~Created by Nicholas & Graham

||  Patch Log for version 0.2
  -Fixed crossbow equip bug
  -Fixed bug where the crossbow does the wrong amount of damage
  -Fixed bug where you can get stuck on the lighthouse

entries.title: The Tourist
entries.description:
After a day out taking pictures, you find yourself in a mysterious crypt.

WASD Movement, left-click to move though dialogue
hold left click and release to, attack, space to jump.

I know the game is difficult, because of the ladders :/ but the game is beatable, however short. I did not get time to add a ending so beating the boss is sufficient.

entries.title: Ancient Racing
entries.description:
Ancient Racing
Where Cavemen compete till the death, or until there is no more meat.
Use the arrows or WASD to move, P to pause and R to restart.

Made in Unity.

Warning there will be a lot of bugs most likely prepare yourself.

entries.title: Ancient Techno Low-G
entries.description:
Ancient Techno Low-G is an pulsating arcade of hack and slash action that test your wits and reflects.

An ancient paraplegic called Low-G has stumbled upon an ancient technology deep within the mines of Ancoria that enables him to hover and move faster than normal human beings. But, by doing so, he has unleashed an endless torrent of monsters that will wreck havoc upon the world.

Can Low-G put a stop to it with his new found tech and makeshift Axe?

Playable with XBox 360 Controller (recommended).

Made entirely in Unity 5.4

By Effinjay Studio for Ludum Dare 36


About the development:-
The game was developed entirely in Unity. Modelling, Animation, and AI Programming. 

The only thing that wasn't made by me was the sound effects, background music and the floor texture. 


Enjoy!


#LudumDare
#LudumDare36
#LD36
#LDJAM36
#IndieDev
#IndieGameDev
#IndieGame

entries.title: Aqueduct Defense Force
entries.description:
Use the ancient power of aquaducts to defend your small, sad, ugly kingdom.

HOW TO PLAY

1. Click on the RESERVOIR in the center of the screen to create an aqueduct.
2. If you connect the aqueduct to a building, the building will ACTIVATE
3. If the aqueduct isn't connected to anything, it will spill water

HOT TIPS

1. Building an aqueduct costs 100 STONE. Attach an aqueduct to the MINE to generate STONE.
2. Aqueducts can be DELETED by RIGHT-CLICKING on an end
3. Your reservoir has a limited amount of water. Rain will cause it to refill.
4. ???
5. You can SUPER POWER a building by connecting it with MULTIPLE AQUEDUCTS!

K, thanks. Try to have fun.

entries.title: BugRocket
entries.description:
Controls: W, A, S and D

Our team:

entries.title: Carolina Jones
entries.description:
My first attempt at a Ludum Dare game. It's a cute little adventure, where you play as the dashing hero, Carolina Jones. Upon crashing in a jungle, you find an abandoned temple...
Update: Fixed some debug stuff I left in (a room was lit that shouldnt have been, normal cursor on top of new cursor, room was in wrong order)

entries.title: GRASS
entries.description:
PLEASE READ INSTRUCTIONS BELOW:

GRASS is "Gorgeously Realistic" Adventure Survival Simulator based in ancient Egypt (or something like that) with VERY complex crafting system. If you love crafting games, like Minecraft, Space Engineers and Factorio, where is many resources - you will love this one. 

Your main goal is to take your people to the stars. Craft, dig and hack for survival. Use hammers and tinkers tools to craft parts of the machinery. 

INSTRUCTIONS:
                        [[[How to play]]]
WASD to move, Space to jump.
Left mouse button to pick, dig, cut and hammer.
Right click to pick ore (pick hot ore with tongs).

Dig, pick ore (RMB) bring it to smelter. Wait until it is hot, pick with tongs, put on an anvil. Use a hammer to make an ingot.

To craft, use crafting table grid, put items in the slots (RMB). Hit crafting table with a hammer to produce item. Use tinker tool to craft small items.

[Q] to drop all items from both hands.

More instructions will be in Alpha.
