entries.title: Gravitone
entries.description:
Gravitone is simple "Gravity" based "Dodge the projectile" endless game.

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B9UfEobPOdwXOU9ub3ZVamcxVzg

This was a "rushed" game, as I only started doing it in the last day of the jam. And yes i made it in GameMaker because i didn't want to cry and die over code in the last minute.

ps: First Ludum Dare, i have no clue what i'm doing XD.

entries.title: LDCode
entries.description:
My submission for Ludum Dare 36.

Docs:
https://zvonimirr.itch.io/ldcode

entries.title: logic puzzles
entries.description:
In vacation, I hadn't time or computer to participate to this LD.

But I had a train journey, and during this journey, I made some logic puzzles as I read in old magazines.

This is just text game and in this way feet with the "ancient technologie" theme, I try to have protagonists with old jobs too.

entries.title: LOST BOT
entries.description:
After a long travel through space, an adventurer finally find his old robot buddy, but he is not alone, a lot of machines from an advanced technology try to capture his badly injured friend.
The adventurer decide to do everything possible, day and night, to save him quickly and bring him back home.

Controls :

Q/W = Move right
D = Move Left
Mouse = Aim
Left Button Mouse = Charge/Shoot

Edit notes :

New versions are coming this week, with debug and more gameplay. 
An online playable version is coming soon too.

entries.title: Lunar Defense 3000
entries.description:
Save the future using the "Ancient Technology" of the past!
A loving parody of Moon Patrol.

I didn't have time to fix the collisions for the guns so the enemies don't shoot and you can't kill them unless you crash into them, but it is still dang hard to make it those 10 kilometers. Good Luck!

Right Mouse or CTRL or Down Arrow fires
Left Mouse or Space or up arrow jumps
left and Right Arrows control your speed
A toggles auto-fire
clicking the middle mouse button enables mouse based speed control.

I also made an Android version, but there isn't any way to put that in the submissions, so here is a link for you :

https://www.dropbox.com/s/c9io5uedl5fkjzj/Lunar%20Defense%203000.apk?dl=0


Touchscreen: one finger fires, two jumps, three toggles touch speed control

entries.title: Optica
entries.description:
PROBLEMS!

This standalone version of the game is actually pretty broken compared to how it ran in the editor. First time using Unreal Engine 4 and didn't
think to extensively test outside the editor.

So basically the physics is totally messed up and the game crashes every once in awhile (awesome), also the camera doesn't move correctly. I will try to fix this up.

CONTROLS:

- WASD or Arrow Keys (Space or Up to jump)
- F to pick up a mirror
- R to restart level

One of the earliest known examples of human manipulation of light is the Goseck Circle in Germany, a wood post construction built approximately 7000 years ago. On sunrise and sunset of the Winter Solstice, the light shown through the southeast and southwest gates, illuminating whatever was standing in the center.

This game is not quite like that but it does involve manipulating light.

entries.title: Overlap
pipe
entries.description:
exploration platformer with awkward controls

| | | |

controls:

arrow keys + z/x (or use a GAMEPAD)

P - change palette
O - go back to original palette
M - mute music
Alt+Enter - fullscreen

| | | |

music by mc hepher


| | | |

if you're stuck on the first screen, press Z (or your GAMEPAD equivalent)

| | | |

mac verison / less buggy version coming soon

entries.title: Rock ON
entries.description:
Technology has gone crazy! Battle the possessed tech with increasingly ancient weapons to get to the bottom of what is happening.

Controls
WASD to move. left mouse or space to dismiss dialog. During the battles, wisely choose your weapon from inventory in order to defeat your opponent. To remove an item from inventory, you must not be in a battle.  Then you click the inventory item you want gone and it is GONE.  No getting it back.  But now you have freed up a spot.

Hotdogs
If you click on a hotdog at anytime you eat it and gain health.  If you click on the hotdog to regain health during battle, you get the health but you used up a battle turn.

Misc
All graphics and music created during the event. The code was also developed during the event. I wanted to do a platformer with our great code library we built up, but no no. We just had to make a final fantasy style game.

It turned out great, so I can no longer complain. Learned a lot about this genre too.

Special thanks to TinkerMill for providing the community that makes this so fun.

entries.title: SDP - Save Da Princess
entries.description:
SDP - Save Da Princess

Discover a brand-new concept of video games!
The princess has been kidnapped, can you rescue her?
(Say what? This isn't brand-new?)

Discover some ancient technology: the fork!

A game made in 48 hours with a homemade engine and GIMP, I hope you'll like it :)


------------------------------------------------------
     HOW TO LAUNCH DA GAME?
------------------------------------------------------
- Windows users: double click on the jar should be enough, otherwise execute the "run.bat" file
- Linux users: you must open a terminal inside the game folder, and type "java -jar ld36penguin.jar"

------------------------------------------------------
     HOW TO PLAY?
------------------------------------------------------
- On the main menu, press SPACEBAR to play
- Then use (A or Q) to go left, D to go right
- SPACEBAR for actions (attack and shopping)
- You can also use the arrow keys

entries.title: Super Numerobis Broccoli Defender - Babylon Edition X
entries.description: You incarn Numerobis who has the mission to transport some vegetables to Hanging Gardens of Babylon. However some mythological creatures do not agree about the trip. You have to protect your broccoli cargo against these scoundrel.

entries.title: Temple Guy
entries.description:
A platform style game in which you must find the treasure and leave the catacombs.
You can teleport with an ancient orb to find your way through the level.

entries.title: Terror of the Tomb
entries.description:
My entry for the Ludum Dare #36 Compo.

The theme was Ancient Technology. The controls are explained in the game, but here's a little reminder

W A S D to move

J to Melee

K to shoot

You are basically exploring caves and ruins when you stumble upon an ancient extinct civilization. When you enter the ancient machines seem to malfunction and attack. discover what happened to the people trough the setting of the game. 
I hope you'll enjoy this game and let me know what you think. This is my second entry (the first one was a piece of glitch). I'm also usually the artist in a design process, so coding.... not my strong suit.

entries.title: The Awakening of the Golem
entries.description:
An ancient technology awakens... KILL THE HEATHENS AND RETURN TO YOUR RECEPTACLE IN THE ANCIENT TEMPLE!!!

WASD to move
Left click to punch
Right click to use laser (when charged)

Notes:
- I know it's annoying that you stop when you punch, but it makes it a little more challenging and I didn't really have the time to do the animation I would need to make it look right if you kept your velocity when punching. 
- There IS an end to this game. Don't just run around killing people until you get bored. Look for the temple and enter it when you think you've killed enough of the humans. You can go get into the golem receptacle to view the scoring screen at the end.
- Seriously! Please play the game until you at least reach the scoring screen, or else you won't get to feel a sense of accomplishment! :P
- This is my first actually remotely fun or kinda good 3D game (other than some minor test projects I've done), plus it's a solo entry, so please be gentle

entries.title: The Journey
entries.description:
The Journey is a small horror themed game about going home, riding your bike, all while trying not to crash and/or go insane.

As with most Ludum Dare games, there's a lot of features and ideas that was cut. I did end up with some gameplay, and it is possible to beat the game- Although I put more effort into the "failing" part of the game.

As for the Theme- I planned to make the theme more obvious than a fairly vague reference to it, in text, but.. it is what it is.

I hope you enjoy it.

###- NOTICE -###
The UI is not optimized for 4:3 resolutions, and some GUI elements may go off screen. I recommend you play in any of the 16:9 resolutions- And use sound!
Also - Play with sound! - As most of the Audio is from Freesound.org and I haven't spent too much time editing the sounds, you may want to -NOT- have your volume at full.

As usually with my games, OS/X and Linux versions have not been tested.

entries.title: The oldest human technology VS NAZIS
entries.description:
A Simple Physics Puzzle Game made in 4 hours hope you enjoy!
You are a scientist jew who decides to use the oldest human technology to defeat the nazis and save the jews!
i made this game in 4 hours in the last day of the LD, before going to college if you find any bugs let me know!

Twitter:@DanielFelipePTA

entries.title: The Sleeper
entries.description:
Captain's log, stardate 218636.2

I'm on my way to the planet Zebes, but here's something that might be interesting:
The computer is telling me there is a power source hidden in a meteor nearby.
I've got a hunch there's some treasure or perhaps some technology to loot here!
Will make a quick stop to take a look.
Looks like the source is located deep inside the meteor.
It's kind of like a cave but it's way too cylindrical to be natural.

I have landed and will go have a look.
There's even a local atmosphere inside this cave, I won't be needing my space suit.
I will bring my laser pistol, though.
Be back in a sec (famous last words, eh?)

Signing off, 
Captain Lance Harding.
---


All stuff by me during LD.

Tools used: phaser.io, Sublime, Aseprite, Audacity & bfxr.net

Edit: I've added the ability to crouch to the Post LD version.

entries.title: Under Siege
entries.description:
You are a stronghold, under seiege by another. Inspired by age of war you must send out units to defend your base and attack theirs. You must also harvest materials to fuel your war effort - finding a balance between military power and harvesting capability is key to victory.

Art by http://ludumdare.com/compo/author/pixelate/
Music from https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/content/34407
Various sound effects borrowed

entries.title: "Office Space"
entries.description:
Curious extraterrestrials find ancient artifacts.

The game's short, and easy, but very polished if we may say so ourselves!

Linux users: Please install Löve from https://love2d.org/ before playing.
Everyone else: The other downloads are self-contained - enjoy!

entries.title: A viking game
entries.description:
Your village is attack and you need to protect your totem.

controls:
AD or QD to move
space to throw your weapon
left click to attack
right click to use shield

this my first time doing a ludum dare.

entries.title: Ancient Astronomer
entries.description:
You are an ancient astronomer looking at the ancient night sky.
Trace constellations with others and determine who drew the chosen topic best.

IMPORTANT: At least 2 people need to be playing this game. If you are stuck as host alone may I suggest inviting a friend so you can see what the game is all about?

**Fixed a bug having to do with losing the host and getting stuck.
**Fixed issue with peers leaving the game.

entries.title: Egyptian Dare
entries.description:
Join Professor Ludum as they work in the Egyptian desert to uncover the mysteries of the ancient sport of Dare. 

How do you play Dare? What does it mean to win? What did it mean to the people of Egypt?

All this and more will be answered, when you play EGYPTIAN DARE.

This is a two-player game, but can be played solo. 

(if you stumble across any secrets, please don't post any spoilers!)

CONTROLS:

Player 1 uses W and S to aim, and Left Shift or Space to fire.
Player 2 uses the up/down arrow keys to aim, and M to fire.
If there is no Player 2, hit T for a simple Ai to play against.

POST-SUBMISSION FIXES:

- balancing changes, UI polish and bugfixing 
- P1 can fire with spacebar, if you suffer from sticky shift keys

entries.title: Electronics Super Shop
entries.description:
Electronic Super Shop is the only shop in the block that can get you updated on your old memories.
Bring your VHS, MiniDiscs, Hi8 or MiniDV tapes, and we'll find a way to plug that out to any thing you want!

The player takes the role of a electronics shop who receives requests from clients, to plug old content into various devices.
Using a connection system, the player must find a viable way to transmit data from the source to the receiving end.


CREDITS

Code:
Ana Lopes (https://twitter.com/jasonmccaslin)
Graphics:
Débora Almeida (https://twitter.com/deboralmeida) 
Marco Vale (https://twitter.com/MarcoValeKaz)



CHANGELOG:
(27.08.2016)
Reset game manager.
Fixed game finish (you weren't able to make money).

entries.title: Ethan Nichols
entries.description:
Ancient Technology has been lost, but one adventurer (You) decided that it's time to discover this technology.

You find yourself in front of a wall, filled with puzzles to solve.

Will you be able to see the Ancient Technology, or will you succumb to the difficulty of the puzzles.


Please know that the game runs in a 1600 * 900 window. So it is recommended that you screen be bigger than 1600 * 900. (1920 * 1080 is the preferred monitor resolution).


Please let me know what you think, on Itch.io or Here on the submission page. Feedback is a great thing to have, and it makes me sad that ratings aren't happening for the first time I do a Ludum Dare

entries.title: Fire
entries.description:
In the distant future...
A disaster happened on Earth which caused the stop of everything.
Nasa center, Florida desert.

You must uncover the long lost ancient technology called “Fire”, in order to get to planet Scadrial and ensure Humanity's survival. To do this, you must fight the enraged Warinite sectarians who protect the last flammable object, the sacred tree.

entries.title: Gear Kitty
entries.description:
This is my 6th Ludum Dare entry and it's always an awesome, yet stressful experience. I had to cut back a lot this time, specifically the dialogue and having a more streamlined gameplay experience, but I managed to get something out which is great! I hope you enjoy. :). 

Gear Kitty
Game by Raiyumi

Made with:
Engine: Stencyl
Sound: Sfxr/Audacity
Music: Made with Beepbox
Graphics: GraphicsGale

entries.title: Joey's Adventures
entries.description:
Joey works at a bank. Don't get me wrong, he loves his job but he always 
had the feeling that something is missing in his life.

Every night Joey dreams about how he would be as a world traveler, in search 
of big adventures and that extra spice for his life.

What is Joey going to be in his dream tonight? A ferocious pirate? A fearless jet pilot?
Or maybe the famous treasure hunter?
Let's see...

Can you solve the ancient puzzles untill your torch runs out?

By the way, really cool experience, our first Ludum Dare and we are looking forward to next one!

entries.title: Kites
entries.description:
[How to Play]

 - Only shoot the blue kites
 - You lose points for any blue kite that passes the red village
 - You lose points for shooting down friendly red kites

[Controls]

 - A: Select Left Canon
 - W: Select Top Canon
 - D: Select Right Canon

 - Canons point towards the cursor
 - Canons Shoot faster the further the cursor is

 - esc: Go back to Main Menu
 - Space Bar: Pause

[Credits]

Programmer: Carl Vitasa

entries.title: No Touch
entries.description:
A short game about trying to find out what the cat wants. The initial thoughts were to collect parts to reform an ancient technology, but I like this better. There is a calculator though.

Tools used: 
IDE: Flash Develop 
Library: Haxeflixel 
Art: Gimp 
Tile Editor: Tiled
Sound/Music: OpenMPT 

Controls: 
Arrow Keys to move and Space to jump

entries.title: Oscilloschaos
entries.description:
​This old oscilloscope has an interesting video game. Maybe is a little broken, but the video game is fun. Catch the green light!

Cursors -> Move
Space -> Shake
Escape -> Exit

Made by Casevse for Ludum Dare 36 #LDJAM

entries.title: Raiders of the cursed Temple
entries.description:
Well... started with a rather small project for my first 48h Compo Entry.

It's based on the old technology of my youth which everybody hoped he could forget: The shitty LCD handheld games. :)
(Ok... might not reaaally fit the theme, but since there are no ratings anyways: just have fun with it ^^)

It's a small dungeon crawler, your objective is to find the crown of the king (which is always in the last chest of the maze... which doesn't seem to have too many forks now... but don't mind that)
On your way you'll find a lot of skeletons which will try to stop you.

Controls are mentioned on the main screen of the game.
You can find Potions and Attack-Upgrades in the other chests.

Tools used:
Sfxr - for the few sounds actually in the game
Photoshop CS2 - not that my shitty attempts at pixel art would have required it
Unity3D 5.4 Personal Edition
Visual Studio 2015 Community Edition


I had fun creating this game, since the few mechanics it uses, seem quite easy scalable for bigger projects.

Edit: Removed OSX Version, since it doesn't seem to work. :(

entries.title: Stone Age Clicker
entries.description:
Cookie Clicker in 2D! Develop your stone age civilization!



GOAL OF THE GAME

- Build a golden statue for the gods.
- Unlock as many achievements as you can along the way.



IF YOU HAVE FRAMERATE ISSUES

- Use Firefox
- Reduce the size of the game window



COMMENTS

I ran out of time so I overran the Jam time limit by about 10 hours. (However I started developing the game about 10 hours after the jam started, so theoretically the game was made in 72 hours. :P)

Since the LD 36 games aren't being rated, I allowed myself to add the following features post-jam:
- Various bug fixes
- Adjusted building costs of shrine and brick house for better balancing
- Music and sounds
- Main menu with credits and fullscreen toggle
- Saving function
- Added two additional tutorial pop-ups

If you want the "true jam experience", mute the sound, don't save the game and wait a bit before building a shrine and a brick house ;)

Make sure to check out my development time-lapse videos!



SOUND CREDITS

- Music was generated with Jukedeck (Music from Jukedeck - create your own at http://jukedeck.com)
- LittleRobotSoundFactory on freesound.org
- dland on freesound.org
- Motion_S on freesound.org
- UncleSigmund on freesound.org
- Kodack on freesound.org
- InspectorJ on freesound.org

entries.title: Stone Revolution
entries.description:
In this game you are Kelly and must protect the Stone Age of a mysterious  stone robots attack.

#LDJAM

entries.title: Stone SpaceShip
entries.description:
!!Play with sound on!!

You are a cadet pilot of an interplanetary builder crew. 
Your job is get your crew on spot, do required actions and get them back to safety.
As your last training mission, you were sent to Earth to help build the pyramids.
LISTEN to the given commands and try to successfully complete your training.


Controls:
W,A,S,D or ARROWS – move
Mouse – look around
Mouse Left Button - use



Our team members:
Yotsuki - voice acting & game design
Anna Sviridenko - Unreal programming
Vladimir Gaidenko - art
Daria Paramonova - Unity programming & sound design





================================
We tried to make a little experiment and exchanged our usual roles... so programmer created sound design, artist wrote code, game designer tried to made art, and another artist made voice acting and game design.
And we wanted to try our hand with Unreal Engine after so much time with Unity.
Alas, we failed at some point to accomplish this, and assembled all created content in familiar environment just a bit under 3 hours till deadline...

entries.title: Stonehenge Earthquake
entries.description:
Hello all!


First timer here. Learned unity while doing this. Had a lot of fun.


Gameplay / Overview: 
The basic idea is a simple game with fire (a super old "technology") to try to get to the green gems.

Avoid the rocks in the earthquake. A simple hit by them could send your fireball into the sky and into the water :(

Controls: Use arrow keys to move around



Youtube Video of Game: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hBrLGdkpnG0

entries.title: The Crush
entries.description:
The Crush is a game where you are suddenly stuck in a crushing room in an ancient temple. You must think quickly and arrange the objects in the room in such a way that the walls will be braced and you won't get crushed.

Instructions

WASD to move, Left-click to pick up objects, Right-click to drop them, Hold Shift to run.

Assets from Unity Asset Store: Mayan Temple:

https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/content/39399

twitter: @joemagiv

entries.title: The Late Fee
entries.description:
In 'The Late Fee' you play as the average diving-suit-wearing Joe on his way to the VHS rental to return a tape. On your way you'll encounter obstacles such as Space Demons, Meteorites, sharks etc.

Controls
WASD/arrow keys to move
Mouse to aim
LMB to shoot

UP/DOWN/W/S to navigate menu
Enter/Space to confirm

Full disclosure:
Friend made meteorites and player character
Audio was ripped from various places
Music: https://soundcloud.com/ruari1/8bit-battle-music
Explosion was also ripped
Everything else was made by me

Website: tagmose.dk
Twitter hjalte_tagmose

Tools:
Unity 5.something
Visual Studio Something numbers
Aseprite
Audacity
Windows Explorer

entries.title: tranzeve
entries.description:
The unexplainable complexity, size, and precision in constructing The Great Pyramid at Giza (completed around 2560 BC) has led some to conjecture that aliens had a hand in building the pyramids in Giza. This simple action game designed for my preschool grandchildren tests speed and reaction time as they help Orecka The Alien-Sweeper vacuum the Alien Building Supervisors away from the pyramids. I used Processing.js to make this game. Executable versions are provided for all platforms except Android. 

Use arrow keys to help ORECKA sweep the 20 aliens off the pyramids. See the time taken in seconds and play again to improve your score.

entries.title: VHS Rental - A retail nightmare
entries.description:
Some people are telling you that VHS tapes are obsolete "ancient" technology. Lies! You wont let this rental store go out of business!

Suffer through your shift at the video rental store, where you must assist helpless customers in renting the movie they're really looking for.

Each customer will give you a clue as to what movie they really want to rent, click on the movie that matches to earn the business money!

Click on the movie they really want +$15
Click on a movie of a matching genre but not the right movie +$10
Click on the wrong movie and they trash your VHS tape -$25

Good luck!
Post your scores!

Notes:
This is my second ever Ludum Dare, and the first I've committed more than a few hours to.
Unfortunately I ran out of time this weekend and couldn't develop sound effects or music! This is something I would love to work on for my next Ludum Dare. Overall I'm pretty satisfied with my efforts and if I had more time, I would have improved the flow of the game, as well as added visual reinforcement of successful actions.

entries.title: WhipUp!
entries.description:
Put in the shoes of the right hand of the Pharaoh and build the greatest pyramid of all time!
Manage your workers assigning them to the right labour, and keep the whip warm in order to finish your wonder in time!

Use the mouse to interact with the elemnts on screen.

-Click on the arrows on the right/left to move the camera to the different buildings
-Click on the arrows on the top/bottom of the progress bar in order to assign workers (or relieve them) to that labour
-Clink on the buildings to speed up the progress

-You need to assign workers to the quarry in order to get blocks of rock
-You also need 10 workers assigned to the pyramid, and 1 foreman in order to get the rock from the quarry and get it to the pyramid.
-Train foremen in the foremancy
-Get more workers by assigning some to the "love house"

Once you've completed the first structure of the pyramid, you'll have to hurry, and complete the cover of the wonder in half of the time!

-------------------------

This game is a complete technical demo, but will differ from the final version. This version is ABSOLUTELY non commercial.

The in-game text is in Spanish. 

4FreaksFiction. 2016.

entries.title: Wrath of Amun-Ra
entries.description:
RETURN TO YOUR TEMPLE

WASD to move, mouse to select PLAY. When in doubt, walk forward.

Originally this was an AR Civ-style builder game. That was a bit out of scope, so it became this.

entries.title: 4000 B.C.
entries.description:
In the not-too-distant future, nuclear apocalypse has reduced mankind to hoards of roving savages.

It's up to JESUS CHRIST to venture through the ages and recover mankind's ancient technologies. And also fight aliens.

Mounting his trusty dragon - the Holy Spirit - he seeks out the most influential figures in history!

entries.title: A Guillotine
entries.description:
A weird text-based pseudo-game about making weird text-based pseudo-games.
[Use mouse for input]

entries.title: A.L.F.I.R.E.
entries.description:
Anti Lizard Flying Improvised Row of Explosives (A.L.F.I.R.E.) is an arcade game in which you need to quickly set fireworks up to defeat the green dragons that are attacking you and the blue dragons that are attacking the city!

Use the arrow keys to control the character and the 'Z' button to get paper, stick and powder to build a firework. Press 'Z' again to place fireworks where the red arrows indicate. You can also use the 'X' button after placing a firework to aim those rockets at the blue dragons.

Team:

-Diego Vínicius "Vinnie" Mendes do Nascimento - Art, Music, Sound Design, Game Design

-Emerson Roseiro Filho - Lead programmer, Game Design

-Jun Moriyama - Assistant programmer

-Lucas Capucho "Kpucho" de Araujo - UI programmer, Programmer, Game Design

-Lucas Takashi Ito - Sound Design

entries.title: Bat-o-Wave
entries.description:
This game was made with using of ancient technology of QBasic. Before yesterday I didn't know anything about it (usually I use GMS), that's why this game is so madskillzish. But it was very interesting and exciting experience.

You are bat. You must hunt and avoid predators. Use up-down arrows to move and  right arrow to shoot. Good luck!

entries.title: Cave
entries.description:
This is my first Ludum Dare Game. The theme is Ancient Technology. What's more ancient then pushing boulders into holes? Nothing! The game is short and easy. All you have to do is find a boulder in a dark cave and push it into a hole. Hope you enjoy and Happy Ludum Dare!
P.S. Sorry for any one using a non-windows machine ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

entries.title: Da Vinci's Cobra
entries.description:
In Da Vanci's make-do wooden tank, you must fight your way through Florence, slaughtering snakes in your way, before they destroy you.

This is the first entry I have made in a team, and this is my team mate's first Ludum Dare (In fact, his first game!). We are proud that we made it this far. We hope you enjoy our entry for Ludum Dare 36 :)

Controls:
D - Move
Space - Shoot

entries.title: Dream of Floppies
entries.description:
Dream of Floppies is an atmospheric arcade game requiring you to mobilize all your skills, awaken your reflexes and release your imagination.

A meticulous adventure into a world forgotten, Dream of Floppies captures inspiration and creates a sense of familiarity—if not nostalgia.

(Coming soon) with a fine selection of music to accompany you through your gameplay.

Explore the dreamy world of Dream of Floppies.

entries.title: EverDown
entries.description:
In ages long past, the Akrasian Empire ruled the world with their mastery of time and space, conquering their foes with weapons the likes of which the world has not seen again ten thousand years hence. Though a bitter succession war reduced their great cities to rubble, it is said that fragments of their ancient technology still lie buried deep beneath the earth...

Alas, all this is little concern to Pan-Terra Mining Corporation, a conglomerate that sees the Empire's ancient ruins as little more than an obstacle to the valuable mineral deposits buried underneath. You are an intrepid archaeologist who has discovered the location of a cache of priceless Akrasian artifacts - unfortunately, Pan-Terra is preparing to strip-mine the location, destroying the artifacts in the process. Dig deep, dig fast, save as many artifacts as you can, and find a way out before the beam reaches you...

Keyboard and gamepad controls supported. Arrow keys (or d-pad/analog stick) to move around and aim your shovel, Z (or A) to dig.

Collecting five artifacts of the same color will give you a powerup:

Buster (Red): A matter-rending weapon, once the bane of the Empire's enemies, now a powerful excavation tool in your hands. Fire it with X (or B) to instantly dig a hole five layers deep.
Shovel (Gray): Is it nanomachines? Strange temporal mechanics? A long-lost energy drink recipe? However it works, for ten seconds you will be able to dig more quickly through stubborn rock and stone.
Slowdown (Purple): Pan-Terra's mining beam takes time to eat through the ground. With this powerup, time is on your side: the ever-accelerating beam will be slowed down somewhat, giving you more breathing room to collect artifacts and find an exit.

These artifacts aren't the only remnants of the Empire's technology you will find: there are still-functioning teleporters in the form of glowing yellow-and-green tesseracts which will take you far away from the encroaching beam, artifacts safely in tow. But how much is enough? Do you take the first exit you find, or do you delve deeper, risking incineration for the sake of greater treasure? The choice is yours...just don't let the beam catch you, or all your work will be for naught!

Developed with ZeroBrane Studio.
Graphics created with Aseprite.
SFX created with Bfxr and Audacity.
Music created with FL Studio.

Special thanks to all my playtesters for their feedback!

entries.title: Farming Sim BC
entries.description:
​Warning: contains pixel nudity


The theme for ludum dare 36 was ancient technology, so I decided to make a game about one of the first farmers!


Controls are customisable but defaults are:
Space - Use item
Shift - Cuss at weeds
Ctrl - drop/pickup item


Tools used: Unity, Audacity, lmms & Gimp.

entries.title: Geomorph
entries.description:
My intention was to create a little platformer game where, after you get 'cursed' trying to unveil the mysteries of an ancient tomb and transformed into some kind of egyptian relics of different shapes and properties, you try to reach the end of the tomb using your new abilty to change your shape to get your normal appearance and maybe discover who's buried there...

The game is not finished yet.

CONTROLS:
W, A & D : Move the character arround.
←↑→ (ARROWS): Change character's form.
SHIFT: Use character's special abilty (form dependant).


TODO:

* Fix pyramid dash. Is broken af.
* More maps, lol
* Add deadly spikes and lava
* Add obstacles
* Add intro and menu
* Add ending

THANKS TO:
Andor Salga for the hieroglyphs sprites - http://opengameart.org/content/hieroglyph-sprites

entries.title: Hero of Alexandria
entries.description:
Learn actual Greek history with the most famous Greek engineer of all time, Hero of Alexandria. Discover his greatest inventions. Kill Romans. Hear nothing.


CONTROLS:

Arrow keys/WASD to move and jump
Space/X to shoot

Optionally use 1-4 keys (numpad works too) to switch weapons once you've unlocked them, although not sure why you'd want to.

OBJECTIVE:

Survive till T-0, that's all.

entries.title: Jukebox Jam
entries.description:
A jukebox audio game!  You catch the falling notes to have them play.

Controls:

Left and Right arrows, or A and D.  P is to pause!


We've had some issues with this project, mostly in terms of delays and tech troubles.  We had to hard turn from a 'note racer', but we compromised with this.


I wanted SPACEBAR to let you go into some kinda 'hyper mode', but we didn't have time for that either >_<  We got the full music track done way late, so I spent a bunch of time tweaking and adding some stuff.  So we've gone a bit over... hope you enjoy anyway!

entries.title: Little Village
entries.description:
The Little Village, well pretty happy with my first attempt for ludumdare sadly lost a lot of time on the last day so have to upload the game in a state without sound or a victory condition but luckily had the rest sorted before stuff came up. Hope you guys enjoy

P.S The Source download contains a link to a zip which contains the game as well as the project its self

entries.title: Mayan Painter
entries.description:
A simple painting game were you paint on random Mayan hieroglyphs.
The colour pallet is on the bottom left, the hieroglyph front ans center and the submission for the hieroglyph in the bottom right. It just requires a mouse click & drag.

entries.title: No Viking's Land
entries.description:
Score points for the right to enter Valhalla.

Credits:
Made by:
Delvin Louro, Diego Gonçalves, Henrique Cacau, Yuri Cruz.


Music by Matthew Pablo
http://www.matthewpablo.com

entries.title: Old Discovery
entries.description:
TheControls:

WASD Style Controls

_________________________________________________________

You are Thrown By A Weird something into this old ancient place u have to survive

entries.title: Protetorium
entries.description:
Edit 02/09/2016 - Added Itch.IO Link
 
 https://drzanuff.itch.io/protetorium

Protetorium

Arrows - Move Pads

Can you discover the secret?

- Two endings
- A hidden Message
- Permadeath

I did this game, in my spare time during the weekend. I really liked the results. Please if you liked the game, say what are your theories about it :P

entries.title: Pyramid Explorer
entries.description:
Pyramid Explorer is a game where you explore a procedurally generated dungeon inside a pyramid. Your goal is to seek out and collect three pieces of an ancient artifact. Your player can run, jump, and use a grappling hook with an attached rope. You can swing on the rope and climb up and down.

Created with Monogame and Visual Studio 2015 Community. I also used the Farseer Physics Engine for physics, Ninject for dependency injection, and Json.NET for loading Json files. Full source code and assets are available on BitBucket (see the Source link).

Very proud of my work during this Ludum Dare. Planning to continue the concept going forward.

entries.title: Ravan
entries.description:
"Ravan" is a 3D action platformer.

~ Story ~
The desert people of Sonora lived happily.
The Aqueduct had provided them with fresh water for longer than anyone could remember.
No one ever questioned where the water came from, until one fateful day the Aqueduct ran dry.
The young lad Ravan was the only one brave enough to go out and investigate the incident.
He followed the Aqueduct for days until it led into an ancient pyramid...

...and then he entered.

~ Controls ~
WASD / ZQSD / Left analog stick to move
Space / Gamepad A to jump
Left mouse button / Left arrow key / Gamepad X to swing sword
Right mouse button / Right arrow key / Gamepad B to throw discus

~ Thanks to my testers ~

~ Tools used ~
Unity 5, Blender, FL Studio (VST: SQ8L_2), GIMP, jfxr

entries.title: Time to Travel (With the addition of Warfstache)
entries.description:
Wilford Warfstache goes on a journey with Prof. Resnov, the two of them meet up with the Aztecs/Spanish (depending on which one you choose)

controls:

Z = Shoot = 10 points 
X = Knife = 30 points
C = Heal = 20 points
Left = Walk left
Right = Walk right
Teach = 20 points
Encourage = 20 points
Shift = Run

entries.title: Aerial Rune Hunt
entries.description:
Fly an ancient style of plane, look for the 6 runes in the world and take them to the location which is only known to the rune, so let it guide you.

Pickup the runes by flying close above them.
If you crash you will respawn at the start. If you had a rune, go back to where you crashed to get it back.

Controls: 
W & S - Pitch
A & D - Roll Turn
Q & E - Yaw Turn
Shift - Faster
Space - Slower
A gamepad should work, however has not been tested.

entries.title: Ancient Robots
entries.description:
Control an Ancient Robot thought to be a plane or space ship using the age old technology of punch cards. These punch cards seem to be made of stone and have aged well.

Controls:
  Use the mouse to select which Punch Card instructions to give the robot.
  You can click a card from the planning area to remove it if mistaken.

Extra Controls:
  WSAD, ARROWS, or Right Mouse Button will allow you to move the camera
  SPACE or Middle Mouse Button will reset camera to see the robot

entries.title: Ancient Ruins
entries.description:
You're an adventurer who traveled to the ancient ruins to find the priceless treasure "The Witch's Eye". Beware, the ruins are plagued with traps to keep unwanted guests, and guess who wasn't on the invite list?

Ha, that was fun to write. The game doesn't have any sound fx,(I wish it did, it would make the game more intense). A lot of the mechanics are physics based and that was something kind of new to me. Everything except the Unity game engine was made by me within the 72 hours(which means I'm really tired and need to go to sleep soon).

I have a time lapse video of the whole process of making this game on my YouTube channel here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tFCgUO-Ssfw&t=7s if anyone is interested

I hope you enjoy the game and please leave some feedback. Have a good one!

entries.title: Caveman Runner
entries.description:
Run Caveman run. You need to need to collect the fire and get back to your cave, while running from the other cavemen. 

Arrow keys to move, 'S' to attack after getting your spear.

This is our first Ludum Dare submission. The game was made using Phaser, art was mostly obtained from opengameart.org (a few sprites where made with Piskel. The audio is all original.

Any feedback would be much appreciated.

Overall, it was a lot of fun.

entries.title: Elsa, Caster of the sun stones
entries.description:
Elsa, Caster of the sun stones

My Ludum Dare #36 Entry.

you play as Elsa : your goal is to protect your home land for 360 seconds, and cleanse it from the monsters if you can.

player clickable weapon: throwing stones.
player passive skills: you gain extra health every 20 second.

your enemies for this level, are Flies that are Occupying your left area, and mean fishy moths that are polluting your right side. it is your choice, which one to cleanse and activate the shield to help you with the invasion. 

or just wait and a Mass your health with no risk, until the shields are turned on (after 300 seconds). 


controls are simple : WASD for movement Left-Control for shooting (or left mouse button). J or Space for jumping



instructions: UnZip and play.

Credits: i own Zero percent of all the art that is in the game(all i did was code the arts i have gathered). and i was in a hurry when collecting them because well, it was a rush. so im sorry for not providing a list of Credits. i'll try to group them up and post them sometime.


final words:

best of luck hope you had a nice time. and i hope you enjoy my game, even if for a second 


Edit: the only change on the file which i made six hours later was
changed health of main base from 50 to 20 and did same for shields. otherwise the player would never lose (it was high for testing purposes ) good thing ludum dare allows for tiny edits like that 
Edit2: now it can be played in Browser and downloaded too.

entries.title: Floppy Disk Glitch
entries.description:
In this game you ARE the most ancient of all technologies- the Floppy DISK!
You must collect the documents in this platformer to fill your bytes. Then you must deposit them into the computer. But Wait? Is this a glitch? Is this supposed to be happening?
