(sorry the game's so buggy and short, we didn't have enough time!)

We used an NES color palette,
Famitracker for music,
and several programming conventions used in old games.
Hopefully it gives you that beautiful retro-game feel!

(use ALT+ENTER to toggle fullscreen)

entries.title: Seeker of Knowledge
entries.description:
This is a stealth oriented game, where you have to evade the rogue robots while trying to acquire the special books of knowledge still inside the library. 

Controls:
-WASD -> Movement
-Shift -> Run
-Ctrl -> Crouch
-E -> See the target books for a few seconds through walls. (Hard to spot, you need to be relatively close by)
-RMB -> Aim
(While aiming)
-LMB -> Flash the robots, stunning them for a few seconds
-LMB while behind enemy -> If you have any discs, you can hack that robot to attack one of the nearest other one.
-LMB while looking at interactable objects -> pickup

entries.title: Solar
entries.description:
Controls:

    SPACE - Shoot your solar ray [Distance travelled dependant on charge time]
    LEFT / RIGHT ARROW : Turn solar ray left / right
    UP / DOWN ARROW: Move solar stone position up / down
    ESC: Quit the game

The ancient aztecs discovered a way to charge up a solar stone with sunlight so they can defend their world from the demons and creatures coming from deep under their pyramids. Save their world (or gaining points until you die).

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I'm just happy that I finally "finished" my first game for Ludum Dare and not giving up somewhere inbetween. It's not really polished and it's really missing some juice / animation and sound but with a dead internet connection over the weekend and all other stuff happening I'm just happy to participate:)

Feel free to comment bugs and feedback.

Greetings,
Suimisu

entries.title: Sounds of Samos
entries.description:
It's the world's most ancient loop station! Use gears to build a mechanism that plays various instruments, and drop sick beats like in the good ol' Pythagorean times.

The game features two game modes:
- Freestyle mode: Build whatever you want, use as many instruments as you like, and jam away!
- Challenge mode: Build a mechanism that replicates a given beat you hear.

HEADPHONES ARE RECOMMENDED!

Basic instructions are included in-game.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

TIPS:
- You can stack smaller gears on larger ones (only if the large one is already connected).
- Each instrument can produce two different sounds, depending on which way its gear is rotating.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

The Challenges can get quite hard. I'd love to know how far you get.

THANKS FOR PLAYING!

entries.title: Starwalker
entries.description:
This is an obstacle course type of game, first person point of view, heavily inspired by Unreal Tournament's Bunny Track game type.

Based on WebGL technology, it is designed to be played in a desktop browser.
Controls are arrow keys and space.

Changes since submission: by a popular demand, improved control, player rotation 2 times slower on the demo site and fixed the annoyance when pressing buttons, now they should not affect the webpage scroll (file starwalker.js). The source contains the original zipped version for historical reference.

Aug 31, 2016: I really appreciate all the comments so far: what amazes me is how much seemingly small technical details such as "air control" are more important to players than fancy graphics. This gives me some ideas about where to go from here, how to  and how to better structure the learning curve throughout maps to make it as fun to new players as those who have decade of experience with this type of games...

Special thanks to the video reviewers. They give me an invaluable insight into the user experience. For example, Daniel aka SirPhoenixGaming seemed to have hard time struggling with controls, while Jupiter_Hadley seemingly skipped through it super fast, I'm so impressed.
https://www.twitch.tv/sirphoenixgaming/v/86519298?t=35m12s
https://youtu.be/hC8B45eG0n0?t=12m9s

entries.title: The Tomb
entries.description:
You are a archaeologist trying to find the hidden artifact in the tomb...
Try to find the artifact and get out of there before something comes after you.

With an ancient artifact orb, which seems to be imbued with some sort of essence of the wielder, and the power to reveal the secrets of the ancient tomb, you set out on a randomized adventure of tomb plundering.

Control your character, watch out for monsters and traps in the ancient tomb and find the ancient staff of Anubis and flee while you can.

CONTROLS:
Move with wasd (or arrow keys)
Use shift for running, (but you will get exhausted - look at your orb).
Use left mouse button to shoot out a navigation orb from your artifact.
ESC (Escape) to exit game.

Please note that the WebGL build have some image/lightning glitches and that mac/linux builds are untested.

Made in roughly 7 hours. I was at a family gathering at the weekend so threw this together in 2 hours Saturday plus my Monday evening after work.

It's a short, rubbish, daft thing with a few branching paths but you'll get sick of it before you see them all, haha.

Hope you have some fun!

-S

entries.title: 40 Days, 40 Nights
entries.description:
This game isn’t really a ‘game’. It hasn’t got any goals, although if you want any of the mechanics for another game then feel free to use the code in this.

Features:
-Randomly Generated Characters (Names, Age, Height, Appearance, Skills, etc).
-Managing Characters to work at certain points around the map.
How to play:

-Catch Fish at the fishing spot.
-Cook them at the bonfire.
-Cooking & Fishing uses tiredness.
-Sleep to replenish tiredness.
-Health not implemented but the eat at the table to replenish Health, uses cooked fish.

The orginal idea for the game was to have to survive for a certain amount of time and keep all of the Players alive. If you’d like to work on this and expand it into a full game, feel free. I think a lot could be done with this if you design it right. I just didn’t expect everything to take this long and I was unfortunately pretty busy over LD36 weekend :(

itch: ansitygames.itch.io/40-days-40-nights

Source: https://github.com/AnsityGames/40day-40nights

Cheers,
Anthony from Ansity Games.

P.S. Although Ansity Games is a team, only Anthony worked on the game which is why I sent it into the compo :)

entries.title: Ancient Contact
entries.description:
Controls: 
Tab - switch between mouse/keyboard
Left/Right/Mouse movement - move saucer
Space/Left mouse button - engage tractor beam

Welcome to Galazon mobile, inc., Domination Engineering department. Your mission is to improve galanet coverage in this sector by using Self-Building Boostable Magma-Powered Neutrino Projector towers. Proceed to the building site now.

".. thanks for changing me pal, I owe you one. Don't worry, just drop the payload on the ground, and thing will basically build itself. Throw some matter into convertors and it will be even faster. Easy as piece of momma's phasdragl"

Note: for increased fun we left out developer spawner keys enabled. You can find them if you want to play around.

Team Volcanic Giraffe, ladies and gentlemen:
Alexey Grishin - code, music, sounds
Ruslan Kibets - code, PR
Anatoly Sazanov - art

entries.title: Ancient Defense
entries.description:
Sorry, the game is unfinished, maybe we will add post-ludum version sometime later.

You can play one level, use 1 or 2 (keys above Q and W) to switch between buildings that you build to protect the earth from aliens. Click the building to fire it.

entries.title: Aqueduct
entries.description: Hi all! We are two oldschool game geeks from Lugansk. Thi is our first try in Ludum Dare. This is somewhat pipemania-like game

entries.title: Aqueduct Architect
entries.description:
RECOMMEND downloadable version or fullscreen web version to small web version; it gets really crowded in such a small window.

My first Ludum Dare game! I'm very proud of Aqueduct Architect, and I plan on working on it more after LD is over. Scroll down on itch.io for downloadable versions and source code.

______________________________________________________________________________

Directions:

Manipulate Camera----------WASD/Arrow Keys
Build Mode--------------------B
Cycle Build Segments-------C
Rotate Segment-------------Mouse Scrollwheel (or Z and X, or < and >)
Place Segment--------------Left Mouse Click
Select Existing Segment---Right Mouse Click
Erase Mode------------------Delete
Pause-------------------------Esc

___________________________________________________________________________

Tools:
Unity Personal Edition 5.4
Blender 2.77
Microsoft Visual Studio Express
GIMP 2.8
Crazybump 1.2
www.abundant-music.com

entries.title: Aqueduct Racer
entries.description:
A game by Demetre Liakos, Ross Bawden and Matthew Basson.


Surf through the aqueducts of an ancient sky civilisation!

CONTROLS
-----------
UP or W -> Jump (Triple jump)
LEFT or A -> Break
RIGHT or D -> Attack
DOWN or S -> Quick drop
SPACE -> Restart 
ESCAPE -> Quit

Hit the boulders, dodge the bombs, collect the coins and see your score!

entries.title: Crazy Catapults
entries.description:
Crazy Catapults.

A 4 player local multiplaying game.
Who can survive the longest!?
Hide in your castle, or go full on offensive, 
or even "rocket jump" yourself into air to shoot from above!

Best played at 1280x720 (encountered scaling issues).

Keys:
P1:
Left & Right Arrow keys to move.
   Up & Down arrow keys to aim.
   Hold Right CTRL to charge, and release to shoot.
   Press Right Shift to respawn (in case you get stuck etc.)

P2:
A & D keys to move.
   W & S arrow keys to aim.
   Hold Left CTRL to charge, and release to shoot.
   Press Left Shift to respawn.

P3:
J & L keys to move.
   I & K arrow keys to aim.
   Hold Spacebar to charge, and release to shoot.
   Press N key to respawn.

P4:
numpad 4 & 6 keys to move.
   numpad 8 & 5 arrow keys to aim.
   Hold numpad 0 to charge, and release to shoot.
   Press numpad 1 to respawn.

0 (zero key) to restart the game.
Alt + F4 to exit the game.
   
Enjoy & thanks for playing!

Credits:
Programming, Design, and Art by Ryan Satyabrata
Music "Skipping Through the Orchestra Pit" from NutcaseNightmare via open.commonly.cc
Made with Unity.

entries.title: Don't Let The Shit Get You
entries.description:
Don't Let Shit Get You
The game where you decide who shits and who don't.

Control who have access to the only latrine in town and fell the power of deciding if a person shit itself or not.

Game made in 48h for Ludum Dare #36

A game by Matheus de Almeida
São Paulo - Brazil

github.com/temdisponivel

Engine: Unity3D 5.X

Source code available in: https://github.com/temdisponivel/Don-tLetTheShitGe...​

All the art and sounds in this game weren't made by me, here are the following credits:

entries.title: First Fire
entries.description:
About:
In the darkness and coldness of the night a man is about to die of hypothermia when a lightning strike hit a three near the dying man saving him.
But the fire can't go on without something to burn. So the man has to catch some firewood to keep the fire alive.


Intro:
Fire, the beginer Ancient Technology.
Survive keeping the fire burning.
Catch the branches and bring the to fire.


Controls:
Move: W,A,S,D or Arrow Keys.


Team:
Paulo Roberto Cruz (Programer)
Gustavo Macedo (Programer)
Mexwendell GM (3D Artist)

entries.title: Follow The Light
entries.description:
WASD to move, e to use current power, r to reload.

You play as an alien stuck in a temple, the only way out is to open all the doors. to do so, move the mirrors so they bounce the light to the crystals. enjoy and tell me whatever you think about the game.

entries.title: Golem
entries.description:
Program your own golem by placing stones on the board.
Battle against other players' Golems.

----------------

I made the game myself, but didn't manage to finish it for the compo.
I used Unity, Photoshop, Audiosauna.com
Font: PR Viking by Peter Rempel

Updates:
- Bugfixes
- New Start Screen

entries.title: Laserface
entries.description:
Laserface is a game about killing scary monsters in a colorful world filled with retro consoles to find.

Kill scary monsters and destroy not so scary blocks with your eyes.
Lasers, monsters, pink blocks, beautiful shaders, play pls

entries.title: MMO Dev Tycoon
entries.description:
This is the most ambitious project I've taken on for a Ludum Dare. While I wasn't even close to finishing my initial concept, I'm proud of what I did get done and I think it at least shows what I was going for.

The idea is to create a game in the tycoon genre, like Roller Coaster Tycoon, where you manage an MMO world. This includes designing and building the world, managing business costs, and responding to player feedback. I was inspired by a developer who is currently a few years into developing exactly this kind of game. You can check out his dev blog at http://www.vectorstorm.org/2014/01/21/mmorpg-tycoon-2-roadmap/.

- WASD or Arrow keys to pan camera, mouse wheel to zoom in and out.
- Use the buttons on the left to add NPC quest givers and artifacts to the world.
- Players will automatically accept quests from NPCs to seek out the ancient artifacts.

I learned an incredible amount about what I can and can't easily do in Unity, and I'll take that knowledge to all my other projects.

If you're having performance issues with the WebGL build, the Windows version should be an improvement.

Thanks for playing!

entries.title: Monocular Rift
entries.description:
Understand how the monocular rift work and traverse platforming puzzles with a intriguing game mechanic.

Controls
Mouse
Scroll to Zoom
R to restart

Game Design and Programming by:

Gustavo Guimaraes
twitter: https://twitter.com/Ghust95
github: https://github.com/Ghust1995

Special thanks to Luiz Henrique and Daniel Cardoso for helping with overall design and complicated math.

entries.title: Old Stone
entries.description:
People of the Stone Age have learned to use technology more ancient civilizations.
In the depths of their cave , they found a machine that could create amazing mechanisms.
In this game you create a machine to protect your home.
It's my first LD and the first serious project , so the game came out very small . There are 2 types of weapons , and 4 of the enemy , it is very, very small. But it took me a tremendous amount of time and effort.

entries.title: OLDNYUZ
entries.description:
OLDNYUZ is a game about how information was gathered by spies in really old times.

Your goal is to collect news before they get outdated and increase your world trend knowledge to full awareness.

CONTROLS : 

Left Click = Select Spy / Select Destination
Right Click = Unselect Spy

Escape = Quit.

IF GAME CRASH : i encourage you to try teh windowed version. Sometimes on windows 10 or windows 7 64bits there is some issues with fullscreen.

Done with monogame, solo.

entries.title: Plague Doctor
entries.description:
Heal hordes of diseased as a plague doctor in a medieval town. 

You have equipped yourself with the latest Plagueproof™ protective gear, a cane and some medicinal herbs. Facing you are a 100 citizens of a town suffering from the black plague epidemic. Can you free the city from this blight or will you join a long list of corpses who tried and failed before?

CONTROLS
Arrow keys - moving
Z - Cane smash
X - Medicinal bottle
C - Healing flash

** CHANGELOG **

Fixed a HORRIBLE bug that wouldn't show "you win" when you win
Also fixed text not showing in certain places

entries.title: Retro Revenge
entries.description: Game made in 12 hours in the LDGC36. Please, use gamepad and press ENTER or START BUTTON to play.

entries.title: That Maze
entries.description:
A short game made for Ludum Dare 36. Doesn't really fit to the theme of "Ancient Technology," but it was fun to make nonetheless. Enjoy.

Controls: WASD/Arrows to Move

Essentially the idea is to get your character (that green alien/thing) to the green ball by utilising a variety of strange tiles. You'll have to work out what each tile does.

Once you've played through it once, try creating your own levels! It's simple, just check out the Custom Levels pdf (Itch.io)!

Get community made custom levels at: goo.gl/9EXToA

entries.title: The Final Siege Of Petersburg
entries.description:
The Final Siege Of Petersburg. Is a game where you lead your union soldiers into battle. During the skirmish your goal is to push your men up to the top of the map.

--Controls--
W,S,A,D - Basic Movement
Mouse - AIM
Left Mouse Button - Shoot
E - Ride horse/cannon
1 - Buy a soldier Price: 1
2 - Buy a cavalry unit Price: 5
3 - Buy a cannon Price: 25

You get 1 mp point for every confederate you kill!

entries.title: Vault of Raza
entries.description:
The Vault of Raza is a 4 player cooperative board game. You must control a machine for long enough to open to open the vault. However, this ancient machine is on the verge of collapse, and will need to carefully manage the pieces.

Generally, how the game works is there is a 3x3 grid of tiles, and two tiles are connected if their adjacent edges are the same color. You must keep a "spark" moving between tiles as you work to unlock the vault door. To do this, you will need to careful turn, move and otherwise manipulate the board to create a path for the spark. The tiles will be destroyed over time, and the board will be harder to manipulate.

The hastily written rules are included in the zip, as well as images to use for the game pieces. Sadly, I did not have time to make images for the cards, so you need a normal set of playing cards for them.

entries.title: Voxel of Evil
entries.description:
How To Play :

Arrow to move
Hold LEFT Ctrl to Aim
(While holding CTRL LEFT) Press Space to shoot

The game is absolutely not complete.
Like a lot of people I lost track of time and sent this very unfinished compo entry  !

entries.title: You Invented Fire
entries.description:
This is an arcade style protection game. You must stop ghouls from destroying man's greatest invention FIRE.

I'm a solo team, designed and built everything myself.

Things I learned:

I spent way to much on design. I love the art, but it limited my ability to balance the game and work out bugs. 

I've never built a game before. I've toyed around with Unity, but the build process and screen resolution stuff was entirely foreign to me. Still having issues with UI rendering

Things to do with more time

Different enemies with different attack patters
Better signaling when a ghoul reaches the fire
More balancing of the spawning pattern to make it more interest
Better signaling about how and what your current combo is
Better signaling about when you can jump again

Please suggest other comments below

**Changed the web version from deprecated unity web player to WebGL

entries.title: Archaeologist Henry
entries.description:
Extremely short game about archaeologist Henry.

------------------------------------------------

changelog:

-fixed locked door bug

entries.title: Castle Siege
entries.description:
In this game you need to manage a kingdom by keeping you civilians happy, make wars with other kingdoms and build defenses.

How the game works:
- You need to defend your castle by hiring soldiers (lower left)
- You need to keep your civilians happy about the taxes (lower right)
- You are able to make war with other kingdoms and they can make war with you
- When you win a war you steal gold from the other kingdom and you will make that kingdom much weaker
- When you lose a war it is possible to lose many of your soldiers,civilians and gold
- By buidling structures you will increase the happiness of your civilians, strength of your defense, strength of your attacks and even get more gold daily
- You are able to hire more soldiers to defend your castle or for attacks on other kingdoms

This has been my first Lumdum Dare game and sadly enough because the lack of available time(school, homework) it didn't live up to my expectations.  I made the music for the game but in the end I did not have time to implement it. Also there is no audio which I really wanted to implement. Anyway my first experience of Lumdum Dare was great I learned so much and I will surely do Lumdum Dare more! Also I will keep updating this game on gamejolt

entries.title: CAVEMAN HARRY
entries.description:
I'm REALLY happy with how this turned out!
This is by far the largest game I've ever made with the world totalling at 35 chunks, each containing 672 tiles!

The game was inspired by old ZX Spectrum games like Jet Set Willy
In Caveman Harry you have to find food for your tribe, leading you to go on strange adventure through the world and overcome tough obstacles!

entries.title: Dino Hipster Survival
entries.description:
Help Dino scientist Mr. Trexman save the planet and other dinosaurs from the asteroid. In this world Dinosaurs are very smart and they are familiar with all new mobile trends... Is it good for their anti-asteroids protections system? It's for you to decide :)

Sound by Dmitry Petyakin ([email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */), Alexander Urbanovich ( [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */)

I'm not the author of code behind the flying missiles and textures behind the explosions. Source by @SetTheBet of the original: https://github.com/AJirenius/MissileCommand.

Added after this @SetTheBet's message:
----
I actually think you could tell people that you are not the author of the game (as claimed at itch.io). You're using the exact game I am livestreaming here: https://www.livecoding.tv/setthebet/videos/jKax8-small-game-from-scratch-gui . Not even replacing art, explosions, changing stroboeffect, tweaking missile and the arcs.. I know my gameproject is publically out there on github for everyone to use but.. the whole game in the gamejam? Claiming yourself as author? 

I also understand it's your first time creating a game in Defold but the engine is actually so simple so you could probably easily create this yourself. Or watch my stream and create anything similar. 
----

Also i'm not the author of the pixel art Dino style, it's Google Chrome's offline mode texture with new coloring and clothes. Asteroid texture was just google by "asteroid pixel art image license free". Buttons texture and back star texture also weren't drawn by me, unfortunately i don't remember from which project them, but it something very old on my Work/Projects/ folder found by grep/find.

entries.title: Elders' Race
entries.description:
Elders’ Race is a competitive multiplayer game where you can challenge your friends to name the most technophile resident of the retirement house between Yvonne, Marcel, Gilbert and Monique. Tune your wheelchair to be the fastest to reach the end of the corridor or die trying! Then it’s time for pills.

Our game is playable by 2 to 4 players, you can play all together on the same keyboard. Don’t hesitate to leave feedbacks and to organize championships with your friends! Let the winner have the last muffin!

We are a team of French students in video games: Yanis and Titouan programmed the game, Clémentine made the graphics and Noé and Florent designed the sounds.

entries.title: Farm: Obelisk
entries.description:
USE THE WEB VERSION ONLY IF  YOU CAN'T DOWNLOAD. The web version is pretty buggy, so if you're able to download it, you definitely should.

HOW TO PLAY

Arrow keys to move.
Z to plant
X to harvest/feed

You win when the timer above the altar reaches 0.

You can hold up to 8 fruits at a time. 

Pressing X while in front of a plant will harvest it. When you harvest a plant, you will get the fruit added to the front of your inventory. If your inventory overflows, overflowing items will be deleted. 

Pressing Z will plant the last item in your inventory. Each plant takes a slightly different time to grow all of its fruit. When all of its fruit have been grown it will start to lose fruit, and eventually die. 

Plants grow at a slightly accelerated rate on the far half of the map.

The stone baby will need food, the food it needs is displayed above the altar. If a fruit is solid that means it needs that fruit. 

You can give it the last fruit in your inventory by pressing X near the altar. If it doesn't need the fruit you have, it won't take it.

Music by me and Canned Olives (https://www.youtube.com/c/cannedolives)

entries.title: Flamebearer
entries.description:
Take the ancient technology of fire and run wild with it through every village you can reach. Your cold-blooded brethren will not perish this winter!

But no matter how fast you run, the flame won't last forever. How many settlements can you light up before it gives out, and you stumble into the cold with it?

A simple runner game. Controls included within the game (plastered over the title screen). 

NOTE: IF THE MUSIC CAUSES YOU PAIN, PLEASE HIT EITHER 0 OR O TO TURN IT OFF! A composer I ain't, it turns out!

INSTALL INSTRUCTIONS:
Things should work just fine unzipped for Windows and Mac, but Linux users should visit https://love2d.org/ to get the LÖVE engine necessary to open this game.

There's also a web version provided by @Ulydev! Thanks, @Ulydev!

SOURCE INSTRUCTIONS:
The same .love file provided can be unzipped for all code and assets used in this game. Either unzip it directly or rename the extension to .zip.

entries.title: Guild Inc
entries.description: You just established your workshops in the city. Now you only need profit. To make profit you know you can make goods and sell them in the market and you are known to be a good trader but that does not stop people from trying to make the stupidest deals which sometimes could give a lot of profit or crack a smile in your face. Now making goods by yourself you know is a bad idea and that's why you hire workers and assign them to your workshops. Though sometimes you make some goods for yourself to not lose your skills. You only wish that you could research something new, but you didn't have the time to build a research shop, at least not yet.

entries.title: Inferno Tycoon
entries.description:
Thanks for playing!

The concept of the game:

You are the devil and your job is it to transport sinners based on their sins to the fitting circle of hell (For more information: Dante's Inferno). You do this by putting a maximum of 5 people into the hell-evator, which transports the sinners to the circle of choice.

Note:
Not only did we massively mismanage our time and ended up creating a really unpolished game, but we even failed to deliver a game fitting the actual theme of the jam (which was 'Ancient Technology').

Nevertheless do we hope that you'll have some fun playing it.

Criticism is highly appreciated!

Twitter:

Patrick Tobler - @Padierfind
Peter Jaschkowske - @P_Jaschkowske

entries.title: Kirstine Bengtsson
entries.description:
Future Rabbit travels back in time and meet Stone Age Man.... will Future Rabbit escape and get back to the future again?

I am new to Unity and programming but had fun making this platform game. I made the pixel art in Pro Motion NG. 

I have found the font on Dafont, and the music/sound on freesound.

Feedback is much appreciated! :) 

#LDJAM

entries.title: La Broza
entries.description:
..:: La Broza ::..

by: Alexander Agüero Shkurenkov A.K.A. NiceAlexanderAS
“La broza” is in spanish. “broza” means a bunch of leaves,  sticks, plants and other related organic material that is accumulate in one area. 

Theme: It was about ancient technology left behind by humans to restore the planet to its original natural state.

..:: Basic Idea ::..

Strategy game
Collect all the trash on the map using your robot worker drons and defend them with robot warrior drons against wild mutants that are multiplying time to time. You win if you clean 80% of the trash. You lose if the mutants kill all of your workers and you don't have enough resources to make another one.

..:: Instructions ::..

The instructions are inside the game but here is a copy (:

(1) Selecting and moving: Left-click to select a unit. To select multiple units
hold "left-click" and move the mouse to form a green selection square.
Any unit inside the selection square is going to be selected.  
Use the WASD keys to move on the map.
(2) Command a selected unit: 
	* Worker Drone: "Right-click" to the trash on the ground
	and he will automatically collect the trash.
	* Warrior Drone: The Warrior Drone automatically attacks
	the closest enemy but he is not going to move. You move
	the drone by "right-click" to a location.
(3) How to win?: 80% of the trash is gone. Little blue icons show your
progress.
(4) How to lose?: Mutants destroyed all your workers and you don't have
resources to make more.
(5) Resources: Little yellow icons indicate how many drones can you create. This icons are call "Tickets". 
You get Tickets by collecting trash. The amount of trash for a ticket is hidden.
(6) Create a Unit: There are 2 yellow buttons on the bottom-right of the screen, one to build
a warrior and one to build a worker  You need 1 "Ticket". They spawn in the main building.
(7) The buildings are decorations.
(8) Mutants spawn on big mutant buildings, you can destroy them.

..:: Requirements and instalation ::..

Linux
     You need SDL2 … thats it I guess
     Extract EVERYTHING from the zip
     Run the binary file: LaBroza

Windows
     Extract EVERYTHING from the zip
     Run: LaBroza.exe

..:: Tools and libraries used ::..

- Programing language: C++
- Library: SDL2, SDL2_Image, SDL2_Mixer
- Editor: Atom
- Compiler: g++
- Audio: Audacity
- Images: GIMP
- Recorder: SimpleScreenRecorder (that is the name)

..:: Notes ::..

- This is not a finish product, the game has a lot of bugs, missing sounds and needs more gameplay experience (i guess good enough for the moment). 

- I plan to continue this game, the idea is really good for me. The main idea is bigger than this. The problem was that i got stuck programming basic stuff and i had to "cut" the game to make it playable.

Version of this game: Pre-pre-pre-Alpha

- Bugs:
     * Units can merge, there is no unit collision or alignment.
     * A warrior can shoot in different directions
     * If you select a bunch of mixed units, there is no way to separate them. (which is uncomfortable)
     * Weird AI

entries.title: Lycurgus Cup Caper
entries.description:
Can you steal the lycurgus cup and escape?

Simple platformer puzzle game loosely based on the concept of the Lycurgus Cup whos color changes based from green to red based when the light source moves from the front to the back of the cup.

My 3rd Ludum Dare solo project using construct2 and gimp.  Planned on having a lot more levels, sound and overall more polish but didn't have the time.

entries.title: Mirror Tech
entries.description:
Mirror Tech (aka Dented)

This game is a puzzle game where the player has to get onto invisible platforms in order to reach each checkpoint. The platforms can however be seen by looking at a mirror object that is guiding you as you progress.

entries.title: Paleolithic
entries.description:
A visual novel game set in the ice age, with a front of fantasy.

UP and DOWN to adjust your selection.
SPACE to select or continue.

entries.title: Pharaoh's Puzzle
entries.description:
Pharaoh's has ordered you to put his wine barrels on their right places. Every time you put a barrel into place, the hourglass is reset. So, hurry up before it's too late!

Use the arrow keys to move the servant.

Press Space at any time to restart the game.

entries.title: Pyramid Defense
entries.description:
Ancient Technology

Stop the alien forces from melting the polar ice caps by using your pyramids to shoot them out of the sky (just like they did in the old days :) ).

Built using GameMaker and Inkscape.  Delivered as a Windows executable in a zip file.

entries.title: Revolutions
entries.description:
Revolutions 1.0
=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
Take Caution!
This game is horrible (as people in the
comments have pointed out), and WILL
WASTE YOUR TIME.

Consider it practice for next LD.
=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
You need to get to the future.
Your plan of action: speed up history.
=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
FAQ:
What did you use to make the "Nature Scene"?
- GeoVox

Do I know this game is poorly made?
- Yes, it is one of my first games made with Unity, and didn't have a full 48 hours to make it (or anything close to it).

Why can I sometimes see through the walls?
- I really don't know. Unity wasn't exhibiting this behavior when I was testing it in the editor. Your mileage may vary.

What do I do if I fall over?
- For some reason (I don't remember) I used a Rigidbody. Press "R" in these scenes to "stand up" again.

Will you work on this game afterwards?
- No. I really didn't like how the game turned out.
=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
Controls

Scene 1:
-Left Arrow: Rotate Left
-Right Arrow: Rotate Right
-C: Collect Bamboo
-P: Attempt to power the time machine

Scene 2:
-Left Arrow/A: Rotate Left
-Right Arrow/D: Rotate Right
-Up Arrow/W: Move Forwards
-Down Arrow/S: Move Backwards
-R: Reset Rotation (I know I should have locked it)

Scene 3:
-Left Arrow/A: Rotate Left
-Right Arrow/D: Rotate Right
-Up Arrow/W: Move Forwards
-Down Arrow/S: Move Backwards
-R: Reset Rotation (I know I should have locked it)
=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
Tools Used:
Unity
GeoVox
Visual Studio
Paint.NET
SketchUp Make

entries.title: Sepulcrum
entries.description:
Two adventurers come into an abandoned temple with a quest to find a legendary gem.
Unfortunately, they turn on an ancient security system that will kill them in 60 seconds.

There's only way to get out of this situation - our heroes have to hack the security system and open the doors before they die. Fortunately, one of them specializes in ancient operating systems and knows perfectly what to do.

The game features never before heard voice acting with a Slavic accent, astonishing graphics, breathtaking animations and okay gameplay!

Info: We are aware of the screen flashing in fullscreen and borderless mode, but can't do anything about it as it's a bug in SFML libraries themselves :(

Bugfix update #1!:
- You can now skip the intro,
- Music now changes correctly when going back to menu,
- Difficulty is not preserved between plays anymore,
- Ending works correctly,
- Sounds in the "Simon says" puzzle are now louder.

Bugfix update #2!:
- Difficulty is really not preserved between plays anymore

entries.title: The Past
entries.description:
This is my first game for Ludum dare.This is one world with 4 minigames in past :D.I tried to do that to be happy when you play this game.This is all.




Good luck

P.S. This game was made in GameMaker

entries.title: The Sphere Globe
entries.description:
Story: You are an archaeologist sent in the amazonian mountains in order to retrieve an ancient artifact: the lens globe, a complex lens structure used for precise observation. 
For some strange reason, the airship that was carrying it has some power running, and you will have to avoid these hazardous traps in a rhythm-based game (warning: sound balance is a little off.)

Controls: WASD = movement, ARROWS = aim, space to shoot
(as mentioned in game, the antique gun shoots slow bullets, don't bump into them!

Code: Monogame, Visual Studio, C#
Art: Pixly, Gimp
Sound: LMMS, BFXR

!!!works on windows for sure, other platforms can always try but there's no guarantee...

!!!You might need to install XNA 4 or Monogame.

We apologize for the bad intro art. Time was limited.

entries.title: The Stones of Kelzi
entries.description:
The Stones of Kelzi is a game made for LD36, with the theme, Ancient Technology. Your mission is to learn the Kelzi language and unlock the power of the Power Stones. Doing this will undo the eternal darkness and eternal rainfall that was cast upon the Kelzians due to their technologies.

It was made in 48-ish hours.

entries.title: Titus Discovery
entries.description:
Titus Discovery
Year 3246, Titus, a history researcher, found a computer from the 2016 and it seems ancient to him. He connects the computer to his ship and it gave it the power of flying and shooting. In the space around we can find some more ancient technology (even more ancient than the computer) that we believe are lost like roman concrete, greek fire and damascus steel.

entries.title: Tomb Of Domb
entries.description:
I ran out of time!

Spent the whole weekend making the text based dungeon crawling engine and didn't have any time to make the dungeon. I have a rad engine now so I'll be sure to do something with it.

If you do play there are only two rooms and there is no win state so if you saw the two rooms and used whats in the chest then you have experienced all of it. Don't forget to 'use' the club and 'open' the chest

entries.title: Why Ducks Never Got Wheels
entries.description:
Why Ducks Never Got Wheels.

Humans invented the wheel a long time ago, and it's still used everywhere today.

Besides, this technology is not so convenient : it requires flat ground to move without using too much energy. Ironically, building flat grounds requires a lot of ressources.

By playing this game, you can experiment this fact in a world which is not made for a wheel. Be a duck, with legs and wings, and you'll see that it's much more easy to get to the end !

--------------------

Sources :

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotating_locomotion_in_living_systems

DirtyBiology : https://youtu.be/LUWkaZkosY0 (don't forget the english subtitles ;) )

http://www.geosociety.org/gsatoday/archive/22/12/article/i1052-5173-22-12-4.htm

Developed by TeamZBLAH with 6 persons.

Thanks for playing.

entries.title: A Funeral
entries.description:
What would you write as your epitaph, if you have just been told that you only have last 72 hours to live?

What would the human being write as its epitaph, if the human have just been told that they only have last 72 hours to live?

Think carefully before you answer, you have 72 hours left.

------------------------------------------------

The link of the original game made during LD36 in 72 hours is listed below..

Code by @houkanshan, @abing
Art by @Serøtonin
Sound by @abing

entries.title: Aijnshent
entries.description:
Build up your ancient civilization from ground up!

Controls:
Mouse Left click - Select/Action/Walk
Mouse Right click - Deselect

entries.title: Ancient Tower
entries.description:
The goal of Ancient Tower is to get to the top of the tower to deactivate the artifact that is terrorising the land around it. The artifact can be deactivated by reaching the top of the tower and pressing (colliding with) the activator.

The story for the game follows an alternate timeline of events after the story of the Tower of Babel, where a single, universal language remained. Instead, god decided he was going to terrorise the land by creating and enchanting an ancient artifact to rule the tower and destroy anyone who came near. It is up to you to destroy the artifact and save the tower.

Controls:
A/D - Move left/right
Space - Jump
Space + S - Fall through platform

This is the first game we've really worked on, with little experience with the framework beforehand. So although it's incomplete with an unimplemented story we're quite happy with the outcome and definitely looking forward to future LDs!

entries.title: Cabbages and Wheelbarrows
entries.description:
Finally the ancients are able to make the first self-driving wheelbarrow. YOU are his AI. Make your makers prouds!:D
ps
the wheel barrow will self adjust to the layout of the terrain, but since it's ancient technology... it will not work well :D

Inputs with Keyboard and mouse:

W S  =  move forward/backward
A D  =  turn left/right
left click / right click = raise / lower the wheel barrow

Move the mouse to turn the camera.

Instructions:
In front of you there is a cabbage dispenser, drive under it and it will dispense some cabbages that you can collect on the wheel barrow. Then you have to drop them in the varios stone circles near the houses(every house has one). Depending on how  difficult is to reach/drop the cabbages every drop give you more score. To allow the dispenser to work you need to leave his immediate area an re-enter when he is done dispensing. After 3 mins the map reset, so keep track of your score!

Final notes:
Game is incomplete, lost two days trying to make the wheelbarrow working how i wanted and i failed, everything you see was rushed in the last day.
Lesson for me, fail faster DAMN IT! :D
Hope at least can be a bit of fun...
Only things not made by us:
1)skybox(standard from unreal engine)
2)material for landscape and music(next day will add proper merits, my m8 has gone and i have no idea who made that song)


Done by:
Renato Kuurstra  - scripts, wheel barrow, package and design
Jakob Furbo - 3d models and textures.

Using:
Unreal Engine
Blender for 3d
Gimp for 2d

entries.title: Chronolabe
entries.description: You are Aletheia, a citizen of a nation with incredible technology and power, thrust forward in time to escape the cataclysm destroying your civilization. But you do not know that; all you know is that you are in a village, ancient and weather-worn. Mysterious machinery is strewn about, and the buildings look abandoned, yet somehow familiar. You must piece together the mystery of the village you find yourself in, and discover why your nation collapsed at the height of its power.

entries.title: Cotton Gin
entries.description: A game based off of Eli Whitney's Invention during the Industrial Revolution, The Cotton Gin

entries.title: Crown
entries.description:
Crown is a micromanagement game, where you play as the king and have to make decisions to bring you kingdom to next level of technological evolution.
Every decision you make have consequences.

You have to be careful to keep the harmony of welfare, religion, army and money at good level, but also to make progress in technology.

Controls:
---------
LClick - interact with NPCs/sit on a throne (needs to be close)
W/A/S/D - move around throne room (only when you don't have visitors)
ESC - Menu
F1 - Display FPS/ticks

This game uses it's own Java powered engine built by me. Also sorry for the lack of music and sound effects, but I felt like it's better to have more gameplay and also I'm not talented musician.

I streamed the whole game making process (https://www.twitch.tv/mar3k_e3) and I will upload timelapse of it soon (or it already is there) to my YT (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYCsrAV6qFGTh2Lp4nUkLDQ).

Thank you for playing and rating!

entries.title: Fax this, please
entries.description:
Welcome to Fax This, Please.

How to use the FAX-O-MATIC:
Use the rotary gadget in the bottom left of the device to input a 4 digit number (Ranging from 1 to 4), going over 4 digits will reset it. Once the number is dialed in, simply crank the lever on the right completely and the page will be faxed. Your success rate is displayed to the left of the machine.

I didn't have a whole lot of time to work on this, but I got the basic mechanics in place. There is no real failure state, just the constant monotonous job of faxing papers.

I used C++ with SDL2 for the code.
Paint.net for the art.
And sounds from the Sonniss GDC Game Audio Bundles. Namely:
    * Sonniss.com - GDC 2016 - Game Audio Bundle\MatiasMacSD - THE MACHINES - ROBOTIC SOUNDS\Robot_Servo_006.wav
    * Sonniss.com - GDC 2015 - Game Audio Bundle\Robert Cordova - Base\Wind-up Toy 02.wav
    * Sonniss.com - GDC 2015 - Game Audio Bundle\Giorgio Riolo - SILENTSCAPES\SFXW001_indoor_server room.wav

entries.title: Get On The Horn
entries.description:
A simple game that takes us back to the days of marvelous T9 texting.

Credits to my cousin Anthony for being the voice of the game.

Tools Used:
Sublime Text
Google Fonts
Audacity
Bfxr

entries.title: Hit Troll With Axe
entries.description:
Hit Troll With Axe is a text based adventure where you take on a journey to save a princess!

You can type "help" get a list of commands.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Original plan: Run a C game with a DX11 basic render engine and plug in Nuklear for UI support.

4 hours in, decided this was a terrible idea and moved over to Unity.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Known Issues: Game crashes 2nd time around. Restarting the game between plays fixes this.

entries.title: Homer and Bart Use Ancient Technology
entries.description: This co-op local multiplayer game lets you use / make ancient technology to get Bart his dinner.

entries.title: Into The Light
entries.description:
Instructions:
- WASD for movement
- Left click - Dash (2s cooldown)
- Right click - Special (costs 30% of your total health)
- Aim with mouse when you are under the light.

Tips:
Be careful with special spamming!
Enemies can drop health pickups.
When you cleanse all enemies in the current wave, you go to a new map with a harder wave.

Known issues:
No feedback when player can dash again.
No game over screen (the game automatically restarts).
Score is not displayed.

entries.title: Kramchay Dig
entries.description:
Temple 36 is a 2D Platformer Action Puzzle Game that leads you to solve the riddle in the temple in order to complete them.

Credits:
GamesTimes(Kramchay) - Art, Programmer, Sound
FB: https://www.facebook.com/Games-Times-772474772813452/
TWITTER: https://twitter.com/GTGamazing

Kerhut Csaba - Programmer

entries.title: Pedalcopter
entries.description:
*2+ gamepads required to play*

Gadzooks! Scoop up valuables with your pedal-powered copter for a not-so-swift getaway. Be on the look out for those dang rival thieves trying to snatch up the goods for themselves. Start pedaling!

Team up with your pals or go all out in a hectic pedal-powered free-for-all  in the sky!

2-4 Players

Programming:
Tim Elzinga - @ElzingaT
Gabe Spencer - https://www.linkedin.com/in/gabriel-spencer-54648330
Art:
Kyle Olson - https://www.behance.net/kyleolson

entries.title: pls get cool
entries.description:
It's a puzzle platformer, where the 'Ancient Technology' theme comes from being an ancient robot (that's not cool), and finding yourself in a strange new future, and then you gotta work hard on self improvement to become cool (like all the other robots of the cool new future).
The drill was gonna be super important but then time ran out. (it's still cool tho)

Made with HaxeFlixel.

PS: There is also one (1) secret hidden in the game, just for the fun of replay value

entries.title: Pyramid Is What I Need!
entries.description:
Pyramid Is What I Need a.k.a PIWIN is a minimal "god game" with slight elements of RTS. The intention was to subtract from RTS all the elements of deciding where your units need to go. This would be all handled automatically.

The goal is to be the first one to build a pyramid. You just have to create the right units at the right moment. Very simple.

The mechanic is a little obscure, and you might lose at first. But, eh, isn't it what video games are about? Observe carefully the AI to understand what needs to be done... Also that balancing is definitely not perfect. Tweaking it is very tricky and is taking quite some time.

This is my very first Ludum Dare and actually my first game jam in general. This experience was extremely intense but very rewarding.

Hope you appreciate it! 

Note: You can scroll left and right when the mouse on the edge of the window. Works great in fullscreen.

entries.title: Pyramid Scheme
entries.description:
Pyramid Scheme is a speech giving simulator fronted by a motivational speaker with a shady history and an unhinged mind. Try not to lose your cool as you think of the right word, phrase, and strategy with which to tell your story and influence the hearts and minds of the world into which you have been reborn.

Video on youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9noK8AfduWA

entries.title: Shadowz Adventure
entries.description:
My second time doing LD. Sadly I didn't have enough time to participate in compo (and some graphics were re-used from my previous projects).

Kill enemies using the not-so-ancient "ancient technology" inspired by a meme. Where blue robot tries to kill red robots. "Voice acting" included.

Also, as for credits and special thanks goes to:
- Kevin MacLeod for music
- Allegorithmic for making great software.
- Unity Technologies and its community for support and creating very good tools for game development.

... And all other participants, as you inspire to make!

entries.title: SimPyramid
entries.description: SimTower egypt style

entries.title: Stones versus Blasters
entries.description:
Stones versus Blasters

This game is a tower defence. The goal: defend your old village with stones, against spacecrafts with blasters !

entries.title: Temple of the Sky People
entries.description:
Temple of the Sky People is a simple Metroidvania.  The basic story goes that you are a caveman who needs a crystal from an ancient temple to heal your sick child or something.  The story was cut for time, so it doesn't matter.

The ancient technology is actually super advanced alien tech, so you start as a caveman with a club and end with alien tech.  Yay!

I still need to add sounds and the final win condition, but I'm traveling today so I might not get to upload the latest version, so I wanted to put something up.

entries.title: The Unknown Meets Ancient Games
entries.description:
The Unknown Meets Ancient Games is 2-player co-op game where you can choose between 2 games: Pong and Space Invaders.
In Pong you need to collect 15 yellow dots with question mark player. Other player play as paddle, question player always needs to jump on paddle, so paddle player can help him by moving left or right.
From time to time white balls appear. Question player needs to avoid them (they will kill him) and paddle player needs to hit them back.
In Space Invaders laser cannon player needs to kill all enemies (flying white things) and question player needs to avoid lasers and not fall. He can jump on green platforms. Lasers destroy platforms.
Controls:
- Main Menu: ARROWS to navigate, ENTER or SPACE to choose and ESCAPE to quit game
- Hall: LEFT and RIGHT ARROW to move, UP ARROW to jump and DOWN ARROW to select game (yellow rectangle)
- Pong: LEFT and RIGHT to move question mark, A and D to move paddle
- Space Invaders: same as pong, UP ARROW for jump (question mark) and W for fire (laser canon)

entries.title: Through The Fire
entries.description:
"Through the Fire" is a platform game where the goal is to get the player to light all the torches and get passed puzzles.
It contains 3 levels
I tried to pass some messages about the ideology of fire (very little), how it is not only considered just one element.

Sorry for the lack of beautiful graphics.

commands
J - Jump
K - Select within the levels.
A - Walking to Left
D - Walking to Right

entries.title: Zombieval
entries.description:
The horde came faster than expected.
You're the last defense against those things; Don't let them in at all cost.

Controls:
    WASD - Move
    Mouse - Attack (Hold for more damage)
    1 - Toggle Arrows
    Space - Pause

entries.title: Airship Journey
entries.description:
Airship combat. You are alone against 6 steampunk airship pirates. The idea was to create a story with more levels and variations, but this was my first Ludum Dare and I didn't had time to implement it all.

Features: Cannon balls, explosions, airships and steampunk music.

There is a bug when you die in the cannon view mode. I know how to fix it but I just found it now... =/

entries.title: Ancient Portal
entries.description:
README PLEASE-----------------------------

Theme:
The game displays the theme in two ways. The first, is the retro style of the game (like it would have run on "ancient technology"), you will notice the games very low resolution (160x120). The second, is the crossbow, and the portal, the story behind the game: You are a man who is destined to protect the portal for his life, because "ancient technology"(the brown boxes around the portal) are used to stop the demons coming through, however they are faulty, which is why you have to be there, to stop the "few" monsters that come through from becoming a lot! Your crossbow is ancient, and made to kill these particular monsters.

How to Play----------------

Controls:
WASD to move, mouse to look, space to jump, mouse button 1 to fire bolt.
Escape to pause (there is a pause menu of sorts).

Strafe jumping:
back when I didn't know what the game was going to be, I implemented strafe jumping, turns out it works quite well. First of all, just jumping makes you go faster, if you hold down space while moving, you will move faster.

however what makes you go really fast is holding down "space", "w" and one of the strafe keys ("a" or "d"). If you hold these down, you will actually ACCELERATE (watch the speed meter), this is key, in avoiding all the monsters, it works very good for quick getaways, and makes you move more (in order to avoid the holes in the floor). The speed increment slows down after around 70, however, it still increases, technically you can get infinite speed!!

THE TUTORIAL IS NOT SUPPOSED TO BE EASY: The tutorial is a strafe jumping tutorial, it is not supposed to be easy, if you cannot do it, then just go back to the menu (via escape) and click on PlayWithNoTutorial. The strafe jumping tutorial is in order for you to improve, so you can get a higher score.

The portal WARNING--------

As soon as you collide with the portal, a message comes up.
When this message comes up, the enemies have STARTED SPAWNING!

Final Words--------

Thank you for playing, and reading this description.
I hope you enjoy, and it would mean a LOT if you could post your scores down in the chat, as I find it very interesting :).

Thanks again,

Ned

EDIT------

I just found out, if you shoot an arrow, and jump at the same time, you get a boost. I didn't actually know this, but it's awesome :D :D

entries.title: ARWeather
entries.description:
*.apk downloadable only*

AR Weather Game!
What ancient technology is utilized by the Earth and humans? Weather patterns!
Control the weather of a small procedural land on your desk.

Goal is to help humans settle in hospitable land by terraforming.

NOTCIE: everything is broken, I'm still working on tracking/rotations, settlement AI, and stacking terrain, so please dont' comment that the gameworld doesn't track your surface surfaces yet.

entries.title: Before You Die
entries.description:
Cruel Heartless Demons have apperared from the ancient ruines!!

But to me, It looks like a perfect sunday for destruction! (┛◉Д◉)┛彡┻━┻

Can you overcome the impossible hordes of enemies?

Controls:
Mouse - Camera
WASD - Move
Left Click - Shoot

Update:
- Improved Particle Performance

entries.title: Betty
entries.description:
You are Tim, and you are married to Betty, a time machine.
Tim forgot Betty's maintenance day, apparently that was a big thing or whatever... She was upset.
Then Tim tried to use her to go back in time to fix his mistake. She wasn't happy about this, at all.
Now Tim is stuck between time and space and Betty is broken. GO FIX HER YOU MONSTER!

Controls:
WASD os Arrows to move.
E or SPACE to interact.
F and G to create itens. (only NPCs)

Game Created by:
Pedro Lopes, Gabriel Galves, Gabriel Mendes, Nathalia Rodrigues and Matheus Marabesi.

Made with Unity.

entries.title: Chariot Arena Battle
entries.description:
With this game I tried to create my first multiplayer game. You take control of a chariot and have to defeat other chariots.

If you are all alone, you can open multiple browsers just to defeat your other self and imagine what it could be like to play with other people.

Cheating in this game is probably very easy, as all logic is client side. The server just handles messages between the clients.

entries.title: Hicks
entries.description:
A game inspired by Don't touch anything.

-----
Art by Pierre Gonzales
Code by Grégoire 'Radnap' André

Made with LibGDX

entries.title: Idle Greed
entries.description:
A chill isometric idle game based on mining resources to improve your ability to mine more resources.​  Basically it's like Dwarf Fortress without the complexity (and without the dying horribly in fire all the time).

Credits:
Ket Ng (Textures & Game Design)
Eliot "Corbeau" Hemingway (Programming & Asset Integration)

entries.title: Joustinator
entries.description:
Nidhogg on horseback but worse


THE FIRST SCREEN IS NOT THE GAME, Just an opening, press any key to continue

Made in game maker 8 and ported to game maker studio for web release
Credit to Dom Englebright and Russell Whiting for encouragement, feedback and testing

Web version is done now, there are a couple of discrepancies between the versions but shouldn't make much of a difference, I would recommend playing the web version though given the choice. However this version performs pretty badly on Safari (thanks joemid and Elliot Greenwood).

The Ai is unfortunately pretty terrible as I skipped developing it to make the character creation menu but overall I'm really happy with how the game turned out.

Thanks for all the feedback guys I just wanted to make something enjoyable to play and its great to see loads of people having fun with it!

entries.title: Made of Steam
entries.description:
Made of Steam

A tycoon game set during the industrial revolution.

Story:
Your father dies and you inherited his mining company. But your father wasn't a good businessman. He owes the crown a lot of money. The crown gives you 3 years to come up with the money.

How To Play: (tutorial exist in the game)
You have to get a mining licences and mine for natural resources.
Transport them to Salford the local capital/hub.
There you can sell them via the market menu.

INFO:
Changed the font after a few complaints.

Info 2:
I hadn't much time to test it if there are bugs please tell me. Balancing could be better too. It's quit easy to win.

Info 3: (the UI is optimized for a resolution of 1920x1080)
Due to UI visibility problemes I removed the link to the webGL build.

Tools:
- Unity
- Photoshop
- Illustrator
- Adacity
- cgMusic
- google ;) for research

Windows, linux and mac OS/x builds are now ready for download.
I added my repo link as well.

Please tell me if you have a problem playing the linux and mac builds.
I can't test them right now.

entries.title: Mammoth for Speed
entries.description:
============= Intro =============
A long time before the invention of the first wheel, there used to be ancient riders. Riders, on highly customisable and tunable mammoths, who competed in crazy illegal races.

Prepare to experience the ancinet tuning technology. Join the riders and tune your mammoth for speed with our global ranking leaderboard.


============= Concept =============
Racing game where you can race the world’s best time saved on our server and tune your mammoth. You get a new tuning part every time you cross the finish line untill you have unlocked everything. This represents our version of possible ancient racing and transportation.

You can also select from three different mammoth types. Every mammoth type has its own parameters which determine how fast it can go (Top speed), how fast it accelerates (Acceleration), how sharp it turns (Handling) and how effective is its stopping power (Braking). Each tuning part modifies these stats and therefore you can have the most awesome mammoth that ever walked the face of the earth.

Be sure to enter your nickname because we plan to have a leadderboard and announce the fastest racer on our twitter @lonelyvertex on September 14. If you want, you can insert your twitter name in a format “@your_twitter_name” and we will mention you in the winner announcing tweet.

Also we will be happy if you tweet us a screenshot of your mammoth, praise or a bug.


============= Controls =============
== Menu (Cave) General buttons ==
Mouse click on buttons in the menu:
 - Floppy disk ……………………............ Save the name filled in the input
 - Mammoth ........................................... Go to mammoth tuning cave
 - Play .................................................... Go to level selection map
 - Home button …………………………... Go to home screen which will allow you to change the name
 - On/Off ................................................. Quit the game

== Mammoth tuning cave ==
 - Mouse click to blue circle ………………. Open available tuning components for the mammoth part
 - Click on available component button …….. Select the part and attach it on the mammoth
 - Colored mammoth button …………………. Select the mammoth type
 - Click and drag the mammoth by mouse …. Turn the mammoth on the platform to see it from different angle

== Map (Level selection) ==
 - Yellow mammoth button on the map....Play the level

== Play (Race) ==
 - Up arrow …………….…… Accelerate
 - Left arrow ……….……….. Turn left (only available while your mammoth is moving)
 - Right arrow ….…………… Turn right (only available while your mammoth is moving)
 - Down arrow ………………. Brake / Reverse
 - R key …………………….... Restart the level
 - Escape key ……………….. Pause the game and display pause menu
 - Pause button on screen …. Pause the game and display pause menu (the button is visible only if you move your mouse for a bit of time)
 - Turn around arrow button .. Restart the level (the button is visible only if you move your mouse for a bit of time)


============= 72 sleepless hours =============
This is the first time that our whole team colaborated and conducted a group sleepover. We were pleasantly surprised, how much we accomplished. Although the most rewarding part is that we know what we are lacking and what we should work on.


Team LonelyVertex
http://www.lonelyvertex.com

entries.title: Navion
entries.description:
In Navion, you play as a little fellow that is kind of a plane taxi in an archipel. Take your friends to where they want to go! Hopefully your plane isn't going to get old...


Played with keyboard arrows!

entries.title: NothingNewOnTv
entries.description:
play the game, do some stuff, push some buttons.

I was shooting for the comp but needed one more day to finish.

controls :
left and right arrows to move
X or space to jump
C to shoot (depends on character)
down arrow to duck

Not tested on mac nor linux.

Tools used :

Graphics : Krita, Shoebox
Animation : Dragon Bones
Game engine : Unity
Music : Ableton Live
Sound Design : Audacity

will upload the sources soon.

entries.title: Pesky Humans
entries.description:
Pesky Humans is a 2D Space-ship shooter. Your goal in the game is to wipe out as many humans and their technology before mankind's primitive technology becomes too much for you. This game was made for the Ludum Dare Game Jam 36 by Darren Shaw.

Post your highscores! I'd love to see them!

entries.title: Place of Power
entries.description:
In the Relic forests, people are used to finding outlandish garbage - the legacy of past centuries. One day, people from nearby villages start to spread the rumour that an eccentric man has moved to the old manor near the mountain, and that he's ready to pay gold for the iron debris of old titans. So, little by little, people start visiting the manor that, in olden times, was called THE PLACE OF POWER.

You are an medieval alchemist. Your main goal to discover the secrets of the ancient technology and build the ultimate weapon. You need to make a lot of experiments to discover the best recipes how to transform materials into pure elements (like Gold and Titanium). You can make up to 3 transformations of each material before disintegration​. Actually disintegration available even on early stages of transformation, but usually it is not the optimal way of materials processing​.
Also don't forget to hire new workers and manage existing ones. 

PLEASE REMEMBER THAT THE GAME WAS MADE FOR LUDUM DARE JAM (72 HOURS) AND PROBABLY CONTAIN BUGS.

Tip: we are strongly recommend you to play with a sheet of paper to fix the results of the experiments.

----Controls----
Left click - take all items (Right click - take half of the items).
Left click - put all the items (Right click - put one).
Shift + left mouse button - move item to the stack.

Team AAAA:
- Artist: Alexey Testov / @Biuzer​
- Programmer: Andrii Vinchkovskiy​ / @AVinchkovskiy​
- Game Designer: Alexey Davydov / @flazm
- Sounds and music: Alexander Ahura / @ahuraster​

entries.title: Pottery Match
entries.description:
A simple memory game where you try and mould pottery to match what you see, at least that's the idea, really I got for way too long on making the generated pot mirror itself so I ran out of time for the graphics, and music, and really the UI isn't so great either.
But my goal with these is always more of making something that has a unique gameplay gimmick, so I'm still okay with what I've done.

entries.title: Sabertooth Arena
entries.description:
Sabertooth Arena is a game in which your goal is to kill sabertooth tigers with clubs. Your club gets better as you kill them. (it upgrades from wood, to silver, to gold)

In case nobody catches on, the clubs are ancient technology.


Controls:
W, E: attack
A: move left
D: move right
Space: jump


I didn't have time for sound effects, but I did manage to compose some music.



The map can be edited under assets/maps/example.numbermap
The two numbers at the top are the width and height, the other numbers are the map itself. -2 for a spawner, -1 for the player's spawn point, 0 for nothing, 1 for grass on the left of a block, 2 for grass on the top only, 3 for grass on the right, and 4 for plain dirt.


Compatibility: It should work on at least Windows 8.1 according to Visual Studio, but it may work on earlier versions of Windows.

I may make a Mac OSX and/or Linux port of the game, but for now you'll have to download the source and compile it to play.


Something else to note: Sabertooth may have been spelled wrong. This is to ensure that you do not confuse my horrible pixel art with an actual sabertooth tiger.

entries.title: Settlements
entries.description:
This game is supposed to be like Tribal Wars but without the PvP part and instead feature things like different settlement types, complex research trees, climate effects and so on. As one might probably expect now, nothing of this is implemented at this point :(

All you can do right now is to create an account (no email required), build villages and upgrade buildings inside them if you have the necessary resources. Before anyone gets they're hopes up: No I sadly didn't manage to implement fancy graphics so it's just tables everywhere. Yay.

Also, because I didn't find the time to implement a settlement type called "Dig Site" there is nothing about ancient technologies either D:

Anyways... After this glorious introduction, I hope you like it!

entries.title: Straw Hat's Adventure
entries.description: This is a game about a girl wearing a really nice straw hat.

entries.title: Tappy Catapult
entries.description:
For this Ludum Dare I decided to use one of the most important Ancient Tech in the World ... The Catapult!!!!

In this Game you have 2 Stages: The Build Stage and the Play Stage. 
The objective is simple ...you try to get the Bomb to the Red Circle (And stay there for a couple of seconds)

Build Stage: You flip the platforms to change the Map as you like and use W,A,S,D to move arouund the map.

Play Stage: You use the left mouse button to drop the boulder into the right side of the Catapult to throw the Bomb.

Software used:
Paint.NET
Unity
Visual Studio

entries.title: The Artifact
entries.description:
You seek a long-lost ancient artifact that could grant you the power of the gods.

progress: 
adding basic features
+player
+wall
+moving wall
+death-ray/beam & cannon
+switch
+tech : base trigger-able,harmful entity classes
+tech : trigger-able entity states
+tech : starts of a level load system

stretch: finish this game

entries.title: The Get Up
entries.description:
You are in ancient Egypt, keep your slaves from getting stoned, up high they go through physics!

Someone needs to get those stones up there, since you are in charge you can grab your slaves to do it. But beware physics are at play here. Someone needs to keep putting wood in front of the stones so they can keep on rolling and nobody gets stoned. Keep everything in balance and you are good to go to get real high!

Controls:
- Use your mouse to drag and drop things (slaves and wood logs)
- Restart = Space, Exit = Alt+F4

Instructions:
- Put wood logs in front to keep your stone(s) rolling on them
- Grab slaves and put them in the back to speed it up and being able to push more stones
- Let the stones hanging on cranes fall on your wood logs by clicking on them
- Keep things balanced

Start playing:
Download and click .exe

entries.title: The Pharaoh's Soul
entries.description:
The Pharaoh's Soul suddenly awakens,though not quite as he imagined.
Learn how to move in your new shape, and find a way to leave this world.

Commands : mouse
- left click : move to the center of the wall in front of you
- right click : undo
- your reach is limited; move to a new canopic jar to set it as a new start point

---------------

Jam version:
- Only 1 level available due to lack of time...
- No sound FX :c
Known bugs :
- Last canopic jar in level 1 bugs and prevents going to level 2 (which is not finished anyway)
- Wrong soul/camera position when going back on main menu

...I'd advise you to wait 1 more day before playing it but if you want to test this half-finished half-broken jam version then please, be my guest :)

I'll upload post-jam linux/mac/web versions when I've corrected the main bugs.

-----------

Music by Jason Shaw (from FreeMusicArchive)

entries.title: Warp Stone
entries.description:
It's a platform game with 15 levels and a Boss

X for the bounce shield
Arrow keys for left and right movement
Space or Z to jump



R to restart the level

entries.title: 54 Years of Hatchets
entries.description:
Logline: The massively outnumbered ancient tribe of Arcadio must try to survive annihilation from the Nairb tribe through innovation of technology within 54 years.

Lore: As the leader of the Arcadio tribe you are responsible for the survival and welfare of your tribe. Your are confronted by the leader of the Nairb tribe who have massive fighting manpower. They threaten of annihilation unless you to accept the mass slavery of your people. You manage to get the Nairb tribe to sign a 54 year peace treaty by relocating. Now you have 54 years to start from scratch and prepare for annihilation.

Genre: Core, Construction and management simulation
Demographic: People that enjoy micromanagement
Game System: PC, Microsoft

Game Overview: Fog thins as you see the Arcadio and Nairb tribes confront. The Nairb leader tells you that you must accept slavery or experience annihilation. You tell the Nairb leader that you will relocate and give up all of your tribes possessions for peace. The Nairb leader tells you that you will get 54 years of peace because it only took him 54 days to go from nothing to finding civilization when he got lost in the wilderness. You relocate to new plains and find a cave that have cravings of tools that advance beyond anything you have seen. For the next 54 years, you build technology from the carvings and use your own knowledge to prepare for annihilation. Depending on how long you survive 100, 250 and 500 people attack your civilization.

Controls:
WASD to move the camera in free mode,
Press Q to switch between free camera mode and selected camera mode

Hover over objects with your mouse for descripton and use

Left click and drag to select/deselect objects,
Press Left Shift and E to deselect all

Speed up time with right arrow, slow time down with left arrow

Press K to make all selected people drop their items

Press B to open the building menu

Progression:

Start by selecting items on the grey crafting pad
Then open the building menu and build a few houses 
Use WASD to view what you have built

Now select some people and make them go near some rocks or sticks
Use the right arrow to speed time up, and once they are there use the left arrow to slow time down
Hover your mouse over the resource until you see a tooltip on the top left then right click the resource
People close enough to the resurce will pick it up
Now move the people back to the grey crafting area and press K to make them drop the resource into the crafting area

Build what you think is necessary and fast forward time untill you encounter some enemies
Your people will fight on their own but you can target enemies the same way you make people pick up items

Then if you survive and think you are well prepared fast forward till year 54, Good Luck!

Our 1st ludumdare game by droweed & me

====================

entries.title: Crazy Chariot
entries.description: Ride a chariot in the future somehow.  Race that chariot through unforgiving streets.

entries.title: Egyptian God
entries.description:
Play as the almighty powerful Egyptian god and control dozens of mice at your fingertips. Your goal: Build a pyramid before the sun sets... Have fun

WASD: Move around.
Mouse Scrollbar: Move up and down.
Q and E: Rotate.

Special abilities:
