entries.title: Pyramid Raider
entries.description:
Pyramid Raider
--------------

In a post-apocalyptic future, an explorer discovers a pyramid full of mysteries. Will he/she be able to save the world ? Probably not. But you can still play this short adventure game to discover what happens.


How to play
-----------

- arrow keys or wasd: move the character.
- e, space, enter, ctrl: interact and pass dialogs.
- escape: quit the game.

Please tell us if you encounter a bug or the game crash.

Fullscreen and V-sync are enabled by default. If you want to disable any of them, edit config.json and replace the "true" by "false" (without the quotes). Be careful, json is really pedantic about the syntax, so if you remove a comma or do a typo, it will fail. However, removing the file should disable both fullscreen and V-sync.


Updates
-------

2016-08-30: Found a race condition while testing on osx that could cause a crash when entering the second level. Updated the Windows executable. The content of the game is unchanged.


How to run the game
-------------------

If you are under Windows and we uploaded a nice .zip with the executable, just download it, extract it and run the .exe. Otherwise, you can compile it yourself, it works on Windows, MacOS X and Linux. See the github page for more informations.

If you are under osx or Linux and would like an archive with a precompiled version of our game, leave us a comment. It might give us enough motivation to do it !


Unimportant notice
------------------

We feel compelled to write "sex" on this page, because last time a bunch of people found our game by searching for it. If this is your case, sorry, you won't find much here.

entries.title: Sassy Salesman Simulator

Welcome to Ancient Tech! The hottest second hand store in town!
Our sassy salesman has been struggling to sell our useless tat. Perhaps you can help guide him to be a better salesman. 

Click a Product to lead the client to it,  then click the client to initiate your sales pitch. Try to talk your way into a sale!

Seal the deal early to increase score. Don't be too sassy or you'll kill the deal.

The game finishes once all four customers have finished shopping. Good luck, and remember to SELL SELL SELL!!!

***Due to time constraints not everything is for sale...Also, some typos still exist but we can't be bothered to fix them now. Sorry.

Unity Adventure Framework

Slavology is an 2D puzzle platformer taking place in old Egypt.
You are a slavemasten and have to build an pyramid for your pharaoh, so you control a group of slaves at the same time, to transport materials and build a giant pyramid.

entries.title: Survive the Cave
entries.description:
Do whatever it takes to survive the harsh, prehistoric world.

You need food and water everyday and you need to make sure you don't freeze during the winter. As long as you are not hungry, thirsty or cold you will be healthy, but as soon as you are lacking something, your health will deteriorate.

To play the game unzip the downloaded file and double click on SurviveTheCave.jar.

This is my first LD entry and I know nothing about game development so please give me some constructive criticism on how I can improve.

Have fun and thanks for playing.

Physics are a bit buggy.

entries.title: Upriver Flow (unfinished)
entries.description:
Unfortunately, it's unfinished: Dialogue, mechanics... most everything?

Press z to select, x to deselect (only speeds up scene text at the moment).

It's my first attempt at any competition like this, and I haven't really made a game in a long time.
I used paperjs for rendering and coffeescript to js for the programming.

There's a working menu selection (though all functions aside from "new" are not available) and dialogue / scene system, but I didn't get around to doing the mechanics in time, and if you go over the scene and into what would have been the game screen, you can see that the placement of water (if you press space) is still off.

I think I've learned a few lessons - to jump straight to making the core of the game, familiarize myself with tools beforehand, and to not make placeholder objects - especially dialogue.

Still, it was a fun experience! I'll try again next time.

entries.title: A Dragons Tale
entries.description:
# Ancient Technology

## A Dragons Tale

### A DOS Text Adventure written in JavaScript

This is a simple DOS text adventure game.
I spent most time developing the engine in the background.
It could be used for other games, as you just need to provide 
a definition for the map (JS-Object) and the different Items and Characters.

Writing events is also possible. (on-enter/ on-leave ...)

### The Game

> You've heard of a great danger in the east. Go kill it!

### Controls

go NORTH, go EAST, go SOUTH, go WEST

pick SWORD up, pick up SWORD, take SWORD, use POTION

attack PERSON, kill RAT...

*commands are not case sensitive*

### Compatibility

The game doesn't seem to run in safari. I tested it for Firefox and Google Chrome.

### Tipps

**Spoiler warning**

- there is a map to the east of where you start
- red potions are always useful

entries.title: Almanac
entries.description:
It's not exactly what i imagined it to be :P

The game is very unintuitive, it desperately needs a tutorial, here's a brief explenation:

Game is about 'predicting' on which day next year events will happen.
You put a corresponding sticker on a date. If you guess wrong your population counter will drop.

By solving sudoku-esque game on the right, you get clues(about when the events happen) in the bottom left.

entries.title: Ancient Sketch
entries.description:
A mad scientist has lost hoped in humanity and sketches out an idea to end all of humanity. But how long will it take? You will be the deciding factor in that.

Made using godot engine, krita, bfrx and abundant-music. Good luck everyone!

entries.title: Ancient SpaceTech™ Corporation®
entries.description:
-HTML5
-Phaser.io
-TypeScript
-BFXR
-BoscaCeoil
-Inkscape

-Desktop only, no touch support
-No sound in Edge browser

The Ancient SpaceTech™ Corporation® has messed up yet again. This time they have lost 50 items of ancient space technology throughout the galaxy. It is up to you to save the universe before they totally freak out.

Use the up arrow to ascend and spacebar to shoot.

Have fun!

entries.title: Archaeology Quest
entries.description:
A top-down, turn-based, tile-based dungeon crawler with procedurally generated levels.

Procedurally generated levels made according to this tutorial: http://gamedevelopment.tutsplus.com/tutorials/create-a-procedurally-generated-dungeon-cave-system--gamedev-10099

Controls:
 Arrow Keys/WASD - Move
 Space - Hold position
 
Gameplay:
 +Collect all three Ancient Machine Parts: The Gear of Gizmo, the Screw of Scralius, and the Doohickey.
 +Turn-based. Ancient Defense Automatons (enemies) all move simultaneously immediately after you do.
 
Features:
 +Movement! (Oooh)
 +Music! (Kinda annoying actually...)
 +Sound Effects! (Aaah!)
 +Graphics! (Is that what those are?)
 +More than one type of enemy! (It's like you weren't even on a deadline!)
 +Procedurally generated levels! (Are you a wizard?!)
 +Bugs! Lots of bugs! (Incredible!)

 Bugs include:
  +Wonky collision that could have been avoided in a real 2D engine! (Good grief!)
  +Sometimes Ancient Defense Automatons will walk through each other! (Goodness me!)
  +Sometimes the level data just won't load at all for some reason! (How terrible!)

entries.title: Aventures Dans Le Système Solaire
entries.description:
The Moon Cannon is prepared, ready to take you on an adventure through the solar system!

...If I had had the time to finish it. Instead the game is super short and doesn't really have any gameplay. You can walk around and interact with a couple of characters. If you decide to try it out, thank you so much for taking the time!


--- Controls ---
Click to move and interact.




Got started a bit late, and didn't really have the motivation and inspiration to make a proper entry. Still I really like the idea of a "A Trip to the Moon"-style space adventure game.

entries.title: Buried Maze
entries.description: This game is first person dungeon crawler in which you play a mage who has to explore ancient temple in order to find forgotten knowledge and power.I made this game with free assets on asset store like music or graphic, but scripting and level design are purely mine.I hope you have fun playing :)

entries.title: Cavey
entries.description:
Cavey (Cave-ey) is an actual totally historically accurate VR caveman simulator.
You need tracked controllers that run through SteamVR to play this game.

There's a Non-VR spectator-only version for people without an HTC Vive or Oculus Rift + Touch hardware.

It's less fun but you can watch people play the game.

The entire game is multiplayer and networked completely, there is no single player mode and there is always-on voice chat. You have been warned.

"Controls":

Grip+moving controllers makes you move forward in the direction you look, hold both triggers to "grab the air" which you can use to jump/hop forward/sideways/backwards, and you can climb anything you can reach!

There's no "aim" to this game, you just play being a caveman.

Have fun. :)

entries.title: Clever Chef
entries.description:
Cooking is an ancient technology, but have our skills improved over time? Test your abilities with a nice simple recipe of bacon and eggs on toast.

... Try not to burn anything.

entries.title: DYSCOVR
entries.description:
​Welcome to the DYSCOVR open beta for project LD36 on exo-planet 543.14.543T!
You (and your fellow DYSCOVRites!) will traverse the planet in your very own DYSCOVR ROVR, digging for exciting artifacts of a lost civilization.

When you find an artifact, give it a description using this DYSCOVR console. If you're not sure what to say about it, then you can see what other people wrote about the same artifact.

If you're not sure where to begin, press the help button on your console!
---
Made by Sean, Ian, and Ryan of the SweetHeart Squad for Ludum Dare 36 using Pixi.js.
---
Post-jam updates:
-​Better controller support
-WASD as alternate keyboard controls
-Better iframe support (autofocuses and prevents page scrolling)
-Bug and typo fixes

(the jam version can still be downloaded from the itch.io page)

entries.title: KEK NOR KEK
entries.description:
You woke up after 3k years of sleep. You are no longer human.
Good for you that you are slept near the resource spot and not died from starvation.
There is absolutely nothing you can do in the game. 3k years have passed after all. Everything dies.

Genre: Walking Simulator. Control: WASD - move, Escape - quit.

entries.title: Magicana - Ruins
entries.description:
* Note: If you don't like visual novels, don't play this. It's a visual novel. Simple as that. *

Solve puzzles in ancient ruins in order to find a crystal. Easy enough, right?

This is my shortest LD entry ever, but it's probably the only one I'm looking forward to going back and making a post-LD version of. I want to add more puzzles and an actual story, explaining who the characters are and the setting. I was busy with life stuff this weekend so I'm happy I was even able to finish it, but it's definitely not the best it could have been.

As always, all of the art, writing, scripting, characters, lack of music, etc. are done by me, Miko. The software I used was Ren'Py, as apparent by the main menu.

entries.title: Midi Evil
entries.description:
Midi Evil was created in 48 hours for the Jam.

Battle the horde of skeletons with the ancient power of BATTLE METAL!

A simple rhythm action game in which note streaks knock back the oncoming horde of evil! If they reach the stage then it's curtains for our heroes.

Controls:

Note keys - A, S, D, J, K

Created by:

Adam Findlay
Joe McClean
Sam Jarvis

entries.title: Mummy craft
entries.description:
Mummy Craft is a match 3 type game where you can craft tools to complete the mummification process. 

PLEASE READ BEFORE PLAYING

Progress will depend on how accurate your craft is.
Touching Annubis's head will renew all jeroplyphs, use it wisely 
Click recipes on the top right to see them!! 

Suitable for mobile

Our top scrore of mummys so far is 82!! 

Programming: Pablo Ferro (PabloLeChuck)
Graphic Art: Sabina Dragichevich

entries.title: Pushy Pushy Cart
entries.description:
The wheel is an invention we often take for granted. We often forget that its perfect symmetry was not easily achieved. In Pushy Pushy Cart, you must try to draw wheels, in freehand, upon which you must roll a cart down a hill without crushing or dropping any melons. Experiment with different diameters and wheel shapes to reach your objective with minimal watermelon casualties.

This Ludum Dare Team project was made in 72 hours by the team at Silvereye, coded in C# in the Unity engine. Its developers were Justin Nauta and Adam Marshall (programming), and Ryan Hetchler (art).

entries.title: Ray Defence
entries.description:
*NOTE* The Beam Shader does not work on Web! 

Your a lone inventor tasked with the possible, use a beam of light to defend your town. Good luck.

entries.title: Super Paddle Ball

Super Paddle Ball.

Reach the longest distance meanwhile avoiding rocks, explosive crates and... UFO?

--------

Anyway, good luck and have fun!

entries.title: Terminal Condition
entries.description:
This is a survival story that takes place inside a sealed vault, hundreds of meters below the surface of a nuclear wasteland. A series of accidents and malfunctions has rendered the life support system inoperative, and everyone else dead. The last remains of oxygen is quickly whittling away.

For you, the nameless survivor, the only hope for survival is a battered mainframe terminal in the engineering department. Can you get the airflow restored in time?

The game is intended to be played on a desktop computer, using a physical keyboard. It has been tested with Chrome.

entries.title: The Temple
entries.description:
Controls: 

move - WASD 
restart - R
fullscreen/windowed - 0 
full hd resolution - 4
hd resolution - 3
Esc to exit

Audio track from freesound.org by esistnichtsoernst http://freesound.org/people/esistnichtsoernst/sounds/333930/

Do not play this if you have epilepsy.
Mac-version contains some bugs.

entries.title: Wizard of the Golden Hat (unfinished)
entries.description:
This is an unfinished game; after getting about 40 hours in I realized that I had spent too much time on infrastructure and not enough on "finding the fun."

My goal was to turn the golden hats of Bronze Age Europe (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_hat) into a game mechanic of some sort. Nobody knows what sort of priests or wizards wore these beautiful artifacts, but we do know that there are solar and lunar cycles encoded into the embossing of the hat. I was imagining an Oregon Trail-style game where the player would have to anticipate solstices and conduct eclipse rituals to progress, but I got bogged down in cosmology and also the text system. Oh well, learned a lot on the way!

entries.title: Abandoned Planet
entries.description:
MISSION #146 DAYS
-------------------------------
The control panel has broken.

I'm landing on a unknown planet.

There's no human or animal on it.

Strange marks everywhere.

Wreckage shows there had some kind of technology.

Hope I can find some useful parts to fix my ship.

entries.title: Amalie
entries.description: It's like going to hell in a handbasket, but instead of a handbasket, you've got a wheel.

entries.title: Ancient Man & Tech
entries.description: Just having a bit of fun with my first LD entry/Unity game. An old man saw "technology" lying in the middle of the street, while facing a tough-looking bully.

entries.title: Ancient Tech No. 34
entries.description:
Ancient Tech No. 34 is an experimental game made for LD36 jam and AGJam 2016 (Audiogame Jam http://jams.gamejolt.io/AGJam).
Our main goal was to make a game based on audio and fully playable for people of any level of sight. 

Help an Ancient Technology No. 34 from Empire of Ice to save their realm.
Do not let the music stop.

"I AM AN ANCIENT TECH NO. 34 FROM THE REALM OF ICE. 
WHEN THE MUSIC STOPS OUR EMPIRE DIES. 
IN THE SILENCE PRESS ANY KEY TO RESUME OUR SONG. 
DON'T PRESS WHEN YOU HEAR IT BECAUSE THAT WILL BREAK MY HEART. 
YOU CAN CLOSE YOUR EYES IF YOU WANT. "


Controls: Any key, the game uses audio so headphones or speakers recommended.

How to play?
When the music stops hit any key on keyboard to turn it again on.
Be fast to restore life of the Empire.
Do not press the key when the music plays. 
Have fun with Ancient Tech No. 34! :)

We will work on this concept to the end of Audiogame Jam.
Ludum Dare jam version is still something like work in progress... :)

entries.title: Aqueducts
entries.description:
Goal: Bring water from the lake to the town by connecting them via aqueducts. 

Rules: 
- Path from lake (blue tile) to town (orange tile) must be complete (a closed circuit). You don't want to lose water!
- Your workers are lazy and have placed down too many aqueduct parts. Not all tiles will always be used.
- Lakes are stationary, so they cannot be turned.
- Some lakes can service multiple towns.
- There should be only one way to solve each level.

** IF YOU FIND A PUZZLE THAT HAS MORE THAN ONE WAY OF SOLVING IT: Please tweet it to me at @Lyzzi_Lightyear! (https://twitter.com/Lyzzi_Lightyear)

I'm going to keep developing this! If you want to see new additions since LD, check out: http://test-aqueducts.herokuapp.com/

-------
Made with Phaser.io by Lyzzi Brooks and Adam Marchetti

entries.title: Atomic Reconstruction
entries.description:
You found a ancient alien technology to manipulate matter at your own will.

Atomic Reconstruction is a Puzzle game, where you have to use the power of fusion and fission to create specific Atoms or groups of atoms.

Experience 15 unique challenges.

For Controls: click on the "?" in the Mainmenu.
If you want to restart a level, just hit escape to get back to the menu.

If you encounter a crash, please post the log.txt that was created in the same folder as the .jar file.

I also hope that some of you go and take a look at my improved LD34 entry that is currently on Steam Greenlight to vote and itch.io to buy.
https://teekeks.itch.io/swarmonian-explorer
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=745362445

entries.title: Catapult
entries.description:
WEB VERSION IS NOW UP AND WORKING!
NOTE: in order that StretchMode will work, play in full screen.

=================== I N S T R U C T I O N S=============================
This is a TOWER DEFENSE game.
THIS MEANS AUTO-AIM!!!

You are defending the castle from the wall (above enemies) and can move
only on it (right and left)

Rules:
1. you may reposition only catapults and only before a combat.
2. stone makes 1 damage.
3. flamed stone makes 2 damage.
4. each normal soldier has 1hp and makes 1 damage to your castle.
5. two catapults usually don't aim at the same enemy.
6. boss/huge knight has 12 hp and 4 damage.
7. workflow screen won't show loop-causing weapons. (if feeded to)

=================== T O D O =============================
1. Too many weapons may cause the list go beyond workflow pane.
         for now it's not too awful because this means you have more
         than enough of the same weapon, such that it won't matter which one you connect.
         (remember that there's a loop preventing mechanism in the suggestions)
2. auto-aimer is simple, but should work for this entry.
3. no naming of devices - didn't have time. You still can manage without it.
4. StretchMode - it's a best effort to support multiple resolutions,
                 thus, turning AutoScale off would make it easier almost definitely
                 and might ruin the game for you.

======================= I N F O =============================
This game/prototype is a result of me trying to do
(that's literally what's written on the paper of brainstorming here):
Tower Defense Puzzle.
(actually I also wrote "with alien mechanics") but that idea dropped
since I had no time to implement it.
(it was supposed to be an event where aliens attack you and you learn
gain access to their weapons when robbing their bodies)
But as you'll see the game/prototype itself is short enough as it is.
Still hope you'll enjoy it for it =] !

====================== T O O L S ======================================
This entry is written in JS and Canvas only.
It is using JSCF which is my custom canvas library, right now in development.
As such, it still lacks a bit documentation about what's ready and what's not and that's why some code is "re-written" instead of being used from the library.

You can check out the source code of JSCF in github:
https://github.com/g--o/JSCF
Right now, it is active only on branch develop so you should check the files over there.

editor - Atom (bad decision..)
art - gimp, pyxel edit. (gimp is actually more comfortable)
sound - my guitar and pedals (cheap court electric guitar, multi-effect and delay-looper).
maintenance - junk food and ice cream.

entries.title: Circle of Fire
entries.description:
Beware, actually a fancy fire simulator :P. You have invented the (now) achient technology FIRE! Congratulations. If only you knew how to control it ey? Maybe not letting it burn down your small island and your village should be your next priority? Well, what are you waiting for?! Your gods will not save you now!

Controls:
 - WASD or Arrow keys to move
 - E to pickup the regenerating water buckets, E again to use.

Handy to know's:
 - Fire spreads fast, so keep the floor cool with water.
 - The redder the floor, the hotter it is.
 - Losing one of your houses will lose you the game.
 - Water kills the fire.
 - The center fire can't be put out.
 - Water buckets regenerate at the docks.
 - The timer in the top right corner is the time left until you win the game.
 - Have fun!
 - Very fancy screensaver if you let the main screen run for a while, if you don't like the gameplay :P.

Thanks for playing and feedback is highly sought after! So thanks in advance!

entries.title: Dizzy Mayan
entries.description:
You can play any lvl, but playing in order its easier for the learning curve.

:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: 

Dizzy Mayan is a puzzlish game where you have to put the last piece of a calendar maya in its place. Click to swap between inner and outer rings. 

Please try the game ! I'm always looking for suggestions and advice. 

-7 LEVELS 

This is my first ludum, used haxeflixel, photoshop, audacity and panic induced adrenaline. I'm really eager to any suggestions. 

If I recieve a good feedback on this Ill make a fun level pack after the compo.

My website; www.aschab.com

entries.title: E.V.I.L. Corp.
entries.description:
Welcome to E.V.I.L. Corp. , docotor!
Your well known will to innovate is needed on our new project. We have found an ancient ship-like stuff that contains amazing forgotten tech, guarded by demons, mummies and all sorts of evil! Isn't that amazing?! Bring us more folders with science papers-stuff about this stunning things!

Simple rules:
You have 3 resources: 
Folders of papers - your score or how much science you got.
People - money for evil doctors. Every card costs people that are lost in process of getting this piece of techonology.
Uncover points - your secret project is searched by everyone: CIA, FBI , KGB etc. When it reaches 100 - you are busted!

Each turn you get new 3 cards and discard previous. Place any card on board to play it and the turn will happen automaticaly! That's it.

Just a game inspired by Quill18's Growth Industries. But I have failed to get the game to a really playbale condition.Now it is a rough demo of the game that I have IMAGINED in my head :D 

Used Ancient Tech:

HTML5
Paint.Net

entries.title: Egypt Cat Spirits
entries.description:
Space to start the game, the rest is mouse driven.

You are an agent, send to stop an unknown group that attacked the researchers of your company and are wrecking havoc. You weapon? An old artifact, able to summon and control a giant cat spirit. If you want to save your company from the mysterious threat, you have to figure out how to control your spirit and destroy the enemy!

entries.title: Kalen O'Brien
entries.description:
A game about a Potato that uses a grappling hook to traverse the world!
First solo jam I've ever done so It was painful, as I'm primarily an artist/animator so programming took up most of my time during the project.

Controls:
A/D For Left and Right movement.
W for Jump
E to shoot your grapple on candles to hook to them.
Use a/d to swing back and forth while using the grapple hook.

My Twitter is @Kalobrienz, tweet me if ya enjoy the game!

entries.title: Magnum Opus
entries.description:
Grog has spent his lifetime working on his greatest creation, the wheel. Prepared to showcase his craftsmanship to the others, he was surprised to learn a storm the other night had created a new phenomenon, fire. With everyone distracted with the incredible and warm miracle, no one will give Grog's wheel any attention. Make things right.

A 2D platformer with a lot of problems, but some heart! About a caveman's wheel as he sends it off to distinguish fires that take away from his brilliance. There is cartoony blood!

Brought to you by: The Amorphous Glob of Friendship!
First Time Ludum Dare with some friends! Used GameMaker Standard, so it is a runnable executive and not hosted onto a website. But if you're willing to download it and try it, I hope you enjoy the experience enough!

entries.title: Modus Catapultus
entries.description:

entries.title: Pharoh Kefmeh
entries.description:
Pharoh Kefmeh has recently become a god. However, nobody is building him a cool temple for his body. He decides to take matters into his own hands. Unfortunately, just as the prophets foretold, he is beginning construction of his monuments on the same day of a great meteor storm.

------------------------------------------------

Controls:

--------------------------------------------------------

Made by Jonathon and Kevin Prehn (The Prehn Twins) in about 12 hours. We had to move into college this weekend, so we didn't get much time. Please don't hold back on criticism though! This is our first game using WebGL, and we are very excited to finish it.

entries.title: Pucketeers of Atlantis
entries.description:
[[[ Loading above is not instantaneous; please be patient for a few seconds! ]]]
[[[ May or may not work with gamepads in your browser; downloads otherwise available! c: ]]]

---------
PUCKETEERS OF ATLANTIS:
---------

The year 2020, and a small group of archaeologists discover Atlantis. Their happiness is overshadowed by the sheer amazement at the fact that Atlanteans are all robots, and like playing hockey with EXPLODING PUCKS™ and time-manipulating power-ups. What a weird lot.

---------
NOTE:
---------

This is a two-player game! Also you need at least one gamepad! Hook up your favourite controller and bring your favourite friend (or sworn enemy, if you're the kind of person to have one of those) and play a friendly (or enemyly) game of Atlantean Hockey! The rules are simple; score points! Use power-ups! Tackle the other team!

This game is kind of a long shot theme-wise, but we hope you'll give it a try anyway! c:

---------
SHORT POST-MORTEM NOTES:
---------

So the last LD was the first time we didn't have time for sound effects. This LD we had those, but no time for music. Always something! But at least we did something radically new with this compared to our older entries, which are overwhelmingly about puzzling, problem solving or more or less unhappy subject matters.

The matches were supposed to be timed and a winner be determined after a few minutes, but there was no time, so now the game simply goes on forever—but it does keep score, so just keep battling it out for as long as you wish instead. Make your own rules! First to 30 points, perhaps?

I am rather amazed at how we continually manage to tie everything up in a SORT OF presentable way last minute every time. It never ceases to be the scariest experience. Throw in all the sound effects during submission hour? Oh, yes!

Bugs may exist, but what can you do?

---------
TWITTERS:
---------

@avaskoog
@thedjuske
@zbegra

---------
LINKS:
---------

Twitter reveal if you want to retweet:
https://twitter.com/avaskoog/status/770455471832596480

LD blog reveal:
http://ludumdare.com/compo/2016/08/29/jam-entry-pucketeers-of-atlantis/

YouTube video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IC9N19iaF1E

Tweet to share video:
https://twitter.com/avaskoog/status/770878328882552832

The game is set in ancient times using ancient technology and weapons but it's also set in an ancient computer technology with a graphical style of a 1970s home computer game.



Game controls:

W A S D or arrow keys
Space for fighting (if you have found a weapon)
1 2 3 to change between weapons

Axe - Good damage but you need to get close to the enemy
Spear - Medium damage usable on distance but quite slow to throw again
Slingshot - Low damage but usable on distance and fast to throw again

Desert
Forest
Caves

Every world is unique and randomly created for each game. 


The game and all the content was created during the jam weekend. LibGDX was used as the framework and the game is compiled for HTML5.

Graphics, sounds and ideas: Mathias Lindfeldt

entries.title: Bread Team
entries.description:
Disclaimer: sorry, this game is not finished yet, so it's not fully playable.

---------------------------

"Bread Team" is a keyboard QTE-based baking simulator about micromanagement and crunch time in the kitchen. You're supposed to control six bakers at the same time, while trying to optimize their workflow and speed up the process of baking bread not forgetting about quality. 

Bread is the oldest meal we can remember, no one knows where its recipe came from, maybe some ancient forgotten civilization was responsible for its creation (what? why not?). This is why only the real professionals are allowed to deal with it! Bread Team - the most trustworthy group of narrowly specialized cooks who take the bread baking very seriously! Bread Team! It's like a Dream Team, but Bread!

By the way, keep an eye on the keeper guy, he is always hungry and constantly trying to steal some bread while everyone is busy.

---------------------------

To dos to finish the game:
1. All the QTEs, four left.
2. Brand new bakers assets + animations. Every cook should be unique.
3. Countdown clocks on the wall for creating pressure and boundaries.
4. Progressive challenges in both the speed and quality of baking.
5. Additional sounds, menu, logo.
6. Balancing the difficulty. A player is supposed to be confused with all simultaneous QTE-sequences at high levels.

Tools used:
- Unity 5.3.1
- Adobe Photoshop
- Microsoft Visual Studio

Resources:
- Temporarily baker asset from Scribblenauts / Scribblenauts Unlimited
- Music and sounds from freesound.org and other portals


Created in associate with Tim Pozdeev.

entries.title: Steam Train Youpi
entries.description:
## Steam Train Youpi

In this game you'll enjoy the work of a steam train conductor !

It's a little complicated so here is your formation :

There is three main parts in your locomotive :
 * Reserve of coal and water, at left.
 * Firebox : place where the coal is burn.
 * Boiler : water tank where water boil (up to firebox).

Press H to see where those components are.

Press M to mute the music.

Here are the controls :
 * F to put coal in Firebox
 * S to activate brakes (keep pushed to brake)
 * C and V to regulate water flow that enter in the Boiler
 * LEFT and RIGHT to switch direction (REVERSE or FORWARD)
 * B to send steam to the engine (keep pushed)

To go forward, you have to produce Steam. Keep the Firebox full of coal (F) to heat the boiler. The thermometer indicate the temperature : there is more steam produced if boiler is hotter.

You can see level of coal in the firebox by looking the dark black level. Same thing for the boiler and the dark blue for the water level.

The bar on top of the boiler indicate the pression. Press B to send steam to the engine. More pression means more speed. When you send steam to engines, water level in the boiler reduce.
You will have to send water in the boiler. Be carefull, adding fresh water will reduce temperature of the boiler. C and V regulates the water flow : 0 means no water is added, 1 means lot of water is added.

The goal is to stop at all stations (there are 5 of them). Use S to brake. the right counter indicates how far is the next station. When you see the STOP sign, you have to stop the train. Start the train when it vanish.
Try to finish the game the faster you can !

Good luck !

Tips:
 * Wait for enough pression in the boiler to activate engines, it will be more efficient.
 * Go reverse if you missed the station. You have missed a station if the right counter is negative.
 * Always put coal in the Firebox (F key)
 * Try things, it will probably work sometime.

(Actual) Technology used :
 * Haxe
 * HaxeFlixel
 * Staaxe
 * Polom lib
 * Krita
 * Audacity

entries.title: Another Day With Grandpa
entries.description:
This game is a parody of technology and what we consider old. It takes 5 minutes of not dying to beat. Your grandpa is very mad because you did not do your homework. 

The game is hosted on my own website.

I have not developed games for long, please keep that in mind.

This game was developed in Construct 2 with some help from gimp and the internet. I did not make the music.

Try using the up arrow instead of clicking and keep in mind you can double jump. This game is not impossible, when I tested the game I beat it a few times myself.

Controls:
Up arrow is jump, You can double jump

Considering this is an 5 minute (not really endless) runner that is all there is to the controls.

Music is 10000 Tons of Sugar by Eternal Sushi.

entries.title: Apalis
entries.description:
Really tight jam this time around. I teamed up with Newan, an art samurai, and Carlos an audio master. The theme wasn't deeply inspiring to the three of us but we decided to go with a good ol' platformer, sacrificing the them a tiny tad bit. We didn't have the time to add certain mechanics or certain assets (audio and art) but I think the result is rather satisfying.

/!\ If you are stuck on one level, know that all levels are unlocked by default, so feel free to escape a difficult level in order to discover the rest of the game.

### Description ### 

You find yourself among a jungle that seems to behold an ancient technology left by locals centuries ago. Stones of pure darkness bewitchedly carved by the azure alchemy of the ancient God Apalis. Explore the jungle and find out what this technology is capable of through 20 levels each tougher than the previous one.

### Controls (Gamepad recommended) ### 

--- Keyboard --- 
QD/AD or Arrow keys to move 
Z/W, Space or Up arrow to jump

--- Gamepad --- 
D-pad to move
A to jump

### Credits ### 

Code and Art by Tselmek 

Art by Newan

Audio by Carlos Pazuzu

### Changelog ###
[30/08/2016 17:32] Fixed a game-breaking bug occuring in the last level.

entries.title: Baby Daycare Simulator 2020
entries.description:
Do you have what it takes to run a baby daycare in the far distant year 2020?

Cultivate crops, place areas for play, rest, food and more.

Protect babies from the dangers of the year 2020, such as radioactive storms, mole-men or death metal bands practicing nearby.

entries.title: BRAVE To The Core
Cooking Caveman
entries.description:
Fire. It lets us warm ourselves, see in the darkness, scare away predators, but, most importantly... it lets us cook!

You're the designated cook for this evening! Your friends will be throwing the meat and you have to cook it with your fire. Careful with the flying rocks though! You'll have to throw your fire in the air, but don't drop it!

Get as many points as you can in 60 seconds! Cooking meat nets you points, but getting hit, missing meat, or dropping your fire makes you lose points.

Controls - W/D or Left/Right arrow for movement, hold and release space to throw fire

Thanks to
- Background art: Open Game Art Contributors (http://opp.opengameart.org/index.php/Contributors)
- Music: Cappelletti Show by Serena Giannini
- Sound effects: Freesound

Made in a day. Not entirely satisfied with it, but I hope you enjoy it!

entries.title: Cyprint
entries.description:
The year is 2018.
You have just stolen a priceless piece of experimental bioware and are fleeing the scene of the crime. Your choice of getaway vehicle is an odd one - an ancient gas burning car. The last vehicle that doesn't have a direct uplink with the 'net ... or a vulnerability to the  nearly omnipotent hack gear of The Authority. You throw open the door and toss your prize in the passenger seat, just barely pulling your floor length trench coat out of the way so it doesn't get stuck in the door. As you race across the abandoned roads in the shadow of the city, you must destroy The Authority's drones and dodge their timed charges until you reach the relative safety of the city limits.

Buckle your seat belt and put on your massive, high-tech goggles, because it's going to be a wild ride.
(WASD to drive + mouse to aim and shoot)
------------------------
Pretty rough around the edges, but there's definitely some fun gameplay.

entries.title: Eye Shooter
entries.description: Android game - Space invader with face tracking. You have to close your eyes to activate the cannons.

entries.title: Grab & Defend
entries.description:
Grab stuff with a mechanical hand and throw it into enemies attacking your castle - The Placeholder Army (pun intended)

YES, the hand is quite hard to control, but that's the point! Once you master the controls, the game becomes not that hard.  Make use of inertia! Rotate the hand and move the machine simultaneously to get max kinetic energy. 

If you feel that the game is WAY TOO HARD, please, write a commenat about it. 
TIP: If you get lost with what keys to press, just try holding Q+W+E or A+S+D simultaneously to move the entire hand at once. You won'nt beat the game if you try to control each joint individually. Move them all at once.



Controls:
Q/W/E - rotate joints clockwise
A/S/D - rotate joints counter-clockwise
Space - grab/throw stuff
left/right arrows - move

Tools:

Engine: Construct 2
Art: Paint.Net, Spriter (post-jam animations)
Sound: Zoom H2n + Audacity
Music: cgMusic, Cubase 7LE, VST

The game was made by myself within 72 hours.
Music I was listening to during development: Ice ages, Goethes Erben



CHANGELOG:

[30.08.2016] v1.0.1 
- Shooting through wall fixed

[31.08.2016] v1.0.2 
- New tutorial
- Waves 1-4 rebalanced
From now on, this game version is considered Post-Jam

[09.09.2016] v1.1.1
- Enemy sprites reworked & animated
- "Arm" sprite reworked
- some visual effects (fire) added
- other minor changes

entries.title: Grampy Katz in: The Big Date
entries.description:
Story:
Grampy Katz has a hot date and his place is a disaster! Help him clean up before his date arrives and discovers what a slob he is. 

Controls:
Use the mouse to move Grampy Katz. Click on objects to quickly complete tasks before time runs out.

Winning/Losing:
Complete as many tasks as possible before time runs out. The ultimate goal is to have a perfect date, but a pretty good date is also nice. Don’t worry, Greta is fairly opinionated and she’ll tell you exactly how she feels when the date ends. Good luck! 

Who Made This?
@Meowza (art, animation, programming, game design)
@Kukubee (game design, writing)

©2016 Meowza Games

Contact us: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

entries.title: Jet Through Time!
entries.description:
# OBS:

Unfortunatly the games window size is specificly set to 1000x1000. There is nothing I can do about this at this moment.

# Summery:

This is a game where you jet through time in hopes of learning something about the mighty inventions of ancient society. It's basically you getting mashed by random flying ancient inventions. I have literally no idea what I have made. Enjoy.


# Controls:

A and D or arrow keys to move the player.

[Space] to activate shield (makes you immortal for a puny little while).


# Analysis:

This was my second Ludum Dare, and my first compo. My goal was simply to create a working "finished" game, which I have problems with achieving normally. I am fairly happy with the structure of my project. Once I had sort of a playable version of the game I made it quite easy to add extra content. Since structure and planning is something i need to work on I feel like I succeded in that part. Well, the planning was abit off. Even though the game sort of works at the moment there is a lot of content that I did not have time to add. For example:

+ Boss Battle

+ More Eras

+ More player interactivity (abilities)


As a conclusion I can say that I am not really that happy with how the game turned out. However, I am still proud of myself that I managed to get something playable in such a short time.

entries.title: Log Driver
entries.description:
A few decades ago log driving was quite famous. Test your abilities to understand the river, and to drive some logs ! You have to guide all the logs downstream. Be careful not to get the logs stuck in an eddy, or on a rock.

input :

A  ==  drive the log up
Q  ==  drive the log down

KEYBOARD ARROWS == to control the log driver, and jump from log to log


UPDATE WINDOWS AND LINUX  : not tested

entries.title: Phreak36
entries.description:
** THIS GAME REQUIRES A MICROPHONE TO PLAY **

...or other functional audio input device
If the default device does not work, you may need to change the input device with V before attempting to play.

Phreak36 is a game about phreaking, and getting long-distance telephone calls for free. The goal is to produce a sustained tone at 2600 Hz. The keypad does not work, sorry. :(

You can read more at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phreaking



CONTROLS:
v = Change input device
z/page down = Lower goal frequency
x/page up = Raise goal frequency



Most people (almost everyone) will be unlikely to hit 2600 Hz. Try lowering the goal to ~1600 for a comfortable whistle.

nerds: If you happen to try a blue box or similar out on this, let me know the results (I don't expect it to be good). I understand this is not an authentic representation.


I planned to have a moodier setting, with drizzling rain, an actual background, functioning phone numbers, and maybe some music... but between ambition and excessive relaxation that didn't happen.
I appreciate the feedback. Thanks for playing!

entries.title: Pointy Sticks and Other Amazing things
entries.description:
You're directing a tribe of people living off the land. Sometimes one of your people has a serendipitous moment of inspiration and a big leap forward happens. This game is about exploring the mundane events that lead to big ideas. 

The tech system isn't as fleshed out as I want it to be, but I really like the way the system has come together, even it its a bit small at the moment.

It's sort of an idle/puzzle game hybrid.

entries.title: Project CAT
entries.description:
Entry for Ludum Dare 36.

You play as a time-traveling man stuck inside of a tomb during your search for some ancient technology. 

You only have 2 weapons with you, the primitive pebble and the highly advanced cat bomb!

Until the portal reappears for you to escape through, you must survive the onslaught of mummies woken up by your presence!

#LDJAM

entries.title: Pyramid Plunder
entries.description:
Traverse the pyramid and clear it from the enemies.

The game features a procedurally generated world. It is not the best that it could be because I wasted quite a lot of time making the procedural generation. It takes a very long time to load so if it seems like it crashed it is probably loading. This is because it takes quite a while to generate the world. Also sometimes it is impossible to enter certain passageways. Feature not bug! The powers of the pyramid prohibit entry through certain passages.

Over all it was a great experience and I hope that I can take part next Ludum Dare.

Instructions:
WASD to move.
Mouse to shoot.
Shooting is disabled until you move for the first time.
You are invincible until you move to avoid death as soon as you launch the game.

entries.title: sOS
entries.description: You have managed to access the top secret secure system of SPACE HQ. Can you use your wits (and trusty Hack Boy™ hacking tool) to steal the precious SPACE PLANS without being caught?

entries.title: TANK, GO EAST !
entries.description:
Phew, finally finished it ! I think I haven't been able to work more than 15 hours on that game, I hope i'll have more time next jam !

HOW THE GAME WORKS :
The enemy is preventing you to use the modern ways to communicate, so you have to give orders to your army by using a simplified telegraph of Chappe.

An order is composed of 2 keywords :
First, the unit to move (Tank, Bomber or All)
Then, the direction (N/S/E/W)

You have a limited time to enter each keyword.
To enter one, you must move the "arms" by using either your mouse wheel or the mouse buttons on the circles of the telegraph.
If the order is composed of unknown codes, or if the keywords are not "Unit, then Direction", none of your units will move.

The enemy will move its units (always both) when you will give an order.

If 2 units are colliding, a fight happen :
The bomber always beats the tank.
If 2 bombers or 2 tanks encounter, they both die.

If a unit die, it gets back to its initial position.

You have to reach the enemy base before he reaches yours !

POST DEADLINE : I made the game a little easier, with more time to give orders

CREDITS :
"Dirt Hand Painted Texture" is from The Chayed - KIIRA (http://opengameart.org/content/dirt-hand-painted-texture)
"Tank Pack - Bleed's Game Art" is from Bleed (http://opengameart.org/content/tank-pack-bleeds-game-art)
"Simple Explosion" is from Bleed (http://opengameart.org/content/simple-explosion-bleeds-game-art)
"Trees and Bushes" is from chabull (http://opengameart.org/content/trees-and-bushes)
"Aircrafts" is from chabull (http://opengameart.org/content/aircrafts)
"Top down painted tanks" is from irmirx (http://opengameart.org/content/top-down-painted-tanks)

entries.title: The Summoner's Bell
entries.description:
Deep within the reaches of a far castle, a bell rings, summoning ancient mechanical horrors with its foul knell.

WASD moves, right click to shoot bolts.  Pick up keys to unlock doors.  Every time the bell sounds, more monsters spawn, so hurry on to the next area before you get overwhelmed!  The game is over when you destroy the bell.  Sorry there is no "You Win" screen.  We ran out of time, and into problems.  Enjoy though!

Currently only supporting Windows, although we'll eventually build out for other stuff.  To run, just download and extract the .zip, then run the final_build.exe file.

This game may lag your machine unless you're playing it on a desktop.  Try launching with a lower resolution if that happens.  Also play around with the graphics quality.  Or just buy a computer that's not a potato.

Known Bugs:  

- Sometimes when you launch the game, it'll freeze for a few seconds.  Sometimes it will even freeze forever.  Just relaunch it.  We don't know why this happens either.

- When you die, the music background track duplicates, which is weird.  So you know... don't die.

Credits
--------------------
Art: Linear
Code: Aurelinator
Sound: tanbor9

entries.title: The Temple of Sharaab
entries.description:
Enter the temple of Sharaab, and claim the ancient treasure that lies within!

Dodge deadly traps and solve devious puzzles as you descend into the depths of the temple.

entries.title: Underground Repair Inc
entries.description:
Underground Repair Inc.

As a young dwarven repairman you are tasked with repairing a remote rat infested facility.

Notes:

 - Its not complete, there is no win condition.
 - Feel free to wander around, shoot the rat or fall down a pit.
 - WASD to move around. 1-4 to enter the tool modes.
 - Requires the XNA 4.0 Redist to run: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914

entries.title: Alien Dungeon
entries.description:
You an archeologist found a cave enterance in a far away land, you enter this dungeon and discover a hallway lit up by some blue lines on the walls.

This game is not infinte

Controls are:
WS to move forward and backward
AD to rotate camera
F to interact with the world

This game was built in my own game engine in C# and OpenTK

I would like to mention my engine does not have support for sound so i have not been able to add sound to the game.


Windows is the only supported platform

entries.title: ANCIENT MAYAN DEATHCHAMBERS
entries.description:
100% accurate depiction of historical Mayan deathchambers. Except for maybe the jumping mechas.

WASD to move, mouse to aim and thrust spear, escape to pause. Your spear can destroy all threats, but some react differently to it.

entries.title: Ancient Motivation Technology
entries.description:
Welcome Ladys and Gentlemen!

Today we'll timetravel back to the good old days.
In those days workers still had the previlege of having a motivator.

Feeling tired? GET MOTIVATED! Don't won't to work anymore? GET MOTIVATED!

In this game you have the chance to play as an old-school motivator and lay
hand on some real ancient motivation technology.

You simply have to pass you working day.
But be careful! Some workers might get demotivated, as you aren't motivating them enough. They will try to end their work day with your death.

HAVE FUN MOTIVATING!


Edit: The game was created in 48h and for the compo, but had to be moved to the Jam-Section, since I forgot to replace a placeholder sound and therefor compo rules do no apply :/

entries.title: Beyond Ages
entries.description:
Game made for the #LDJAM 36 in 72 h.

Beyond Ages is a platformer game where your friend think that the people who lived in Atlantis detained an extraordinary technology. You decide to bring this thing to your friend, but ...

Requires :
- Java

Uses :
- LWJGL 3.0.0b90
- JOML

Credits :
Programmer :
- Mathieu C. AKA Mathiouza

Designers :
- Mathieu C.
- Paul G.

Have fun !

entries.title: Dinomash
entries.description: Dinos vs Aliens. Ancient vs Technology.

entries.title: Disgolem
entries.description:
Disgolem was made for LD36 by @OhCarson, @ghoulkiss and @Jack_Gill_SGS over 3 days.

Click dancing golems and use the arrrow keys, or W,A,S and D keys to the different beats to control them on the dance floor.

Match the same colored golems to get points and clear up some room for more!

'A golem is an animated anthropomorphic being, magically created entirely from funky ingredients, such as platform shoes, sequins, and four-to-the-floor drum patterns' [citation needed] Once every ten thousand years, deep below the surface of the earth, the ancient and forgotten catacombs of Disconia are woken by the power of ancient funky Disco beats, and the silent denizens of that once proud civilisation take to their feet, with one resolute aim; Getting' down. As a conductor of funk, take control of the Golems of Disconia and guide them to their dance floor partners, to transcend this world in a flash of flares and disco fever. Connect bigger Golem groups for more points, and become the stuff of ancient Disco legend.​

entries.title: Egypt Ramps
entries.description:
Help the Egyptians to build your pyramid. Use the ramps to make the pieces reach the target.

Have Fun!

entries.title: Escape From Earth
entries.description:
ESCAPE FROM EARTH
=================================================================

A young Earthling, bored in their sleek futuristic environment, looks for a way to escape monotony and soon becomes fascinated with a very addictive relic from the past.

=================================================================

HOW TO PLAY

Left/Right Arrow or A/D: move
Space: interact

=================================

Programming by Stending (@MatthieuWololo)
Art by Buttshark (http://www.buttshark.net)(@chaziemcblack and @jakechirak)
Music by Pierre Vanier (@PierreuhVanier, https://www.youtube.com/user/ThePeterSongs)

Made with Unity, Photoshop, Medibang Paint

entries.title: Flight Of Icarus
entries.description:
- Clik to fly up
- Each time you fly up you loose one feather
- Don't fly close to sun
- Don't loose all feathers
- Catch birds to replace feathers

entries.title: Hunter Gatherer
entries.description:
HUNTER GATHERER
---

You are your ancient ancestor who only has two concerns in life: Eating berries and not getting eaten by bears.

Eat berries or animals to keep your sustenance bar up, collect rocks and wood to craft items that can protect you from bears.

---HOW TO PLAY---
-Run around with WASD
-Collect resources by holding F until the resource disappears
-Press Space to attack (requires spear)
-Press C to get into the crafting menu
-Hold T to place traps

--Running the game on Linux-- 
tar -zxf _hunter_gatherer_linux.tar.gz
cd HunterGatherer_Linux
sh run.sh

Requires .NET Framework 4.5
Built with C#, OpenTK, custom 2D engine and my randomization library RUL (https://github.com/MStadlmeier/RUL)
I mostly made this to test my engine, so feel free to give me feedback on any technical issues :)
And please do forgive me for the art...

entries.title: Kessel Run
entries.description:
"You've never heard of the Millennium Falcon?…It's the ship that made the Kessel Run in less than twelve parsecs."

///

I ran into a few errors trying to convert the game into an executable so for now here's how to run the game:
1. Make sure you have Python 3 installed
2. Make sure pygame is installed, if you have python installed you can install this by typing "pip install pygame" on the command line
2. Download and Unzip the KESSELRUN.zip file
3. run "KESSELRUN/kessel_run.py" in Python 3

///

CONTROLS
LEFT/RIGHT to move
SPACE to shoot

entries.title: Khufu: the Pyramid Builder
entries.description: Unfinished physics sandbox around building pyramids.  Build the highest pyramid by sliding the blocks on top of each other using ramps.  After you move a block, you can't move it again, so plan ahead!

entries.title: Killer Space Cat The Game
entries.description:
​this is my first game ever made (publicly) in like 48 hours (though most of it spent slacking off and sleeping due to a headache) for the ludum jamaflam​. At first I wanted to make something serious but then I realized I wasn't really having fun so I tried to make something on the wim organic without much thought . It was a lot of fun... I think moving around in this is quite fun so i'll probably look at it later. I think the space part is actually the best though but I couldn't think of an (easy) way of expanding it.

think it only works on windows though (never exported a game into an application in gamemaker before). To be honest I don't really care what people think of the game, i'm just happy that I enjoy it as it's more of a for me thing.

entries.title: Lighthouse - Illuminate to rescue!
entries.description:
Lighthouse - Illuminate to rescue!
----------------------------------

Rotate the Mirrors to bring the beam from the table to the top of the lighthouse.
You must illuminate all light connectors before the ship crashes on the cliffs!

Genre: 2D Puzzle Game
Minimum resolution: 1280x720

==================
Web Version Quirks
==================
Web Version works, but please download the windows version if you can to prevent unexpected events.


==================
EASY MODE
==================
If you want to fully experience the game with a much easier timelimit, please download the easy mode version. This version was created after the Compo ended, so this version is just for fun.


Controls
=================================
Click and drag the rotatable Mirrors and Prisms with your mouse.
The mirror will always face in the direction of your cursor.
If you want to finetune the mirrors, move the cursor farther away from
the mirror while being dragged.

How To Play
=================================
Use the mirrors to bring the beam from the bottom of the lighthouse to the top and
hit all light connectors (the triangles) with at least one beam.
You have to be quick, as you will lose when the ship hits the cliffs.
Use prisms to split the beam in two beams.

CHEATS
=================================
Press N to skip to the next Level if you want to see all of them

Tools
=================================
Game Engine: Unity 5
Graphics: Adobe Illustrator
Music: GarageBand + Yamaha EZ-220

Questions, Bugs, everything? Write a comment, or write me a mail at [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

Thanks for playing and have a nice day :-)

entries.title: Monolith
entries.description:
The idea is inspired by 2001: A Space Odyssey.
But the game haven't tested yet.It might have some bugs.
Anyway  hope you enjoy it.

entries.title: Onager
entries.description:
A simple "Tanks" clone (not enough time to make a "Worms" clone of it ;) )

"The ONAGER was a Roman siege engine that is a type
of catapult that uses a torsional force,... (wikipedia)

Use your LEFT and RIGHT cursor to move the "stopper" which will determine the angle at which the stone leaves the "arm" of the onager.

Press SPACE and hold to build up power, release SPACE to shoot the stone.

No time for sound + better gfx + more gameplay, have fun :)

Made by Larzan the unmotivated for LD#36, the lost one.

entries.title: Roswell
entries.description: in 1947,  Roswell, New Mexico, a mysterious shape appears in the sky

entries.title: Search for the Bygone
entries.description:
Search for the Bygone is an exploration game. The goal is to explore different ancient structures, and the mechanisms surrounding them. Art by @itsandrea

WASD to move
Space to jump
Left click to get a pointer to your next location


I ran out of time to fix bugs/optimize, so sorry if you come across any!

*New BUILD post-jam for Linux and Windows Low Spec PCs*
*Update 1*
--WebGl version is discontinued, for best experience use the Windows version--

entries.title: Sir Serell Saves The World
entries.description:
Hostile time travellers aliens have stolen some key human ancient artefacts. Sir Serell is called in order to get back those precious item and avoid a space-time disruption.
It's time to fight aliens, searching keys and retrieving lost ancients advanced technologic items?
Sir Serell saves the world is a top down shooter with a gameboy ancient technology look.
AWSD or ZQSD to shoot , arrows keys to move.
Oh yeah and you have to find keys to open the chests (that look like old fashioned tvs, don't ask why.)

Hopefully I'll find the time to fix a lot of things post comp.


FX have been generated with sfxr
BGM has been created with Beepbox.co the link to the source is on itch.io' game page.

I know door are terrible ^^' and I couldn't find a quick fix for the wall stuck problem. I'll have to figure something postcomp.


[EDIT]
I just added a few fixes

- Controls are now WASD to move and arrow to shoot
- Monsters have less health
- Uniformying the keyboard controls fixed the gamepad issue!
- Corrected a spall typo error on the ending screen

entries.title: Some Kind of Ancient Phone Technology
The Big Sweep
entries.description:
Here is a little platformer the four of us built on the weekend! We used Python (pygame) and Tiled. We tried to make a release without any dependencies, tell us if it works for you.

For the three of us, it's our third or second LD (and our third or second game ever!)

You need to clean you house of old appliances! You can do both level in whatever order from the main menu. Complete both to win!

Controls: 

WASD for movement
SpaceBar for jumping
Hold left mouse click to charge attack distance
Release left mouse to fire
M to mute

Version :

Windows : If one doesn't work, try the other.
OS/X : You need to have XQartz https://www.xquartz.org/ to run the game.
Linux : We don't have a version yet (working on it).

Music :

The music is from Visager.

http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Visager/

- Factory time
- Miniboss Fight

We did not have the time to create our own music. freemusicarchive.org is a cool site, check it out!

entries.title: Voyage
entries.description:
Inspired by Asteroids, we created our own twist taking into account the theme of this ludum dare, Ancient Technology.

Controls:
A or Left Arrow - Rotate Left
D or Right Arrow - Rotate Right
W or Up Arrow - Add Thrust
Space Bar - Fire Arrow

Survive for as long as possible and post your score in the comments!

Music from - https://musopen.org/music/1134/frederic-chopin/preludes-op-28/

Created under the company - Galactic Hounds

http://www.galactichounds.co.uk

entries.title: WinDoors
entries.description:
A kind of "old computer repairman" simulator. You are in your shop and customers come inside to ask your services.

They bring their old computers (Windows95, called WinDoors95 here) and other old stuff and machines (but I missed time ^^) and you find strange details in there.

The idea was to make a kind of "Papers, Please" experience.

I did this game with Python and Pygame and this is my first video game in life :)

Last thing : I had problems with resolution, I apologize for the bad quality of the images...

To launch the game : launch the "main.exe" file.
Made with Pygame and Python 3.4.

EDIT: it seems to bug when no sounds output is connected. Just put anything like headphones if you don't have any speaker.

entries.title: Alien Attack
entries.description:
This is a small game for DOS. It's a very simplistic space shooter and not particularly fun, but it was an interesting exercise to write. 

Written in C with the Allegro library and the DJGPP compiler. 

I haven't tested it on a real system, only in DOSBOX, but I will when I have a chance (and will make changes to make it run if it doesn't). 

The included cwsdpmi.exe file is required for the game to work on systems without a DPMI host (ie: DOSBOX).

entries.title: Bird Flapulator
entries.description:
You are a monster! Haha, just kidding.. sort of. You are a harpy living in the Amazon Rain Forest and the local tribe doesn't like you much. The chief of the tribe has decided that if you work for him for a week delivering packages, he will make you an official citizen of the tribe! But if you fail, the chief will use you as a sacrifice to the gods for the upcoming harvest. Oh noes!

Dodge and weave your way through the forest to deliver packages on time or else you're done for, bwak-ak!

=== IMPORTANT NOTE ===

This game technically runs (probably) but we ran out of time before finishing our polish phase. If you'd like to check back in a day or two, we should have a menu, proper endings, and the levels will be balanced.

This was a very ambitious project and if we had just one more day I think we'd have really made it. I'm still very happy with the results, but I want to "complete" this game, so look forward to it! <3

You must have Java 8 or higher to run this game. Just right-click and open/run with Java SE Platform Binary (or whatever it's called). Have fun and let me know what your highest score is! entries.title: Collided Worlds
entries.description:
Two ancient civilizations must battle against each other. World 1 has been opressed by World 2 for as long as the history books can tell. Exploitation of human resources is a natural occurence. The top students of the mandatory Bachelor's Absolute Judgement Scale (BAJS) taken at age 18 are all sent to the finest universities of World 2. It's considered a great honor to be selected, but it means World 1 see very little technological advancement.

Apart from the BAJS, World 1 farmers must turn over a large amount of their grain, crops and livestock to World 2, leading to famines and hatred.

Lately, nationalism has grown stronger than ever. Young ones have managed to find a way to fake the BAJS and are developing weapons on their own. Data and communication is available thanks to a huge underground network developed over several years. At long last, it looks like World 1 is going to be able to fight on par with World 2 and free themselved from the schackles of opression.

But where will it lead? At last they're at equal footing, but will the war lead to freedom or just mutual destruction?

The controls are:

Player one: WASD
Player two: Arrow keys

"Collided worlds is action packed. Its subtle political commentary really makes you wonder."
-Alla

entries.title: Echo Through the Aztec
entries.description:
After 72 hours of on and off work (most of which was done in the last few hours), we have finally finished our debut product: ECHO THROUGH THE AZTEC!

Originally we were looking at a Metroidvania style puzzle game with collectible tools. Each tool would be required for a section and they would all need to be used for the final level.

We didn't have as much time as we would'ave liked to make more levels or make more collectible items and mechanics but we're pretty proud of what we were able to do. For most of us, this was our first time participating in Ludum Dare and creating in our respective roles. 

We've all learned a lot from working together to create something of our own!

We hope you find ETA as fun as we do and we appreciate any constructive feedback :)!

misc --
Uses personal engine all written in D (check source code)
Map is randomly generated

entries.title: Nineveh
entries.description:
A Simulation of the Neolithic Revolution
=========================================

You can turn the speed up to max and sit back and watch various tribes attempt to settle down, learn agriculture and build city states.

Alternatively, you can take control of your own tribe, the Ammonites (Dressed in white) and see if you can overtake everyone else.

Tribes with lots of food will trade it to adjacent tribes that don't, shifting the balance of power between the two.

Once agriculture takes hold, things tend to get a life of their own...


Features
=========

 - Emergent social heirarchy (slaves and ruling elites)
 - Tribes will fight over fertile land, displacing one another
 - Trading of food and culture.
 - Foraging and agriculture.
 - Seasonal plant growth and survival conditions
 - Randomized world


Hints
======

Foraging: Fruit is randomly distributed across the map at the start. During warmer seasons, fruit will regrow in forests.

Farming: Your tribe can learn this by spending time on Plains. Plains and Steppe both produce food from agriculture, but plains produce more.

Trading: Happens automatically, just keep your tribe adjacent to one another to ensure and food and culture will move freely.

Housing: Spend long enough in one place, and your tribe will build houses, improving their survival chances.

entries.title: Pyramid_Watchdog
entries.description:
POST game jam updates
The big links on the bottom are the original 72 hour LD ones, if you want to try the LATEST then download this:
Windows - goo.gl/XVIXFQ

Protect your pyramid from the greedy thieves. Control all the equipment in your Smart Home™ to guide both the attackers and your loyal (and hungry) pet alien. If they reach the throne room on the top, you lose.

The game is made for Oculus Rift CV1 but can be played with mouse and keyboard (for this, download the Windows version).

INSTRUCTIONS
http://imgur.com/Ix8DcuV (same as the 2nd image)
If you kill all the enemies, the next round will start with 2 more of them. The alien's lives are shown above him as numbers, if he dies, the whole game restarts. The interactable rooms' numbers: the yellow shows the active time, the blue shows the inactive (you have to wait that much until you can use again).

CONTROLS
Rift: 
Move - headtracker
Interact -  A on the controller or SPACE

PC:
Movement - ASDW
Movement speed - Q & E
Zoom - mouse wheel
Interact - LMB

Unfortunately we didn't have a dedicated programmer, so one of our brave artist took it upon himself. Also the wildly appearing T-poses are features.

Béla Szabó - Blueprints, Character art, animation
Ákos Halász - Environment art
Borsika Arday - Character concepts, texturing

We made all of the assets in the project.

If the LudumDare.exe doesn't work, go into LudumDare/Binaries/Win64 and use LudumDare-Win64-Shipping.exe.

!!! We got lots of comments about the issues with the gameplay and that it's pretty unplayable. This was absolutely true, so we put out a few more switchable doors. It is less likely now that you bump into a situation where you can't influence the events at all. We hope that this can be considered as bugfix, but if not please contact us and we will put out the old version. !!!

POST game jam updates
This is the LATEST version with modified gameplay:
Windows - goo.gl/XVIXFQ

Game jam links:

links.label: Windows latest - Post Game Jam (use the above ones for critique)
Oculus Rift latest - Post Game Jam (use the above ones for critique)

entries.title: Steam Heart
entries.description:
So the theme was Ancient Technology, so I went with Steampunk-ish setting. I planned to have more stuff in, but alas time is short and I wanted to make a polished game instead of cramming loads of stuff in. It's basically the first stage from a long lost Mega Drive game.

My tribute to Treasure's lovely run-n-guns.

I highly recommend playing the windows version as the game isn't well optimized for flash as it was intended to run on a window exe format.

CONTROLS!: READ THIS!
(You can edit the controls in the options menu to some alternatives)
Arrows: Move 
Shift: Jump 
Control: Shoot 
\: Change Weapon 
Space: Dash (you can also dash by pressing down and fire) (Dashing makes you invincible Dash through enemies, bosses and bullets!) 
Press F2 will hard reset the game :)

You can change the controls to different types in the options menu.
Just to note, as this is a more relax jam, I did cheekily take the sound effects from Dynamite Headdy and Gunstar Heroes for the extra authentic feel :D 

Hope you enjoy!
TIME FOR SLEEP!

entries.title: The Ancient Shaman
entries.description:
Hi, this is my first Jam, it has been a great experience, I'm happy just being able to do "something".

I tried to make an "educational" game that would help you to learn binary.

All of you already know binary so it should be easy for you to beat :)

My lack of gfx skills is a mayor problem for this category, but I like the idea of improving on that in the future.

I'm not done yet as I'll try to extend the tutorial a bit more and is possible I would like to add some kind of "enemies" that difficult your movements...

This time sound is totally out off scope :-(

*HOW TO PLAY*
You must "activate" the power sources that at a the up of the screen, for that you must:
- Arrive to their position.
- Click on them.
- Select a symbol.

There is an "invisible" link between the sources and the connector, there are different types of connectors that modify/combine sources in a new  symbol.

You must match the bottom of the screen symbol with the one on the connector in the middle of the screen.


Thanks for your time,
Unai.
