Right: glide right
Space: launch catapult (hold)
Enter: Works as a "continue" on various parts of the game

Unfortunately, this game is quite unfinished. If you perfect the launch, you can reach the moon (and stand on it). Hit the bamboo springs on the ground to give yourself a boost. The money is useless.

The game is quite big (in file size) and takes a few seconds to start up.

The reason I didn't get as much done as I hoped is that I spent too much time not developing the game...getting distracted, and my new GTX 970 came in the post heheh..

The game works for Windows 64bit, and probably works for 32bit. I outputted a jar for mac and linux aswell, but they're unlikely to work at all.

Timelapse of this project: https://youtu.be/84yQKdlE5rA
-> Made with ChronoLapse and ffmpeg

entries.title: Wilderness Survival
entries.description:
In wilderness survival, you are a caveman defending his campsite from wild creatures and other humans. Not only do you have to worry about staying alive, you also have to focus on protecting your supplies from being stolen. To accomplish this task, you will use various weapons. You start out with throwing rocks, but you can get a spear or bow and arrow from enemies. Try and protect yourself and your camp and last the full time.

Controls:
Movement - Arrow Keys/WASD
Weapon - Space
Pause - Escape

entries.title: Wing Warrior
entries.description:
Fight in a stadium to the death! Includes human-powered bombers! Requires skill.
IMPORTANT NOTE: It's rather hard to play at first. You will miss content if you don't dedicate a good chunk of time. Sword fighting isn't the only content, there's flying too!

Controls:
Arrow keys to move.
Z to attack.
X to fire an orb (you must have ammo)
Space bar to jump
More instructions can be found inside the game.

Objectives:
Get 1000 points and don't die to win!

Versions:
The Kongregate version has leaderboards available if you have an account (completed the integration within the time limit)!
Use the Direct Link otherwise (or register an account)

entries.title: ALBI: The First Great AI Computer
entries.description:
(This is my first time entering the dare and I'm excited about it.)

"ALBI: The First Great AI Computer" is an html/javascript game with original ascii art and word puzzles. The game is not 100% complete by the dare deadline but will be expanded upon after the competition ends. However, There is an ending and it is accessible if you can find it. The art and flavor is pretty well there too.

(update: Thanks for feedback. I cleaned the game up a bit. keeping with the spirit of the Ludum Dare, I did not add new features or anything:
-fixed the Chrome text issue
-made the whole screen black and green to make it easier on the eyes.
- Added a mute button for sound
- Took the ending text out of an alert box to remove an unnecessary popup.
- The Clicky spots are much larger now )

Please provide feedback if you can. Positive or critical is welcome.

entries.title: Ancient Boom
entries.description:
Ancient Boom! Throw explosive rocks and torches to keep the bad guys away from your NPC Jared!

Not only will your rocks and torches kill any bad guys it hits, the flame created by the explosion will also kill any which touch it! Torches have an especially large flame for a large area of impact.

NOTE: Game doesn't load? Try refreshing. It happens.

Desktop build coming in a bit.

Instructions:

WASD or arrow keys to move. Click to shoot. Protect yourself and your NPC.

Web performance is much better in Chrome due to Firefox not running canvas well.

entries.title: Ark: The Untold Story
entries.description:
What is the Ark of the Covenant? Why is it so powerful? Is it the ultimate weapon? Duh! It's aliens!

Whew! My first Ludum Dare. What an enjoyable and tough experience! I learned a lot from this one especially project and scope management. This game is just bare-bones, just a single stage (tutorial), no audio or special effects. But I'm happy about it since its my first LD. Looking forward already to the next one!

entries.title: False Promise
entries.description:
GamePad is Highly Advised (X to attack (X360 pad))! (you can skip intro cutscene with space or escape)


 edit 1 :

Small Update  0.1 : 
Fixed Reversed control
Improved Health System (now have a health regen and you can see Hp)
Improved Attack animation speed and movement animation speed to be a bit more dynamic
when you die the level restart
You can now skip intro cutscene with space or espace :)

edit 2 :

small update 0.2 : 
added some hit sound and put a music on the level
fixed many collision bug
added a "boss" at the end of the level (even if the level never end)
added more light to the level :)

Big update (that will be poster as no jam) will came later , most of the team is taking pause because they're tired like hell, I'm trying to do my best to fix critical bug ^^

___

Our hero is blasted into the past by a strange anomaly that occur into the cold fusion core he was working on.
During the incident, John Kevin got touch by the energy of a paradox, causing random jump in time.
His only option: Go forward and try to understand this time problem.
Will you bring back John Kevin at his present ?

John Kevin is a surface tech,
Working for the Global Corp Industry.
As his father , and the father of his father before him,
And then since the oldest ages.

Like every morning, John Kevin went to work,
Present at 4am, ready to clean his sector.

The Cold Fusion powerplant of Global corp 
is an Huge instalation which ask permanent maintenance.
The inert particle result from this fusion are numerous and dirty, 
with an unbearable smell !
Each days is his dog life John Kevin Work Hard.
His imitation of his walkman hooked to his waist bag, 
he begin his day on a sound of Transmission - John Deley and the 41 players

entries.title: Flamethrowing Dynamite Wizards on Ice
entries.description: "Flamethrowing," largely because it's the first spell taught at the academy. "Dynamite" because flamethrowing doesn't always quite cut it. Donning ice skates, these wizards explore the caves and gather up crystals. Since the legends say "the one" who gathers all the crystals, and not "the team," cooperation is infrequently the norm.

entries.title: Headspike
entries.description:
A thousand years ago, a mysterious engineer lived hidden underneath the great mountains of Völgrad. Strange machines bustled restlessly through the tunnels, to serve their master and huge Treasures were piled in his hall.
Those golden times are long gone and the masters hideout is abandoned. But it is told, that one single machine is still active, maintaining the dungeons deadly traps, and not a single piece of gold has been looted.

Heroes are on the approach. Build traps and hide in the secret passages, before the hero is there. If a hero sees you or reaches the dungeons end, you lose. Those filthy heroes will destroy your traps every now and then, so watch out for that.

Controlls:
WASD - Move
Mouse - Look
Left MouseButton - look on the ground and open the building menu to build traps

entries.title: Invent the Wheel
entries.description:
Ancient technology – it almost can’t get any more ancient than the wheel! 
In our game you invent (or reinvent?) the wheel. It’s very simple: Draw the wheel and see it roll down an ancient greek pathway. If it reaches its destination or not is up to you – the rounder and better your wheel is the faster it goes down the path.

Controls: use the right mouse button or finger (on touch devices) to draw the wheel .

There's a highscore where you see how well you did against other players. Also, there's a WORLD RECORD which you can compare your own score.

We wanted to make a multiplayer-mode too, but unfortunately we didn't have enough time. Please let us know via comments or personal messages if you'd appreciate a multiplayer-mode, and we will implement it when LD36 is over.

Team: 
Stefan Laubenberger: lead developer, scripting, level design, brains
Lucien Ryter: idea, highscore, multiplayer (coming soon if possible), scripting
Dominik Castelberg: GUI, graphics, level design, scripting
Gianluca Scarciolla: music, sfx, textures, animations, scripting

And now, WHEEL ON!

UPDATE - We released the version 0.9, which fixes/includes:

1) Overdrawing - You only have a limited area in which you can draw.
2) No more timer - You have an infinite amount of time to draw your wheel.
3) Updated controls - You now draw with RMB, which appeared to be easier during our testing.
4) White flag - You can now abort your run and retry.

entries.title: Long Story Short
entries.description:
Well, I have no idea why I picked this name for the game, but anyways, let me present my second LD game. This time I've tried to put more effort in art and UX, and I think this entry outperforms last one. Yay, +100XP.

I've used all the same tools as in last compo: 
- Visual Studio + Resharper 
- Bridge.NET + Bridge.Pixi + Pixi.js 
- Art: http://www.piskelapp.com/ 
- Music: http://online.boscaceoil.net/ 
- Deployment: Microsoft Azure + ASP.NET Core
(Core is actually new one in this list and it's freaking awesome!)

P.S: This time no iFrame D: Please, proceed to Web link.

entries.title: Nothing is Silent
entries.description:
Nothing is silent, not even the clouds.

Controls: WASD, mouse
music from incompetech.com

entries.title: Obsolete
entries.description:
Update: Fixed loading issue. Fixed ability menu since it was completely broken. Now it's just a little broken.

"Obsolete" by Stellar Door Games
Adam Silcott (@adsilcott) - Programming / UI
Greg Lord (@gplord) - Music / Writing / Models
Melanie Judd (www.instagram.com/inkystache) - Artwork / Logo

Abandoned amidst the junk of a yard sale box, the lonely GameBox is feeling unwanted… and old.  Ancient, even.  And as he sits there, he wonders if there’s any place left for him and the games he loved to play.

Until a smug kid, and his even more unbearable mePhone come along, and make matters worse.  You were already feeling pretty low, but this insult was the last straw.

You won’t be discarded.  You won’t be forgotten.  You’re the GameBox.  A classic.  A survivor!

And if you have to take on the modern world by force… so be it.  You’re only a few upgrades shy of being a modern day device.  And there are plenty of other devices in this yard sale to take them from...

Swearing revenge against the mePhone that wronged you… you set out into the cul-de-sac, destined for revenge, and to prove that you might be ancient…

…but you’re far from Obsolete.

-----------------------

HOW TO PLAY

Explore the cul-de-sac, challenging each of the other Devices to a battle of both strength and wits, wearing them down until you can defeat them and take their precious accessories!

Each accessory makes you both stronger and more durable, until at last you can defeat the mePhone that wronged you.

Attack:   Regular damage attack
Talk:     A battle of insults and persuasion, and the strongest way to defeat your enemies! (But also the trickiest!)
Ability:   Use accessories you've taken from previous Devices!
Run:      Run!

Can you defeat all five bosses?

entries.title: PteraRide
entries.description:
Requires: VR headset and XboxOne controller

Fly around in VR on a pteradactyl, all while the sky is full of other birds that want to take you down. Fortunately you have a trust spear that you can throw at all the creatures coming at you.

Demo video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xm4pQ8NoQ_w

entries.title: Quasi-Ra
entries.description:
How did the Egyptians build the pyramids? Aliens, of course. Be one of them in this physics-based puzzle-ish game.

Made in Construct 2 and relies heavily on it's built in physics engine.

entries.title: Run From The Storm
entries.description:
My 2nd time participating in Ludum Dare!

I wasn't able to spend as many hours on this as I hoped, but I am pretty satisfied with what I got done.

The level is procedurally generated infinitely, so once you are past some red cubes you have seen everything the game has to offer.

Control:
Arrow Keys to move
Space to jump and to move to red cubes

entries.title: StarGate
entries.description:
Something I throwed together for this jam. Didn't really become a game since it has no goal.
Dial the gate and you can go true.
My brother helped me a little with the textures.

Move
WASD

Use /DailGate
Muose Left
or
E


Sry for only having windows version. Forgot to download OSX and Linux export when I installed Unity last time.

entries.title: Sumolems
entries.description:
Somewhere deep in China, a certain group of individuals uses lost arts to bring life to magical constructs of incredible might. Their goal? Sumo wrestling, of course!

Sumolems is a turn-based two-player puzzle game. The objective is to drop Power Stones, remove them and rotate the board in order to align lines of 3 stones or more and push the opponent off the screen.

Controls: Mouse only.

Basics:
- One line gives 1000 points.
- Completing multiple lines in one move gives a combo bonus. 2 lines is x1.5, 3 lines is x2, and so forth.
- "Denying" a line to the opponent gives them 750 points with no combo multiplier.
- Score decreases by 1% (?) per second during a player's turn.
- A player wins if their score goes 10 000 points over their opponent's.
- Therefore, to win, one must prioritize line combos while denying the opponent from doing the same.

Uploading this from my phone as my PC gave out earlier today. This is the latest build fetched from Windows Safe Mode and should be fully functional, all that was left to do was to draw/add characters and possibly a story mode, and fine-tune the AI. Hopefully everything works fine. Will verify and update with other platforms and any required hotfix as soon as I can.

entries.title: Super Slayers
entries.description:
Tools Used:

Gamemaker:Studio
Paint.Net
BFXR
BOSCA CEOIL






I really hope that you like it as much as I do.

entries.title: The Adventures of HMS Kingdom Brunel
entries.description:
Hello!

As you might expect, this game is a fraction of what I wanted to complete in the time, but I'm putting it up any way!

When it comes to technology, I'd wager there are only a few, if any, engineers who were as innovative than Isambard Kingdom Brunel.

Who also had very good taste in hats.

After building countless things on earth, it seems only reasonable that this English civil engineer would cast his sights to the stars. And what better way to accomplish it than in a coal powered spaceship flying through the heavens armed with iron canons. Totally sensible.

You must maintain the ship as well as you can by addressing any issues that crop up.

Oh, and don't forget about the petunias. 



Controls
========
Arrow Keys - to move!
Space Bar - to use (face an object and hold down space bar to 'use' it)


Tools Used
=========
GameMaker
Photoshop


Twitter: @Hi_ImTemmy

entries.title: The Ancient Cave
entries.description:
You woke up in a Cave. Find the way out by solving the ancient riddles.

Controls : 
Move - Arrow keys
Jump - Space
Interact - Z
Fullscreen - F4

About the game :
- Only 3 levels

About me :
My first Ludum Dare, and I really wanted to do the comp for my first time. Unfortunately, I had no time for the art/sound(novice for both) and the levels I wanted to show. Moreover, I have never used GameMaker physics before (still wanted to add lights, heh).
But it's fine, we learn from mistakes, and I learned a lot. I'll be here at the next Ludum Dare with a better game this time!

entries.title: Trapped in Egypt
entries.description:
Horus and Seth are busy fighting that they didn't realise they're in an area covered by traps.

Winning : Collect the coin or kill the opponent
Losing : Die

Controls: 
- Player 1 : WASD
- Player 2 : Arrow buttons

Team:
- Asyzruffz
- Sol
- Raiex
- Ec-chah

Disclaimer: Audio are not done by us.

entries.title: underpromote
entries.description:
Underpromote is(would have been) a game played with a standard chess set but single player, or potentially asymetric multiplayer.

You play as the white piece and each move you change which kind of piece you are, you see upcoming pieces in a little preview like tetris. Or it would be if I'd finished, at the moment it's just pawn>rook>knight>bishop>queen>king>repeat.

You get points for taking pieces and clearing boards.

===

Anyway I suffered a pretty wicked allergic reaction yesterday and this game lacks AI + a couple of other features so this is an unfinished game uploaded for prosperity's sake. Voting is turned off.

also shout out to @clintbellanger for the sweet chess set
http://opengameart.org/content/chess-set-for-gbjam

entries.title: Videos, Please
entries.description:
Have you ever wanted to play "Papers, Please!" without the papers and with 100% more video rentals? If so, this is the game for you! You are tasked with renting a video from Bloc-buster that will satisfy your whole family. 

Game for Android and PC

Art by Corinne Groble
Coding, music, and sounds by Brian Peters
All art and music were made during the jam.
Made with GameMaker, Spritesomething, and Cakewalk SONAR
Features some music player code we wrote a little bit ago, and the Tweenline Engine for GameMaker.

Apologies to Lucas Pope.

entries.title: Walking Fire
entries.description:
Down, down the rabbit hole. Find the hidden portal to move on. Don't let the fire beat the mighty wheel! You. Will. Never. Escape!

You can only move left and right. There is no ending, the game loops on itself. Hence, the never escape part.

entries.title: Water pump madness (with bombs)
entries.description:
In this game you control a character who has a water pump. When you place the water pump, a drill will descend below ground level. If it hits a water pocket, you gain 500 points and the pump will start pumping water. The pumped water is spit in a fountain-like manner. Collecting a water drip gives you 10 points.

Jumping on an other player stuns it for 2 seconds.
Making contact with an explosion stuns you for 4 seconds and sends you flying.
Being hit by a lightning bolt stuns you for 5 seconds.

NOTE: Play in 16:9 resolution only

To control your character;
P1, xbox 360 controller, or
-left and right arrow keys to move
-up to jump
-down to place your water pump
-right ctrl to throw bombs (if you have any)

p2, xbox 360 controller, or
-a and d to move
-w to jump
-s to place your water pump
-left ctrl to throw bombs (if you have any)

Sorry for the following;

No start up screen to set up the amount of players, so it's fixed to 2.
Too tired to finish end game logic, just pretend it's there when the clapping starts :D
Too tired to jerk around with the input manager, so 2 players only

entries.title: Zhopa Truda (Le Mythe de Sisyphe)
entries.description:
Sentimental story about overcoming.

How to Play: Spacebar!

Ministry of truth decided to destroy all evidence of historic objects.

You are the one to do the job.

Controls: arrow keys ZX, space
or WASD QE

Use ZX for God's sake! It makes plane control that much easier!

entries.title: Anciennce
entries.description:
In this game you desing a base and then watch it defend itself from enemies.
firs select the "house" button, build up the base, hit start and watch the game run out of memory :( (if you're good at it).

Credits:
    MatousFiala
    GLProgrammer

    music:
        Suonatore di Liuto Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

Now for a bit of post-mortem:
    So... After my first (real) Ludum dare, I feel that We have overexended ourselves, but also learned a lot in that. There were many problems (Not having learned GitHub good enough, general lack of time), which lead for this game to feel kinda of buggy and unpolished, but  I don't really feel ashamed of it, but it's not great either. Thanks for any feedback, se you all in December -MatousFiala

entries.title: Ancient Blocks
entries.description:
Ancient Blocks is a simple arcade puzzle game where the goal is to shepherd colored Energy globs into the correct gate.

The Energy is part of some mysterious Machine of unknown origin. They emanate from the center and drift aimlessly until they arrive at an Energy Gate. Place Blocks, Repellers, and Attracters on the Machine to keep it from shutting down!

Controls:
Left Mouse: Place Blocks, Repellers, or Attracters
Right Mouse: Remove select Blocks, Repellers, or Attracters

1: Switch to Blocks
2: Switch to Repellers
3: Switch to Attracters

Space: Clear the Machine
Esc: Leave the Machine
P: Pause the Machine

User Interface:
Top Left: The Energy Level of the Machine (score)
Top Right: The Structural Integrity of the Machine (lives)
Bottom Left: Currently selected action; click to switch between Blocks, Repellers, and Attracters
Bottom Right: Button to clear the Machine

entries.title: Ancient Vs Technology
entries.description:
Robot Technology takes vengeance against Ancient Roman towns people for fun.

-WASD to move-Space to build tower-E or Click to use power up
-Stay on tower to build
-Kill as many Ancients with  you Technology as you can

There are two power ups: a dash and a explosion shield. 

Art: Nicholas Wise
Sound: Kevin Minehart
Programming: Andrew Hackmann

entries.title: Ancient Weapon
entries.description:
Pilot an ancient Atlantis weapon, capable of untold devastation, built for a war unknown. Of course, it'll be more effective when you figure out how the darn thing works.

Troubleshooting: Press the refresh button if WASD/Q doesn't work. I suggest playing full screen as well.

Controls:
 * WASD to move.
 * Q to change weapon energy
 * Click on world to shoot
 * Click on schematics to alter the ancient Atlantian crystal circuitry.

Schematics:
 * There are 2 schematics: Regenerative Shielding and Phasers.
 * Alter the logic to get special bonuses, such as: Charging shields when taking damage, use shields to power your phasers, build up phaser reserves and unleash the true power of Atlantis.

======

List of logic gates:
* Default/"XORISH": If the input energies are different, the output is the remaining color. If the input energies are the same, the output is that color.
* RGB NAND: If the input energies are not the same, returns the color of this gate. Otherwise, returns something else.
* RBG OR: If either input is the color of this gate, returns that color. Otherwise, returns something else.

======

List of schematic effects (these are the nodes usually on the right with 1 input):
 * Top Shield - Gain 1/8th charge if energy input matches energy from damage type
 * Middle Shield - If the energy to this node matches heat, regenerate health and recharge shield
 * Bottom Shield - Gain 1/8th charge if energy input matches energy from damage strength

 * Charge Phaser - Based on color, either: increases charge gauge, fires a normal short, or uses some charge to fire multiple stronger shots.
 * Shield Phaser - Diverts power to shields, allowing quick charging at the cost of heat.
 * SHUT OFF - If trigger, phasers will not fire. Must adjust energy input (either changing logic or changing conditions) if your phasers stop working.



============

Feeling great for getting it done, but I'm gonna do a personal post mortem below.

It's not a well polished or cleanly designed as the last time I did this (LD 34). I'd say the biggest part of that is I went pretty big scope this time with both a shoot 'em up mechanic and a puzzle mechanic smashed into one. I also almost forgot music and sounds, which were started about 3 hours ago and completed 1 hour ago. A few small things slipped by because, even though I had a spare hour to tweak and clean things up, I just forgot about them. The lose screen is also really crammed in, but I like how the intro turned out, as far as I can like such a tutorial-heavy tutorial.

entries.title: Catapult Simulator VR
entries.description:
A physics based catapult arcade game in VR. 


Playable only on SteamVR with tracked controllers!

Controls:

("Grab" means pull and hold the controller trigger)

- Grab the bottom of the catapult basket and pull down to arm. It has to be below 10 degrees when you let go to lock.
- Grab a rock from the stack.
- Turn the small wheel on the side of the catapult frame to adjust power.   Clockwise = more/add power, counterclockwise = less/subtract power.
- Turn the larger freestanding wheel to change the firing angle left or right.
- Pull the lever towards you and down to fire the catapult.

The targets award points based on where you hit them, from 50 - 1000 points.
Check your score on the white billboard to the right of your platform.

Restart the game with the big red button.

Close the game using the SteamVR Overlay.

entries.title: Clock Chaos
entries.description:
This Action-RPG game will make you wander through a steampunk-like world that you devastated not so long ago.
In order to survive, you will have to find some artefacts that will increase your beloved rifle !
Beware of the robots that await your death...


Hey guys, thanks for coming to this page, we hope you will enjoy our little game, despite some content that had to be cut since we were in such a rush.
The game might take a bit long to start so dont worry about it and physics is kind of approximative ingame.

Used :

- SFML / C++
- PhotoShop
- Audacity

Audio audioDesigner = "Nadir Arbia";
Graphics graphicsDesigner = "Gnoumagbée Camara";
Programming mainProgrammer = "Alexandre Du lorier";

entries.title: Deadly Decay
entries.description:
GameJolt Version: http://gamejolt.com/games/deadly-decay/184857
-- If you could rate after you play it would be appreciated 

NOTE: I advise you play in 1280x720 Windowed as I haven't setup the GUI Scaling all that well , its still playable but some text will be hard to read :/

Story
==============
Earth has been ravaged by a powerful and deadly disease that not only has eradicated most of mankind but also has the undead rising.Earth was in a state of total anarchy.

Soon after the total fallout of earth people began trying to fix the situation with research and trying to find a 'Cure' however there was no luck...

After searching endlessly you came across a ruin with a strong beam of light with ancient monsters pouring out... This could be promising.
==============
Features:
-Randomly Generated Rooms / Layout
-2 Monsters (Wanted to add more didn't have time)
-Multiple endings
==============
Controls:
WASD - Movement
R - Reload
E - Interact (You will be prompted for this most of the time)
==============
Music (Not Produced by me)
-Credits To be added

Art (Produced by me using GraphicsGale)
Programming / Gameplay (Done by me /w Unity)

entries.title: Firefly Effect
entries.description:
A VR game about observing fireflies.

An Oculus or OpenVR-compatible headset is required to play.

Created in LD36 Jam by @HybridEidolon and @autumnrtaylor.

entries.title: Fisher King

You are a king.

A poignant social commentary on Renaissance-era aristocracy.

My wife's review: "This took 2 days? You should have just stayed home with the baby."

entries.title: Grave Robert
entries.description:
<---Desc--->

Grave Robert is a simple platformer - shooting game where you play as Robert, a grave robber. Your mission is to uncover the mysteries in the tomb and use the artifacts you find to keep going on the search of the final treasure.

<--Idea-->

The project was concived as a metroidvania where you have to obtain some ancient technology items through a egyptian pyramid dungeon to beat the game. In the end it's a little platforming - shooting game with some puzzle mechanics and a dark mine dungeon esthetic.

This is my second 48h game jam, my second game with GM and my first time in LD, hope to be able to be in the next ones!

entries.title: Icarus
entries.description:
NOTE: WebGL messed with this game A LOT. If you can, download the game instead if playing the web version.

This is a horizontal shooter with a twist: you can only go up by flying into windy areas, but if you fly too high, your wings will melt!

Controls:
A = slow down
D = speed up
S = descend faster
Left mouse button = hold to charge the bow, release to shoot

Modes:
Campaign - fight your way tough a predetermined wave of enemies and make it to the end. You can also turn on "Nightmare mode", which removes health drops, reduces invincibility duration and increases sun damage.
Challenges - A few scenarios for which you have to come up with a solution.
Survival - Kill as many enemies as you can and set a new high score.

entries.title: In service to the gods
entries.description:
Created in QB 7.1 (playable in DosBox), a super short simple text adventure set in ancient times. LOOK at your surroundings to get some interesting details and pick up certain objects.

Move around by typing n, s, w, e for north, south, east, and west (you will be given available directions at each "room")

if you get stuck or something isn't working, be sure you have looked in all the places.

Still stuck? Keep LOOKing.

entries.title: KoYo

KoYo
jump your way through spikes and such

entries.title: My Cat Ate My Floppy Drive
entries.description: A text adventure game about the trials and tribulations of the 1980's, student paperwork, and fire alarms.

entries.title: Pony Express
entries.description:
Before computers, before phones, before the telegraph...people used to leave marks on sheets of wood-pulp and pass them around to their friends. Then they found the gold. 

A courageous, enterprising few took it upon themselves to brave the dangerous, wide swaths of land between towns in across early America. 

They called themselves the Pony Express, and you...are one of their horses.

===

You win by delivering all packages on the map to their destinations.
You lose by running out of health.

Each path between towns has a duration and a treachery rating (indicated by the hourglass and stars respectively). The longer the duration and the higher the treachery rating, the more likely it is that something bad happens to you.

Also, your jockey is invisible because we didn't have time. Also, it probably is inaccurate to call him a jockey but I mean. You're a horse. How are you supposed to know what the right word is.

NOTE: If, for some reason, you're having issues with game state, or if we push a bugfix and your version is out of date, visit https://makerslocal.github.io/LudumDare36/clear and it'll generate a totally blank game for you. Or you could just lose. Up to you. :P (Technically winning also counts.)

NOTE'S NOTE: If you want it fullscreen on Android, add it to your Home screen and go into landscape.

entries.title: Primal Survival
entries.description:
You are a primal man, gathering food for your tribe

What would you do when you encounter a beast?

entries.title: SubSahara
entries.description:
SubSahara is an adventure puzzle game about a diver trapped in mysterious ruins of an ancient Egyptian temple, sunken long ago in the underwater caves of the Congo. To escape, he must unlock the secrets of Set, the god of storms and unravel the history of his life and death. 

Left Click to rotate the circles left. Right click to rotate them right. Hold shift to click and drag pieces in and out of the locks. Align the correct pieces and escape before your oxygen tank depletes.

entries.title: Tank You: Going Ballista
entries.description:
TANK YOU: GOING BALLISTA is a deathmatch game for two to four players on a single screen.

It requires gamepads and controllers.

It's explosive good fun.

I think that wraps it up nicely.

Like a bow.

An ancient bow utilized as a siege weapon to detonate castle barricades.

On skates.

With thorny bits.

entries.title: The forgotten day
entries.description:
- Move with A,W,S,D
- Hold LEFT MOUSE to fire!
- Press SPACE to call your friends
- You can select one robot to be the leader with RIGHT CLICK
----------------------
So... you are a tiny robot lost on a dead ancient civilization.
You've to survive.
Try to destroy the red spawns and collect the drops (fires).

HINT: The green symbol on the base is for random upgrades, it's very useful at the begining

SPOILER NOTE: If you don't know what to do, it's simple:
-Try to collect items and doing some upgrades or buying some robots at the left base (your base).
-Start exploring the map in order to find some enemy spawns, you have to defeat the enemy's hordes in order to have the spwan's drops (a fire), then carry it to your base.
-Collect 5 fires and beat the game :)
----------------------
Thank you for playing :) I've enjoyed doing this little game.
If you beat the game, notice it to me!!
Also, notice me the bugs.

GIF: https://twitter.com/Shallow_indie/status/770630033471832064/photo/1

Made by Motasashy (Oscar Pimentel) for Ludum Dare 36.
Special thanks to @zminusone sound for the music www.zminusone.com

** V02 CHANGELOG**
-added hit's color
-Some bugs fixed
-Now the game is easiest
-The 5 difficulty is not longer almost impossible

entries.title: The Machine
entries.description:
A machine from several billion years ago is talking to you, and needs your help.

Technical notes:
- This game was created with pixi.js framework and haxe programming language.
- While the game is playable "as is". The story nor the gameplay are finished. There is room for a lot of improvements and additions that go beyond this LDJAM.
- There is no sound.

I hope you will like it!

entries.title: The Operator
entries.description:
You are a telephone operator. Your job is to connect people's calls.

The old switchboards have jacks at the bottom panel that you can plug into the top panel to connect two people.

You will be notified of callers on the right hand side.
Connect two jacks of the same column in the bottom panel to the matching female jacks at the top panel.
People are impatient, though, so be quick.

entries.title: Vitruvian Man Goes To Heaven
entries.description:
Use the "A" and "F" keys on your keyboard. Or, tap the buttons if you are playing on a mobile device.

Help Vitruvian Man get to heaven using some of Da Vinci's inventions: the catapult, parachute, flight wings, tank, and helicopter. While you're at it, give Michelangelo a paint brush so he can complete painting the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel.

- I did not finish on time for compo.
- This game works on mobile phones and tablets :)

entries.title: Water Flows
entries.description:
Use the tiles to create the irrigation canals from the Nile to the pyramids.

Tiles selected can not be placed in a occupied slot.

Try to not overflow the canal; Don't let the water hit a blocked path.


*bugs are expected, please leave your feedback*

-----
MOUSE LEFT BUTTON - Select and place the tiles;
MOUSE RIGHT BUTTON - Cancel the tile selection.

entries.title: Anachronism
entries.description:
--Synopsis--
A chill, very unfinished walking sim about an alien who visits Earth long after the human population has died out. This was my first entry into Ludum Dare with the theme Ancient Technology and unfortunately it didn't go all that well. Its unfinished primarily because I just lost interest in the idea near the last day. But honestly letting go of ideas, especially when they aren't inspiring you feels a bit liberating so I guess everything turned out quite well.

--Controls--
Movement: WASD

Run: Hold Shift while moving

Quit Qame: Alt + Tab and quit application on task bar

entries.title: Any Person's Planet

entries.title: ARCHAEA TERATA
entries.description:
Archaea Terata / Ancient Monsters

WASD - Move
Left Mouse Button - Shoot
Right Mouse Button - Blink
E - Recall

Does the controls sound familiar? The original intention here was to design an experience around Overwatch's Tracer abilities. The game was meant to be level-based with puzzles to solve and timed obstacles to overcome, however I had to abandon those ambitions due to time constraints. So as it is, the Recall ability is pretty much useless.

Enjoy! :)

entries.title: Candle Dungeons
entries.description:
Note : The image above was a screenshot taken when I was developing the game in the last few hours. The game and screenshot may have minor differences. 
 
Candle Dungeons is a game where you explore treasure Dungeons with your trusty candle. You have 15 seconds with each wick, collect Yellow Coal cubes to extend you light time. How much time of light you have left is displayed next to the player. Each coal provides 15 more seconds of light. Use the arrow keys to move , Space to jump, and ENTER key to open doors. Doors could only be used once. Also this game is in need of a post combo update which I will do tomorrow. Right now this game has only one level, and no Menu screen, no enemies. But don't worry, I'll include those in the update tomorrow. So drop by again tomorrow to see whats new.

If you have a idea for improvement ( besides for what is in the update ) or found a bug, please let me know in the comments. Thank you !

entries.title: Chariot Race
entries.description:
Race in your chariot and win over your enemies with some technical tricks built into your vehicle.

You earn money at the end of each round, depending on your place, to buy upgrades for you chariot.

There are currently 3 tracks which get randomly selected.

entries.title: MummyDrop
entries.description:
-----
IMPORTANT NOTE: The web version of this game has been tested for Chrome and Firefox, but there were some minor issues, including a weird positioning issue with how HTML5 handles physics (if mummies aren't sliding down smooth slopes, this is the reason). If you have any of these issues, please download the Windows binary for the smoothest experience!
----- 

MummyDrop: The Great Sarcophagus Sorter!

MummyDrop is a physics arcade game that requires quick reflexes and planning. Your objective is to sort the different colored sarcophagi into the correct tombs by creating a path for them to drop through using a series of levers.

Controls:
Click on the canes to toggle their direction
Click/Right Click and drag to pan camera (also works with WASD or Arrow keys)
Mousewheel to zoom in/out (middle mouse resets zoom)
Space bar toggles ALL canes simultaneously (only for the brave!)

Features:
- Mummies!
- 5 levels with increasing difficulty!
- In-game instructions!
- A questionable take on Egyptian history!

Additional Controls:
F2 - Small screen mode 
F4 - Close game (Windows version)
M - Toggle optional mumbley sound effects

MummyDrop was made by Evan Good for LD 36: "Ancient Technology". This is my fifth LD entry. Ancient Technology seemed like a pretty wide-open theme, but as I'm sure many people did, I immediately started thinking about Ancient Egypt and wanted to dream up some fantasy machinery for that era. As for the game type, I had a memory of a similar "peg" game that I built out of wooden dowels and ping pong balls with my brother when I was young. From Plinko to Peggle, I've always liked those sorts of games, so I decided to fit a new one into the theme!.. In as silly of a way as I could come up with.

MummyDrop was developed using the following tools/resources:
GameMaker Studio Pro 1.4 (with HTML5 export)
BFXR sound generator
Audacity audio editor
MSPaint (for that professional touch)

No pre-existing art, code, or assets were used.

Game features no Egyptian-based puns. They're b'Neith me.

Thanks for playing and congrats to all the other entries!

Declared Post-Dare Bugfixes:
8-28-16- Had to redeploy all versions due to a potentially game-freezing bug when beating a level.

entries.title: Mummys Day Massacre
entries.description:
Synopsis:
2-4 bumbling archaeologists have stumbled into the wrong tomb and angered its sleeping inhabitants. It's been a long 4000 years and Mummy's cranky. Worse yet, it's Mummys Day and nobody thought to bring a Mummys Day Card!

Gameplay Instructions:
Interact with the sarcophagi to loot them for coins. Use the coloured switches on the ground to open/close doors. Raid the tomb and make it out alive. Trap your friends with the unstoppable mummy to get away with your plunder. Whoever makes it out with the most in two minutes is the winner!

entries.title: No Excavation Needed
entries.description:
A game about finding things in the sand, or archaeology, or 3D platforming. Short but sweet. Play as the enthusiastic Dr Turquoise in a quest for the highest button... If you have one, play with gamepad!

Edit: Added Mac and Linux versions (untested)

Edit 2: My best time is 68.52 seconds! (To get close you need to cheat on the last button, while it folds)

entries.title: Okarina
entries.description:
Update 2: Working on port the experience to Android and Cardboard VR. But my android could't run VR technology, so maybe could be broken.
--------------
Update 1: Couldn't port it to WebGL because of the microphone. I will try to port it to smarthphones.
--------------

Okarina is a game music lab experiment. In this game you have to play a instrument (a Ocarina, perhaps?) or whistle notes. If you will use an instrument, it's better if it is tuned in C.

You need to use your music ability in this game to help your mom in some tasks, in a beautiful (and free) minimalist scenario.

Or if you're not patient enough to hit the right notes, just press Space on each puzzle. :P

This game lab was developed by myself, @stigmawall.

Survive waves of enemies and get a tan.

Archaeologist Sarah Richards was on an expedition when she discovered an ancient Mayan ruin. She entered the tomb looking for treasure, but soon discovered that the ruin is actually a giant machine filled with traps. entries.title: Video Telefaxer 570X
entries.description:
NOTE: This game opens external links in your browser. If you're playing the web version, these pop-ups may get blocked. Check to make sure they're not being blocked!

I would advise the download version if you can :)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

You are the lucky guy at the office who gets to use the amazing VIDEO TELEFAXER 570X! It's like 2 Fax Machines in one! And a VCR. And a washing machine. And...

Your job is to send as many faxes as you can. Keep completing orders before they run out of time! Click on the orders to open the instruction manuals, and go to the given page to find out what to do.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

This game was designed to see if it was possible to make a game based on real life instruction manuals for real life appliances.

Yes that's right the instructions manuals used in this game are actual manuals from actual machines. I hope that isn't considered breaking the rules. I don't actually include them in the game, only link to websites where you already find them. And they're not really the game, just the way of telling you how to play the game.

There's more to this fax machine than faxing. If you get through a few orders you'll see there's some other stuff going on. I would have loved to include loads more appliance types and loads more manuals and loads more instructions, but alas this is the way of the game jam. I think I got enough in though for a quick bit of fun :)

Assets used
-----------
Fonts:
http://www.1001fonts.com/digital-7-font.html
http://www.hipsthetic.com/alien-encounters-free-80s-font-family/

Sounds:
http://soundbible.com/851-Fax-Machine.html
http://soundbible.com/1070-Dial-Tone.html

entries.title: Antikythera Mechanism

I participated together with my friend. 
And we didn't quite like the theme, so we just decided to do something derpy with it.
After some googling we found the 'Antikythera Mechanism' which seems to be an ancient computer.
No one knows what its function was.

Enjoy the game :)

entries.title: Burning light
entries.description:
=== DISCLAIMER =======================================

This game is broken beyond repair. This build is what I was able to savage from that horrible mess. (but this may be me, the developer, looking at the game could be but isn't... ¯\_(ツ)_/¯)

=== ABOUT ============================================

On a distant land, an explorer found a set of mystical lenses. Any ray of light that passes through it gets perfectly focused into a single direction, sometimes seemingly defying physics. Also, any ray that passes through it becomes able to light flammable materials.

On that same land, the explorer found some small shrines that resembles torches and perhaps could be lit...

== CONTROLS ==========================================

There are 3 suggested control schemes, but they are active at the same time.

Gamepad scheme (using XBox 360 terms):

move around: Left stick/D-pad
Cycle through the available lens' angles: shoulder buttons
Jump: A
Hold lens: B
Put away lens: B
Put lens into holder: B
Take lens from holder: B

Keyboard (I):

move around: A/D
Cycle through the available lens' angles: Q/E
Jump: W/space
Hold lens: Left ctrl
Put away lens: Left ctrl
Put lens into holder: Left ctrl
Take lens from holder: Left ctrl


Keyboard (II):

move around: left/right arrow keys
Cycle through the available lens' angles: X/B
Jump: up arrow
Hold lens: C
Put away lens: C
Put lens into holder: C
Take lens from holder: C


There's a single action button that is context sensitive. (that's why the same button is repeated over and over)

** Gamepad usage is highly recommended **

[EDIT 2016/08/30]
=== TOOLS/TECH =======================================

* Language: C
* Libs:
  - SDL 2.0.3 (input, window and audio handling)
  - libGFraMe 2.1.0 (framework, handles time step, loading assets, rendering pipelight - i.e., sort sprites when needed and render'em through OpenGL/SDL2 -, remappable inputs etc)
  - libCSynth 1.2.0 (synthesizes audio from a text file; wasn't used D:)
* Tools:
  - VIM
  - GIMP
  - Tiled
  - Chronolapse
  - Open Broadcaster Software

entries.title: Caveman Invasion
entries.description:
Cavemen are coming to invade! Shoot them down with your brand spanking new rock shooter! They can only be knocked over by the same color rock! Shoot ammo crates to get more ammo! Gain points by knocking them over. Lose points by hitting the wrong color caveman!

entries.title: Chariot Racing Manager 44 BC

entries.title: City of Ancient Events

This game was entirely made in front of a live audience of well around 8-15 people sometimes it was just me , was lonely... jokes aside. This is my first Ever Ludum Dare game.  The entire process of making this game (except of 3-4 small assets made in paint)was done while livestreaming.

The game is a "Deckbuilding Turnbased Citybuilder" in which you try to make your city flourish as best as possible with the cards given to you. Since it is hard to explain it may be best to try it out to understand what i mean. 

In Order to play the game from source you have to start it from the scene "permastuff". If you do not do it this way certain things will not work.

entries.title: Prometheus

A long, *long* time ago, our ancestors lived in a dark era full of terrors, hiding from dangers everywhere. One hominid is about to change that.

entries.title: Proxima

entries.title: Pyrimos

Some bugs and what not, but pleased with where I got it to go.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rDfCemN_hq0

entries.title: SOITES (Unfinished)
entries.description:
You have to defeat the alien race SOITES with only your sword and magic abilities. Sneak your way around them or kill them - the choice is yours.

That's what the description would have looked like if I had finished the game. The game itself was too complex so I could not create the main systems and enough content in the time limit (as well as add sounde effects etc.). That's why what you see in the (way too dark) video (https://youtu.be/VzlqPsERht8) is all there really is in the game at this point. Also, I concentrated too much on polishing little things which in the end resulted in less content.

However, I'll definitely keep working on the game!

Controls:
Movement: WASD
Jump: Space
Crouch: C
Attack: Mouse 1
Warp: Press and hold Mouse 2

NOTE: Download it with the download button in the top right of the Google Drive page

Credits: Music: "Epic Orchestra Loop" by joshuaempyre at freesound.org - http://freesound.org/people/joshuaempyre/sounds/250856/

entries.title: Tape Memories
entries.description:
This game is a tribute. A tribute to the technology and the wit. A tribute to the best ancient technology of the world...of all time. A tribute to MacGyver, to 80s and music. 

In short....what do you get if you use a pen and a cassette? Exactly, a huge amount of nostalgia :)

Hope you like it!

Design: Maria Fernandez and Jose Moreno
Artist: Maria Fernandez
Code: Jose Moreno

entries.title: The Lost Portal Gun
entries.description: My first submission, due to real life events I had to leave for most of the weekend, and thus only had about a total of 15 hours to work on this. I was going for a platformer- exploration type feel. Overall I learned a bunch this event, and am eagerly looking forward to the next one!

entries.title: The Museum
entries.description:
It's your first day at the museum and your boss is sick. Someone needs to handle those tours - guess you'll have to improvise!

Note: there are 6 exhibits in total and for each tour it picks 4 at random, so if you want to see all of them you'll need to do multiple tours.

entries.title: The Pyramid
entries.description:
Enter the pyramid at your own risk to compete with your fellow explorers for the ultimate prize. Help the other players fight off the ancient traps in the pyramid then betray then once you no longer need them so you can claim the ultimate reward for yourself. 

MULTIPLAYER ONLY. Requires a server and at least 2 clients to play. Works best with 3+ people. External chat (preferably voice) is highly recommended/necessary to play.

I appreciate that, being multiplayer, it's unlikely to get many plays (hence I created it in the unrated LD) but it would be awesome if a few people could try - let me know on the irc pighead10 or twitter @pighead10 if you have any issues getting this working. 

Instructions for playing and setting up the game are inside the client download in the menu screen.

KNOWN ISSUES:
-Starting client before server (or entering wrong ip, etc...) results in undefined behaviour.
-Random crashes in client from time to time. Heap corruption or something. Hopefully I'll fix these at some point.
-Placing a health chest in a room sometimes doesn't appear.
-Issues with game generation means sometimes a client will never load.
-Issues with game generation means sometimes someone will find the treasure without much effort or the game will be unbeatable. These are less likely to happen with 3+ players.

entries.title: The Time Traveler's Cat
entries.description:
"The Time Traveler’s cat”

Are you sure that time travel is imposible?

Genre: text adventure/ interactive book.

Description:
You will enjoy an exciting dangerous journey through time along with Alexander and his pet cat.
An Ancient technology, a well- known personalities, a mystery.
Change the course of human history, but be careful - the time is not forgiving!
It's all on you!

Features:
- plot of fascinating
- visual style
- themed mini-games
- humor
- age restriction: 6+

entries.title: Tower up
entries.description:
Multiplayer platformer game [require controlers]

Players earn points by reaching the top of the screen and lose them by falling down.
Use your attacks and availables bonus to disturb your opponents while climbing as fast as possible.

entries.title: Amelia Deerhart and the Elemental Temple
entries.description:
Aviatrix and adventurer Amelia Deerhart is in search of glory and fortune.  But when the lost temple of Auctor fails to produce any treasure, her hired treasure hunteres tired her up and left her behind.  Help guide Amelia free from her plight and maybe, just maybe, find the hidden idol of Auctor as well.

Classic point-n-click adventure game.  Left-click to interact.  Right-click to examine.

Note: The general interface graphics and Amelia sprites were taken from another project of mine.  All other graphics are new to this entry.

Extra Note: You're not going deaf.  I didn't have time to incorporate any sound or music in the game.

entries.title: Ancient Starship
entries.description:
You and your ship are far from home, in a primitive and hostile planet.
Recover the five Ankh's Crystals to return to your planet.

entries.title: AncientBlobSurvival
entries.description:
My first Ludum dare and also my first game jam thing.

Goal: Slay as many evil red blobs as you can before they kill you!

Instructions:

Left click to shoot the bow.
Hold left click on blocks to destroy them.
Place spike traps by clicking the button at left, then clicking somewhere near your player.


Tools used: Unity 5.4, Blender, Krita, ChipTone
Time-lapse: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Monm9Ups8v4

entries.title: Ancients Home
entries.description:
***The main feature was broken and all text was unreadable so I have created a fixed version***

A puzzle game where you go to the home of your ancestor.

You can write notes that are shared between others players.

Broken old version https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B5j70jka51uTNjJVemZXRi1aWWM .


------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Controls:

WASD - Move
Space - Jump
Left Control - Crouch
E - Interact
R - Zoom
F - Write a note
X - Flashlight
Escape - Exit

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entries.title: Aqueducts of Solomon
entries.description:
For instructions on how to play, visit:   http://barkingdoginteractive.com/aqueducts

Can you match the wisdom of Solomon and bring the life-giving waters to the desert?  In "The Aqueducts of Solomon", you build ancient aqueducts and roads, temples and villages, quarries and fields, to strengthen your empire.  How well can you do?

In this solitaire high-score-chasing strategy game, you play cards to build special hexes on a hex map, and then use the special abilities of the hexes to increase your capability.  You have ten turns to get the highest score you can.

The game was written from scratch in Canvas/HTML5 with no third party frameworks.  All art was created for the compo.

entries.title: Boobytrap Egypt
entries.description: A game made in about 4 hours. I didn't have much time to Program, because I was occupied most of the weekend, but I decided to throw out here anyway. It was supposed to be a kind of labyrinth like game, where you had to collect some stuff and avoid boobytraps(the ancient technology) to clear a level and progress. It doesn't yet have an obtainable goal, also the lag of animations makes it look pretty dead, but it was fun to experiment with.

entries.title: Brocco VS Lee
entries.description:
Brocco and his brother Lee ate broccoli for lunch. But they were radioactives! Now Lee is out of control. Brocco needs to command the village to save the world!

Use the ingame tutorial to learn how to play.

I could not try the OS/X build nor the Linux build. Windows build preferred.

entries.title: Centurion Defend My Castle
entries.description:
The Commander has called you and demands you to control the castle defences and repel all incoming enemies.

Instruccions:
- Move mouse to aim and left click to shoot an arrow.
- Press 1, 2 or 3 to change between Scorpios.
- Press Q or Mouse Click to use the hot oil power for the enemies near the walls.

I recommend playing the WebGL version, it will load on Kongregate if your browser is different from Firefox.

entries.title: Crystal Exploits
entries.description:
Dev Notice:
Was busy this weekend and finish most of core mechanics, but not much level design & modeling. Only three levels :(

Timelapse:
https://youtu.be/MJwxWaAJ-gY

Game:
Objective is to get to the door at end of level to progress through next level.

Controls:
Hold Right Click and move mouse to rotate camera.
WASD to move.
Press R to reset current level.
Go to pedestal and left mouse click to get crystal.
Place on other pedestals to see results.

Tools:
Built in Linux :P with vim plugins.
Blender for 3D modeling (just player model though..)

Sorry for the lack luster game, first real game jam with little time, but had lots of fun.

Bug:
You may lose your cursor on the end screen (if its hidden while loading new scene), simply alt-f4/terminate app >_<

entries.title: Death to the future!
entries.description:
It's the year 2253, and the zombie apocalypse finally happened! sadly they're only armed with ancient technology, but are you gonna let that stop you from wiping out humanity? No you're not! You're gonna command the undead and conquer the planet! 
 
Select your unit type with 1 through 5 on the keyboard, then Place units by clicking on a tile, right click to remove.
When done placing your units click the play button to see if your army can finish the job! And don't worry if they can't, just press the stop button to and place some new, more competent zombies to do the job!

Can you beat the hardest difficulty with only one unit? No, of course not! But how many do you really need, to beat those squishy future people?

entries.title: Excavation Manager
entries.description:
So, first version of the Excavation Manager. 

To play the web version, just do so above.
To play the desktop version, just execute the Jar-File with Java and there you go.

You have to place camps in the desert to get people to run around, and send these people to various other camps so they do stuff. Try out the prospectors camp, so they start looking at the ground very hard, or try a dig site once the prospectors have been very happy about a certain spot.
And finally, use the research tents in order to figure out amazing qualities of these ancient artifacts. Because if you don't, your employer will be very unhappy!

If the game is too small, just resize it. 

(and if you fail too hard, press F3 or F4. Ahem. Note that F3 cannot be disabled in the web version.).

entries.title: IguanaDons
entries.description:
Join the most epic adventure of all times and help IguanaDons to fulfill his destiny! Explore the dungeon, avoid deadly traps and retrieve the One Great Artifact that will determine the fate of an entire race!
Choose your path wisely and plan a few steps forward. No mistakes will be forgiven.
#LDJAM

entries.title: Isaac's Descent
entries.description:
There is a temple.  Cave.  Dungeon.  You know.  Whatever.

At its depths, a hidden treasure of immeasurable value.  Isaac, the great newt wizard, wishes to purloin this treasure.  But between Isaac and their prize lie all manner of ancient traps, or at least as many as I could cobble together in 48 hours.

Can Isaac make it through these dangerous chambers?  I sure hope so!  I playtested at least, like, once.

Made on the PICO-8, though with a little vim usage early on.  Enjoy!

entries.title: Ištēn
entries.description:
Ištēn: "First"

You are a scribe - an acolyte of the First Information Age. Writing, the most important of ancient technologies, is new to your region, and even to your city. Will you help propel your fellows to greatness through your remarkable accounting prowess, or will you doom your kingdom to low profit margins and economic stagnation?

entries.title: Jurassic Survival
entries.description:
CONTROLS:

Q - spear

W - bow once you unlock it

E - axe when near a tree to collect wood

[space] when at workbench to open upgrade menu

HOW TO WIN:

collect wood from trees and experience (XP) from killing dinosaurs to upgrade and unlock new tools and weapons at the workbench. once all items are unlocked collect 150 experience and buy the last item to win the game

TIPS:

after hitting a raptor walk back and prepare to attack again, hitting it will stun it but only for a small time, being back will allow you time to hit it again. keep backing up after each hit to ensure the raptor will not get to you

t-rexs can not get into your cave

entries.title: Knocker-Upper
entries.description:
​Britain, August 1924
Alarm clocks are not yet available in Britain​'s industrial neighbourhoods.

Your job as a Knocker-Upper - or if you prefer, human alarm clock - is to wake up industrial workers to prevent them from arriving late at the factory.

CONTROLS: 
Using your mouse, shoot peas at workers' windows using your pea shooter.

Left click: Shoot peas
Right click: Speed up cart
Scroll wheel: Zoom

Made in 48 hours for Ludum Dare 36
By Neonable (http://www.neonable.com)

entries.title: Light Mirror
entries.description:
Hey, I made a broken game with a more broken language. You have to place Mirrors so the light gets to the finish.
It's very easy and sadly was unable to add more difficulty to it because I made some bad design choices in the beginning. That said, hopefully the 20 seconds you play it will be somewhat good.

To start the game load the index.html in your browser.
Enjoy LD36!

entries.title: MistIslands
entries.description:
MistIslands is a boardgame-style RPG, you play as an adventurer to re-seal the old god creeping in these islands. 

Faced with a number of events, manage your resource, use your cards to overcome situations. Once you failed your mission, your legacy will be sent to your grandchildren and the destiny will be passed within your bloodline.

entries.title: No Man's Fire
entries.description:
You wake up one morning (or one afternoon) with all the village panicking... What's happening ? Is the fire extinct ?? How is this possible ??

It's an adventure game about bringing back an ancient technology : the fire. It seems that the citizen of this world doesn't know how to make a fire, they've been exchanging fire for centuries and watching it 24/7.

I've done it myself but used content available in Mixamo Anim Pack and StartContent from UE4. And some assets found on TurboSquid and CGTrader.

entries.title: Replicator
entries.description:
Try to communicate with an ancient, forgotten replicator to find your way out of a cave.

The game was made solo in Construct 2. Control the character with your ARROW KEYS and SPACE, klick on the blinking orange light to start typing in words.

entries.title: Space attack
entries.description:
Here is my little top down space shooter game. This game is related to the theme by is old school gameplay mechanics. Take note that this game is not in fullscreen.

Control:
W or Up arrow: Move up
S or Down arrow: Move down
A or Left arrow: Move left
D or Rightarrow: Move right
Space bar: Shoot

You need to kill 250 enemies before the last boss appear. Take note that the more you kill ennemies, more the difficulty will increase. For the boss fight, be ready !!! If you have suggestion or comments don't hesitate. Have fun !

Musics credits:
http://eliteferrex.newgrounds.com/audio/
http://eliteferrex.bandcamp.com/

links.label: Open AL (If game crash at start)

entries.title: Star Seeker
entries.description:
the Sun should wake our cattle
the Sun should bathe our vines
the Sun should rise upon us.

But it didn't.

Destiny is a threacherous companion,
and it trapped us here, in time
in that night.

Destiny said
tonight, we end
and it's eternal.

But maybe...
There is
light.

==================================



In this game you control a ship in a sunless world. Throught many generations, you will create your own guidance with the stars to reach the light.



CONTROLS:

WASD - Movement

Mouse Left Button - Select the stars and connect them



==================================



Credits:



Matheus Mortatti (@MatheusMortatti) - Code and Art;

Pedro Stringhini (@PHString) - Code;

Otavio Miranda - Code;

Leonardo Villani - Code and Music/SFX;

João Baraldi - Art


==================================

Notes: 
->The game has balancing issues (it's pretty hard). With your feedback/sugestions we hope to fix those problems!
->We are noticing some bugs, but we either don't have time or have a windows pc to fix it with Game Maker. But in the weekend we'll be updating the game!

entries.title: The Ancient Artefact of Amusement
entries.description:
(A controller is needed to play for now, sorry)

One day, while you were playing with the newest 60fps, 1080p AAA released, you felt bored. And as you walk outside to take breath of fresh air you stumble upon a stick, a wooden stick.
An ancient way to have fun they said, if you can use the power of imagination.
So you take the stick the stick with you and go inside your secret base, hidden far away in your garden and who knows, maybe you get back that power.

Go in the this strange temple and find use for your stick. By collecting words you might be able to attach those words to your stick to make it a better stick !

No endings for now so just explore and try stuff, but i'm probably gonna keep on working on this later. I really wanna add a lot of stuff to that game. It's my first Jam using GM so i was a bit lost at first and it's a bit clunky on some parts.


Left Stick to move
A - Jump/Accept
X - Use the stick
D-Pad to change what the stick does
Start open the menu in which you can add "words" to the stick

entries.title: Unmapped
entries.description:
Travel the land and mark the landmarks in your map.
WebGL version in the making

WASD to walk
M to toggle map
Left click to place landmark
Right click to swap landmark
X to end the game

Sorry no sound this time

entries.title: Ancient Heist
entries.description:
Move. Steal. Escape.

Credits:

Game Design - Level Design - Art & Animation
Rodolfo Flores

Programming
Richard Da Cruz - Germán Cruz

Song name
Hamatan - Ragnarok Online

entries.title: Antique Battle
entries.description:
Go through different ages of the past and beat the enemies you'll find in the way. #LDJAM

A/D= Left/Right

Space= Jump

Ctrl= Bend

Left Click= Atack
This game is based on having fun beating all the enemies and try to keep your life safe.

Enjoy it.

entries.title: aRCANE
entries.description:
___________________     _____    _______  ___________

Checking out an ibm pc with some old stuff, found a folder called "aRCANE". 

Its contents (which you can now access through html5) seem to be some sort of drone controlling software. 

Ive tried to trace the signal from my computer and it goes straight to the atmosphere so it might be sending some stuff to some place.

Graphics are advanced for its time on some part of the galaxy (made with an ancient/godlike tool call Aseprite).

Sound effects are lo-fi for amazing enjoyness (generated by the ol´ Labchirp).

And that´s all I have to say about this.

Use ARROW KEYS to move the DRONE & Z, X, C to access his functions.

M to mute the bastard (music was made with an old software called Figure for iOS).

F to Fullscreen/Full experience/Destroyer of eyes and ears.

Notes from the engine (a really old crappy software called C2)

entries.title: Bud.E
entries.description:
At first I wasn't gonna' make this but then I made this :) There should be a video breaking dev down in a couple of days

If you wanna' chat tweet me @TheTomTalks

entries.title: Cerise Music Ride
entries.description:
I've been telling my daughter for months I would create a game with her drawing, and never could take time to do it.

For my first LD participation I saw it a perfect time to prototype something.
And Leo joined me for the music and sounds.

Here we are, 20mn before the Jam's end, actually posting our musical game..
Help the sorcess grab the keys within the rythm to discover the entire music !

------------------------
Tools:

Corona SDK + Cherry (https://github.com/chrisdugne/cherry)
Gimp, Logic Pro X

Music by VelvetCoffee (https://soundcloud.com/velvetcoffee)

entries.title: Contraband Crate
entries.description:
CONTRABAND CRATE- A game by programmer WolfkingW and artist Teledoor24

Artifacts and technology from various historical civilizations are flooding the black market, and it's your job to make sure these items are packed and shipped off to your shady customers as fast as possible!

INSTRUCTIONS:
Rotate, move, and rearrange to cram historical objects into each crate as you race against the clock! Packing in more items gives you a higher time bonus. When you're ready to send out a shipment, drag the crate lid on top of the crate.


CONTROLS:
Pick Up: Left Mouse
Rotate: A/D or Left/Right Arrow Keys or Right Mouse


Comment with a picture of your high score to secure your place on the leaderboards!

LEADERBOARD:
1. 7:00 (HuvaaKoodia)
2. 6:36 (Teledoor24)
3. 3:40 (WolfkingW)
4. 3:25 (Senor Salty)
5. 3:07 (BMacIntosh)
6. 2:24 (DaleP)

entries.title: Fan Boy
entries.description:
*A CONTROLLER IS REQUIRED TO FAN THIS MAN*

Fan the man, boy. Keep his lard rolls uncooked by the sun's rays and untouched by the filthy feet of the encroaching Fly Army from the deep south.

With your ever reliable and accurate RIGHT and LEFT STICKS shake that fan like it's all you know. SHADE the hot spots to beat the heat. FAN the flies to shoo them into oblivion.

entries.title: FRIDAY  NIGHT  DEATH  ARCHAEOLOGY  !!!
entries.description:
F R I D A Y
N I  G  H T
D E  A  T H
ARCHAEOLOGY

the concept behind this game is a wario-ware style minigame compilation, with the unifying theme of an archaeologist trying to figure out how ancient people lived and used technology.

you're going to need a keyboard and a mouse.

entries.title: KMF
entries.description:
Four people and a sound-guy. Ludum Dare 36.  Go fishing.  Chill out.

Fishing is an ancient technology.

Fishing is the activity of catching fish. It is an ancient practice dating back at least 40,000 years. Since the 16th century fishing vessels have been able to cross oceans in pursuit of fish and since the 19th century it has been possible to use larger vessels and in some cases process the fish on board. Fish are normally caught in the wild. Techniques for catching fish include hand gathering, spearing, netting, angling and trapping.

The term fishing may be applied to catching other aquatic animals such as shellfish, cephalopods, crustaceans, and echinoderms. The term is not usually applied to catching aquatic mammals, such as whales, where the term whaling is more appropriate, or to farmed fish. In addition to providing food, modern fishing is also a recreational sport.

According to FAO statistics, the total number of fishermen and fish farmers is estimated to be 38 million. Fisheries and aquaculture provide direct and indirect employment to over 500 million people.[1] In 2005, the worldwide per capita consumption of fish captured from wild fisheries was 14.4 kilograms, with an additional 7.4 kilograms harvested from fish farms.[2]

entries.title: LightBringer
entries.description:
LightBringer is a 2D puzzle platformer where you must light up fire beacons.

Controls : 

Left / Right arrow : Move
Space  : Jump
E : Grab Torch/Light beacons
A : Drop Torch
left ctrl : Invoke Torch (must have tokens)
left shift : Look where the torch is
______________________________________________
Release edit : I've fixed a Bug where pain was undoable (and so player was unable to finish the game).

entries.title: PowderKeg
entries.description:
Controls:
arrows/wasd: move
9/1: spark
0/2: pick up or put down keg
f: fullscreen
r: restart
esc: quit

What to do:
Place barrels near rocks to blow 'm up so you can collect the gold. First to 15,000 wins!

entries.title: Pyramid Builder
entries.description:
Use given resources to build a pyramid!. Look how your village is growing with build progress. 

Not all functionality are ready yet, whats more gameplay is still mostly "theoretical" ;), but have fun guys!

entries.title: Pyramid Scheme
entries.description:
As a royal trapmaster you have been given the duty to protect the pharaoh's treasure with sporadically functioning boulder traps. Show the incoming grave robbers the fate of those who would defile the pyramid!

Use WASD and spacebar to move the camera around, right-click to spawn boulders that roll into the direction of the rotating arrow and R to reset the game.

entries.title: Remedy Of All
entries.description:
Remedy of All is a game where you make mixtures to heal incoming patients. 


-- Controls --

R restarts the game. ESC returns to menu. Mouse for rest of it. 



-- Instructions On Patients--

- For each patient find their illness by searching for symptoms in the book.

- After finding the illness apply one of the known cures to patient to heal them. If the treatment is correct you'll gain reputation.

- Some of the mixtures are dangerous and can kill a patient if used when unnecessery. You'll be also wasting the item If you use it on wrong patients. If you kill a patient you'll lose reputation.

- If you are not sure about the sickness or don't have any of the cures you can send patients to temple for praying. This way you'll lose much less reputation compared to killing a patient.

- When you fill the reputation bar your fame will grow and you'll get new items. Game will end when you hit 10 fame.



-- Instructions on Alchemy --

- Look at the recipe of mixture you want in the book. Add items in given order and given times.

- You have to count yourself.

- If you can cook successfuly, you'll get 1-3 items based on your time correctness.


Game is done in Unity. This was a huge learning experience for me. (Espically about ScriptableObjects) And compared to my old ludum games this one is actually a standalone complete game. Well almost. Add some cutscenes and you're there. 

My Experience Post: http://ludumdare.com/compo/2016/09/03/remedy-of-all-experience-post/

-- Credits --

Programming: Mantlair ( https://mantlair.itch.io/ )
Graphics: Rouzuberii ( http://rouzuberii.deviantart.com/ )
Music: Carlospazuzu ( https://twitter.com/carlospazuzu )
Text/Idea Help: Corupta/XeciX
Old Looking Font: http://www.dafont.com/roman-sd.font

entries.title: Scuba Steve
entries.description:
DISCLAIMER
=========
Unfortunately, we were not really able to finish this. We were a little more limited on time this LD and were too ambitious. So know that It's not yet possible to win the game.


Story
====
You find yourself in a strange space. You discover a magical ancient alien weapon near you, and now you must fight your way out of this terrifying place you find yourself in. 

Controls
======
WASD for movement
Left Click for single shot
Right Click for multi shot


Will try to get other builds up later!

entries.title: SOS Snake
entries.description:
You are trapped in a cave conveniently shaped like videogame levels. Don't worry, an old and familiar entity is here to help you.

SOS Snake is a dynamic platformer mixed with a good old Snake to create a new hardcore action-puzzle game ! You can play it locally with a friend, or all by yourself if you want a good challenge.

Controls : 
* Arrow keys to move
* WASD/ZQSD to move Snake
* R for Restart
* M for Mute

by Gdcvdqpl & Pyrofoux
Musics by RoccoW

entries.title: Stoneheart
entries.description: Simple block pushing puzzle game, going with an temple technology theme

entries.title: The Cube
entries.description: There's a strange cube on the ground and a button next to it. I wonder what it is?

entries.title: The Legacy of the Pharao
entries.description:
Story:
The Pharao Ignatz Lichtbringer was building a huge pyramid before he suddenly died.
His legacy is to finish the pyramid. Unfortunately he wasn't popular.
Back as a mummy he has to enlighten the chambers under the pyramid using sunlight and mirrors.

Controls:
- Arrow keys to move
- Space for mirrors
- Backspace for level-restart
- Escape for exit

Hey that's our first LD. We hope you'll enjoy playing. Unfortunately we didn't include any sounds (no time).
We would appreciate to get any feedback.

Fixed:
- Collision with character and lightrays on movement.
- Mirror placing on grid

Have fun
Lukas Goclik,
Alex Nieddu.

entries.title: The Museum of Time
entries.description:
The Museum of Time. Journey through the museum to discover all the ancient technologies that are now obsolete and discover the truth behind the museum...

WASD / ARROW KEYS and Jump to move
Gamepad Supported

Largely a narrative game with simple puzzles so please play with loud audio or headphones on. 

Museum voice 1 by @nixxor982

Please leave feedback or tweet me if you want @Xopsx

Thank you for playing!

entries.title: Time Traveller Training
entries.description:
Training ground for time travellers.

WASD to move, aim with mouse and left click to shoot.
1-3 number keys to select a weapon once you have it unlocked.

Credits:
Jani Ylinen - 3D modeling

entries.title: Timely Delivery
entries.description:
You play a pigeon post that can travel back in time. Your goal is to deliver all the scrolls to their respective mailboxes as fast as you can.

Programming/Art/Music by Frank Brizuela - @aumniez

Controls:
AD to move
Space to Jump
W to pick up or drop scrolls
E to rewind time
S to fast fall

README:
This is a time trial-type game where you're against the clock. It is easy to beat the level but it may be hard to try to beat the Dev time (my time!). For those hungry to go faster, here are some quick tips:
-Fast fall is pretty good
-Rewinding freezes time
-Throwing the scroll is better than bringing it by foot and throwing the scroll depends on your current momentum
-Rewinding reverses the momentum you had
-Often, it is not about pulling off some crazy frame-perfect tricks but simply to look at the level and try to find a clever way to use the rewind mechanism to go through the level in the shortest path possible.

entries.title: Transport Tycoon [Moddable]

Play this game to find other such wonders.
Yes it does supports mods, be it just simple ones.

Hope this game brought a smile to your face but crushed it instantly when lost because it's a hard tycoon not an unfair one (Hopefully :) ).

PS: Maximum revenue is calculated as the sum of the people that want to go there and the people are generated with random amounts of money and destinations at random intervals between 0.125h - 1h in game time so it may not be balanced.

The source code in in the Zip file.

entries.title: Headsets Of Yore

In this interactive documentary we will look a typical challenge faced by an early VR adopter in 2016.

Can you help Steven to complete his VR game without his wife divorcing him?



Controls:
