entries.title: Retro Player
entries.description:
=======
Intro
=======

What's this? Why's everything in monochrome? Why is everything so blocky and pixelated?

It's time to pay a small homage to the ancient technology of yesteryear! Back  to good ol'-fashioned 8-bit graphics and SFX!

=======
How To Play
=======

- Drag the player indicator around the screen, and the character will move towards it.
- Drag the crosshair to aim where the character is firing.
- Tap on the powerups at the bottom to use them when they are fully charged!
- Stay alive for as long as possible!

=======
Notes
=======

- Kill 30 of any enemy to charge up the Bomb Powerup!
- Clear the screen from enemies and threats with a single tap!

- Kill 7 slimes to charge up the Speed Powerup!
- You move at twice the speed for 20 seconds!

- Kill 10 constructs to charge up the Shot Powerup!
- Double your firing rate for 20 seconds!

- Kill 12 mushrooms to  charge up the Health Powerup!
- Heal 1 health! Can't go above 5.

- Skeletons drop free powerups when killed!

- This game is mobile-friendly!

=========
Post-Jam Updates
=========

If you want to play the updated version, click on the post-jam link below!

1.1
- Music changed to 8-bit. Finally!
- 3 bosses added! (Technically one with three forms)
  * An extra layer on the Ancient Technology theme: Golems!
  * Kill 30 enemies to spawn a golem to fight!
  * Defeating the golem increases the enemy spawning rate by a small amount.

1.2
- Tapping on the character now stops her in place to allow emergency stops or to realign your indicator
- Golem's 'Paper' form improved
  * Open palm now moves towards your crosshairs to intercept your shots

==========

And a special thank you to those who have played this game and given their support!

==========

entries.title: The Marvelous Mrs. Marble
entries.description:
The Magnificent Marble Machine presents: The Marvelous Mrs. Marble & The Maleficent Magnetic Monsters! A tale of adventure and greed!

Unfortunately the Maleficent Magnetic Monsters are making a movie and won't be making an entrance. This leaves Mrs. Marble plenty of pellets for her palate.

Programming and photographs of wood textures by Andreas Renberg (@IQAndreas).
Featuring the voice of Kully Panesar (@kully_panesar).

This was my first time both participating in Ludum Dare, and my first time working in Unity.

entries.title: The Mummy's Boom
entries.description:
This must be YOUR LUCKY DAY because you just picked up the hottest new Electronic Handheld Experience, The Mummy's Boom!™ Can you help the Mummy™ recover it's lost Talismans™ from all TEN LEVELS the Tomb of Doom™?

Here's the Scoop:

Mummy's Boom is a puzzle game. Place bombs to break blocks and find the talisman in each level.

CONTROLS:
LEFT / RIGHT - WALK
UP - JUMP
SPACE - DROP and KICK BOMBS
R- Restart Level

TIPS:
- PRESS SPACE to Place a Bomb at your feet.
- To KICK a BOMB, Release SPACE while you're still touching it
- TO PLACE a BOMB, Hold SPACE until you have walked away, then release.

KNOWN BROKENNESS:

- You may occasionally get stuck in tight corridors.. Just press R to Reset the level
- The bombs bounce in a somewhat insane way in some areas but there is a science to this madness
- I have encountered a couple of spots where the mummy seems to die for no apparent reason, if this happens, let me know!
- You sometimes get a little stuck in the floor after taking damage, just jump to escape.
- THE SCORE SYSTEM is basically pointless, I will fix this at a later date.

THINGS I WILL ADD EVENTUALLY:

- BGM of some sort
- Fixed Scoring
- More levels
- Tweak controls
- Prettier opening sequence
- Better and more excessive dumb humor

Tools I Used:

- Game Maker 8 for the Dev (I 99% used the drag and drop tools)
- SFXR for Sound Effects
- Photoshop for the intro art and case art
- Audacity for some minor SFX tweaking
- 

Thanks in advance for playing, and enjoy!

entries.title: The Ruins of Cuglatr
entries.description:
"As an acolyte of The Coalition you have to venture out into the wilderness and bring back wonders from The Golden Age of Technology. Will you survive the challenges ahead of you?"

Went for the ancient technology on two fronts. The story is about uncovering old technology, and the entire game runs on the console.

There are two endings and different ways to approach problems. The middle part of the game is randomly generated, choosing from a pool of events. There was no balance pass on the game. The only external code I used was stretchy_buffer.h from the nothings library, everything else was programmed from scratch and is in one big C file. It's not portable at all.

Update: Version 1.1 has fixes some spelling, string construction, and a possible infinite loop.

entries.title: Ubuq
entries.description:
“Ubuq” is a 2D action video game, at which the music is the main driver for the combat system, similar to Guitar Hero style, and it has few components of Shoot’Em Up and RPG.

The ancient civilization of Ubuq already used advanced technology from 6.000 years ago, and nowadays they evolved until dominate the world. In order to try change that situation, the rebel group Glitch has sent a time traveler to the past. His name is Swap and he uses a timeless music machine, by which he can control the sounds of the future in order to neutralize the ancient technology and so disassemble the Ubuq civilization.

Instructions (xbox gamepad / keyboard):
 * Left Stick / Space Bar = Move
 * Left Trigger / Space = Prepare Attack
 * Buttons A,B,X,Y / Keys 1,2,3,4 = Launch Attack

This games has been developed at Ludum Dare #36 by:
 * Jose Barberà (Code) – twitter.com/cubotrox
 * Alfonso Miguel Sánchez (Art) – www.alfonsomiguel.com

entries.title: The Mighty Stick
entries.description: The Mighty Stick is a game about the most ancient technology. It's about a stick, which can help you to survive in the cold space. It's a kinda adventure game, but from the first perspective.

entries.title: Ancient hunter
entries.description:
Hunt animals, collect food and upgrade!

Controls:
WASD/arrows - navigation in menu, movement in game.
F - trade with trader.
Space - attack.
Ctrl - sprint.
QE - change weapon (if unlocked).
Enter - choose.

Entrance is on the left, Exit is on the right between two rocks.

entries.title: Aqueducts
entries.description:
### Build your aqueducts and get water for your city!

# How to play
Click and hold to increase the arc height, until you release. Your objective is to get a good path for the water from the mountain to the city.

Try to beat your records! It's hard, because you only have one opportunity...but try to do your best to not have thirsty people in your city :)

# Video
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EFzsucNW5hQ

# Code
https://github.com/Xatpy/LD36_Aqueducts

entries.title: Automaton's Paradise
entries.description:
Automaton's Paradise

Waking up in a dark carton is the  old toy's worst nigthmare. Help this one to make his way to paradise ! You may encounter some trouble but keep turning the keys and you will find your way.

REQUIRE a controller (Xbox type)

Unity3D

FL Studio

lemecavecunchapeau : Sound(https://soundcloud.com/louis-monmarche)/Code
Marie Pauillac : Art

entries.title: BG BLU
entries.description:
BG BLU is an exploration game. I don't want to spoiler much ;)

WASD to walk
Shift to run
Space to jump

entries.title: Boat Philosophy
entries.description: First time i join in on ludum dare. Im not verry skilled yet but i hope it brings atleast some enjoyment for you guys :)

entries.title: Brigit Fall
entries.description:
When "jumping", your calculation must be really precise, other wise you can end in a very inconvenient place! In "Brigit Fall", YOU, yes YOU, were in chase of some criminal called Branigan, but a miscalculation made you crash into an unknown planet. Can YOU do what it takes escape this mysterious place?

Recommended BGM (SC: Protoss OST): https://youtu.be/EVf1y_I0Ok0
Recommended BGM (Analogue OST): https://youtu.be/T_GSrWmv2_A?list=PLFgX1EWUym06Q4guoeJ-W9tcQrbdbXU5E

Instructions:
1- Follow your heart
2- Click which action you want to do

Tools:
Editor/Engine: Inky / Ink <https://github.com/inkle/inky>
Management: Trello / Toggl

Features:
- Totally customizable character! (Just imagine how you want!)
- 9 different endings! (5 "Unique" "Death" endings and 4 kinda unique "Alive" endings!)
- Futuristic UI!
- A story full of emotion, fights, treason, and more!
- Combat system 100% deterministic! (The result will always be the same!)

Known Issues:
- Firefox resets the auto scroll to the top of the page (CRUSHED!)

/************************************************************************
Hello hello everyone!

Thank you for checking out my entry for LD36! This time I made a text adventure! I've been wanting to do one for some time, but never really made one. When they announced the theme Ancient Technology, I wanting to create an adventure/exploration game, with an air of mystery to the objects found, but I knew I wouldn't be able to do that graphically, I'm a programmer and my graphics skill are hardly my best. But as I also play a lot of table top RPGs, I decided to make a text game that could evoke more of the player imagination.

This game is a very simple one, and although the quality of writing doesn't keep up until the end, I hope you can have fun reading/playing this little journey. This project had many ups and downs, but I will discuss this later in my Post Mortem, which I should write after one or two weeks, after I gathered some feedback.

As always, please leave a comment so I can check your game too!

Congratulations to all!
*************************************************************************/

Announcements:
* (08/28) I don't know how to make the embedded browser in itch.io stretch to the whole page. I will work on that. Also if I find that the font size and spacing isn't very comfortable, I'll change it ASAP!
* (09/06) Added two recommended BGM, added Firefox bug
* (09/06) Firefox bug crushed
* (09/08) Embedded URL was wrong, fixed

entries.title: Hadrian's Defence
entries.description:
This game is about defending your wall from attacking invaders. Use siege weaponry to pummel your opponents into submission and get as many points as possible!

- Web Build a bit laggy, physics not designed for HTML5 - runs differently on some slower computers. Windows build preferred.

entries.title: Isolation
entries.description:
Ancient Technology / Isolation / Upgrades

Your boat's engine gave out and you're now stranded on an island with nothing else than your hands and your wit.

Build rudimentary tools and constructs, go fishing, bake bread, and ultimately repair your boat to be able to go back home!

WASD/ZQSD to move. Use your mouse to pick up items or show tooltips. Press ESC to pause the game.

Tools: Notepad++

Thanks a lot for playing! <3

entries.title: Parthenon
entries.description:
A game about building a Golem under the Parthenon and choosing to destroy the city or seek the people's worship.

TURORIAL :

Left Click and drag to rotate the camera.
Right Click and drag to move the camera up and down.
Scroll Wheel to Zoom/Dezoom.
Click on a part on the right, then on the golem where you want to place it. You can then click elsewhere on the golem if you want to put it on an other place.
Use A and D to rotate the part.
Validate or cancel your choice by clicking on the corresponding button.
When you have finished building your golem with all the parts you wanted, click on ACTIVATE to finish the building phase.

You can move in the city using W and S.
Orient the golem using the camera.
Destroy the buildings to inspire fear, but beware, the towers will start attacking you.
If you stop moving during a few seconds, peoples around you will start worshipping you.

CREDITS :

Sirkovitch

NOTES :

For now the game can't restart, so it just quit itself.
Also (among other things,) score doesn't seem to work. Yay.

entries.title: Pyramid AI
entries.description:
You are an Artificial Inteligence left to protect a very precious piece of technology. Having the tomb of his masters invaded, it's your time to protect this sacred technoly from the hands of those who are not worthy.

===

UPDATE 09/12: Following some suggesting, I decided to make some changes. I don't plan to fix the game entirely since I'm working on other projects, but I agree with a lot of what you guys said, and since they don't see like big changes I decided to do some.
- I changed the controls to amore confortable scheme
- Now there's a minimap (sorta)
- And now there's a visual feedback when you're near a weapon but aren't possessing it.

Hope these changes will make the game more easy/confortable to play! =D

===

Controls:

WASD = Movement
Right Click = Control Weapon
Left Click = Activate Weapon
E = Activate Slow Motion

===

Hey, this is my first LD! I couldn't make it to the compo, but at least I was able to make it playable for the jam! :D

Hope it's not too buggy, haha.

entries.title: Rekt of Towers
entries.description:
Catapults are a very Ancient Technology. They are meant to destroy stuff. And destroying is FUN! Which Ancient Technology could be cooler?

Controls:
WASD: Aim
Space: Confirm aim and launch
Q: Camera zoom
E: Map view
Click & drag: Orbit view

Programming by:  InigoVY & David Vidal @Txotxopue
Music:
The Builder Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)

http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

entries.title: Restonerant
entries.description:
A two man project with my friend @tomstal handling the art and myself @wrexialmt on coding. We had multiple ideas for the Ancient Technology theme but ended up doing something which we both never dreamed of before, a cooking game! It probably shows in the design but we had fun creating this jam, I hope you will like it too.

The game is played using drag and drop and has 3 levels of difficulty which adapt depending on how you're doing. It'll change the difficulty between days, so if you win 3 days in a row, you're awesome and leave us a comment. Any questions feel free to post below, feedback is very appreciated, we do this for fun and to grow as game makers. Audio is from free online sources.

I had to do some magic tricks to get the Ludum Dare website to behave and remove the scroll bars, mainly scaling down my game and forcing scroll-bars to be turned off. This leads to a bit of skewing, if it bothers you please use the link provided below for the original experience.

entries.title: RIP.tech
entries.description:
Once upon a time there was a civilization that managed to develop a technology that made people immortal.
And then they died.
Explore the dark Temple of Science, where death awaits those who seek immortality!
Your objective is simple - go deeper, to uncovered the secret of the temple.

Controls: 
A - left
D - right
Left Mouse Button - shoot
Esc - pause

Time needed to complete: Maybe 5 minutes
Time needed to complete if you know what you're doing: around a minute.

My first entrance, please be gentle. It's not brilliant. It's barely functional. But I made it, yay!
Spent too much time sleeping, didn't have time to add sound:(. Enjoy the silence.

The only 2 things I didn't make are the fonts: Carnavalee Freakshow(http://www.1001fonts.com/carnivalee-freakshow-font.html) and Arial(I'm not sure. 

LAST MINUTE NOTE: The hearts are messed up for some reason, worked just fine inside Unity. Health count still works, but the display doesn't. I could check what's wrong, but it's 3:10am, it wouldn't be fair and, most importantly, I can't be asked.

I'll probably do a Web port sometime later. Goodnight!

Thanks to my girlfriend and my brother for putting up with me during these 48 hours and for providing great insight and brilliant ideas.

entries.title: Roman Defence
entries.description:
Roman Defence is a retro arcade style tower defence game. You play a Roman defending your town from escaped beasts. 

This game was designed and made over a weekend for Ludum Dare Game Jam 36 using Scratch to make the game, and the Android apps Pixel Art and PixiTracker to create the sprites and the music.

The Scratch file was converted to Flash using the converter at http://junebeetle.github.io/converter/

This is the first game the team has made together.

entries.title: Save Her
entries.description:
Hi everyone! It's the first time I jam alone and I quite happy I could do this, yay! I don't have a clue about programming, so I used Fungus for Unity in order to do this game.

It's a narrative story where you are a soldier in war and you have to use an old radio to help a woman who is running away from prision.

Hope you all like it! I'll apreciate your comments :)

P.D: Sorry if my english is bad sometimes during the game, but it's not my first lenguage and I write a LOT.

Credits:

Ending Illustrations by @mahatmandie

Gamejolt: http://gamejolt.com/games/save-her

entries.title: Shi
entries.description: My first time using Unreal Engine. Of course I didn't get as far as I wanted, but hey, it was a learning experience! (web version's still uploading… will link soon!)

entries.title: Star Eating Tree
entries.description:
Long ago in a 2D world, there was a tree that looked like a big monster.
Every day, the people living near that tree saw it eat every single Sun that came under the ground. That's why they called it "the Star Eating Tree". Yes, even neanderthals knew the Sun is a star.

Without a Sun, they were cold, so one day, they decided they wouldn't stand it anymore. They were going to cut it down.

But when they were ready to do it, this Ancient Greenpeace guy said they shouldn't do that.

Defend the Star Eating Tree from being cut down by the ignorant neanderthals.

-Spin the lever to keep the tree alive.
-Kill the enemies so they don't get to the tree.

Archers shoot from far away.
Pushers hit it with their bare hands.
Torch guys will set the tree on fire and kill it with one hit.
Mammoths are really hard to kill, but they're afraid of fire ;)

If your health reaches 0 you will be unconscious until it gets to 100 again.

Controls:
-Move with WASD or Arrows
-Spin the lever and attack the enemies with Space

Thanks for playing!

Build Stonehenge

The original plan was to make a management style game for building stonehenge. Unfortunately, not enough time resulted in a boring simulation.

PS: The druid does nothing, originally he was supposed to be a sort of supervisor.

ALIENS HAVE ABDUCTED YOU, A TEEN VIDEO

entries.title: Tower Power
entries.description:
It was supposed to be a different game, this is kind of "Plan B".

It's small Tower Defence game, but still pretty unbalanced.

entries.title: Tutankhamun's Curse
entries.description:
In Tutankhamun's Curse you are an archeologist exploring the depths of KV62, the tomb of Tutankhamun. Solve the puzzles to find his resting place and embrace the fate that the awakening creates.



Tutankhamun's Curse is a first person puzzle game. You control the player with mouse and keyboard (WASD), and interact with objects using (E).



This game was made by Team Potaton, consisting by Dastina, Ralf, Hidde and Mark.
We hope you enjoy our, although quite short, cool game! :D

entries.title: WMATA Metrorail Repair Dispatch System
entries.description:
The most awful piece of ancient technology I deal with on a daily basis is the DC Metro. So I've built a little simulator of what I can only imagine working at Metro HQ must be like.

As a would-be WMATA dispatcher, your job is to send repair crews to different stations as they suffer one calamity after another. The system map is displayed as ASCII text, which might actually be more advanced than whatever WMATA really does. You've only got 5 repairmen available to keep the system running. Again, 5 repairmen may be generous compared to the real Metro. If every line in the system has 0% passenger capacity for 6 in-game hours, you lose.

The game is built with vanilla HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Nothing fancy--just a quick and dirty web game. I choose to imagine the low-fi graphics, simplistic technologies, and messy code are an accurate reflection of real life inside WMATA.

Game isn't optimized for smaller screens--desktop play recommended.

entries.title: Year of the Bow Simulator 2017
entries.description:
The year is right, the breeze turns sharply in a strange and unnatural direction as a target darts into your vision. Your bow is prepared for its reign.

Use the arrow keys to move, hold the spacebar to draw your string, and release to shoot.

entries.title: Ancient Robot Overlord Chess
entries.description:
'Go into the cave.' they said...
'It'll be fun.' they said...

Now I'm stuck in here with no way out and some scary Ancient Robot Overlord who wants to play a weird game of chess to assert is dominance.

entries.title: Apple Battered

entries.title: Archaeologist
entries.description:
Archaeologist
Explore space looking for ancient technology and use these artefacts to unlock a gate to another dimension.

Mine ore to sell at the local space station traders to buy fuel to fund your exploration.

Be careful with your fuel, it's a limited resource!

We were a bit ambitious with all the features we wanted to try so the game is a little incomplete but hopefully it's fun to play around with for a bit.

Controls

E - Use (Enter/Exit spaceship, trade, mine ore)
Mouse Wheel - Zoom in/out camera while in ship

Team
Programming

Art

entries.title: Atlantis Builder
entries.description:
Please leave a comment! ^^ even a few words will make me happy.
I promise to play & comment anyone who leaves a comment.

===============
Description
===============

This is a Building / survival / sandbox game.
Expand island, Plant crops, Craft items, eat to not starve to death.
No enemies yet sadly.

============
Controls
============

Move by left-clicking on adjacent ground.
Select items in bottom-bar by left clicking.
Use/Place selected item with Right-clicking. (click on player to eat!)
Scroll-click to Pick-up an item from the world.

Use "A" and "D" to rotate camera, scroll-wheel to zoom.

Click the gear at the bottom to select the Ground manipulation device (Atlantis Core).
Use Right-clicking / Scroll-clicking to create/destroy/manipulate ground.
Hold "R" or "S" to Rotate and scale Objects respectively.
This costs energy, wait for recharge.

The 3x3 circles on the right are your crafting table,
Left-click to place/add the selected item to a slot.
Right-click to remove/subtract from the slot.
if the recipe is correct, an item will appear. left-click to craft it.

** Cheats: **
Click "C" to get all existing items.
Click "V" to fill Core energy.

============
About
============
"You are the last survivor of the sunken atlantis city, you managed to save the most ancient technology of the city, the Atlantis Core.
it used to power the whole city and keep it afloat.
You are stuck on a small island, with only these: the tree of wisdom, one sweet water pool, one chest with tidbits, and the atlantis core.
The core is an awesome solar powered device, but it's only as powerful as the wisdom of it's holder, you will only be able to do some actions every day untill it runs out of charge.

You will have to rebuild atlantis, while learning why it falled, and facing opposition from dark forces that do not want it rebuilt."

^ That was the initial idea I wrote down when starting this project. The game is a bit different then what is described there, no sweet water, chest or tree of wisdom.
I didn't get around to adding Enemies, or defensive structures as I wanted.

For now it is a kind of a sandbox game, build whatever you want, and have fun ^^

=====================
Crafting & Progress
=====================

plant sapling to get: Apples, Wood, Leaves
plant corn to get: full Corn
Eat Apple/Corn to get: Organic waste

Use wood to get: Planks
Use Planks to build structures

Mix organic waste + Leaves to get: Fertilizer

Use fertilizer on dirt to turn it to grass.
Use fertilizer on grass to grow: low grass
Low grass grows in time to: tall grass -> Flowers

Harvest flowers to get: magical dust
Use magical dust + wood to get: wooden Defensive tower

Wooden wall:
plank, plank, plank
plank, plank, plank
plank, plank, plank

Wooden door:
plank, plank, plank
plank, Empty, plank
plank, Empty, plank

Wooden wall with window:
plank, plank, plank
plank, Empty, plank
plank, plank, plank

Wooden Fence:
plank, Empty, plank
plank, plank, plank
plank, Empty, plank

Wooden Roof:
plank, plank, plank
plank, Empty, Empty
plank, Empty, Empty

Wooden Bunny statue:
plank(dark), magic-dust, plank(dark)
plank(light), plank(dark), plank(light)
plank(dark), plank(light), plank(dark)

============
Credits
============

Music (Sea Puzzle) by: spirulence 
Main Font (Popular Cafe NF) by: Nick Curtis [http://www.nicksfonts.com/]
Game ideas and general help: Shake the magical stitch

============
Platforms
============
I only tested on windows, Mac and linux download is there in case it just works.

entries.title: Bot

#LD36

Walk simulator + puzzle

entries.title: Cat-O-Pult

Castles/Worms type of a game, but in this one you use cats as your weapon of choice. You need to conquer dwarven fortifications with the power of cat love!

entries.title: Connor & Harley
entries.description:
A text adventure built with Inform 7. You can play in-browser or with an interpreter. The web link below has instructions for how to do either of these.

You're Connor, a college student on a trip through an enormous, rather odd renaissance-era palace. Your girlfriend Harley gets a bit bored wandering around with the class and your droning professor, so she decided to wander off. It's up to you to follow her, and to decide how far you're willing to follow her. The palace holds many secrets.

entries.title: Enlightened Cave
entries.description:
Web version now available!

Explore the cave and solve its puzzles

Controls:

w/a/s/d or the arrow keys to move

R to return to previous checkpoint

entries.title: Europa Descending
entries.description:
Remote control a rover exploring some ancient ruins underneath the icy surface of Europa. 

Was originally intended for the compo, but um, got lazy and watched cartoons all of Sunday. :) :) 

A full playthrough if you know where to go and what buttons to poke should take less than 5 minutes.

No sound.

entries.title: Forbidden Ruins
entries.description:
Welcome to "Forbidden Ruins", my Ludum Dare 36 competition entry, made in 48 hours.

Controls: W to thrust, A/D to steer, K for lasers, L for bombs.

The goal is explore procedurally-generated levels of increasing difficulty, searching for the exit room. You will have to open various colour-locked doors by shooting the matching crystals and avoid dying horribly.

entries.title: LD36 - Ancient Technology
entries.description:
I had fun making this :)
Thanks to my friend, Ninja Picnic (https://soundcloud.com/ninjapicnic-music)
for the music!

Left and right arrow keys to move, up arrow to jump.
Collect all the "technology diamonds"!

entries.title: Megalith
entries.description:
Megalith is a management game, in which you try and build a huge prehistoric monument as quickly as possible. Assign your villagers, research new technologies, and die of starvation!
(Side note; I kinda ran out of time on this one, so it's a little rough in places, and very rough in others. I'll be fixing any game-breaking bugs though~)

--Controls--
It's totally mouse-driven.

entries.title: Misungastood
entries.description:
You play as Unga a genius ahead of his time. Hes misunderstood by his fellow cavemen and they blame him for the misfortunes that fall upon them. One day the other cavemen decide they've had enough of Unga and decide to be rid of him. Run for your life!

CONTROLS (AREN'T DISPLAYED IN GAME SO READ)
WASD - Movement
Right Click - Aim
Left Click - Throw Rocks
Left Shift - Roll
Space - Jump

/blog
Im kinda dissappointed with my game this time around, it feels really boring but i felt id put too much effort into it to not upload so hey. I feel like i didn't really fulfill the theme aswell as i intended too either. Overall a bit lackluster for me but theres always next LD.

entries.title: NEON BLOOD QUEST IV
entries.description:
CONTENT WARNING: EXISTENTIAL DESPAIR, VIOLENCE, BLOOD, FLASHING LIGHTS AND HARSH COLORS, LOUD MUSIC WITH HIGH PITCHED SOUNDS

YOU ARE STUCK IN AN ABANDONED VIDEO GAME

VISIT THE SUFFERING INHABITANTS

EVERYONE DIES

TALK TO THEM UNTIL THEY START TO HATE YOU

CONTROLS: INTERACT WITH LMB, MOVE WITH WASD

THERE'S CURRENTLY A BUG WHERE YOU CAN ONLY END THE GAME IF YOU TALK TO THE PERSON WHO'S LIKE "WARM OUT TODAY. WARM OUT YESTERDAY." SO IF YOU'VE TALKED TO EVERYONE AND EXHAUSTED THEIR DIALOGUE AND THE GAME WON'T END JUST TALK TO THAT PERSON AGAIN.

A GAME BY @COSMICWANGST (ART, WRITING) AND @LYCAONTALKS (MUSIC, WRITING, PROGRAMMING)

entries.title: Project Silentzone
entries.description:
Take control of a caveman pulled into a weird dimension that is not his own with creatures quite unlike he's ever seen.

However, keep you mind open, there are two moons hanging up on the shadeless sky.

entries.title: Purify Alchemy Pinball
entries.description:
It´s a little, buggy Pinball game about Alchemy. Activate all 4 lights to transmute your pinball from a base metal to a noble one to get a multiplier. 
Have Fun.

entries.title: Running With The Wolves
entries.description:
It is back in the stone age. Man has just discovered fire, and is fighting for survival.

Your goal is build a suitable shelter from the dangers of the wild. Gather resources by exploring the wilderness. When it get's dark, don't stray too far from the safety of your fire!

Link to a video of the gameplay
http://incinious.tumblr.com/post/149684887772/for-our-ludum-dare-36-entry-video-made-by-a
(wish I could make a hyperlink)

*Disclaimer: We did not manage to get all the sounds in time...*

Instructions:
- Craft weapons by placing items on the crafting "skin"
- Build your house by placing enough stone and wood in the dirt circle
- Pick up/Drop items using 'E'
- Hold LMB to light bonfires using a torch
- Click LMB to attack using a spear or club

Goal:
- Build your house as quickly as possible

entries.title: Runty Raptor's Rock Roller
entries.description:
Runty Raptor's Rock Roller is a level-based runner game that challenges you to balance greed with speed to beat the pack to the juiciest prey. Pointless skateboard tricks and bad physics included AT NO CHARGE!

Runty was always the smallest of his pack; Always late to the hunt; Always stuck with the unappetizing leftovers (Feet and tails! Yuck!).

Runty dejectedly kicked a large stone down the hill and sighed. His eyes widened as the little dino gears in his mind began to turn. The stone picked up speed as it bounced and rolled across the terrain!

Runty worked tirelessly throughout the night, leveraging tooth and claw to craft a wondrous example of ancient technology: The Skateboard (Or, as Runty dubbed it, The Rock Roller)!

With this, Runty would be able to beat the pack to the Hunt and, finally, have his pick of the juiciest prey!

entries.title: Siege Climber
entries.description:
Your time machine is stuck on top this medieval tower! Their ancient technology doesn't stand a chance against your superior climbing gear!

Controls:
Move Left: A / LMB / Left Arrow Key
Move Right: D / E / RMB / Right Arrow Key
Sprint: Left Shift
Wipe: Space / MouseWheel
Exit: Esc

Obstacles:
Poop: lose height
Rock: lose some height and health
Vomit: slow down
Boiling Water: slow down some and lose health
These effects are multiplied while sprinting so be careful!

entries.title: Telegrapher
entries.description:
Telegraph is a new technology in the country. Therefore, the ministry of truth is looking for someone to operate it. Fortunately or not, you are being selected.

PS: I would argue telegraph is relatively "ancient" for us now :p

Author: @jackyjjc

Credit where credit is due: Heavily influenced and inspired by "Papers Please"

entries.title: The House On Rotham Drive
entries.description:
Join Private Eye Elena Morrison on this adventure through a farm powered by ancient, cultist technology. 

Stuck somewhere? Try exploring, searching, and stealing anything that isn't nailed down!

==Useful Commands==
Type a command into the input field and then press Enter to submit it.
[Move] - Move in a direction. Can also just type the direction (as in "n", "w", "east", "up", etc).
[Look] - Look at the current room, or look at an object in the room or item in your inventory.
[Search] - Search the room, or search an object in the current room.
[Use] - Use an item on an object in the room.
[Take] - Pick up an object in the room.
[I] - View your current inventory
[Open] - Open or unlock an object

entries.title: Trireme Hero
entries.description:
Welcome to the Athenian fleet! You have been selected to serve as the drummer aboard one of Athens' fine triremes, beating time to keep the rowers on course. Some say the heart of the ship is the captain, some say it is the helmsman, but I say it is you. Do you have what it takes to be a Trireme Hero?

This game was created for Ludum Dare 36 as our first venture into the world of HTML5.  As such, it may not have the same functionality as the Windows version. Enjoy!

entries.title: Unearth-Burial
entries.description:
Unearth-Burial! (Make sure to download the whole zip file!)

Play as a man who finds his friend's dead body. He then spends the next day collecting his friend's favorite things, which happen to be nascent technologies. 
  


CONTROLS:
Arrow keys to move, Up arrow to jump.
Press down to examine/dig.
THE NEXT CONTROLS ONLY UNLOCK LATER IN THE GAME:
Press and hold W to launch the rope snake. If it hits a platform, you can swing on it. You can also jump at the end of the swing.
  
Press Q to throw a spear. Spears act as platforms when they stop. The snake can also swing on them. You can only have 3 spears out at a time.  
  
Man this was one of the hardest things I've ever done. I had to cut a lot of ideas out just to finish this. 
  
The source is the assets folder. It contains all my art, music, and code.
  
Fun fact: All the music was written AND performed by me on my keyboard! Hope everyone enjoys it.

entries.title: WarcherLD
entries.description:
A turn-based strategy game where you only have two units to control - lose them and it's game-over.

Use your mouse and click a character (on the right) to select that character. 

Characters:
Archer & Warrior.

Up = Attack
Left/Right (only Warrior can move) to move
Down to end turn.

Special thanks to certain people who helped me develop this. 

Due to issues I had with Unity - the game is far from the world's greatest.

entries.title: Ancient Invaders
entries.description:
​--What the hell is going on?!

Oh, nothing extraordinary. There are two space invaders, kind of tomb raiders, or another treasure hunters, you know. One has a sword, another a flame thrower. They are looking for great ancient technology hidden in stone plates. stone plates locate on the unexplored planets, contain into usuals stones. Its all sounds awesome, but local wild tribes don't give it to you without a fight. C'mon, stop reading, just try to play it!​

--Controls:

First character: WASD: Moving, H: Attack
Space: switch characters (if you play single, use it!)​

Press M to toogle sounds!

Second character: Arrows Moving, L: Attack (for multiplayer)


Good luck with you invades!
Can you get the highscore?!

--
Tools: Defold! Glad to use it in LudumDare
Glad to complete my first Jam Dare (some new experience in the team!)
You can play solo, just use Space to switch character!

Credits:
Insality: Code
Freeda Meteora: Art

entries.title: Ancient Technologies
entries.description:
Assemble the ancient technology in order to unlock its secrets.

Controls:

In the room, use the mouse to click on things.

Once the ancient technology is assembled, use a gamepad or arrow keys + space to play the game.

[Note for HTML5 players: There seems to be a glitch (at least in Chrome, not sure other browsers) where certain clickable objects in the room intermittently don't work because mouse events are being doubled for some reason.  This does not appear to be an issue in the Windows builds, so for the best experience I recommend trying Windows if possible.  If HTML5 is your only option, refreshing the page may help.  I will try to release an updated build in the near future that gives a keyboard shortcut as a workaround.]

###

Programmed in GameMaker: Studio by csanyk

Audio was ripped from the Atari 2600 games Adventure, Asteroids, and Superman using Stella + Audacity by csanyk.

Graphics:

Living room background created in paint.net by csanyk. 

Cute Girlfriend did the TV set and the cartridge using Adobe Illustrator; I converted the drawings to sprites using Illustrator, Paint.NET, and the GameMaker Sprite Editor.

Atari 2600 console graphic by AloneAgainstPixesl ripped from DeviantArt.com: 

http://aloneagainstpixels.deviantart.com/art/Atari-2600-console-Pixel-art-372549389

Atari 2600 joystick graphic by DareDevilDillon of the defunct piq.codeus.net: 

https://www.google.com/search?q=atari+2600+joystick+pixel+art&newwindow=1&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiF66GpoOPOAhUM62MKHQZuDDEQ_AUICCgB&biw=1638&bih=830#newwindow=1&tbm=isch&q=joystick+pixel+art&imgrc=t-jKdVJ7nrmwXM%3A

Woodgrain from the title was the product of a Google Image Search.

[spoiler]

To hook up the Atari 2600, it has to be plugged in, the tv has to be turned on, the cartridge has to be in the slot, and console has to be turned on. To be able to play the game, you need to plug in the joystick.

[post-submission improvements & fixes]

PRE_DEADLINE:
- Game's challenge level resets to 0 when game resets, inits, or kills.

- Asteroid max_speed nerfed (slightly).

- TV screen now all-black when game is on.

- TV Type switch now functional (this was a feature I dropped to make submission deadline, then added back in last minute).  Now you can flip between playing in color and B&W!

- The flashing color text on the Title Screen now flashes in authentic Atari 2600 NTSC colors only!
Death animation

- Respawn bug -- it's supposed to wait until there's open space around the center so you spawn a little more safely.  Instead, it was doing the opposite!  Fixed!

-A few logical checks were added to prevent things that shouldn't be possible, like audio playing when the TV is off, etc.

POST_DEADLINE:

- Fixed a memory leak caused by spawning an object without checking to see if it already exists, once per step, while the game is turned on but in game_over state.

[planned post-jam updates]

-working difficulty switches

-working game select switch

entries.title: Doom of the Ancients
entries.description:
The Doom Slayer had walked the planes of hell. He found the technology of the ancients - teleport and he stepped into it, so he can kill the last remnants of the hellish scum.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The game is a hardcore topdown shooter. You need to find your way through the maze of rooms and teleports. Enemies drop necessary health packs and weapons with various stats and abilities (the blue beams can penetrate walls). Unfortunately, I was not able to do a proper ending (game exits when you finish it), it has only a single level, no animations and sounds/music.
At least I was able to finish the base of the game, unlike the last time.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
WASD to move
R to reload
K to shoot
L to swap weapons/teleport
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
You need to have Visual C++ 2015 Redistributable to run the Binary: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=48145

entries.title: God's Gift
entries.description:
This is a kind of static strategy game with a tech map like Civ.

[Quick Info]

The goal is to reach the last tech in the tree before 2016.
The universe rebirth after you fail, but the items inside the pyramid remain the same.
Each tech has a related item.
The items inside the pyramid can unlock the related tech without cost.
You can put any item inside the pyramid after you developed the tech.

[How to play]

Hold the btn at lower right to progress the time, and you can gather some resources with time.
Select a tech and press the btn at right side to research.
Click the Square btn to select the item related to the tech.
You can also select an item inside the pyramid up there.

[About]

Game is done by one person during 72 hours.
The game is not complete from the original design so it may look stupid somewhere.
I spend quite a time to plan the full tech tree, yet in the end, no time to put it into the game.
So the tech tree is too short here.
I might update the game to what it should be.

entries.title: Hypozomata

The Trireme

One of the greatest weapons of the Athenians

A ship so large it risked bending and breaking in the oceans waves

To prevent this, a large rope called a HYPOZOMATA was tied end to end to stop the
ship from tearing itself apart

The HYPOZOMATA was considered a vital secret: the removal of one from the city was
punishable by death.

You and your men have infiltrated Athens in the dead of night and have found a 
HYPOZOMATA.

Return to your ships by Dawn!

There's no 'win' or 'fail' state, so if try to get to your ship to 'win'. If you lose, press ESC to exit.

Press SPACEBAR to skip the intro.

entries.title: Paws of Purrsia: Kitty Litter
entries.description:
The Game

"Paws of Purrsia: Kitty Litter" is a 4-player party game where players coordinate their moves to keep a palanquin from tipping-over. Think Persian-version of Crazy Taxi with four drivers controlling one vehicle. Remember, you are carrying VIPs on a palanquin, so pay attention to their individual demands while marching.

WHILE THIS GAME IS MEANT FOR FOUR PLAYERS, YOU CAN TOTALLY PLAY IT ALONE IF YOU HAVE A GOOD CLAW GRIP

The Controls

Player 1

Move Left     <-
Move Right   ->
Jump   Right Shift

Player 2

Move Left    A
Move Right    D
Jump    W

Player 3

Move Left   F
Move Right   H
Jump   T

Player 4

Move Left   J
Move Right   L
Jump   I

The Story

Ancient Purrsia is a hub for foreign trade, and people from all around the known world pass through the city on their trade routes. The King of the Kingdom--King Fat Cat--is having an epic parade in honor of the anniversary of his ascension to the throne. You are assigned to carry his most prestigious guests and His Majesty himself! No single cat can bear such responsibility alone, so the four of you must bear him together.

The city is colorful and extravagant, as are the people who pass through it. From rich merchants to shady individuals, holy men to warriors, winos to weirdos.

Level one - King Fat Cat: His Royal Highness is the latest in a long line of benevolent rulers. He doesn't quite measure up to his father in terms of brains, but he believes he is the best of his family and will be the most awesome ruler. Parade him through the city in a stately manner.

Level two - Drunk Cat (developing): He's a very rich and powerful cat, who may have over celebrated a bit at the King's parade. He's drunk and quite confused, so he never knows which way he needs to go. He also tells rambling stories as you walk. Don't move him too fast or he will vomit, don't start and stop too much or he will vomit.

Level Three - His Husky the Excellency(developing): He's a very serious and stoic kind of guy, who doesn't recognize jokes and takes everything said at face value. He has been told of a vendor selling hot dogs for food(!) and he is incredibly insulted. He demands that you take him to this vendor so that he may investigate these claims. He wants to go fast and he needs to stay cool.

The Team

Justin Acker--Development, Music, Game Design, Voice Acting
Christina Goefron--Development, Concept Art
Corinne Cohen--Art and Animation: Lead
Veronica Grijalva--Concept and Character Art: Lead, Narrative Design, Level Design, Editing, Vocalist
Jack Chu--Development, Level Design
Chris Bonilla--Development, Playtesting
Yuxin Gao--Music and Sound Effects, Writing
Hoteck Kan--Project Management, Sound Effects, Writing

entries.title: Temple Trial
entries.description:
You are an alchemist entering the famed Temple of Knowledge, in search of mythical artifacts, but you find out there aren't any. However, deep into the temple you find two tables, labeled "Research" and "Combine," and an entrance into a series of caverns, filled with ancient materials. As you begin to experiment with the materials you find in the temple, you realize you can create the artifacts you were searching for. And throughout all this, you feel a looming sense of imminent danger. You must create three specific artifacts to escape the ancient temple before time runs out!

Drag the materials to the trays on either table, and click on "Research" or "Combine." When you are out of materials, click on the door to delve into the caverns and find more.

Make sure you have pencil and paper handy to note all of your findings.


This is my second game jam, and I am quite happy with the results (especially because I was too busy Sunday to do anything)! If you care, my first LD game is here: http://ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-35/?action=preview&uid=88958

Special thanks to Jacob Harris for doing the art for me!

entries.title: AGE of OORGH
entries.description:
​This is my scrapped Ludum Dare 36 compo entry.

If you just want to play the game, skip to Gameplay. If you want a premature post-mortem (pre-post-mortem? pre and post cancel each other out, meaning it's a mortem?), read on.

Why scrapped? 

I intended to do much more with it. LD36 theme was 'Ancient technology'. My initial plan was that Oorgh is an inventor and a hunter. He'd be able to gather wood, stone and other resources to invent and create advanced tools and weapons like stone, club or even a spear!

So what happened?

3 reasons.

1. If you follow me on twitter (@pi_pi314), you might know that I developed this game in ANSI-C STD-99. And I didn't have nearly enough experience to develop in C like I do in Java. I also didn't have as many tools as I do when developing in Java, so I had to code some of them (and learn libpng to load images).

2. Early on I chose a bad structure for the game. Due to this I had to either follow it til' the end or rewrite it. Rewriting and debugging for the 2nd time would take a hell of a lot time, so I decided not to do that.

3. I had a hard time focusing. This was in fact the first time I couldn't focus properly. This has to do with some unrelated personal stuff.

What now?

​Nevertheless this Ludum Dare was an amazing experience. I learned what is good and what is bad in C (still kinda new to it, considering how extensive and powerful it is). I did some work on the tiny framework that was used in this project. I think this might've been my favorite Ludum Dare yet just because I learned more than ever before during a game jam. I wonder what will be in december. Maybe a 4.0+? That is the goal anyway.

What am I proud of?

Actually, the graphics. I like how they turned out. I'm also proud of some of the internal work I did.

Gameplay, or how does this game work?

While this game is unfinished, it still has some "gameplay".

There are exactly three mechanics:

1. Walking left or right.

2. Pressing w at the bush. This triggers the hunt sequence.

3. The actual hunt. It's pretty self explanatory. Press space at the right time AND when the animal isn't looking up. If you hit green, you succeed instantaneously. If you hit red, you fail instantaneously. Yellow and orange have a chance of 30% and 60% of succeeding. Whether you fail or not after hitting yellow or orange is determined semi-randomly.

After that the game ends and you get either the good or the bad ending, depending on the hunt outcome.

​Source

Full source code for the game is included with the game in the archive below.

Only a linux build is available. You may try to compile for Windows, but I really doubt it's possible.

So, now I'll play your submissions and do the feedbacks on the feedbackfriends. After that, see you in december!

entries.title: EGFS  ('Epic' Gladiator Fighting Simulator)
entries.description:
This is my entry to Ludum Dare 36 because my first attempt which I spent most of the time on i could not get to work so i made this quickly.

entries.title: Evolutionary Defense
entries.description:
Defend your base against the enemies of centuries! Start in the middle age and protect your little tent against other clans. As time progresses, you will get stronger and unlock new technology, but your enemies will, too - so be careful!

Controls:
Space - Pause
Shift - Fast Forward

Click on an empty tile to place a turret. Turrets can be upgraded in range, shot speed and damage after they have been placed.

===

This game was made by Zettelkasten (Programming) and Tandorel (Concept, Design).
Sadly, half way through the Jam Tandorel got sick and couldn't continue.

The game is not complete, but playable. Please excuse this!

entries.title: Forever Someday
entries.description:
*Forever Someday is a deep psychological experience about breakups and depression.

*Get to know the mind of the developer in the most sincere thing ever done by him.

*This is not a traditional game, it is an experience full of meaning and every design choice has a reason.

*Be open-minded, play at your own pace, try without hurry, pay attention to the details and try to understand what this game is trying to say.

*The sounds and the music are very important, so a headphone is recommended to full experience Forever Someday.


Controls:
*Mouse only
*Esc to quit

entries.title: Pyramid Caveman Battle Arena
entries.description:
"Don't forget your mission Ug", the words kept echoing in his head as the time machine powered up, "We didn't unfreeze you from that squirrel infested snowball for nothing, we need you to recover the Sceptre of Khufu. Don't ask why."

The time portal opened, it was time for Ug to step through. "Due to the nature of the time portal, we'll only be able to supply you with technology of the era, so be careful. competing agents are likely to be there."

Ug sighed, shook his head then turned to the camera, and looking straight into it he said, "I'm getting too -old- ancient for this." Exit through time portal.


Controls:

Left Mouse Button: Shoot
Right Mouse Button: Melee (can deflect projectiles)
WASD: Move character
'V': Boost/Slide
1,2,3 keys for changing weapons, Stone, VCR, Spear.


The game is a multiplayer based arena fps. Its a host/client setup so you will need someone to host and someone to join, the host might also need port 7777 open.

If you want you can try joining "johanw123.nu" or "217.215.62.12" as ip, it might be up or it might not, cant really be sure about the stability :)

entries.title: The Ancients Call
entries.description:
After finding an ancient portal structure you travel with it to the Ancients, protecting it from harm along the way. 

WASD to move. Left click to fire. E to drop a bomb.
Protect the portal for five waves, until it charges and can transport you back. There are five areas, each more difficult. Reach the ancients after the final jump to win.


This is my first Ludum Dare entry, and I had a lot of fun making it.  I wrote this game in Java.


I’m not entirely sure that I did the export and download setup correctly, so if there are any problems please let me know.

entries.title: Transcontinental
entries.description:
Try to complete the rail track before the train crash into the wild !

Transcontinental is an arcade/puzzle game in which you have to create a path for the train already running on the tracks, so you must complete it before it comes to the end. I think the pressure brought by the rain running behind you works really well :)

I had a lot of fun creating this game, even if the path system took me nearly one complete day to achieve. In the end I'am happy with this game, but a lot of things are missing because of this ... Like better graphics, more mecanics, more level, and maybe sounds and music.

Controls :
- Mouse to rotate and place tracks
- Up and down to control train speed
- Left and right to switch track type

This game was created with :
- GameMaker
- Photoshop
- A few deseperate hours

I hope you're gonna enjoy it, see you at next LD !

entries.title: WakeUpCall()
entries.description:
WakeUpCall()
A pure console roguelike about what happens to a Warbot when World Peace is a reality.

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=- 

Made in 48-hours from the Ludum Dare Compo by Martin "quill18" Glaude 
Livestreamed start-to-finish in front of an audience of thousands. 

Written in pure C# out of many Console.SetCursorPosition() calls.

Tools: 
MonoDevelop

Special thanks to Essentia for beta testing -- as well as everyone out in Twitch-land for supporting me and my streaming! 

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=- 

DIRECTIONS:

Use the Numpad or Arrow Keys to move around.
Use [<] and [>] on stairs to move up and down floors.
Moving into enemies will melee attack them
Moving on to items will pick them up.
Use [L] to look around, and [ENTER] to examine objects.
If you have a ranged weapon equipped, [F] will enter Aiming Mode. [ENTER] fire.
Access your Inventory by pressing [I]. Items can be used or equipped.
Your goal is to acquire the Yendorian Power Cell from the bottom of the complex.

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=- 


Questions?

entries.title: Aliens Didn't Build Em'
entries.description:
Welcome to this game...

This time I am not going to do my whole speel about how I ran out of time, becaue that happens everytime. Anyways, there are still some critical bugs that will be fixed within the next few hours (game breaking), and I will mark them so you know they were made after the deadline (even though there is no ratings)

Anyways, this game is (was supposed to be) a mashup of super smash bros. and platformers. Basically, you have to move around with A, D and W to jump. The goal is to collect pyramid pieces from killing enemies. To kill an enemy with the first guy (peasant), you hit space to melee, the next guy can throw a pot by clicking. The third guy can do both. The last guy has laser eyes. You have five lives and health per life.

Once you get enough pieces and the pyramid becomes full in the top corner, you may jump into the portal to advance into the next stage to the next person (sometimes the same).

Jumping on enemies bounces you up but does not affect the enemy and running into an alien will make you lose health and, eventually, your lives.

Hope you enjoy what the "game" and I hope you can leave some feedback about some non bug things. Thanks!

Post-Jam Edits:
 - made music actually play
 - Enemies spawn past level 3
 - win screen added (small thing so you know you won)
 - removed wall glitch (few)
 - made arrows not invisible when shooting (soldier third guy)

entries.title: Blocky Hill
entries.description:
Blocky Hill

The chickas are invading your lovely house in the hills. Stop them with ingenious medieval traps, ballistas and boulders!

Blocky Hill is a 3D tower defense game where you use the terrain to your advantage: roll boulders down hills, chop enemies with spinning axes as they walk past, and line up deadly spear traps for massive AOE damage!

---------------- INSTRUCTIONS ------------------
- Drag towers from your deck onto the landscape
- Some towers can only be placed on top of blocks, others on the side of blocks
-----------------------------------------------------

Brian Zou: Design, Art and Programming (www.sweatychair.com)
Matthew Chin: Music and Audio (soundcloud.com/dragor)
Cong Xu: Programming (cxong.github.io)

entries.title: Borg's Quest
entries.description:
Too much time on boilerplate.. no time to spend on actual content :P Note to self: next LD use framework like Phaser.

Well, managed to scrape up something!
Help caveman Borg to craft the tools he needs in his everyday life.

HOW TO PLAY:
You move the resources aka the white boxes into the shape to win the level. You move them by swiping on them with mouse or by finger. Reset the level by clicking the box again. The shape is written on the level box, see legend below. No time for fancy UIs or help screens X(

Start the level by clicking on the box at the bottom of the page! 4 levels atm.
Not all resources are needed! Some are used just in moving others, only the ones in the shape matter!

Legend:
St - Stick, brown line
Ro - Rock, gray circle
Hi - Hide, puke yellow... thing
Fl - Flint, black triangle

Well, it's an entry!

entries.title: Curse of the Ancients
entries.description:
Made together by @nikatha and I.

Pyramids - ancient constructions that boggle minds all over the place even today. In stories, they are filled with deadly traps to do away with ne'er-do-wells. But the ancient builders of these structures had one more technological marvel in store: vengeful spirits!

When plunderers invade the final resting place of an old spirit, this old ghost takes control of the pyramid's traps and turns them against the intruders. Time to make good on a curse.

WHAT? 

* Protect your tomb from greedy intruders
* Place traps to slow down your enemies until the time runs out 
* Get extra resources by eliminating enemies

HOW? 

* Choose traps and place them using the mouse
* Clear your currently held trap with RIGHT CLICK
* Move the camera with WASD / Arrow keys
* Zoom with scroll wheel, or +/- keys

===

TOOLS USED

* Unity3d 
* Pixen for the sprites 
* Audacity and Bfxr.net for sounds

FONTS

* Meroitic Hieroglyphics by Reinhold Kainhofer: http://www.dafont.com/meroitic-hieroglyph.font
* Cleopatra by Alphabet & Type: http://www.dafont.com/cleopatra.font

MUSIC

Tabuk Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

entries.title: Faro
entries.description:
Welcome to Faro! 

Faro is a game where you will be fighting against Thoth and his minions while playing a game of blackjack. 

You, as the player, have 3 hands to play blackjack with. You must kill Thoth's minions to draw additional cards to your hands. If your hand's value goes over 21 then that hand has BUST and will be disabled. This will automatically move your current hand to the next hand of cards. 

You can press E to HOLD a hand which will prevent cards from being added to that hand and will switch to the next hand of cards. Once all 3 hands have either been BUST or HELD then the hands that you HELD will be compared to Thoth's. All hands that are higher in value than Thoth's cause additional benefits for the player. 

Thoth is invulnerable until the hands have been revealed.

If you have 0 winning hands then Thoth will rain down beams of light at random locations which you would need to avoid. 
If you have 1 winning hand then Thoth will shoot a laser from his crown in a horizontal motion, you also deal 5 times damage to it. 
If you have 2 winning hands then Thoth will do a series of slam attacks in front of it, you also deal 10 times damage to it.
If you have 3 winning hands then Thoth will be stunned for a short duration allowing you free reign to attack it, you also deal 20 times damage to it.​

EDIT: Re-updated so that the UI scales with screen!

Brought to you by Ouroboros Games Studio.

entries.title: Retro YouTube Simulator

https://twitter.com/crazyaivan
https://twitter.com/pogouk

Move with WASD
Look with the Mouse
Interact with Left Click
Zoom with Right Click

Demonstration video (by gamejamcurator): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=duSg1GlbyG0

Instructions:
Left click the terminal to access it.
Search for videos by typing "query" followed by a space and your search terms. e.g. "query cats"
After some time your video cassette will arrive.
Pick up the tape with left mouse.
Put it into the VCR to play it.
Click the buttons below the VCR slot to eject a tape.

Type "help" in the terminal to see a list of all available commands.

We hope you enjoy!

entries.title: The Pyramid's Secret

You play as an old man that has dedicated his whole life to finding the Pyramid's secret. Walk through room after room and solve the puzzles, if you're lucky, you might find what the secret that sleeps deep inside the pyramid.

I am aware that it has quite a few bugs and glitches, and that it lacks in several aspects, especially sound, but this is what I managed to do in my 48 hours of game jamming. If you have any tips or critique about the game, I would love to hear from you, all I want to do is get better!

entries.title: Caveman Massacre: 10000 B.C.E
entries.description:
Alright, here we go. I made this game in a day and a few hours, because I slept most of the weekend. The whole project wasn't very well thought out, I just tested out an interesting mechanic and fit it into the theme. I really wanted to give up several times, but I feel I would have regretted that decision. I'm glad that I stuck it out, shit games don't make themselves. 

I made the art, most of it, the two guns can be found here: http://u3d.as/ayJ
and everything else, programming and animation.

My friend Jake produced the music, you can find more of his band Days To Break's music here:
https://daystobreak.bandcamp.com/album/ambitions
and you can also find them on FaceBook here:
https://www.facebook.com/DaysToBreakOfficial/?ref=bookmarks

You can contact me on Twitter here: https://twitter.com/SaltyAssault

Overall, this was a good learning experience. I'll definitely be more prepared next time and probably create some sort of starter package that takes care of the more menial tasks like creating a menu, pausing, and other basic functionalities so that I have more time to focus on actually creating the rest of the game. 

I hope you enjoy. 

You'll probably need these...
Controls:
WASD: Movement
Mouse 1 + Mouse Movement: Controls direction that melee weapon swings in, release to swing melee weapon (Mount and Blade style)
Space: Jump

Esc: Pause Menu and settings

entries.title: Caveman's Sky
entries.description:
Caveman's Sky is an RTS Survival Crafting game where you control multiple units in their quest to save the world.

Mostly mouse controls. There is a quick tutorial in the beginning that should explain everything you need to know.  NOTE: You can cycle through your units with the TAB key.

**The embedded version doesn't quite fit, but the link to the Web version should work well in Firefox.

This is my 4th Ludum Dare, and the first time I felt like I didn't have enough time. While I'm happy with the finished product, there are a few graphical glitches, and collider issues I wish I could have fixed.

** My live-stream: twitch.tv/archonthewizard

All the art and sound assets are from the Unity Asset store.

A special thanks to everyone who watched my livestream on Twitch.  Your feedback was invaluable, and your support carried me through!

entries.title: Forty Two
entries.description:
Forty Two is a puzzle game about uncovering the secrets of everything ancient, alien and technological. Control multiple particles to power up each pyramid's particle accelerator-powered technology and find out what's beneath! Each pyramid unlocks a new mechanic.

CONTROLS (in case it's not obvious):
Left Click to do/place things
Right Click to remove things

BASIC GAMEPLAY (this is all visually explained in-game when each mechanic is introduced, but in case you want to read more stuff):
> Goal of the game is to get a particle to the corresponding end point of each level, with no stray particles.
> Particles of the same color bounce off against each other.
> Particles of different colors neutralize each other and form a block other particles can bounce off against.
> Portals teleport particles to the other portals.
> Splitters split a particle into two, with directions shown.
> Shifters shift the color of a particle.

Made for Ludum Dare 36 (#LDJAM) by a team of 3:
Diptoman Mukherjee (Programming, design)
Pranjal Bisht (Art, design)
Joel Montpetit (Audio)

entries.title: Hippie Horde
entries.description:

They believe that this will solve all of the world's environmental problems, and so they steal a time machine and travel back in time to try to tear down your machine. The goal is to shoot the hippies with your cannon before they reach your generator.

Controls:
Space to shoot

entries.title: I'm not saying it's aliens...
entries.description:

This game is a proof, that aliens were not able to build pyramids by themselves.

Keys:
    Mouse - look around
    WSAD - move UFO
    Q E  - rotate UFO
    R F  - move UFO up & down
    SPACE - enable/disable anti-gravity beam
    Scroll wheel - change beam size
    Esc - menu

Use alien holographic display for precision aim.
After you grab building blocks, they will be more or less locked in their position - remember to go up and down!

Disclaimer:
    Some sounds were created using downloaded samples. Following samples were used:
    - rock falls with cracking.mp3 (rock_on_ground) - SoundCollectah - https://www.freesound.org/people/SoundCollectah/sounds/157804/
    - two large cobblestone blocks (jobel0092) - https://www.freesound.org/people/jobel0092/sounds/268055/

entries.title: It Started Out With A Brick
entries.description:
HEADS UP: FOR SOME REASON UNBEKNOWNST TO ME, THE WEB BUILD RUNS INFINITELY FASTER IN FIREFOX - EVEN FASTER THAN THE DESKTOP BUILDS!

With one week left till school (starting high school!!!), I decided that a partaking in this game jam would be the perfect way to ease myself back into the pressure and general sleeplessness that accompanies school life. Thus I present to you, ladies and gentlemen, a beautiful ragdoll-and-blood-filled game featuring a genetic algorithm, a reference to 'The Killers' and my amazing piano arranging skills (as always, made in much less than 48 hours).

The "game" is a simulation of the development of (killing) technology - from ancient stuff (chucking bricks and rocks) to excitingly complex things like guns that fire guns.

What you have to do is simply to answer the questions at the start (these act as parameters for the simulation) and enjoy the ensuing carnage. The machines get pretty good at taking out entire crowds of ragdolls at about generation 5 so be patient.

Also, if any of you guys feel like building the game in Unity Pro and making it into a screensaver, hmu because that would be fab.

______________________________
THE ALGORITHM: I've used a genetic algorithm which basically means that the first generation is randomly generated. Then the most murderous of the first generation are bred together to produce a second even more murderous generation. It's basically natural selection on a computer!

entries.title: Just Another RTS
entries.description:
Another RTS.
Ma first Ludum Dare.
I know it's shit.

entries.title: Keep It Up!
entries.description:
Made on an actual boat, in 2 hours!
https://twitter.com/hashtag/shiplog?src=hash

The wind is strong and someone left the gunports open!

Inspired by real life events of 1628

entries.title: Map The Stars
entries.description:
You are an ancient astronomer working with a partner to try and create a book of star charts and maps but nothing can really be that simple. It's a text based adventure game crossed with some interactive elements. 

Some basic commands:
EXAMINE <item>
USE <item>
USE <item> ON <item>
EXIT
USE <direction> DOOR
PICK UP <item>

There are some others so if something doesn't work, try a few other choices.

Known bugs:
One of the lines of speech has <player name?> In it. I will fix this in the morning as it doesn't impact gameplay right now.

entries.title: Phase of the Scarab
entries.description:
Archaeologist (you) found a weird tomb full of scarabs that can be destroyed only with items that are in the same phase as they are. Use tombs ancient technology of phasing to destroy all the scarabs.
By standing in different phase circles, your hammer gets phased and will hurt scarab of same phase (red, blue, ...)

Controls: WASD or arrows for movement, left mouse click for throw attack

Tools used:
Unity 5.4
Visual Studio Community 2015
Paint.NET

entries.title: Pigtraptions
entries.description: Combine ancient machinery to create a jumbled contraption that will deliver the piggy to his lost carrot

entries.title: Primitive Spearfighting
entries.description:
A multiplayer spearfighting game where you are a savage fighting to the death against the opponent. You throw your spear and if you miss you have to travel to the location the weapon landed to pick it up and try again.

The game uses Java so must have it installed to play.

Controls:
A - go left
D - go right
W - jump
Mouse left click - throw spear to the location mouse is pointing at

Notice: we were not able to implement proper lag compensation in time so if you are far away from Frankfurt(where the server is hosted) or have a slow internet connection in general the game can be very hard to play, sorry about that.

entries.title: Pyramid of doom
entries.description:
Welp, I didn't even get close to finishing, but this is the first time I've done my own graphics so I wanted some feedback. And there's no way in hell I'll be able to go on another day, as I'm practically brain dead by now. So here you go!
Tell me what you think of the graphics please [:

entries.title: Quest For The Rounded Wheel
entries.description:
Quest For The Rounded Wheel. A game made in 48 hours.
A world where everything is squared. But your people have discovered the blueprint for the legendary Rounded Wheel, which will revolutionize your Ancient Wagon which uses unconventional squared wheels. You set out on a quest for collecting resources for constructing the wheel, however, a band of barbarians are trying to kill you, and steal your blueprint in the progess!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

DISCLAIMER

This is my first Ludum Dare and I underestimated the time required for creating the game I originally envisioned. But hey, the game is playable - so enjoy!
Also, any feedback would greatly be appreciated. Thanks in advance!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

HOW TO PLAY

The game plays like a simple RTS.
You start the game with 5 villagers, which each have different stats. Most importantly, the Gathering Skill determines how fast the villager collects resources, and Attack Power determines how fast the villager deal damage to barbarians.

To win the game, you have to collect all of the specified resource amounts in the top left corner.

You lose if all your villagers die, before collecting the specified amount of resources.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

CONTROLS

Camera control: 
- Movement: 'WASD' keys or arrow keys
- Rotate: 'Q' and 'E'

Selection units:
- Left click to select a Villager
- After selecting a villager, you can:
  * Right click to move him around.  
  * Right click on a resource to make him gather it.
  * Right click on your Ancient Wagon to store the current resource.
  * Right click on a barbarian to attack the barbarian.
- Left click on empty space to de-select the selected villager.

Various:
- 'h': moves camera to your Ancient Wagon

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

OTHER

- I was not able to test the Mac build, so let me know if there are any problems.
- The game was made using Unity 5.4, Blender and Photoshop.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

CHANGELOG

2016-08-29:
Fixed a bug where you could not select any villagers, if you lost a villager while having him selected.

entries.title: Tech Support, 3162
entries.description:
A weird visual novel-ish puzzle adventure game with aliens and a cell phone, and over twelve different endings.   

NOTE:  If you intend to get every ending, don't exit the game as there's no save feature.  Sorry.

entries.title: The Last Machine Before the World Ends
entries.description:
Here is our entry for Ludum Dare 36 ! It’s not “very” ancient technologies, but we’re very proud to have a game like this after our first LD ! 

It’s a 2D reflex/puzzle game where you have to activate modules of an old machine in time to save the world… Will you succeed ??

Controls : mouse only
You have to keep the time bars of each module full and wait for the next level to appear !

Made with : Unity, Photoshop, Ableton Live

entries.title: The Mystery of the Maniac AI
entries.description:
The ancient AI in charge of an electric grid monitoring system has been switching everybody's electricity on and off! Also it's been killing people. Go in and shut it down.

There are logic puzzles here, but it's a little bit different from what I've done in the past.

Tools:
Coding: Notepad++.
Testing: Chrome, Firefox, Edge.
Audio: FL Studio, Miroslav Philharmonik.
Code base: the reusable parts of my previous entry.

entries.title: Tower Miner
entries.description:
Hi!

This is our first attempt at making a tower defense game! Instructions are in-game.
We'r looking on feedback on how to better incorporate the mining aspect.

- Reyn/Clemens/Marlo/Greg

Thanks!

Quick thing made in one evening.

WSAD - move, IKJL - shoot.

entries.title: Adventure Time
entries.description:
Hey, 

our second LudumDare ends with a little adventure game.
We got a good programming time but less people.
We could have used an artist and some Questwriter, too.

But overall we got a way better game than LD35 (http://ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-35/?action=preview&uid=91426).

//DEMO Version///

Move- WASD
Action - F
Fastmove dialog - Enter

Play and enjoy, AND leave a comment!

Team:

All textures and sounds are selfmade except for some tiles :
