entries.description:
This game is meant to be played with two people at the same keyboard. You both start off as triangles, and compete in a series of simple minigames. If you win a minigame, your polygon gains one side. To win, get to 8 sides.

Note: We originally brainstormed some ideas in which you started off as a triangle and eventually became a wheel (or circle), which turned into this. It doesn't relate much to the original theme, but you can imagine some backstory in which a bunch of shapes are competing to become the first-ever wheel. This game also uses a lot of mathematics/physics, which I'd say is a prime example of ancient technology. :P This is also the first game we've ever made, so we hope you have fun and would love any feedback.

Controls

Player 1/yellow polygon: WASD

Player 2/green polygon: arrow keys

Made in HaxeFlixel.

entries.title: Sandy City
entries.description:
Sandy City is a game developed for Ludum Dare 36.

It is a game where you have to survive the attacks of the other cities and build the biggest pyramid the world has ever seen.

How to run:
Install OpenAL and Visual Studio Redistributable 2015 x86, which are provided with the executable.

How to play:
Move with WASD and hold right click to rotate.
You can scroll through the building by clicking the arrows on the left and you can select one by clicking on it. If you have enough money and energy, you will successfully select it.

Win by building pyramids in the center of the map (3x3).
Lost by letting the battering rams get to the pyramids.
Destroy the battering rams by repeatedly clicking on them.

Get gold by building gold mines on gold. They will disappear after a while and you can only have 2 at a time (not enough workers).
Get energy by building temples and shrines.

Programs, libraries and tool used:
Visual Studio Community 2015 - IDE
Ducky - game engine (made by me)
Photoshop CS6, PaintDotNet - image editing
Blender - 3d models
Fruity Loops - music
Audacity - sfx
Chronolapse - recording

Timelapse video:
https://youtu.be/bhSnl_ccR6U

Hope you like it and have a nice day :)

entries.title: The Physician
entries.description:
--------
Be a caveman!
Be a doctor!

No wait, be both at once!

In this small game, you play as a Caveman Physician.
(undoubtebly a most prestigious one at that)

As is your job description, cavemen from the village come to you with health problems,
and you FIX them!
Of course, maybe you're a failure... and then the problems don't go away.

Or maybe you make a horrible mistake and accidentally kill them.
(no wait. Scratch that. Don't kill them please)

Or maybe you just like killing people, and wanna see if you can make everyone die!
(but only if you're a completionist. You don't get a special achievement for that. seriously)

Click objects to look or use them!
Read what they say!
Or don't!
(really, whatever suits you)

Maybe you'll even get to die once or twice!
(but seriously, what fun is that?)
-------
And now more seriously:

1. This is a WINDOWS game.
Tested on Windows 10, but should work on most other Windows platforms.

2. You'll need a copy of .NET 4 to start the game.

http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=17851

(if you don't already have it)

3. Hopefully in the next LD we'll find a more comfortable platform to release this in. Sorry for the inconvinience! :(
-------
Enjoy!

entries.title: The Truth About The Pyramids
entries.description:
Story:

As we all know, the pyramids were built by Aliens. What most people don't know is that the pyramids are actually spaceships that were used to conquer the earth! Let's rewind 5000 years into the past and re-experience the moment of us overcoming their attack in the thrilling, photo realistic sci-fi shooter!

================================

Goals:

You are the mage defending against the pyramid. Don't die.
If all the people die, you lose.
Kill the pyramid to win.

================================

Controls:

WASD - Move
Left mouse button - Press to place a magical rocket - hold down to charge - release to fire. If the rocket doesn't hit the pyramid it will fall back to earth and explode, so watch out!
Right mouse button - Hold down the right mouse button and make a circle with the mouse to create a shield. The shield will be created when you let go of the mouse button. The bigger the shield, the shorter it will last.

================================

Comments (feel free to skip this part):

Personally I think this has much lower quality than my other LD entries. I was planning to only work on it for 6 hours, so my ambition level was very low. I did it all on my laptop while stationed in the sofa. It turned into double the time I had planned, and at least it turned out good enough to kill a bit of time for me. What I think personally it's missing the most (as in, it could obviously be improved in pretty much every single other aspect as well :) ) is stuff like intros, outros, health meters and other indicatiors. And sound of course. The idea was for the pyramid to crash and take the position it's in today when you kill it. Anyway, pay attention to the pyramid just wreaking havoc on the world if you do nothing. That's probably what turned out the best. If you scare the people that start outside the houses they will also act a bit more naturally, they're less static after that.

================================

Original description:

The truth about the Pyramids. I'm too tired to explain anything - I'll be back for that! :)

I had very little time this time around, but I squeezed something in :)

entries.title: Windmill Will
entries.description:
The game has to be full screen to play. Mute tab to mute music... sorry.
Left/Right or A/D. Space bar to lift legs. R to restart.

The foliage (GREEN stuff) breaks your car. The fire (RED stuff) will hurt you. The dinos will hurt you and your car.

A physics based game that tests the limits of caveman automotive technology, and hip joints.

So much work needs to be done to make this a complete game, but for my first Jam entry, I'm kind of proud. I am deeply sorry for the music... I was in a rush!

I was inspired by the QWOP genre of games. I did have cool ideas that would have been a lot more conceptually interesting, but then I also have Windmill Willy. He has lopped his way into my heart, and refuses to leave. I have accepted this union.

entries.title: Witch Stuff?
entries.description:
I started late. Finished later.

I had to cut a load out of the game.
I haven't tested much of it either.

Sorry for the lack of music (I have it, just didn't manage to add it in time).

You play as a Witch (I know it looks just like one).

You need to cure all the villagers, by speaking to them with "SPACE" you can find out their ailments and tips for cures.

All interactions happen with space, so if you see something pop up at the bottom hit space.

Walk with WASD or arrow keys.

No time limit/win condition/end condition. Sorry! 

Use the ancient technology of medicine! No matter how primitive.
(ancient medical technology).

entries.title: You Go First
entries.description: Explore the ruins with your loyal meat shields.

entries.title: Ancient Tech Playground
entries.description:
Simple physics sandbox made for LD36, in 7 hours. There is no objective. Play around with the control panel. Shoot water physics particles, tweak gravity, create castles, destroy castles, whatever you like! Try creating interesting situations by tweaking objects in mid-simulation pause mode.

Send me feature requests at [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

entries.title: Charles 2 - Charles and the Ancient Ruins
entries.description:
#LDJAM

Charles 2
Charles and the Ancient Ruins

This is our first sequel! Our highly imaginative bunny comes back for another round in 'Ancient Ruins.'

After doing some studying with his friend Sammy the Otter, Charles sits alone to read while waiting for him to return.
As he falls asleep, he begins to dream of hunting for ancient treasure...

BASIC CONTROLS: (and their default keys)

KEYBOARD (Compatible with gamepads as well)

UP - Interact with object, screen, sign, etc. (Up)
DOWN - Dodge, Pick up something and put it in your pocket (Down)
LEFT / RIGHT - Walk, highlight tool/weapon/item (Left/Right)
SPRINT - You move faster but burn up stamina (Shift)
JUMP - Hop hop hop! (Space)
LEFTHAND - Use a tool/weapon, Pick up something and instantly equip it to Left Hand. (C)
RIGHTHAND - Use a tool/weapon Pick up something and instantly equip it to Right Hand. (V) 

ENTER - Item Menu: You can access your tools/weapons/items here.
      - Select, Drop, Equip items. You can assign 2 tools/weapon (One per hand)
ESCAPE - Map, Game Menu: You can customize controls, volume, window size here.


TIPS: 

EXPLORE - There are hidden items aound in the game for you to discover and pick up.
CHECK POINTS- Check points heal you a little bit whenever you discover a new one.
SAVE BOMBS - You may want them for things other than blowing up creatures!
THERE ARE 2 DUNGEONS - Once you have bombs, you can enter the second dungeon (The 1st is blasted open for you already!)

This is a collaboration between Jimun Batty (who did all the coding, sounds, character work and awesome scripting stuffs), and Chip Caramel (who did all the world art, tiles, and music).

This was a tough and thoroughly fun challenge and we hope you enjoy it!

entries.title: Evacuate
entries.description:
Here it is! My entry for Ludum Dare 36. I actually feel pretty good about this one. It's not perfect, but it's far more polished than anything else I've done.

You are the leader of a small group of villagers. Your people start in the ancient caveman era, and through science, slowly advance to the modern age. Your lands are plagued by monsters and you must escape! Advance your technology to build a rocket and flee to a better home.

The game was created in Java using the standard libs. The art was created in Gimp and the sounds were created in BFXR. All assets/code were created by me within the 48 hours.

Feedback is welcome and encouraged. Please let me know what you think and especially what I should have done differently! Thank you all and happy Ludum Dare!

entries.title: farm defence
entries.description:
the game takes a few seconds to load,there i no preloader.
the game is a computer game, it dosnt work on tablets and smartphones.

/////controls////////

movement = w,a,s,d or arrow keys

place farm and traps etc with mouse left click(long click and not on top of other stuff).
also left click to use sword.

build:(1,2,3,4 keys)
farm = press 1  (costs :40 credits)
spike trap = press 2  (costs :10 credits)
wood fence = press 3  (costs :20 credits)
crossbow tower = press 4  (costs :50 credits)

if anything is not clear write in the comments.

/////how to play////////

at first build only farms to build your economy(build farms only).
you can do that until wave 10 or 8.
then you build a crossbow tower on each side.
add some fences and spike trap,survive a few waves.
when you reach 900 credits you win.

the monsters are weak at the first 10 waves,after that you will need traps and turrets.
they have an attack timer so if you hit them fast you wont get hurt.

the monsters will attack farms at random, you will have a small amount of time to save the farm when they reach it.


//////devlopment experience////////

this is my second ludum dare.

i wanted to make a top down shooter. but becuse of the theme i made a top down slasher.
the genre i choose was arcade defence. its easy to implement and ive done this before (i have a tower defence framework prototype and other defence type games under my belt).
after the first day and all the bugs and proformnce issus my dom based js engine have.
i realised i wont be  able to implement everything i wanted it wasnt realistic.
i droped sound effects and ui...

next time i wont be using it im moving on to phaser,it has everything i need and more, plus i can port my framework on top of it so my workflow wont change.

the code of this game is a mess becuse of time pressure usually i try to be more efficent and create reusable methods and classes.
i manged to create two behaviors before it went to hell, i had to sacrifice alot to be able to make time for everything.
writing this,uploading the game to github. creating a small 8bit track and a logo (almost two hours).
also i had to use a gif recorder to record gameplay.

i created the --game art-- on the first day, im a programmer not an artist.

in the last ludum dare it was easier i only had to implement 2-4 mechanics to create. an original game is harder to create.
and most of the time 2-4 mechanics is not enough.

but as i get used to it i will be able to take larger scope two day projects.


ludum dare have thought me alot about myself,my tools ,self discipline,staying calm under pressure,setting goals,and "finishing" another game.
this compo/jam is great for the aspiring game developer, which is a dream of alot of us.
i hope one day i will get into the indie industry and make a living from what i love to do.

------critique-------
if you have any critique shot. i know of alot of bugs. but i wouldn't mind hearing from other people.

-------previous ludum dare:------
35)

http://ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-35/?action=preview&uid=80283

////////contact form:

https://programingstuff.wordpress.com/%D7%A6%D7%95%D7%A8-%D7%A7%D7%A9%D7%A8/

------------bugs and error fixed--------------

*" when i buy anything, it spawn far off to the right (outside of the frame), thus at first i tho its didnt spawn. "fixed 3 hours before compo was over thank you  Ghen 

*player rotation problem,i think i fixed it (mouse difference between game container and global page xy)fixed 3 hours before compo was over.

entries.title: Golem Hunt
entries.description:
Very crude survival game prototype: fight skeletons and ancient golems, on an endless map.

BEWARE: the webgl version does not work with the infinite map,
maybe the windows version is not that ok with it too :/
but at least the later does not crash.

Controls: arrows to move; left control for primary weapon; left alt for secondary. Alt+F4 exit.

Authors: Carlo "zED" Caputo; Ivan Garcia Filho; Ary Monteiro and Fernando Marcok.

entries.title: HighFly
entries.description:
The first ever game created by the NDSU Bison Robotics team. This game was made of the CraftStudio engine, and features many different levels with a wide assortment of themes.

Key Controls: Use W to move up, and S to move down.

Hud: Lives are displayed in the upper left corner. Number in the upper right corner is a timer. The level played switches randomly at the 30 second marker.

Hope you enjoy it!

entries.title: History Class
entries.description: Fight you're way through history in your dreams!

entries.title: Hollywood is Loomynarty
entries.description:
This is a game about how the ancient egyptician technology helped the loomynarties (23Δ) to create Hollywood.

The commands are simple : 
Up: move foward
Down: nothing
Left: turns left
Right: turns right
Spacebar: shoots

Every action spends energy, the loomyship (the spaceship) is powered by shootingstars energy, so collect shooting stars to increase the energy.

Nothing more than survive and shoot, make some score and stuff. Enjoy!

entries.title: Keysmash
entries.description:
Keysmash is a game about smashing keys.

Long ago, when the egyptian empire was strong and... actually, there is no story in this game. You just destroy keyboards because fun.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Get a friend to play this with.
2. Sit down in front of the computer and start the game.
3. The stones at the bottom of the pulleys will display a letter. Press your letter to lift your stone.
4. The letter will change after each button press you do, so prepare to fight over the keyboard.
5. Whoever reaches the top first wins!

Please note that the Web Version is missing some small graphical details.

entries.title: Most Ancient of Technologies - Catapult
entries.description:
Prepare to experience the most ancient of technologies as you play the game Catapult! 
What mysterious ancient technology awaits you? You must play to find out!

Left/Right - Move
Spacebar - Action

(I opted to not post a screenshot of the actual gameplay so as to not ruin the surprise of the amazing ancient technology)


----------Rights Stuff----------
Sounds generated in sfxr
Music from Opsound.org [Public Domain]
Icons made by: 
HeavenlyDog, Lorc, and Skoll [Creative Commons 3.0 BY (http://game-icons.net)]
Additional Art Assets:
Ancient greek text - Ioannis Kontomitros [Creative Commons Attribution 2.0]
Illustration from "Bilderbuch für Kinder" [Public Domain (Old)]
Tour De Marbault clipart [Public Domain (OpenClipart.org)]

entries.title: Mr. BigCash
entries.description:
A puzzle game here.

Play as a couple of treasure hunters descending 9 floors in the ancient temple. Unveil what artefact of ancient technology the mysterious Mr. BigCash wants you to bring him.

Don't forget to go to "Instructions" section in the menu.
Controls: 
WASD - move (AZERTY and Dvorak should work too)
Tab - switch character
Shift - push/pull stones
M - toggle music
Ctrl+R - restart level

Good luck!

Any feedback/questions welcome!

Version 1.1.1
- Fixed lags on some systems (hopefully)
- Fixed character facing at level start
- Fixed grammar error

Version 1.1
- Added dialogue
- Fixed minor bugs
- Tweaked graphics a bit

Powered by HaxeFlixel.

Credits:

Igor S. at twitter.com/IgorsGames
Egor at facebook.com/egor69ok or twodreams.ru
Fedor at vk.com/jackerton or fedoreli [at] mail [dot] ru
Font: Banksia by Daniel (goodreasonblog.com/fontery)

entries.title: old stuff
entries.description: play around with some old stuff

entries.title: Phaust The Weird  Cat
entries.description: Sry for the site being in js fiddle its my first ludum dare and i didn't know how to upload my game into a website

entries.title: Pre-ARC
entries.description:
How to play:
You go on the link or start the embed game, afterwards you and at least another friend go to the airconsole.com site and enter the session number the game gave you. Your phones are now your controllers for the game.
If you don't have a friend readily at your site try the AirConsole Simulator link.
The 'restart' button doesn't work, I don't know why it's still included in this version.

Here's an imgur album to show the correct screens in order: https://imgur.com/gallery/5LjkF

@D_Sostre and I(@derGeruhn) made a game about traveling space as a Pre-Archological Response Command. The task is to visit planets and assess when the civilization of that planet is ready for space travel. Visit them again once the counter is down and welcome them to your alliance to ensure your dominance in this sector.

The first time we made anything with AirConsole so I definitely left a comfort zone there.

Used engines/frameworks while jamming:
PlayCanvas (dumped)
PhaserJS (dumped)
Unity3d
AirConsole

Used languages (all in final game):
JavaScript
HTML
CSS
C#

Team:
@D_Sostre: Graphics
@derGeruhn: Code

Story

Surviving in this world never have been easy.
Especially with the ability to roam the galaxy, many dangers lie ahead of us but also new allies!
Explore the universe and find as much friendly units as you can in order to form a mighty alliance. Each world needs a certain amount of time to be ready. With your first visit, you gain knowledge about their progress of technology, so be there in time before they start setting out!
We can only survive if we stay together...

entries.title: Recurrence
entries.description:
Hey there!
Here is our little submission "RECURRENCE".

Fly around with arrow-keys.
Shoot some meteoroids with space (or v).
Toggle help with h.

Quit with ESC.

Have fun!


PS:
There is not much to do because our gameplay is missing :(


Team:
 interru
 nikikoe
 urfoex

Made with C++ and libSDL2.

entries.title: Revenge of Sacred Cat
entries.description:
The people of an ancient land have turned their backs on the all powerful deity, Sacred Cat! But now Sacred Cat returns to the land to eradicate the heretics of the false god, The Frog.

Arrow Keys + Spacebar

Play in fullscreen!

entries.title: Sephiroth
entries.description:
The 10 skies....
Behold...The ancient power...Lost....How and why?
The lost temple...holds an artifact...of great 'light'....wield it...and you WILL die....
Arrow keys-movement
left mouse button-attack
Right mouse button-shield 
Alt+F4 exit.

KILL EVERYTHING AND YOU WILL PROBABLY DIE
2016
Xelidous

entries.title: Smoke Signals
entries.description:
This is my unfinished entry. I would suggest running from the command line so you get feed back. Basically control your troops with smoke signals. Pressing space will signal, you can do either long or short. If you take too long it will confuse your troops and mess it all up. To signal first you choose which troop you want to address then what you want them to do.

Honestly I'm not sure you should try to play it because its still way into the development state and has no UI.

I think next LD I'll be teaming so I have motivation to complete it.

entries.title: Soaring with the Ancients
entries.description:
Soaring with the Ancients is an exploration game were you must use your ancient flying technology to explore the land and discover all the ancient landmarks.

Soaring with the Ancients was made in 72 hours by one person, ME! -xzippyzachx

If you want to see a full time lapse of me making this game check out my you tube channel and it will be available there soon! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UChIh-0hvTYlwhqsdRWmtc7g

------

Controls

Quit: esc
Roll: A & D
Yaw: Q & E
Air Brake: S
Pitch: Move mouse up and down
Free Look: Hold left-alt and use mouse to look

links.label: Time-lapse of me making the game

entries.title: Tech-Alchemist
entries.description:
In Tech-Alchemist you are able to create newer technologies by combining two older ones. You start from ancient times, with only natural resources, and as you progress you may be able to reach classic, industrial or even future technology! Are you up to the challenge?

Note from the author:
There are a lot of missing icons, as making them is a lot of work for only about 36 hours.
I will be uploading an updated version soon with all the icons. I think it doesn't break the rules of the Jam, and will provide a better user experience.

** Update 0.2 **
- New icons, for a total of 62.
- Tweaked some elements' epoch to be more realistic.
- Android: Buttons are larger, so they are easier to press.

entries.title: The great catapult war
entries.description:
Description:
This is a strategy game for two players. The goal of the game is to defeat your opponents catapult army. Rules are included in the game. 

HINT: An important part of the game is to control the bonus fields. If you owns and controls a bonus field, at least for few turns, the victory can soon become yours.

Controls:
The game is most point and click with the mouse.

- Mouse wheel:  Zoom
- Right mouse button: Rotates camera
- Escape: Quit game
- R: Restart the game
- L: Toggles the graphics setting from high to low


Used Software:
- Unreal engine 4
- Blender
- GIMP 2
- Paint.NET
- Inkscape
- Audacity


Have fun and please leave a comment.

entries.title: thepyramid
entries.description:
Explore the depth of an egyptian pyramid but beware of traps and other kinds of Ancient Technology...
And don't let the mechanical anubis-guardian get you.

To trigger the "good end" you have to collect all five treasures in the pyramid.
Maybe talking to the NPCs will help you to solve the puzzles.

Arrow Keys / WASD to move
E / Spacebar to interact
Mouse for close ups/puzzles (Click to interact)

IF YOU HAVE PERFORMANCE ISSUES:
- Use the Post-Jam version.
- Alternatively set "Darkness" to "Bright" in the menu but that doesnt look nearly as cool.

Made in C++ with SDL, SDL_image, SDL_mixer, SDL_ttf and SDL_gfx

Junber - Programming, all sorts of stuff
NonSans - "Graphics", Game and Level Design
MarC - Music and Sound

Changes for Post-Jam:
- Incresed performance
- Increased size of player light making "realistic"-mode playable
- End-door actually emitts lights
- Dust particles dis-/appear if you change to/from Bright setting
- (Hopefully) made the hint for one puzzle more clear
- Made Torch-flickering look less shitty
- Redid all text screens without anti-aliasing to look more like the menu
- End-screen no longer sometimes ends because of previous input
- Pressing Space or E now quits puzzle mode
- You no longer see the light of torches behind walls

Have fun!

entries.title: Ugh
entries.description:
Try and invent your way to modern society.

Was not inspired by the game. Got bored by it. Didn't finish it. Uploaded what I got done anyway.

entries.title: Xolotl
entries.description:
Storyline:
Your name is Sun. You are walk the lonely road to the underworld but an aztec deity named Xolotl decides to help you on your way.

============================================
Walk - Left/Right Arrow
Jump - Spacebar
Teleport - Down Arrow
============================================
Game created in Defold for Ludum Dare 36 - Compo, 2016

Yes I know the game has a steep difficulty curve. It's only 7 levels so try beat them all :)

If totally stuck and want easier levels you can download version that is POST COMPO here:
https://setthebet.itch.io/xolotl



Superhappy for all types of feedback.

entries.title: A Blind Man's Text
entries.description:
It is the year 1513.
One day, in front of your house you find a 50 year old printing press. Since you don't have a job, you decide to start a business.

This game isn't finished and a lot of big components aren't implemented in this build. For updates follow the itch.io page 

CONTROLS: Click on the letters to type ( to use the printing press they had to stack each letter on individually ); Hold SHIFT for uppercase letters.

DOWNLOAD: To download please scroll down the page and click download.

entries.title: Agnes the Explörer
entries.description:
Agnes is a what she calls her self ”Modern Explörer”.
When Agnes was a little girl she found a small glowing crystal.
All her life she have been searching for answers.

One day, in a museum far away she found a door.
This is where you get to help Agnes to find here way.

Dungeon Crawler.
Main mission is to find your way to the Crystal of Saviors.

Use WADS to move.
To open the inventory click i or click on Agnes.

The rest is up to you to figure out.


Good luck and have fun!


A Znibben and Bootat game.

entries.title: An Ancient Mistery
entries.description:
A bomb has been planted, and a detective specialized in ancient misteries was called. Could he be able to deactivate it? 

This game uses the "ancient technology" of criptography. Discover both the cypher and the key that were used to activate the bomb and type the correct password to disarm it!

You can take your time :-)

PS: Google is your friend.

entries.title: Blunderbuss
entries.description:
F= Fullscreen 

Welcome to Blunderbuss! Use your colorful blunderbuss to shoot at things, endlessly. Avoid deadly enemies, get powerups, and shoot all the things!

It is recommended to play fullscreen. You can also download a standalone version.

You may have to click once in the gamezone so it becomes the active zone of your web page.

entries.title: Bumper Battle
entries.description:
Gain score for disrupting the energy beams of other players while protecting your own.

GENRE
Couch-Coop

CREDITS
Programming: Kutsarit "Kutsi" Vanthavongsee
Game Design, Art: Stefan Kringe
Sound: Matthias Droll

TOOLS
Unity
Visual Studio
Photoshop
Audacity
BFXR

entries.title: CaveKillers
entries.description:
Explore a primitive world, fight cavemen with your rifle and RPG, and collect the gold you lost while in space.

WASD moves your character, the mouse looks around and left click fires your chosen weapon. Cycle between your weapons with 1 (for your rifle) and 2 (for your rocket launcher). Don't let the cavemen stab you to death with their spears!

entries.title: Door to Door Door Salesman
entries.description:
You've just invented the best thing ever: it's some wood that you put in front of your house to make it into a distinct space from the outside. You call this invention the "door" and it's going to change the world!

Your neighbors just don't get your genius so you'll have to "convince" them how great it would be to have a door. Maybe if you demonstrate how anyone could walk into their house and start breaking things, hypothetically. If they had a door they couldavoid this "hypothetical" situation.

Sell doors to the whole village and maybe you'll get the attention of someone special ;)


A/D to move left/right.
Space to jump. 
W to enter doors and climb ladder. 
Q to try to sell your door. 
E to swing your briefcase full of doors, you can't be blamed for anything it might happen to hit.

Art by Karl, https://twitter.com/B4CONL4KE
Programming by Andy https://twitter.com/Dwemthy

entries.title: Eye of the Boulder
entries.description:
You play as a caveman called Sir Hamelot, and his assistant Brock.

Our first Ludum Dare entry. Unfortunately we ran out of time so there's currently only one level and no goal.

Controls
=====

- Control Sir Hamelot using the WASD keys
- Control Brock using the arrow keys
- Press space to wait
- Press escape to pause the game.

Team - Jolly Llama Games
================

Detrohutt - [GitHub](https://github.com/Detrohutt)

Soullesswaffle - [GitHub](https://github.com/Soullesswaffle)

entries.title: Flight of Daedalus
entries.description:
=======================
Flight of Daedalus
=======================

Daedalus a mighty inventor is stuck in a tower because of his great ego. He must fashion a way to escape his jailer that does not use land or sea. He sees birds in the sky and knows that today is the day he conquers the air.

He must fashion another set of wings for himself as the first pair was for his son, Icarus.


=======================
Controls
=======================
Default:

Left arrow - left
Right arrow - right
Z - Attack
X - Interact
Space - Jump

Keys can be rebound on menu screen.

========================
Known Issues
========================
1. Music and sound setting must be chosen for sound and music to be heard. There is an issue where the default is not being assigned.
2. Guards don't do anything, there was no time for their code.
3. There is an interact button, try using it when next to or on something, it does work.
4. Color scheme sucks, I know.
5. Yes, acceleration was intentional. By request I won't use it in the future.

entries.title: Gears
entries.description:
Created as part of JamBridge. Made with the open source Godot engine.

Connect the yellow gear to the driving green gears with some of the falling gears to make it spin. Once you have, you wil advance to a new level (see counter in the bottom right).

If a gear is conflicted about which way it should move (e.g. if three moving gears are in mutual contact) it will break.

Hit space to reset the level. Page up and page down can be used to skip through levels.

entries.title: Golden Ruins
entries.description:
Solve each puzzle to open doors in the ancient ruins. Drag and drop the pieces from the bottom to the slots. Make sure each slot is filled out. Highlight the icons on the left to see the rules for each row. Click execute after you have placed all your pieces.

Music starts muted.

---

Source is under downloads on itch.io

entries.title: Hand Cranky
entries.description: Using the "ancient" technology of a hand crank rail cart you must outrun the avalanche of rocks chasing you!  How far can you get before you are inevitably crushed?

entries.title: I Shall Duel Thee At Dawn
entries.description:
A competitive typing flintlock pistol duel!
Hit the prompted keys when they flash to load your fiddly gun, and when the clock strikes noon, hit your corresponding CTRL key to fire!
Played on one keyboard with two players, so fight over the buttons to honour your duty!

Fun levels, like RAVE and MOON! Period specific victory sounds! The fast paced thrill of Duelling for the modern gamer!

#GETREKT #MLG

entries.title: Incinerator
entries.description:
Incinerate all these boxes containing ancient technology. Upgrade burners and conveyors. 

(Unity HTML5)

entries.title: Into The Ground

entries.title: Spectacular Stride Machine
entries.description:
Spectacular Stride Machine is an endless runner with balance control mechanics about one of the forgotten steam inventions and it's owner.

Back in 1876, England:
"It's alive! I was finnaly able to make it move! My SPECTACULAR STRIDE MACHINE! MWAHAHAHA! Time for a walk to the patent office! Let's see who has the last laugh then!"  - Unknown inventor.

Today, Lithuania: 
Team KAMAN has found some old blueprints of an unknown machine. It was a gadget invented by a scientist [UNREADABLE NAME], who lived in Victorian England and used steam as the main source of power for his inventions. Unfortunately, the mechanism seems to be nonfunctioning and impossible to make.

***************

Instruction:
Avoid obstacles by changing the height of the Stride Machine.
Keep balance by adjusting the tilt of the Machine.

Controls:
Arrows left/right - Lean machine left / right
Arrows up/down - Adjust height level of the machine

Team KAMAN:
Ksenia Shatunova @xushaw – art
Anton Kolchunov @garfeild – coding
Monika Anastasija Daunyte @artisacurse – art and animations
Andrew Vasiliev @Andrew_Chewie – coding

entries.title: Blow Dart Arena
entries.description: This was a game made in Unity where you ran around and shot other people with a dart gun. Multi player kinda works!

entries.title: Coinsortium
entries.description:
This is a 2D physics-based puzzle to sort Roman coins into their different types. When you click the start button, 20 random coins of the types visible on the bottom will appear. You need to create a sequence of ramps to sort the different coins into the correct slots. If you get them all in the right slot, you'll get the maximum 20 points for that prototype.

There are a few points I didn't manage to get into the in-game instructions:

* Right-click or click the polygon icon on the left again to finish a polygon.
* You can't create concave polygons yet (since box2djs doesn't work well with them). The game should stop you creating concave polygons.
* If you click inside a polygon when you're in polygon creation mode you'll highlight a corner. You can nudge that corner using the arrow keys to finely adjust the polygon.
* Use the pin tool to anchor stone shapes to the back wall, otherwise they'll fall off. If you anchor in one point the shape can rotate. If you anchor it in two places it will be fixed.
* The coins have different densities as well as sizes, which might help you sort them.

There are probably still a lot of bugs left - if you find any, I apologise, and if you let me know what happened I'll try and fix it.

entries.title: Crucifixion
entries.description:
Crucifixion
By Lon Porter
Built with Processing and Processing.js
Released 2016/08/28

For Ludum Dare 36 Competition - Theme: Ancient Technology

Press Space to take a breath before you black out and succumb 
to suffocation, but you can only take so many breaths before 
blood loss and exhaustion take their toll.
Press c for another crucifixion.

“To talk about a cross in the ancient world would be like talking today
about instruments of torture. Listen to some of the ways people in the
ancient world talked about crucifixion:
	Punished with limbs outstretched, they see the stake as their fate;
	they are fastened and nailed to it in the most bitter torment, evil
	food for birds of prey and grim pickings for dogs.“

“Another Roman writer, Seneca, speaks of the variety of creative options
open to the sadistic executioner: “I see crosses there, not just of one kind
but made in many different ways: some have their victims with head down
to the ground; some impale their private parts; others stretch out their arms
on the gibbet.”
-Two sections from The Gospel and the Cross, by Craig Van Gelder published 1999.

entries.title: Da Vinci vs Ancient Creators
entries.description:
In the year 2560 BC the ancient Egyptians raised the great pyramids of Giza, but how did they do that? What ancestral technology did they used to achieve success? This question has turned crazy scientists for years, but not anymore. 4070 years later the true creators have returned to claim their works, and only one of the brightest minds of today may save us!

-------------
INSTRUCTIONS
Move with up and down arrow keys
Shoot with spacebar
-------------

Made with: Unity 3D, Photoshop, bfxr

Authors: 
Kate
Rac
Tetsu
Maca

------------
VERSION 1.1:

Fixed bugs: 
-health bar now displays and updates correctly. 
-Score shows up in game over screen
-Background moves properly without freezing

Small improvements to gameplay (as it was quite un-balanced):
-Improved collision for character: Da Vinci's wings don't get hit
-Improved spawning of enemies
-Improved character movement: removed inercy
-Improved shooting speed of character

entries.title: doomed
entries.description:
a last ditch attempt to save something, after failing.
Its a pretty weird first person thing, watch the youtube video if stuck on first part.

entries.title: Ember
entries.description:
Fire, such an ancient technology... but have you ever been stranded in the woods without a lighter?  Not such a simple task.  Winter is coming and our people will freeze if we can't keep the fire alive.  Chop and collect wood and feed the fire... if you let it die, welp.. GG.

Community Submission from Twitch.  At least 66 people contributed to this game, completed in just 53 hours.  The source is available and open source, we hope some will take it from here.

Created @ twitch.tv/HardlyDifficult

entries.title: George and the Mighty Ancient's technology (VR)
entries.description:
George and the Mighty Ancient's technology is an experiment where you play George, a mighty deep-sea diver. He wanted to discover some ancient artefacts but he might discover a terrible secret...

Would you survive to this quest ?

Compo entry: all assets and game made in 48h. I wanted to do so much more, any idea for improving is welcome.

Controls: 
- look around with the mouse or your head when using cardboard VR
- press any key to move forward, or the Cardboard button in VR

Help:
- why would you need help, you're a mighty player, aren't you?
- There is 2 version of the game: one for PC/Mac and one for Android using Cardboard VR
- Don't go too fast or you might experiment dialogue overlap
- The game is not optimized yet, let me know if you have performance problem

UPDATE:
- New version available with ending screens and bug fix
- itch.io page: https://jacqueslelezard.itch.io/mighty

entries.title: Golems!
entries.description:
In Golems, you control a team of 3 good (red) golems, and must block the 2 evil (gray) golems.  You see all 3 golems viewpoints simultaneously, and can control them by clicking in their views (top to go forward, bottom to turn around, etc.).  You win by blocking the evil golems so that they can't move for ~20s.

This was an experiment on a number of fronts.
- I wanted to play around with having multiple viewpoints (and not initially even knowing how they correlate). 
- I wrote this using Scala.js, having not written any Scala before, so it's been a learning experience.
- I'd done very little Blender modelling (and no animation) before.

In retrospect, I should have spent more time on gameplay - it was quite ambitious (given all the learning) and I only actually got a game going in in the last few hours.

entries.title: I am the Destroyer
entries.description:

I have been imprisoned to prevent me from wreaking my havok upon the surface of this earth...I shall escape...

entries.title: National Egyptian Slave Racing League
entries.description:
Welcome to the 36th annual Slave Racing World Cup! We’ve got a fantastic lineup for you folks today, it’s sure to be a race for the ages! While the racers are making their way up to the starting line, let’s have a look at who’s competing, shall we?

A brand new face to the slave racing scene, you're taking the reins as "The Rookie", a young slave racer ready to make history in the big leagues!

Whip your slaves to achieve maximum speed, swerve and drift your way around the track, and knock your opponents out of the way to cross the finish line first!

Left click to whip your (and your opponent's) slaves
M to toggle the Map on and off
TAB to toggle the Third Person Camera on and off
CAPSLOCK to switch to Cinematic Mode (good luck playing in this) :P

Space to slow your slaves down
R to reset your position if you get stuck

ESC will lock/unlock the cursor

Made in 72 hours by
Alexi Bay (Programming, UI, Unity Stuff)
Noah Gracey (3D Art, Texturing)
Timon Incze (Sound Effects, Voices)

entries.title: One Man Army
entries.description:
You have entered yourself in an arena match, in the match you will be faced against an entire army.

PS

The button hit-boxes are messed up for some reason.
There is also a little Easter egg, see if you can find it.

entries.title: PHOSPHORUS
entries.description:
PHOSPHORUS is one of those games you play on an ancient oscilloscope screen, just like the famous "Tennis for Two". 

Since you probably don't have such a device, I made it run in LÖVE instead.

How far can you climb the tower?

A few hints:
* You can jump higher when you go faster.
* You can create combos by at least twice in a row skipping one level of the tower. You can get really high scores that way!

entries.title: Relics of Karnage
entries.description:
Welcome to Relics of Karnage! The 2D platformer where you shoot EVERYTHING many times! Explosions! Boss fights! Online scores! You name it, we got it!

This is a game for MEN!

Controls:
_________

* The usual W, A, S, D
* Left click to shoot (hold it down like a man)

entries.title: Return of the Ancient Technological Golems
entries.description:
First ever gamejam, lots of fun!

Adventure RPG overworld with top-down slasher action!

An ancient race of Technological Golems has returned and driven humanity from the land.  Only you, a Half-Golem put into a self-imposed slumber, can purge them from the world once and for all.

Collect runes to level up!

Z to slash
Arrows to Move
Space to Dash!

Credits to other people:
A Opengameart water tile used!
Everything else:  Return of the Ancient Technological Golems Team!

edit: Re-uploaded to fix exceptions!

entries.title: Ruins of ZZT
entries.description:
Ruins of ZZT is an homage to classic ZZT games of the early 1990s.

Venture into the ruins, collect the purple keys, and escape with your life!

Apologies in advance for the hassle in actually playing this. It's made with ZZT, an MS-DOS game from 1991. It's definitely a relic, but I had fun making it.

Here is what you'll need:

1) Dosbox - Unless you can run MS-DOS applications natively
Download it from http://www.dosbox.com/download.php?main=1

2) ZZT - This is a ZZT World so you'll have to run it through ZZT.
You can get it at http://zzt.org/zgames/z/zzt.zip

3) Run ZZT.EXE, select Keyboard/Color. Press W to open the world list
and from there, pick RUINS.

4) Press P to play! More detailed help and instructions are provided
within the ZZT World itself.

TECHNOLOGY TOOK OVER THE WORLD...

EVERYTHING WE DO IT'S RELATED TO MODERN TECHNOLOGY.

COULD WE SURVIVE IN THE OLDER ERA, WHEN THE ONLY TECHNOLOGIES WERE THE 3 ELEMENTS?

LET'S FIND OUT!

Every time you complete the game you unlock a random(but properly selected) famous quote
