entries.title: The Unreal Odyssey
entries.description:
Hi, everyone!
It's my first entry for LD.
Hope, you'll like it.

=============== INFO =================

Hello, stranger!

Your ship has been lost in the waves of the Mediterranean Sea. 
Now you have only 25 weeks to save your team and bring the ship back to the Island!

But how can you find the road to your home?
Use the spyglass to observe night sky and the Starmap to find out how far are you now from the Island!

Celestial navigation is your best friend.
Let's know would you survive in Ancient Greece.

============== CONTROLS ===============

W - move forward
S - move backward 
A - counterclockwise rotation
D - clockwise rotation
SPACE - turn on/off the Starmap mode
TAB - turn on/off the Spyglass mode

=========== HOW TO PLAY ===============

Look to the sky using the Spyglass and remember what stars and constellation (or their parts) are directly over your ship now.
Try to figure out where they are shown on the static Starmap and how far you are from the Island marked with the red cross on the map.

========= POST-JAM FIXES ===========

- Updated boundary colliders to prevent stacking outside the sea area
- Added ability to restart game after "Game over" by clicking "R" button
- Fixed shadow rendering (no gaps anymore)

========= FUTURE OF THE GAME ===========

Thank you for all your comments!
They are encourage me to continue polishing this game and turn this 2-days prototype to a real game.

There are my plans for the game:

- Fix bugs and improve performance.
- Add background music and sound effects.
- Add short playable tutorial to explain how to use the Spyglass with the given Starmap.
- Add various types of obstacles, not only rocks.
- Create whirlpools that will work as portals.
- Improve appearance of the Island and obstacles on the screen. Make it more natural.
- Make dynamic low-poly waves.
- Update UI and polish 3D models.

entries.title: Trail across Darkest Europe
entries.description:
Text-based Oregon Trail style game set in a post-apocalyptic Europe, with a fantasy theme.

Basic idea is that Riga is under siege by a vampire army and you're refugees who make the journey to Toledo. Only had time to create the most basic game-play a Oregon Trail player would expect. You can trade money for mana potions (think bullets in Oregon Trail) and food. You ration food amounts. You also set your party's speed. Slower means you take longer to get to your destination, but safer; faster means you get to your destination quicker, but much riskier. Random bad events occur depending on your speed. Professions exist which modify certain game-play attributes.

I had planned on having some ASCII art throughout the game, but ran out of time. The code for victory is missing as well (Gameover is working just fine though)

Tools:
 - Lang: go
 - Libs: gocui (github.com/jroimartin/gocui)
 - Editor: Atom
 - Other: Google Maps (For distances between cities)

Fixes:
 - 2016-08-29 18:21 EDT: Fixed menu item highlighting under Windows

Anyway this is my first ludum dare and I'm happy with the results, but still I should have been more prepared... Sorry if the sound is too loud, you may want to turn down your audio before running the game. Anyway this was a great learning experience and I really hope you can run the game and enjoy it. All done in a grueling 48 hour period where at times I almost gave up but in the end I'm proud of my work. I hope you all had a good time during Ludum Dare 36 and I'll see you all next time.

Controls
Movement - WASD
Can't fire until hit E to activate ANCIENT TECHNOLOGY
Firing - ARROW KEYS LEFT RIGHT

HEADS UP - HOW TO RUN
-may only work if both LD36Veto.jar and LD36Veto_lib are copied to the desktop. Try that if it doesn't work I apologize.
The program does work on my desktop but not on my laptop, I apologize if it doesn't work on your computer but I cannot figure out why it isn't working sometimes, I believe jdk is necessary though.

entries.title: 200 Generations
entries.description:
The Game:
Identify items of ancient technology from human history. Slow down the spinning items to make identification easier, but slower speed means a lower score. Also gives you a humorous summary of your ancestors based on what you thought each item was.

About:
This is my first LD entry, coded with the awesome Love2D, and although it's a simplistic game I'm happy to have got it into a working shape from scratch especially as I'm only just learning Lua.

The Good:
Everything at least works even if the layout is a bit odd in places!

The Bad:
I underestimated how much time would be needed to create pixel-art type images. As a result the amount of content is severely lacking. Appearance would have been improved greatly if I'd had time to use bit-mapped fonts rather than relying on a default system font. I would have liked to add more pzazz by way of effects etc but the game is a bit too simplistic to warrant it.

Autopsy:
Having a better grasp of the language selected would have been useful! At least I learned how to package up Love2D programs for Windows, despite developing on a Linux box, and how to use the excellent Piskel in some detail.


The download is for Windows 64 bit (archive includes source)

A source-only *.love file is available for Linux users (who will need to install Love2d to play it).

entries.title: Baja Berserkers
entries.description:
>>>
I've been really busy with other things during the jam (landing a job among them), so the jam deadline version really sucks (still the temporary car model, shitty driving, can't shoot yet)...
I'll update as soon as possible, so check back later for something much better!
>>>

"Baja Berserkers" is a game entirely based on the fact that a friend of mine is 3D modelling a post-apocalyptic Military Baja Beetle.
I promised him I'd make it drivable, and the Ancient Technology theme fits perfectly, so I'm doing it right NOW, with the current version of the model! :)

Our goals for this game are:
✓ 0. setting up a World Machine terrain
✓ 1. making the Baja Beetle drive
— 2. making the M202 FLASH rocket launcher / M2 Browning machine gun shoot

Stretch Goals:
— 3. exploding targets (and car itself too!)
— 4. local 2-player driver (keyboard/gamepad) + gunner (gamepad) shenanigans
— 5. ONLINE multiplayer with several local driver/gunner teams battling each other
— 6. online ranking / highscore system
— 7. VR mode (definitely post-jam, still waiting for the Vive to arrive!)

entries.title: Project Leonardo
entries.description:
This is a command line like browser game. It contains quotes from movies and sci-fi novels, it's something between text adventure and a puzzle, I guess.
It is very short (~5 minutes of gameplay) and unfortunately it is not mobile compatible. 

I made it in around 10 hours, I had no time to prepare in advance and I had to cut lot of corners (the code is not modular at all and the whole code is one big fat file).
It's made with javascript, nothing special. I always wanted to join the Ludum Dare so the goal of this time was to deliver a game in time without loosing time looking up tools or resources. 

I was planning to make the hint command work with a thesaurus online, add more technologies, make it multilingual, implement save and load but the time was very limited.

The source code is available at: https://github.com/MicheleV/Leonardo
The game can be played at: https://michelev.github.io/Leonardo

I hope you like it. Any feedback is welcome, thank you for you time!

entries.title: Random Access Aliens
entries.description:
Oh no the alien drones are attacking earth! They even destroyed all of our firearms and melee weapons! What could we possibly do to stop them?!

Use our good ol' grenades, of course!

This is a terminal turn based game that I did with my own engine (specifically made for Ludum Dare!). Your goal is to survive as long as you can! Every 10 turns new alien drones will spawn and you will find a new grenade/heal 1hp.

map.txt is the map. You can edit if you want - just remember that alien spawn positions are hard coded (I really wanted to make it not so it would be easy to change the map but I had to rush everything in the end).

there is also .score file that is keeping the score. But do you really want to cheat? :P

Controls:
W, A, S, D - walk or or aim
Spacebar - change between walking and aiming
Enter - throw grenade or end turn
Escape or Q - quit game (score will not be recorded)

Legend:
@ - player
A - Strong alien drone
a - damaged alien drone
_ - killed alien drone
# - wall (drones can fly over them!)
X - place where are you aiming
o - thrown grenade 
* - explosion
! - place where alien drones spawn



P.S. PLEASE RUN THE GAME FROM A DIRECTORY IT'S AT!

P.S.S. If somebody wants an OS X version just drop a comment below, I'll see what I can do.

links.label: Windows (not tested but apparently works fine)

entries.title: Temple Quest
entries.description:
Welcome to "Temple Quest"

You will try not to crash into columns
You will try not to fall into chasms
You will try not to be burned by fire
You will try not to be cut into pieces by sawblades
You will try not to use the skip button (S) to jump ahead

You will learn to jump over gaps
You will learn to build bridges
You will learn to extinguish fires

You will find the ancient artifact - by any means!



I had a little help with the soundtrack from my friend Gercr - everything guitar and bass is him. 
The tracks he's part of are "Intro Stage" (Level 1) and "Metal Guardian" (Level 5)

If you want to hear more music from Gercr and myself - why not take a look at our soundclouds?


https://soundcloud.com/gercr
https://soundcloud.com/voidsquared (<- that's us collaborating as a virtual band :) )

https://soundcloud.com/vaiaphraim


A few tips for the controls - the jump has always the same distance, and you can't move while jumping. Also, you can't use any other moves while you are in air. If the terrain is riddled with obstacles, you might want to consider a bridge instead.

You can hold down keys to do so. In fact, while you keep pressing <SHIFT>, you can't fall into chasms (provided that you have bridge segments in your inventory)

Same thing counts for fire - keep holding <Q>, and fire can't hurt you. However, if you press <SHIFT> and <Q> at the same time, only the last button you pressed will be persistent. So you can't play superman by holding down both ;)

The hardest parts of the game are the double columns/saws, I think. These sequences are the randomly generated ones. However, you can beat them, if you double tap your movement keys quickly. (It's very hard, but possible, trust me)

It's also possible to do precision jumps to conserve bridge segments in some cases, but that requires a lot of skill to pull off :)

This game is a kind of revival of good ol' Asteroids. It may not be the most original one, but we really like our shader job here.

The rounds are getting a bit longer each level, on the end you will be shown an upgrade screen where you can upgrade your weapons and shields.
Use arrow keys or WSAD for ship movement, Space to shoot, Left Ctrl to shoot special.

Download, unzip and double click or "java -jar ld36.jar"

Requires Java 8 and a graphics card supporting OpenGL 3.1+. The build has been tested on Windows and Linux, it won't probably work on Mac, but we will be very grateful if you try it anyway and post a log.

Uses LWJGL, JOAL + Paul's Soundsystem (terrible combo, but still easier than other options). Based on GabeNgine (https://bitbucket.org/datt/gabengine)

entries.title: Lorem Ipsum or Engineering for a Civilized Age
entries.description:
--FUTURE NEWS--
Debian Xenial version is up (since that's related to what I'm running and could compile for). Debian Trusty version is in the works, I need to find a machine that's running it or pull up a live CD somewhere.
Once that's all done I'll probably work on a post-LD version with cleaned up colors, fixing the camera issue, and maybe getting rid of a couple bugs I didn't have time to get to. So comments with bugs/complaints/suggestions are appreciated :)
--END NEWS--

First day was spent on a completely different project which didn't pan out. In a panic I spent the last 29 hours getting this together. There's no real proper ending like I was hoping. If you manage to get all three cities hooked up, just imagine a fanfare and much dancing and rejoicing, all "we love you" and "thanks for making our crops not all die".

If the resolution doesn't fit on your monitor, the window's resizable and the config.prc file holds the default resolution. The UI may or may not have issues outside 16:9 but you're free to test that out.

By all accounts this /shouldn't/ work in wine, but if the linux version doesn't run for you by all means feel free to try.
Notably, the windows version comes bundled with python3.5, but the linux builds do not. To play those you'll have to make sure you've got python3.x installed and that run_game.sh calls the appropriate python exec.
If someone wants me to get an OS X version up, hit me up on AfterNET or Freenode. I'll see what I can do.

Powered by Panda3D.

entries.title: MES
entries.description:
You had a nostalgia rush last night, so you decided to satisfy it by playing one of your favorite childhood games for the Mintendo Entertainment System, Attack of the Killer Robots. You popped in the cartridge and prepared for some rose-tinted fun when suddenly...
...nothing happened.
You turned off the MES, took out the cartridge, blew the dust out of it, put it back in, and turned on the MES. You found yourself playing the game, except you were inside of it!

Protect the MES! If it gets destroyed or you get killed, it's GAME OVER, literally.

Use the arrow keys to move, A to reload, D to shoot, and S to melee.

Shortcomings:

 - There is no leveling up or progress

UPDATE: 8/29/2016 2:25PM Eastern

I found a bug where, if you played again from the game over screen, some of the difficulty settings weren't getting reset. This was a very small fix so I've uploaded a new version.

I've also found a case where level generation can get stuck (on the "Get Ready" screen) in rare cases. I'm not sure how often this happens, so let me know if it happens to you.

entries.title: Time Grabber
entries.description:
You start each level in a primitive state with 2 weapons: a sword and a crossbow.
The goal of each level is to navigate the room and figure out how to reach the mini boss, kill him to get his keycard, and use it to unlock the exit door.

You repeat the process each time you begin a new level, until you reach the final boss.
Basic drones are not hostile towards the player. However, they will hurt you if you touch them, and you can also destroy them with your weapons.
You will find item crates in the levels: they may contain a health pickup, a stability points pickup, or a coffee powerup.


Stability bar and its mechanics: a full stability bar lets you use your futuristic armor, and replaces your basic sword and crossbow with the Tachyon blade and blaster, which deal more damage to enemies and bosses. However, when this gear is equipped, your stability points will deplete over time, as the curse prevents you from maintaining such technology for too long in the same timeframe.

The levels themselves are also quite dangerous, as various hazards may be present on the floor, such as lasers or security turrets.

(Note : all features may not be present during the LD build)

Controls (for now) :

Use QZSD (use Alt+Shift to switch Keyboard type if you are on a QWERTY)
to move the character in al directions

press space to shoot with the crossbow


(Updated ! ! !) 13/09/2016 :

New build available !

Changelog 0.4 : 

Now displays the end screen and credit screen upon game's completion (at least this LD build) we'll still try to improve stuff here and there but this build should give you a better idea of what we intended to make with this entry :)

help us find if any glitches remain

entries.title: Arch Journey
entries.description:
Welcome To Arch Journey! This is Our first Ludum Dare and we've surely taken the wrong path. It's sad, but we couldn't achieve what we have planned. You can see about 5% of total game.

  Controls: 
a + d - moving
w - jump
space - use doors (background doors when they are open)
You can cut the rope with sowrd to unlock new paths

  Arch Journey is a game about 3 archeologists who went to a new unusual archeological site. When they arrived an earthquake happened. They fell down into an ancient catacomb. But only one survived. Chose your hero and help him escape this place and return home. You can chose between 3 tools (sword, hammer and bow) representing each of archeologists. Depending on this choice you'll have different paths of progressing through the game. In this game you'll have to solve puzzles, defend yourself from the ancients, find ancient spheres to improve your tool and finaly escape. Here is where your journey begins.

  And to the sad part.. What did we implement.
One level, one hero (with sword), a couple of easy puzzles, one ancient sphere to improve your sword mastery, a couple of dummy enemies (no AI, sorry guys =( ). At least we got a solid dungeon atmosphere. It's a bit more of a prototype than actual game, but it's still was a lot of fun. We hope you'll enjoy our game. Leave feedback and have a nice day! GL. 

P.S. I haven't tried the web version myself (didn't have enought time). Unix version either. Windows version is working.

entries.title: Naumachia
entries.description:
Naumachia - Ancient Roman Naval Warfare

Naumachia, literally meaning naval combat in Latin, was an Ancient Roman event in which naval battles were re-enacted for entertainment. It involved a large arena or coliseum, filled with water. Where gladiators and prisoners fought to the death.

Instructions:

WASD to move your ship around. Left-click to select a soldier, then right-click a position for them to move to. When a soldier is killed he flips upside-down and ceases to jump. A ship is sunk when it's general is killed. The game is won when all other ships are sunk!

entries.description:
Known bugs:
Sometimes the player collides with the Health AND the treasure when trying to take it head on (so by pressing W); simply go around it and take it from the side (either walk over it with A or D, probably backwards with S also works), sorry for the inconvenience.


*Resolution is set to 1024x768*

You are a treasure hunter adventuring in a dungeon whose doors are protected by an ancient technology that locks them with some sort of password; you will have to guess them and make your way to the treasure room.

entries.title: Zlotxx: The Origin of the Pyramids.
entries.description:
This is a cyrptic puzzle that tells the story of the last days of Zlotix, an Alien who happened to crash at Ancient Egypt, and tried to resupply his Mothership energy to return his home planet Zlotxxia, while accidentaly turning into dust and giving birth to the most amazing legends of human history by mistake: the Pyramids ><'

Objective:
- Guess what the heck the Mothership is asking you to bring her.
- Memorize the Icons when she is happy with the result.
- Try to complete at least 7 of the 10 steps sequence of energizing to win.
- If the time reaches 0, you lose. If you can'c complete 7, you lose.
- Have fun :D

CONTROLS:
- ARROWS  to   MOVE
- SPACE   to INTERACT
-  G+R    to  RESTART

entries.title: 6210 B. C.
entries.description:
Okay, this time I hardly made it but at least it's something almost playable.

The idea in 6210 B.C. is to gather enough resources for your civilization to develop new technologies that help your gathering progress. 

What I got is the gathering phase with two technology levels. 

~CONTROLS~
* WASD or arrow keys to move around
* SPACE or E to interact
* ESC to quit
* P to Pause

~HOW TO PLAY~
Without the proper tech you can't fell trees or mine piles of stone, you have to collect loose twigs and pebbles first and deliver them to your village.

Should you get lost, there's an arrow above your character's head that's always pointing to your village.

Walk up to a resource and hold down the interact button (E or SPACE). When you gathered enough, head back to your village to deposit your materials. If you collected enough stuff, you'll unlock a new technology.

If you've made it to tech level 2: CONGLATURATIONS !!! You've seen all there is to the game. Please don't try to gather for the tech-level after reaching level 2, because there is no new content waiting for you, just endless grinding and a crash upon reaching level 4. So don't do it.

~REMARKS~
I am pretty happy with the graphics and the overall style and maybe there's some future for this game since I had a whole bunch of ideas that wouldn't make it in the game, such as fighting against other clans and upgrading your weapons. If you spend too long on gathering than on upgrading the tech, the other tribes would suddenly have more advanced weapons than you, for example. Players would have had to balance fighting and gathering and what resources they spend for which domain.

Anyways, I hope you enjoy it despite the clunky UI and lack of sound.

entries.title: A Fox's Pottery
entries.description:
Hello!
This is my Ludum Dare 36 Entry with the theme "Ancient Technology"

Well my game is about a fox in a museum of ancient technology.
It's kinda short but I hope you like it anyways.

entries.title: Ancient Siege
entries.description:
Match tiles to create an army and defeat your opponent!

Use the arrow keys to move the cursor around
use space to select and swap tiles
Make 2x2 squares of different pairs of tiles to create units
Press Z to submit the bottom two rows and summon the units

You can make vertical lines:
  OXOXOX
  OXOXOX

horizontal lines:
  OOOOO
  XXXXXX

or checker patterns:
  OXOXOX
  XOXOXO

for different units. Try to find them all!

You can also use the 'U' and 'I' keys combined with 1 2 and 3 to spawn units
use Shift to spawn them on the enemy side instead (but thats cheating ;)

entries.title: Arena of Death
entries.description:
Back in the late 80's-early 90's Bulletin Board Systems (BBS for short) were all the rage! If you had a modem in your computer (this was not standard issue) then you could connect to someones computer running a BBS. ON the BBS you could chat, post messages to the message groups, download files (this was the best way to get shareware games) and play DOOR Games. Arena of Death is a homage to those DOOR Games. It is a text based arena combat simulator. Some of the stuff in it is based on D&D and other stuff was my own doing.

NOTE: This is a keyboard driven game. The mouse is only used to select the input field to enter your name. 

NOTE2: A WebGL version is in the works as are MAC and Linux. I will remove this message when they are uploaded


Inside the game there are Instructions which I call tips. Here I wanted to present you with more of those tips.

1. The armor class (AC) system is not based on D&D. You start out wearing Rags which has an AC of 0, so this mean you will get hit a lot and you may die a lot too. The AC System is simple the higher your AC the less you'll get hit.

2. The entire game and fake BBS are written from the perspective of some who is really putting up a new BBS, which is why the Instructions in game refer to later updates.

3. I recommend when you get enough money that you purchase armor first, Heavy Robes have an AC of 8, while it since great it should keep you alive longer.

3. .50% of your strength is used in the calculation of damage, both regular and critical.

4. .50% of your dexterity is used in the calculation to see whether the monster hits you.

5. Both of these stats can be increased with potions.

6. I say it in the Instructions and I want to repeat it here. When your character dies it will be deleted and you will have to create another one.

I hope you all enjoy this glimpse into the past of a game from a bygone era. I truly had fun creating it and while I know it can be frustrating at times I hope you all have fun playing it.

entries.title: Cat Ball VR

entries.title: Corsairs and Cannons
entries.description:
Corsairs and Cannons:
A game of ancient ships and navigation equipment.

*** Update: *** 
Fixed html5 compile and fixed a tiny bug where non-important buildings don't die. The windows build works well now, html5 should also be fixed, but let me know if any errors pop up, and use the windows exe in the mean time if so!

+ Destroy the islands to collect your navigation equipment and head home!
---Note: (drops somewhere next to the island, and the island has a marker    ---letting you know it has a drop)
+ Destroy enemy boats and drive up to them to commandeer them!
+ You can't heal, so commandeering boats is the only way to refill your health!
+ Different ships move, turn and shoot at different speeds, and have different cannons!

For more help and a terrible rushed story line, click "how to play" in the main menu.

Tools:
Unity
Blender
Photoshop
http://www.bfxr.net/

Some bugs and notes:
+ Sometimes the ships that shoot will get confused and stand still, I know what causes it, but had no time to fix it.
+ Sadly, no music and only two sound effects. For some reason, we can't disable voting in the sound category.
+ The sails only render one way, and didn't have time to fix it or update the models to fix their UV mapping.
+ Forgot to add an exit button :(
+ Any bugs we didn't manage to find.

Made by Zee and Jerek.
Special thanks to Vin and Doug for some feedback and help!

entries.title: CRTs are Ancient, right?
entries.description:
"CRTs are ancient, right?" is a fast-paced and somewhat funny take on the stealth and FPS genres, providing multiple ways to deal with the threats in each level.

Do you rampage through, killing all who oppose you, or stealth it up like a ninja?  Brute-force the passwords, or look for clues?  Collect all the things, or just make a beeline for the exit once you've gotten your target?

FYI: The game may or may not be broken on macs.  If you get a grey screen with sound, please post a bug report on the Itch forum topic I've got set up, with computer specs and OS version.  I want to make sure it's not specific mac versions and models, rather than Unity just exploding.

I might put the source-code up on Github if anyone's interested, though it also depends on if I'm going to be choosing to leave it completely free, or if I want to add the ability for people to pay to buy the game.
Something about asking for money, for this early of a game...it seems wrong.  Not sure if it'll even ever surpass this pseudo-tech-demo status!

You can pick it up on Itch.io for free; no accounts required, no donations accepted.  Yes, I disabled the ability to pay for this.  I'd feel guilty if someone paid and then the game never surpassed being a tech demo.

FYI: For the time being, I'm going to keep it solely on Itch.io, so as to keep my metrics in one place and make maintaining/updating the game easier.  I shan't be re-uploading it to any other sites, not even for Youtubers; if you want to link to the game, link to the game on Itch or the LD entry.  You don't need anything other than that.

-=​​​CURRENT FEATURES=-
 * ​Two main levels (One main "infiltration" style level, and one "brawl" style level)
 * Cheesy CRT-screened computer terminals to muck around on
 * Beanish capsule security guards with revolvers and hats
 * Your hat falls off if you die
 * Your enemies lose their hats too
 * Decent graphics
 * Spazzy-but-funny music
 * Main menu accessible through an ingame terminal
 * Currently broken on Macs, possibly

entries.title: Firestarter
entries.description:
Your goal: Start a fire.

* Rapidly tap right and left arrow get sparks going
* Hold spacebar to feed the sparks
* Tap down arrow to add kindling

entries.title: Holy Moo!
entries.description:
Holy moo!

In this game you play a guy who has been tasked with sending a holy cow back to heaven.  To do this he must travel across the skeleton infested land to collect water from a well.  He must then bring the water back and fill up the cows' water trough so that it can drink.  Once the trough is full the holy cow will drink, regain it's energy, and then return to heaven.

Controls:
  A - D = Move
  Shift = Sprint
  Space = Jump
  W - S = Raise and lower well bucket
  E     = Get water from the well's bucket
  Q     = Place your water into the trough

  Point and click = Shoot

entries.title: Kentron
entries.description:
KENTRON
--------------------------
Story:
Kentron is the care taker of the ancient world alignment machine.
(The Ancient world machine being the connection to the LD theme)
Sometimes the evil bug lords will manipulate the machine 
and cause the world to fall out of alignment.
Only Kentron can figure out how to fix it!

Instructions:
Find the buttons marked with the infinity symbol.
These platforms will cause the entire row or column
to shift one step. The trick is to press the correct
buttons in the correct order to get the button-tiles
to the four center tiles in the world.
Thereby restoring the world order while avoiding
the evil bugs.

Controls:
W/A/S/D - Forward/Back/Left/Right
K/L - Rotate Left/Right
-----------------------------------------

Tools used:
The graphics were made using:
Make human
SculptGL
Blender (the winner this time in my personal competition: "Which tools will crash the most")
Milkshape
Xnormal
MeshLab
Gimp
Tiled

The engine is my own engine, that's available for all on GitHub: https://github.com/AlexMartinelle/PicoEngine

and it was written using:
Visual Studio 2015
notepad++

Sounds were made using:
bfxr
Audacity

-----------------------------------
So I tried to make something a little more surreal this time :-)

I also tried out a new workflow for the games 3D graphics
which turned out to be a huge mistake.
Every single piece took ages to make and still didn't turn out
they way I intended them to...

I also planned to add proper animations and realized too late
that I really didn't have time to add the feature to my engine...

-----------------------------------

entries.title: Lyrics
entries.description:
Lyrics is a retro text adventure game.

It is about a journey through the recent history of music and music devices such as tapes and the CD. You will have to solve puzzles to move forward through time.

Lyrics was made completely from scratch in Java using IntelliJ IDEA.

How to play:
Type the action followed by one or more parameters, separated by spaces
<action> <p1> <p2> ...


The game needs Java to run: https://java.com/en/download/

There is a problem with saving in linux. If you are using linux run the game from a terminal to properly save and load the game. It should work in OS X and Windows.


Hint: The 'look' action is important

entries.title: Pyramid Raider

A simple platformer where you collect artifacts and avoid spikes in the deep tunnels under the pyramids. 

The game works best in Google Canary, but Google Chrome is also good. There might be long loading times between levels, because of poor optimization. 

I coded in Webstorm, made the art in Paint.NET and made music in Soundation. If you want to mute the music there is a button in the bottom right of the page.

All feedback is welcome if you made it to the end.

entries.title: The Bunker
entries.description:
The Bunker - LD36

You luckily manage to escape the horrors of the nuclear holocaust above ground by seeking refuge in a cold-war era nuclear bunker. However, the ANCIENT TECHNOLOGY present within the bunker is old and broken. The bunker's supplies are limited until this technology is repaired, so your only option is to scavenge for supplies and parts back on the surface. Luckily, there's an old radiation suit left behind in the bunker that you can use. You may even find items on the surface to unlock deeper parts of the bunker. Good Luck.

This is my 7th consecutive and overall Ludum Dare entry. I was considering missing out on this one, but at around noon on Sunday (British Time (GMT+1)) I had this idea. With not a lot of time left I threw this together, and here it is! Enjoy!

I'm going to sleep now...

Controls
WSAD - Movement
E - Search buildings, open doors, general interaction key
F - Eat (when available)
T - Drink (when available)
H - Put on hazmat suit (when available)

Instructions
Search through buildings in order to gain parts to repair the bunker's equipment, and keycards to unlock deeper areas of the bunker.

entries.title: Way of the Gear [Unfinished]
entries.description:
Explore the tomb of the Gear. What lies at its heart?

...

Unfortunately, we may never know. I was unable to finish this game in time because I had a very busy weekend! However, I was able to create and tune mechanics for what could be a very fun puzzle game.

entries.title: Aliens vs Ancient Indians
entries.description:
Ancient Indian civilization is so advanced in science, medicine, maths and even space travel.

Ancient Indians have fought them equally when Aliens attacked a city in India. Now that city is submerged under sea.

You use with this ancient technology to fight incoming Aliens.

Help:
~~~~~
Vimana = Ancient Flying Vehicle of India
Arrow Keys or WSAD : Movement
Space  or K    : Shooting

Destroy all the Aliens to save the Earth.
Note: Tried webgl unity build, have some issues but full screen version working fine in browsers

entries.title: Ancient Weapon Smith Technique
entries.description:
Ancient Weapon Smith Technique

In this game, it's your task to run a small weapon forge. 
You have to buy materials, accept orders from your customers and forge weapons to sell them or use them to complete the orders of your customers. 

Will you master this ancient weapon smith technique to become the best smith you know?

------------------------------------------------------------------

Controls:
The Game is totally controlled by mouse. Just click on the button you want and see what happens. :)

------------------------------------------------------------------
This is already our third Ludum Dare Entry and it was again an very exhausting, sometimes frustrating, very enjoying and absolutely crazy weekend. 

Nevermind the result, but we are really looking forward for every upcomming LudumDare and if we are able to participate, we will. 

This time we created a small shop simulator with an very challenging minigame. It's kind of easy to learn, hard to master minigame and we hope you all will enjoy this. 

Best wishes and happy gaming 
Christian (@ChristianT1987) and
Christian (@key_user)


P.S.
Again, the Mac and Linux Version is not tested and we hope that we will not have the same graphic bugs like last time. :)

entries.title: Oceanus
entries.description:
Cowboys em cavalos marinhos, alienígenas e tanques aquáticos, todos querem destruir Atlantis, mas só você pode pará-los!

Em Oceanus, um top-down structure defense shooter, cada wave de defesa é uma época! Ao longo dos anos, Atlantis conseguiu viver em segredo da sociedade e em paz. Bom, quase em paz: Em determinadas eras, Atlantis foi realmente achada e atacada! E coube a um guardiao de seu legado assegurar que ninguém saia sabendo de sua existência...

Atire nos inimigos de várias épocas em que Atlantis foi descoberta: Romanos, Cowboys, Militares e até Alienígenas vão invadir a sua preciosa cidade e atacar suas estruturas e você, um golem empoderado pela energia defensiva da cidade. Se a cidade cair, você cai também! Mostre a todos que a tecnologia anciã é a mais duradoura!

entries.title: Reflexum: The Path of Light
Riptale
entries.description:
See video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mq1N5rf94EU

Riptale is an action platformer where you progress down a procedurally generated tunnel full of danger and loot.

This was my first collaborative effort in Ludum Dare together with the team from Super God. We made great progress, but in the end we overestimated how much time we can pour into the project.

We feel that this a game we want to develop further, so look forward to a post-compo release soon and please leave feedback related to that version as well!

W / Gamepad A = Jump
Control / Gamepad X = Attack

Known issues:

- The level generation is slightly off (some objects overlap)
- The level ends abruptly and generates a new one
- Sometimes the game will produce an error during death

How many days did you survive? Did you find Iceland ? How about Bergen?

Controls:
Turning: Left-/Right-arrow (or A/D) 
Forward: Space
Look at stars: Return

entries.title: Yet Another Cat In a Pyramid
entries.description:
Yet Another Cat In A Pyramid for Ludum Dare 36

This is my first 3D Ludum Dare entry, so my scope was a little larger than what I could deliver in the time I had.
Yet Another Cat In A Pyramid is a 3D puzzle adventure based around the concept of ancient Egyptian traps.
There is one complete puzzle in this build, but hopefully you'll enjoy the experience anyway.
Oh and sorry for the lack of sound! GlHf.

HOW TO PLAY
-----------
Just run yacip-ld36.exe and away you go.

CONTROLS
--------
W, A, S, D: Move
Q and E: Rotate the camera clockwise or anti-clockwise
F: Use
Enter: Begin (Title card only)
Escape: Quit

KNOWN BUGS
----------
* If you die in the spike pit below the puzzle, you will respawn at the start of the puzzle but the puzzle will not reset. The puzzle only resets when you are killed by an axe. To reset the puzzle, just die by stepping on an Ankh block.

* There is a collision bug at a secret exit in the large chamber. So if you suddenly are on top of the walls, that would be why.

2016
Book, cup, phone, pencil and figurines on wooden table top
1280 x 720 pixels
Courtesy of Ludum Dare 36

In our entry, we present the 'Gamebook', a piece of ancient scripture / technology that hasn't left the shelf in over twenty years.

This piece is known as the 'Lightbringer', Book 1 in the Legend of Zol series.

entries.title: Leonardo's Painting Machine
entries.description:
Leonardo's Painting Machine is one of Leonardo da Vinci's lesser known inventions. In fact, before this game was released, nobody had ever heard about it!

You program the machine using punch cards, in order to reproduce a particular painting. The holes in the punch cards control brush motion, colour, numerical registers and control flow. These are introduced gradually, so don't feel disappointed if the first few levels seem simple ;)

This game draws inspiration from Zachtronics games (TIS-100, SpaceChem, Infinifactory) and esoteric programming languages. Be warned: if this sounds like your kind of game, you may not go to bed on time tonight.

You can save and share your creations by clicking the Link button, which will give you a copyable URL in your browser's address bar. This, plus the in-game stats, might allow for a little competition: who creates a particular painting in the least number of cycles? Who needs the fewest holes in their punch cards to do it?

An HTML5 game made with HaxeFlixel. No audio. Tested on Chrome and Firefox.

POST-COMPO CHANGES:
- Added the browser scrollbar for those who need it.
- Added keyboard controls to make up for small click targets; press F1 for help. If you want to experience the true compo version, just ignore them ;)

entries.title: Lindisfarne
entries.description:
My first (actual) attempt at making anything substantial in the game development world. I went into this only being fluent in Java and C#, as well as knowing the Ins and Outs of the Unity editor. What I didn't know about were the smaller things, such as, uh, Art, Sound, Animation, Physics, and so on. Overall I'm satisfied with what I've achieved, knowing that my experience with this will just help me in December (or whenever the next one is)

LINDISFARNE
Play as a Viking as He takes a stroll through English Coastal Towns, setting fires, murdering, and looting.

~HOW TO PLAY~
-Use WASD to Move, Left Click to Attack
-Enemies will chase you while in range, and attack you on intervals. You have no interval, and will need to use this to your advantage
-Step into the Gold Ring at the front of each house/fort/monastery, then press 'E' to Loot and Set Fire to it.
-Retreat to the World Map by going back to the Gold Ring at your ship
-Use your loot to Upgrade your Stats, Health is Health, Attack is Attack, and Defense is Divided by 10 and Subtracted from the Enemy Attack
-When you're Dead, you're Dead. You aren't coming back.

Hope you like my really, reeally bad Art!

~KNOWN BUGS~
-Colliders are Wonky, and it's Easy to Glitch your way in and out of the map. Thankfully the Enemies can't.
-UI Scaling on the World Map. Just couldn't get it to fit right at all resolutions.

~TOOLS USED~
-Unity 5.4
-sfxr for sounds
-Paint.NET for Images

~LINKS~
Youtube: http://www.youtube.com/valefisk
Twitch: http://www.twitch.tv/valefisk

entries.title: No Man Has Gone Before
entries.description:

When playing the web version, please set it to full screen, I didn't handle window resizing, well, at all.

No audio, but I suggest listening to the Interstellar soundtrack to get in the mood: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iBfk37Fa3H0 while playing.

You can inspire the facilities but the task is complicated with the fact that objects You're interested in, are in the layer of the earth's species. Through a series of experiments to determine the content of a substance in these artifacts, you need to establish which subject it was.

entries.title: Plant + Birds
entries.description:
***this game was made in 48 hours, despite entry to the jam***

You breed plants.

You are the planets only hope.

The bird king rules the skies with an iron claw, and it is up to you to stop him.

------------------------------------------

Build up your plant with new sections and turrets, selected from the bottom left.

Collect fruit from your plant to pay for these sections and turrets.

You have a limited inventory. **Manage it and don't get stuck without green fruit!**

Kill all the birds. Click to Kill.

If they take 7 or more pieces away, then you lose.

The king lives at 500m in the air. Beat him to win. (use the flamethrowers, they work wonders)

Collect sunshine with your plant to clear a miss (represented by birds in the upper left of the play area)

------------------------------------------

Use right click to place, left click to kill birds and collect fruit.

1,2,3,4,5 switch what you are building.

------------------------------------------

Music by Ben Powell, my brother.

entries.title: Portal to Darkness
entries.description:
(Instructions:
1 - Kill monsters until portals are vulnerable.
2 - Destroy the portals.
3 - Hit the boss.
4 - Repeat 1,2,3 until boss is dead -> next level.

Attacks are different for each kind of monster. Different attacks are made by different rune combination. All rune combinations are in the pause menu!! )

The Story so far…

Have you ever been caught between a war with creatures from other worlds? Step in the shoes of our protagonist, who has been looking for an ancient power for decades, and even though he can’t now remember his own name, he finally found it. The problem is… he awoken this really powerful and angry God in the process… and it brings a mythological army with him.

Your mission is to destroy every monster in the dungeon and the two portals at both sides of the room. 
After that, when the God Ghomuev tries to attack you, it’s time to fight him. Hit him 3 times to complete the level and proceed to the following one.

There are several types of enemies, each one requires an unique combination of runes to defeat it. Special enemies, like tank enemies, need more than one shot.

All of our art was made for the Ludum Dare event. The art team worked really hard to be able to finish in 72 hours!

Records and many more features and improvements will be added to the game soon. 

The game will be available in many platforms soon! Stay tuned!



To play in Windows systems use 1280 x 768 resolution.

entries.title: Trending Pharaoh
entries.description:
Trending Pharaoh, a ancient technology game developed for the Ludum Dare 36 Game Jam. 


**** Description ***** 

BECOME A TRENDING PHARAOH! 

In ancient Egypt there was also the need to be popular! Your mission: to become the trendiest pharaoh in all of the ancient social networks of Egypt. 

Use #hastags in Meowerrr, tag friends in SphinxBook and post great pictures in InstaRa. Unlock all the social networks, increase your follower base and change the future of social networking in the ancient Egypt!


**** How to Play **** 

Click several times to carve a post in the wall to increase your follower base. Spend followers to make some upgrades.

Improve your Input Tool, Reach and Community Manager.

Improving your Input Tool will let you post with less clicks.

Improving your Reach will get you more followers per post.

Get a Community Manager to automate clicking. Improve it to get more clicks per second.


**** Information **** 

Game Made using Unity by Cristina Charneco (@CCharneco), David Jaumandreu (@DavidJaumandreu), Miguel Murat (@Xanday), Xavi Heras (@XaviHeras) and Xavi Peña (@Xavier_PF).

entries.title: Trireme
entries.description:
Build the most technologically advanced fleet in all of Greece in TRIREME, a fast-paced shipbuilding sim! Take a ship spec and build it quickly to earn points.

---

How to play

A trireme is made up on individual ship sections: the front, middle sections with or without a sail, and the tail. Once an order comes in, you start working from front to tail, following the on-screen instructions to make the necessary materials for each section. Your active section will be highlighted yellow underneath it in the work order, and will turn green on completion. Each work item in a section requires one material to start (either a tree or a sail). Complete all the sections to finish the order and earn bonus points.

​Tip: Don't forget to check which color the sail is and apply the correct paint prior to painting!​

---

Controls

Uses the PICO-8 control scheme

(O) - Z,C,N
(X) - X,V,M
Directions - Arrow keys

---

Note: the source is in the .p8 file you can download at the bottom of the Web link. If you have PICO-8, just open the file. Otherwise, just open it in any text editor; it'll be at the top of the file under the "__lua__" section.

#ldjam

---

Changelog:

8/31:

* Swapped (O) and (X) to /actually/ reflect how they are written in the PICO-8 documentation (d'oh);
* It was possible with luck and really fast fingers to overflow the score (PICO-8 numbers only go to 32k). Reduced ship-length score multiplier, but added bonus points for each sail section;

https://twitter.com/mkosler

entries.title: Building the Great Pyramid
entries.description:
What is BTGP?

BTGP is a strategy/simulation game where you have to build the Great Pyramid of Giza. The Great Pyramid of Giza is estimated to have been build over a period of 20 years involving the transportation of over 2.3 million stone blocks. How long would it take you if you were in charge? Manage workers and resources to build the Great Pyramid of Giza in the least amount of time.

HOW TO PLAY:
- BTGP is played mostly with the mouse.
- Manage resources with three different buildings: Houses, Farms and Stone Quarries.
- Houses increase your worker population as well as food costs.
- Farms can produce food. However you must assign workers to the farm to start producing. In addition food can be sold for silver, which is used to build/upgrade new facilities.
- Stone Quarries can produce stone blocks. Similarly to farms, the number of blocks produced depends on how many workers are assigned.
- You win the game when you have placed the 2.3 million blocks. Don't let your workers starve or they will abandon you and stop the construction!
- Good luck!

entries.title: Hunab Ku
entries.description:
- Hunab ku - The Only God -

In Hunab Ku you help a lost Mayan deity to bring the world into ruin.

He is trying to use ancient sundials to restore his power. By rotating the disks in the correct manner the power of the heavens will be yours.

The catch is? There are some constructions on the dials that make it hard for certain disks to move. Using keys to unlock doors and sliders to move towers around prepare to get dizzy with Hunab Ku.


-- THE IDEA --


I set out to make a puzzle game that could very well be played on a mobile platform. With that in mind the game quickly grew a bit to large for the mobile.(stuff got to big). But it would be able to work for a tablet! (After some ui element adjustments.

I liked to make a puzzle game sometime ago that was going to be centered around Circular motion. I never fleshed it out and it stayed like a coaster idea. 

Whilst I wasn't as pleased with this theme as I Like the more abstract themes, I am realy amazed by the results (it might be because of lack of sleep).

I hope you have fun playing the game as much as I had fun making it.


-FAILED ITEMS-

What I did not manage to do was the following.

Hud elements... Always hud elements 

And credits. That is about it.

--KNOWN BUGS--

- Sometimes a ring with a pilar will slip past a wall when releasing it next to a wall (Solution know No time to implement yet)

- Sometimes when disconecting/connecting a key the doors dont respond. Reconnecting the key should work but it costs you a move.

- Some of the introduction text is to long and goes off the screen. No story for you :<

- Getting all 3 coins on a level should be difficult. Right now you can trivialize it by doing one turn with the golden rings and one turn without but below minimum movements. Going to check if you have the golden rings connected before you can get the minimum movements completion. This should make the last few levels harder to fully complete for you puzzlers out there.

==DEVNOTE==

I will try and fix the last few bugs this week so it will be buggless next weekend. I wil also make an Android APK of the game (in portrait mode) for you to play. Both for Tablet and mobile devices. This requires abit of UI layout changes but no gameplay changes. It should idealy be played on those devices so I think the game would be loads more fun after that.

entries.title: Left Behind

Use WASD to move, Q and E to blink your lights, and Z X C to beep. You can select which drones cameras and servos/lights are active by clicking on the buttons in the bottom right.

A game made for Ludum Dare 36, with the theme of Ancient Technology.

This was my first attempt at using Unity, and my first 3D Project too. There is no aim or objective to this game, but overall I am pretty pleased with the result. The rovers can explore, either separately or as a team, can sing call and responses, and can find each other with their blinking lights. There's more I would have liked to add to the game, but for a first project, I'd say I'm satisfied with the result. I hope you enjoy your brief visit to this world I've created!

Controls can be customised from the Unity starter.

entries.title: No Pyramid's Sky
entries.description:
You must escape from the planet in your flying pyramid before it's too late!

Controls:
Space: Jump
Arrow keys or 'a' & 'd': Move

I used:
Unity 3d
Guitar Pro 6
Adobe Photoshop
Adobe Illustrator

entries.title: Pharaoh's Pyramid
entries.description:
The pharaoh has commanded that you will construct him a new pyramid. Can you construct it before time runs out? Or will you anger the pharaoh and be sentenced to death? There's only one way to find out...

Visit my website: http://www.actuallyeverything.com/
Twitter: @notactuallycam

Original music composed by: @crossmark

entries.title: Robots vs Mummies: Space Pyramids
entries.description:
A game is soon to be done.
Play as the Spooky-less Mummies as they make their way to the moon in their pyramid, while fighting againts nasa's Robots that try to get to the moon too.

entries.title: Save the Engineers!
Slash em all!
The Cursed Farmer
entries.description:
So I decided to make a farm sim that takes place in the colonial days. You need to keep to farm running for 30 years otherwise you kids will starve. Lots of unexpected things will go wrong like in Oregon trail, will you survive?

This game functions fine but the one thing I need to change is the game balance, outside that I need to make the colors mesh better, make more responsive buttons and just generally make the game look nicer.

All items outside crops help increase your yield ratios, if your money hits zero you lose. 

Tools Used: Chrome Dev Editor, ATOM Text Editor, MS Paint, Phaser, Javascript, WD-40 and Duct Tape

entries.title: The House on the Right
entries.description:
Welcome Detective,
You were called to this house on the right side. Sarah Zuch and Diana Burnwood are the dead victims.Find out what happend, who did it and why (complete the puzzle in your head because i am not a programmer and its a mircale that this even runs in 5:4 (sorry)).
You can move around with WASD and if you need to take a closer look press the right mouse button. Also use your sharp mind. Good luck with your case, Detective.

If you found out the solution, please comment or send it to me one twitter. https://twitter.com/who_kai 

the video post-mortem https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9jgJyc481rQ
Credits
Art Kai Werder
music http://dig.ccmixter.org/files/doxent/50485#
made in 18 hours

entries.title: Vimana
entries.description: Place Holder

entries.title: An Historic Defense
entries.description:
Basically a FPS defense game.  You are in a war museum in the future.  You steal some stuff.  Your robot overlords get mad and come to get you.  WASD to move, space to jump, Left Mouse to shoot, Right mouse to pick up.

I am just really happy that I have a playable game in 2 days.  First LD.

entries.title: Ancient Robot
entries.description:
Conquer the world with a mighty, unbeatable war machine!
Driven with muscle power of tousands of warriors it will not halt for anyone.

Crux: It's only a bit hairy to steer ;)

# Controls
Steer the ancient robot with clicking down on the joints and rotating around it to rotate the leg(-part)

# Multiplayer
There is multiplayer! :) You can challenge the best war machine driver and be the new king of the hill.

EDIT: multiplayer is now fixed and functional ! :) let's battle!

entries.title: AncientVenture
entries.description:
Team of Him and Her at the jam.

Sooo. Crap. We were to slow so.

Anyway, The game was going to be Logic-Platformer, where player can move 3 different characters on the map and combine their skills to overcome challanges around the level. 

To "play", Press 1,2 or 3 to change character, WASD to walk and E to interact... alt+f4 to quit :) 

A lot of systems done. Camera controller, movement, half of HUD. Interaction system, animations... 

Unfortunatelly we did not make it to build and set-up at least one whole level. We do not play any sound in the game, also some buttons do not work and we did not made intro. (look at the screens with text ). 

So. Conclussion is: too much ideas, too big dreams for this weekend, if you like the idea of the game write a comment, and we will send you complete game when its ready.

TO DO:
- entry
- HUD
- tutorial for the game
- more levels (enemies, assets etc.)
- sound

#LDJAM

entries.title: Civil Service
entries.description:
You and your alien buddy are stranded who knows where, and you don't even get cell service! Luckily, you've found a way to build an antenna so you can call a friend and get another ride to Xanthor's party!

Control your ship with the arrow keys, and use "space" to active the Grabbatron!

entries.title: Drone

entries.title: Gyro Gents
entries.description: Take to the skies in this aerial sports game. Pilot your gyrocopter while whacking massive croquet balls at the dandy devils you call friends. Has AI to play solo, but can also seat up to four players.

entries.title: Ludum Dare 36: Deep delving
entries.description:
The lore (Or what was supposed to be)
//This is a demo concept for a larger game we want to make

You are a half demon competing to fight in Lucifer's tournaments; for now however you are training your skills in a simulation hosted in the ancient ruins of an old museum. Each floor you visit holds various idols and relics (If the thing didn't break so often). However, the Elevator breaks frequently! You must collect elements of power to continue your deep delve.

Controls:
WASD or Arrow Keys to move
E to activate the elevator
Left Mouse to attack

Known issues:
Monsters and score counter do not spawn
-Temp fix: just reload the game. I don't know why it does this.
Animations don't always play:
No fix, not enough time for detailing out the intricacies
Mob kills itself: Planned to fix; For now it's a game balance ;3

alt+f4 to exit game. Source files included in download!

Credits:
Sprites and Animations : Quentin Harris - Studio Hiro
I would not have any Sprites for this game period if he didn't crank them out!
Unity API: Small script samples
Unity 5 flipped a lot of things on it's head for me, I had to last minute relearn a lot of steps.

Tools:
Unity, Blender, Gimp, Photoshop, MonoDevelop, Google Drive

So long, and thanks for all the fish!

entries.title: Morse Code Morris
entries.description:
I chose Morse Code for my ancient Tech, and i made this little space adventure game, Morris is an astronaut who is lost in space on each level he is presented with 6 portals 5 of them will kill him 1 will advance him to the next level.

By Decoding the Morse Code in the audio you will be able to choose the correct portal.

This is fun to play as a team you will need to google a chart that will help you decode the Morse code and you'll need a pen and paper to write down the answer, this could also work well played through a stream so someone viewing could decode the morse.

My original Intention was to include a document with the download which included a chart but time got the better of me i will try to add this at later date.

The Game was built with Shoot Em Up Kit, a program i have been using a lot for jamming recently and i really like it you can create a lot more than just Shmups with it.

The Graphics where done in Photoshop and everything else was built in Shoot Em Up Kit's Particle Editor.

The Sound was Made with a Morse Code Gen and Magix

Controls - just cursors and left Ctrl or you can play with a pad (Alot Harder)

If Playing alone Headphones Reccomended.

This game was a bit experimental and was fun to put together.

entries.title: nat
entries.description:
controls: click to walk. dragging works too.
shift+1, 2, 3, 4 or 5: change pixel scale -- this was supposed to be behind a debug shortcut but i guess i forgot

basically a walking simulator. it was going to be a pikmin clone sort of but i ran out of time and so i cut what didn't work.

source will be on github after i get some sleep.

entries.title: Og's Wheel
entries.description:
Physics based game where you play as Og a caveman riding a stone wheel.

Play with Left, Right arrows.
Space to jump
And R to restart.

entries.title: Pong 2.0
entries.description: Pong, with a twist. It's tough, but it's definitely possible.

entries.title: Revenge of Tutankhamun
entries.description:
INSTRUCTIONS

============

You are the pharaoh Tutankhamun. From the distant past, you can look into the future thanks to your magical crown and see that brave explorers want to loot the treasures you will be buried with. Guide them to the spike traps to kill them!

Use the arrow keys or WASD to select the direction in which you will place your magical arrows. Click on an empty tile to place the arrows pointing to the direction you selected. When an explorer steps on it, it will change its direction to match the one on the arrow, except if there is a wall. You can only have one arrow in each direction active, placing a new one will remove the existing one. Arrows will disappear when they have been stepped on 3 times.

Kill all explorers to complete the level, and don't let any of them get to your crypt on the right side of the screen!

CREDITS

=======

entries.title: War party
entries.description:
War party PROTOTYPE.

Its the end of the dark ages and you must Lead a war party. Research ancient technology to unlock more units and grow your army.

More of a prototype than a full game.

Review :
I ran out of time and had to cut back so much ( multiplayer, units, upgrades ). I also had to rush the GUI which doesnt look to great. But im glad i finished it ! 

My first Ludum dare ! 

Edit just fixed a bug - with the archer unit - still in time tho
Fixed another bug that caused the game to crash.

KNOWN BUGS - [Farmers are free,death state doesn't reset game,trapped king]
